name: Gothic Metal
description: Gothic metal is a subgenre of heavy metal music that combines the dark atmospheres of gothic rock with the aggression of heavy metal. It typically features prominent guitar riffs, melodic vocals, and symphonic elements. The lyrics often focus on themes such as death, sorrow, and despair. Gothic metal bands often incorporate elements of doom metal, black metal, and symphonic metal into their sound.

name: Progressive Doom
description: Progressive Doom is a subgenre of Doom Metal that combines elements of traditional Doom Metal with progressive rock and metal. It is characterized by slow, heavy riffs, often with complex time signatures and structures, and often incorporates elements of jazz, classical, and folk music. The lyrics are often dark and introspective, and the vocals are usually low and guttural. Progressive Doom is often seen as a more experimental and progressive form of Doom Metal, and is often seen as a bridge between traditional Doom Metal and more progressive forms of metal.

name: Progressive Metal
description: Progressive metal is a subgenre of heavy metal music that combines the aggression and intensity of metal with the complexity and technical proficiency of progressive rock. It is characterized by the use of complex song structures, extended instrumental solos, and unconventional time signatures. It often features a wide range of instrumentation, including keyboards, synthesizers, and multiple guitars. It is often characterized by its use of complex and often dissonant harmonies, as well as its use of extended instrumental passages.

name: Avant-Garde Metal
description: Avant-Garde Metal is a genre of metal music that combines elements of extreme metal with experimental and avant-garde music. It is characterized by its use of unconventional and often dissonant sounds, complex song structures, and unconventional time signatures. It often incorporates elements of jazz, classical, and folk music, as well as other genres. Avant-Garde Metal is often seen as a more extreme form of progressive metal, and is often associated with bands such as Arcturus, Ulver, and Ved Buens Ende.

name: Canadian Metal
description: Canadian Metal is a subgenre of heavy metal music that originated in Canada in the late 1970s and early 1980s. It is characterized by a blend of traditional heavy metal and hard rock influences, with a focus on aggressive, fast-paced rhythms and powerful guitar riffs. Canadian Metal bands often incorporate elements of punk, thrash, and progressive metal into their sound. Common lyrical themes include Canadian pride, social issues, and politics. Notable Canadian Metal bands include Anvil, Exciter, Razor, Voivod, and Annihilator.

name: Djent
description: Djent is a subgenre of progressive metal that is characterized by its use of extended range guitars, polyrhythmic drumming, and complex song structures. It is often characterized by its heavy, distorted guitar sound, and its use of palm-muted, low-pitched guitar riffs. Djent is also known for its use of odd time signatures, polyrhythms, and syncopation. It is often associated with the metalcore and mathcore genres, and is often seen as a more technical and progressive form of metal.

name: Vancouver Metal
description: Vancouver Metal is a subgenre of heavy metal music that originated in Vancouver, Canada in the late 1980s and early 1990s. It is characterized by a mix of thrash metal, death metal, and hardcore punk, with a focus on aggressive, fast-paced rhythms and heavy guitar riffs. The genre is often associated with bands such as Annihilator, Strapping Young Lad, and 3 Inches of Blood. Vancouver Metal is known for its intense live performances and its lyrical themes, which often focus on social and political issues.

name: German Post-Rock
description: German Post-Rock is a genre of music that combines elements of post-rock, ambient, and experimental music. It is characterized by its use of extended instrumental passages, often featuring guitars, drums, and synthesizers, as well as its focus on creating a mood or atmosphere. It is often characterized by its slow, dreamy, and melancholic soundscapes, as well as its use of repetition and minimalism. German Post-Rock is often seen as a more experimental and abstract form of post-rock, and is often compared to the likes of Sigur Rós, Godspeed You! Black Emperor, and Mogwai.

name: Instrumental Post-Rock
description: Instrumental Post-Rock is a genre of music that combines elements of post-rock, ambient, and experimental music. It is typically characterized by its use of guitars, drums, and other instruments to create a soundscape of soundscapes. The music is often instrumental, with minimal or no vocals, and often has a cinematic quality. It is often used to create a sense of atmosphere and emotion, and can be used to create a sense of tension or suspense.

name: Post-Metal
description: Post-metal is a genre of heavy metal music that combines elements of post-rock, progressive metal, and sludge metal. It is characterized by its slow, heavy riffs, complex song structures, and often lengthy songs. Post-metal often features long instrumental passages, often with a focus on atmosphere and texture rather than traditional song structure. It is often characterized by its use of dissonance, repetition, and a wide range of dynamics. Post-metal bands often draw influence from a variety of genres, including ambient, drone, and noise music.

name: Post-Rock
description: Post-rock is a genre of music that emerged in the 1990s and is characterized by the use of rock instrumentation, but with a focus on texture and atmosphere rather than traditional song structure. Post-rock typically features extended instrumental sections, often with a repetitive, hypnotic feel, and often incorporates elements of ambient, jazz, and classical music. Post-rock bands often use unconventional recording techniques and draw influence from a variety of genres, including electronic, experimental, and world music.

name: Eurovision
description: Eurovision is a music genre that is associated with the annual Eurovision Song Contest, an international song competition held among the member countries of the European Broadcasting Union. The genre is characterized by its upbeat, pop-oriented sound, often featuring catchy melodies and lyrics that are often lighthearted and humorous. Eurovision songs often feature a wide range of musical styles, from traditional folk music to modern pop. The genre has become increasingly popular in recent years, with many countries now competing in the contest.

name: Stoner Metal
description: Stoner metal is a subgenre of heavy metal music that combines elements of doom metal, psychedelic rock, and blues-rock. It is characterized by slow tempos, heavy riffs, and a thick, fuzzy sound. The genre is often associated with a "stoner" lifestyle, and its lyrics often focus on themes of drug use, alienation, and escapism. Stoner metal bands often incorporate elements of sludge metal, grunge, and alternative rock into their sound.

name: Swedish Alternative Rock
description: Swedish Alternative Rock is a genre of music that originated in Sweden in the late 1980s and early 1990s. It is characterized by its melodic, often melancholic sound, and its use of distorted guitars and synthesizers. It is heavily influenced by punk, post-punk, and new wave, and often incorporates elements of pop, indie rock, and electronica. Swedish Alternative Rock bands often have a strong emphasis on melody and atmosphere, and often feature female vocalists. Notable bands in this genre include The Cardigans, The Hives, The Sounds, and The Wannadies.

name: Neue Deutsche Harte
description: Neue Deutsche Harte (NDH) is a German music genre that emerged in the early 1990s. It is a combination of hard rock, heavy metal, and electronic music. It is characterized by aggressive, distorted guitar riffs, fast tempos, and electronic elements such as synthesizers and drum machines. The lyrics often deal with social and political issues, and the music is often seen as a reaction to the political and social climate of the time. NDH is often associated with the Neue Deutsche Welle (New German Wave) movement, which was a reaction to the traditional German music scene.

name: Alabama Metal
description: Alabama Metal is a subgenre of heavy metal music that originated in the state of Alabama in the United States. It is characterized by a blend of traditional heavy metal and Southern rock influences, often featuring a mix of distorted guitars, double bass drumming, and melodic vocal lines. The genre is often associated with bands such as Pantera, Black Label Society, and Down. Alabama Metal is known for its aggressive sound and hard-hitting lyrics, often focusing on themes of rebellion, freedom, and personal struggle.

name: Deep Melodic Metalcore
description: Deep Melodic Metalcore is a subgenre of metalcore that combines elements of metalcore with melodic death metal. It is characterized by heavy, distorted guitar riffs, breakdowns, and screamed vocals. The genre also incorporates melodic elements such as clean singing, melodic guitar leads, and keyboards. The overall sound is often dark and aggressive, but with a strong emphasis on melody.

name: Melodic Metalcore
description: Melodic Metalcore is a subgenre of metalcore that combines elements of metalcore with melodic elements from genres such as melodic death metal, post-hardcore, and alternative metal. It is characterized by heavy breakdowns, screamed vocals, and melodic guitar riffs. The genre often features clean singing and melodic choruses, as well as breakdowns and blast beats. Melodic Metalcore is often seen as a bridge between metalcore and melodic death metal, and is often seen as a more accessible version of metalcore.

name: Metalcore
description: Metalcore is a subgenre of heavy metal music that combines elements of extreme metal and hardcore punk. It is characterized by a combination of aggressive riffs, breakdowns, and screamed vocals. Metalcore often features a combination of melodic and aggressive guitar riffs, double bass drumming, and breakdowns. It is also known for its use of breakdowns, which are slow, intense passages that emphasize the low end of the guitar. Metalcore bands often incorporate elements of other genres, such as post-hardcore, deathcore, and nu metal.

name: Progressive Metalcore
description: Progressive metalcore is a subgenre of metalcore that combines elements of progressive metal with metalcore. It is characterized by its use of complex rhythms, intricate guitar riffs, and often incorporates elements of jazz, classical, and folk music. It is often characterized by its use of clean vocals, as well as harsh vocals, and often features extended instrumental sections. It is often seen as a more technical and progressive form of metalcore, and is often seen as a bridge between metalcore and progressive metal.

name: Classic Hungarian Pop
description: Classic Hungarian Pop is a genre of music that originated in Hungary in the 1950s and 1960s. It is characterized by its upbeat, catchy melodies and often incorporates traditional Hungarian folk music elements. It is often performed with a combination of traditional instruments such as the cimbalom, violin, and accordion, as well as modern instruments such as electric guitar and synthesizers. Classic Hungarian Pop is often seen as a bridge between traditional folk music and modern pop music, and is still popular in Hungary today.

name: Classic Hungarian Rock
description: Classic Hungarian Rock is a genre of rock music that originated in Hungary in the late 1960s and early 1970s. It is characterized by its heavy use of electric guitars, bass, drums, and keyboards, as well as its incorporation of traditional Hungarian folk music elements. The genre is often associated with the "Golden Age" of Hungarian rock music, which lasted from the late 1960s to the early 1980s. Classic Hungarian Rock is known for its energetic and often aggressive sound, as well as its lyrical themes of rebellion and social criticism. It is also known for its use of complex and often dissonant chord progressions, as well as its incorporation of traditional Hungarian folk instruments such as the cimbalom and the tambura.

name: Brazilian Metal
description: Brazilian Metal is a subgenre of heavy metal music that originated in Brazil in the late 1980s. It is characterized by a mix of traditional heavy metal, thrash metal, and death metal, with influences from Brazilian music such as samba and bossa nova. The lyrics often focus on themes of Brazilian culture, history, and politics. Brazilian Metal bands are known for their energetic live performances and often incorporate elements of traditional Brazilian music into their sound.

name: Brazilian Power Metal
description: Brazilian Power Metal is a subgenre of heavy metal music that originated in Brazil in the late 1980s. It is characterized by its fast tempos, aggressive guitar riffs, and melodic vocal lines. The lyrics often focus on themes of fantasy, mythology, and history. The genre is heavily influenced by traditional heavy metal, but also incorporates elements of thrash metal, progressive metal, and classical music. It is often characterized by its use of multiple vocalists, complex arrangements, and intricate guitar solos.

name: Brazilian Progressive Metal
description: Brazilian Progressive Metal is a subgenre of metal music that combines elements of progressive rock, heavy metal, and Brazilian music. It is characterized by complex song structures, intricate guitar work, and often incorporates elements of jazz, classical, and folk music. The genre is often associated with bands such as Angra, Shaman, and Noturnall. It is known for its technical proficiency and often features extended instrumental passages, complex time signatures, and extended solos. The lyrics often focus on themes of fantasy, mythology, and Brazilian culture.

name: Neo Classical Metal
description: Neo Classical Metal is a subgenre of heavy metal music that combines elements of classical music with traditional heavy metal. It is characterized by the use of complex musical structures, intricate guitar solos, and often incorporates elements of classical music such as symphonic orchestrations, choirs, and operatic vocals. It is often associated with power metal, progressive metal, and symphonic metal. Notable bands in this genre include Yngwie Malmsteen, Stratovarius, and Symphony X.

name: Power Metal
description: Power metal is a subgenre of heavy metal music that combines traditional heavy metal with a more uplifting sound, often featuring soaring melodies, virtuosic instrumental work, and fantasy-based lyrics. It is characterized by a fast tempo, double bass drumming, and high-pitched vocals. Power metal bands often draw inspiration from classical music, folk music, and fantasy themes. Common lyrical themes include epic battles, heroic journeys, and tales of fantasy and mythology.

name: Progressive Power Metal
description: Progressive Power Metal is a subgenre of heavy metal music that combines elements of progressive metal and power metal. It is characterized by its use of complex song structures, intricate guitar riffs, and soaring vocal melodies. It often features keyboards and synthesizers, as well as a wide range of vocal styles, from operatic to death metal growls. It is often characterized by its use of double-kick drums and fast tempos. It is also known for its use of fantasy and science fiction themes in its lyrics and artwork.

name: Latin Metal
description: Latin Metal is a fusion genre of metal music that combines elements of Latin American music with heavy metal. It typically features a mix of Latin rhythms, such as cumbia, salsa, and merengue, with heavy metal instrumentation, such as distorted guitars, double bass drums, and growling vocals. The genre has been popularized by bands such as Ill Niño, Puya, and Sepultura.

name: Rock en Espanol
description: Rock en Español is a genre of rock music that originated in Latin America and Spain. It is characterized by its fusion of traditional Latin American and Spanish musical styles with rock music. It typically features electric guitars, drums, and bass, as well as traditional Latin American instruments such as the charango, vihuela, and maracas. Rock en Español is often lyrically focused on social and political issues, and is often sung in Spanish. It has been popular in Latin America since the 1970s, and has gained international recognition in recent years.

name: Spanish Metal
description: Spanish Metal is a subgenre of heavy metal music that originated in Spain in the late 1980s. It is characterized by a mix of traditional heavy metal and traditional Spanish music, such as flamenco and folk. It often features Spanish lyrics and instrumentation, such as acoustic guitars, castanets, and flamenco-style handclaps. It is often associated with the thrash metal and power metal genres, and is often seen as a bridge between the two. Popular Spanish Metal bands include Avalanch, Saratoga, and Tierra Santa.

name: Eurodance
description: Eurodance is a genre of electronic dance music that originated in Europe in the late 1980s and early 1990s. It is characterized by a fast tempo, a four-on-the-floor beat, and a repetitive chorus. Eurodance typically features synthesizers, samples, and a variety of electronic instruments. It often incorporates elements of techno, house, and pop music. Eurodance is often associated with the Europop genre, which is characterized by its use of English lyrics and a catchy, upbeat sound.

name: Europop
description: Europop is a genre of popular music that originated in Europe in the late 1980s and early 1990s. It is characterized by a combination of electronic and traditional instruments, often featuring catchy melodies and a strong dance beat. Europop is often associated with the Eurodance genre, which is a more upbeat and dance-oriented style of music. Europop is also known for its use of synthesizers, drum machines, and other electronic instruments. Common themes in Europop include love, relationships, and partying.

name: Album Rock
description: Album Rock is a genre of rock music that originated in the late 1960s and early 1970s. It is characterized by its focus on album-oriented material, often featuring extended compositions and complex arrangements. Album Rock is often seen as a bridge between the more traditional rock and roll of the 1950s and 1960s and the progressive rock of the 1970s. It is also known for its emphasis on musicianship and songwriting, as well as its use of extended instrumental passages and complex arrangements. Album Rock is often seen as a precursor to the more modern genres of alternative rock, grunge, and post-grunge.

name: Art Rock
description: Art Rock is a genre of rock music that incorporates elements of classical music, jazz, and avant-garde styles. It is often characterized by complex, experimental song structures, extended instrumental sections, and the use of unconventional instruments and sounds. Art Rock often features lyrics that are abstract, poetic, and often highly intellectual. Artists associated with the genre include Pink Floyd, David Bowie, and Radiohead.

name: Blues Rock
description: Blues Rock is a genre of music that combines elements of blues and rock music. It typically features electric guitar, bass guitar, drums, and vocals, and often incorporates elements of other genres such as funk, soul, and jazz. It is characterized by a heavy use of electric guitar, often with a distorted sound, and a strong emphasis on improvisation. It is often seen as a bridge between blues and rock music, and has been popularized by artists such as Eric Clapton, Jimi Hendrix, and Stevie Ray Vaughan.

name: Classic Rock
description: Classic Rock is a broad genre of popular music that originated in the mid-1960s and has since become one of the most popular genres of music. It is characterized by its heavy use of electric guitars, drums, and bass, as well as its blues-influenced sound. Classic Rock is often associated with the classic rock bands of the 1960s and 1970s, such as Led Zeppelin, The Who, and The Rolling Stones. Classic Rock is also known for its lyrical themes, which often focus on topics such as love, relationships, and rebellion.

name: Flute Rock
description: Flute Rock is a genre of music that combines traditional rock music with the sound of a flute. It typically features a rock band with a flutist playing lead melodies and solos. The flute is often used to create a unique sound that is both melodic and powerful. The genre has been popularized by artists such as Jethro Tull, Deep Purple, and Led Zeppelin.

name: Hard Rock
description: Hard Rock is a genre of rock music that originated in the late 1960s and early 1970s. It is characterized by heavy guitar riffs, aggressive vocals, and a strong backbeat. Hard Rock is often associated with a rebellious attitude and is often seen as a precursor to heavy metal. Common themes in Hard Rock include rebellion, sex, and partying. Popular Hard Rock bands include Led Zeppelin, AC/DC, and Guns N' Roses.

name: Progressive Rock
description: Progressive rock (often shortened to prog rock or prog) is a broad genre of rock music that developed in the late 1960s and early 1970s as part of a "mostly British attempt to elevate rock music to new levels of artistic credibility." It is characterized by the use of extended instrumental techniques, complex song structures, and often unconventional instrumentation. Progressive rock bands often used concept albums and extended compositions to explore philosophical, social, and political themes. The genre is often associated with the use of synthesizers, Mellotrons, and other electronic instruments.

name: Psychedelic Rock
description: Psychedelic rock is a genre of rock music that emerged in the mid-1960s and is characterized by the use of distorted and experimental sounds, often created with the use of electronic effects. It is often associated with the psychedelic culture of the 1960s and 1970s, and is often seen as a precursor to the development of other genres such as progressive rock, punk rock, and heavy metal. Psychedelic rock often incorporates elements of other genres, such as blues, folk, and jazz, and is often characterized by its use of extended instrumental solos, improvisation, and surreal or abstract lyrics.

name: Rock
description: Rock music is a broad genre of popular music that originated as "rock and roll" in the United States in the late 1940s and early 1950s, and developed into a range of different styles in the 1960s and later. It typically consists of a guitar-based sound, with strong rhythms, and often incorporates elements of blues, folk, country, and other genres. Rock music is often characterized by a heavy backbeat, distorted guitars, and emphatic vocals. It is often seen as a rebellious and energetic form of music, and is often associated with youth culture.

name: Symphonic Rock
description: Symphonic Rock is a genre of music that combines elements of rock music with classical orchestral instruments. It typically features a large ensemble of instruments, including strings, brass, woodwinds, and percussion, as well as electric guitars, bass, and drums. The genre often incorporates complex arrangements and dramatic dynamics, and is often characterized by its use of classical music forms such as sonata and rondo. Symphonic Rock is often used to create a powerful and emotional soundscape, and is often used in film and television soundtracks.

name: Epic Doom
description: Epic Doom is a subgenre of doom metal that combines elements of traditional doom metal with epic and symphonic elements. It is characterized by slow, heavy riffs, often with a melancholic atmosphere, and often incorporates elements of classical music, such as choirs and orchestras. Epic Doom is often seen as a more melodic and atmospheric version of traditional doom metal, and is often seen as a more accessible version of the genre.

name: Folk Metal
description: Folk metal is a subgenre of heavy metal music that combines traditional heavy metal with folk music. It typically features the use of traditional folk instruments such as flutes, bagpipes, and hurdy-gurdies, as well as traditional metal instruments such as electric guitars, bass guitars, and drums. The lyrics often focus on themes of fantasy, mythology, and nature. Folk metal is often characterized by its use of clean vocals, as well as its incorporation of traditional folk melodies and instrumentation.

name: Nordic Folk Metal
description: Nordic Folk Metal is a subgenre of heavy metal music that combines traditional folk music with heavy metal. It typically features traditional instruments such as the fiddle, accordion, and bagpipes, as well as electric guitars, bass, and drums. The lyrics often focus on Norse mythology, Viking culture, and nature. The genre is characterized by its fast-paced, aggressive sound, and its use of traditional folk instruments.

name: Pagan Black Metal
description: Pagan Black Metal is a subgenre of black metal that incorporates elements of paganism and folk music. It typically features distorted guitars, blast beats, and shrieking vocals, but also incorporates traditional instruments such as flutes, violins, and drums. The lyrics often focus on pagan themes such as nature, mythology, and pre-Christian beliefs. The genre is often associated with the Norwegian black metal scene, but has spread to other countries such as Finland, Sweden, and the United States.

name: Swedish Doom Metal
description: Swedish Doom Metal is a subgenre of heavy metal music that originated in Sweden in the early 1990s. It is characterized by slow tempos, heavy riffs, and dark, melancholic atmospheres. The genre is heavily influenced by traditional doom metal, but also incorporates elements of death metal, black metal, and progressive metal. The lyrics often focus on themes of death, despair, and the occult. Swedish Doom Metal bands include Katatonia, October Tide, and Swallow the Sun.

name: Viking Black Metal
description: Viking Black Metal is a subgenre of black metal that incorporates elements of Viking culture and Norse mythology. It is characterized by its fast tempos, shrieking vocals, and distorted guitars. The lyrics often focus on Norse mythology, Viking history, and paganism. The music is often accompanied by folk instruments such as flutes, violins, and bagpipes. Viking Black Metal bands often use imagery of Norse gods and warriors in their artwork and music videos.

name: Viking Metal
description: Viking metal is a subgenre of heavy metal music that combines elements of traditional heavy metal with folk metal, black metal, and/or power metal. It is characterized by its use of Viking-inspired themes, such as Norse mythology, Viking culture, and Viking history. It often features epic, heroic, and melodic music, as well as harsh vocals and distorted guitars. It is also known for its use of traditional instruments, such as the fiddle, flute, and bagpipes. Viking metal bands often incorporate Viking-inspired lyrics and imagery into their music and artwork.

name: Downtempo
description: Downtempo is a genre of electronic music that is characterized by a relaxed, chilled-out atmosphere. It is usually slower than other genres of electronic music, and often incorporates elements of jazz, ambient, and trip-hop. It is often used as background music in films, television shows, and video games. Downtempo is often associated with chill-out music, and is often used to create a relaxed, laid-back atmosphere.

name: Japanese Post-Rock
description: Japanese Post-Rock is a genre of music that combines elements of rock, ambient, and experimental music. It is characterized by its use of extended instrumental passages, often featuring heavy reverb and delay effects, as well as a wide range of instrumentation, including guitars, drums, keyboards, and synthesizers. The genre is often associated with the shoegaze and dream pop genres, and is often seen as a more experimental and abstract form of rock music. Japanese Post-Rock is often characterized by its slow, melancholic, and atmospheric soundscapes, and its focus on creating a sense of atmosphere and emotion.

name: Alternative Metal
description: Alternative Metal is a genre of heavy metal music that combines elements of traditional metal with other styles such as alternative rock, hardcore punk, and industrial music. It is characterized by its aggressive sound, distorted guitars, and often complex song structures. Alternative metal bands often incorporate elements of rap, funk, and electronica into their music. Popular bands in this genre include Korn, Deftones, System of a Down, and Slipknot.

name: Australian Metal
description: Australian Metal is a subgenre of heavy metal music that originated in Australia in the late 1980s. It is characterized by its aggressive sound, often featuring fast tempos, distorted guitars, and harsh vocals. It is heavily influenced by thrash metal, death metal, and black metal, as well as traditional heavy metal. It is also known for its use of Australian slang and references to Australian culture. Popular bands in the genre include Parkway Drive, The Amity Affliction, and I Killed the Prom Queen.

name: Christian Metal
description: Christian Metal is a subgenre of heavy metal music that incorporates Christian themes and imagery into the lyrics and sound. It is typically characterized by aggressive instrumentation, distorted guitars, and powerful vocals. The lyrics often focus on themes of faith, hope, and redemption, and may also include references to scripture. Christian Metal bands often perform at Christian festivals and events, and the genre has become increasingly popular in recent years.

name: Norwegian Metal
description: Norwegian Metal is a subgenre of heavy metal music that originated in Norway in the early 1990s. It is characterized by its dark, aggressive sound, often incorporating elements of black metal, death metal, and thrash metal. Norwegian Metal bands often feature harsh vocals, distorted guitars, and fast tempos. Common lyrical themes include Norse mythology, Viking culture, and nature. Notable Norwegian Metal bands include Emperor, Mayhem, Darkthrone, and Burzum.

name: Prog Metal
description: Progressive metal is a subgenre of heavy metal music that combines the aggression and intensity of metal with the complexity and technical proficiency of progressive rock. It is characterized by the use of complex song structures, extended instrumental solos, and unconventional time signatures. It often features a wide range of vocal styles, from clean singing to growling and screaming. It is also known for its use of synthesizers and other electronic instruments.

name: Oriental Metal
description: Oriental Metal is a subgenre of metal music that combines traditional Middle Eastern and North African musical elements with heavy metal. It typically features traditional instruments such as the oud, qanun, and darbuka, as well as electric guitars, bass, and drums. The genre is often characterized by its use of Middle Eastern scales and rhythms, as well as its incorporation of traditional Middle Eastern and North African melodies and vocal styles. Oriental Metal is often seen as a fusion of traditional Middle Eastern music and heavy metal, and is popular in many parts of the world, particularly in the Middle East and North Africa.

name: Turkish Metal
description: Turkish Metal is a subgenre of heavy metal music that originated in Turkey in the late 1980s. It is characterized by its use of traditional Turkish instruments and melodies, as well as its incorporation of Middle Eastern and Mediterranean influences. The genre is heavily influenced by traditional Turkish folk music, as well as classical and progressive rock. It is often characterized by its use of complex rhythms and time signatures, as well as its use of traditional Turkish instruments such as the saz, darbuka, and ney. Turkish Metal is often seen as a fusion of traditional Turkish music and heavy metal, and is often seen as a way to express Turkish culture and identity.

name: Death Metal
description: Death metal is an extreme subgenre of heavy metal music that typically features fast tempos, low-tuned guitars, and guttural growling vocals. It often incorporates elements of other extreme metal genres such as black metal, thrash metal, and grindcore. Death metal lyrics often focus on topics such as death, violence, war, and the occult. The genre is known for its aggressive sound and dark, often gory, lyrical themes.

name: Gothenburg Metal
description: Gothenburg Metal is a subgenre of melodic death metal that originated in Gothenburg, Sweden in the early 1990s. It is characterized by its melodic riffs, heavy use of double-kick drums, and growled vocals. It is often referred to as "melodeath" or "Swedish death metal" and is considered to be one of the most influential metal genres of all time. It is known for its technicality, complexity, and melodic approach to metal. Common bands associated with the genre include At the Gates, In Flames, Dark Tranquillity, and Soilwork.

name: Melodic Death Metal
description: Melodic Death Metal is a subgenre of heavy metal music that combines elements of death metal with melodic elements such as melody, harmony, and sometimes even classical music. It is characterized by its use of growled or screamed vocals, heavily distorted guitars, blast beats, and complex song structures. Melodic Death Metal often features complex guitar solos and melodic lead guitar lines, as well as a wide range of vocal styles, from clean singing to death growls. It is often characterized by its use of keyboards and synthesizers to create a more atmospheric sound.

name: Metal
description: Metal is a genre of rock music that developed in the late 1960s and early 1970s, largely in the United Kingdom and the United States. With roots in blues-rock and psychedelic rock, the bands that created heavy metal developed a thick, massive sound characterized by highly amplified distortion, extended guitar solos, emphatic beats, and overall loudness. Heavy metal lyrics and performance styles are sometimes associated with aggression and machismo.

name: Swedish Death Metal
description: Swedish Death Metal is a subgenre of death metal that originated in Sweden in the late 1980s and early 1990s. It is characterized by its fast tempos, heavily distorted guitars, and growled vocals. It is often associated with a darker, more melodic sound than other forms of death metal, and is often influenced by thrash metal and traditional heavy metal. Common lyrical themes include death, violence, and the occult.

name: Swedish Melodeath
description: Swedish Melodeath is a subgenre of metal music that originated in Sweden in the early 1990s. It is characterized by its heavy use of melodic guitar riffs, often in the form of harmonized dual-guitar harmonies, as well as its frequent use of growled vocals. It is also known for its use of keyboards and synthesizers to create a more atmospheric sound. The genre is heavily influenced by death metal, but with a more melodic approach. Commonly cited bands in the genre include At the Gates, In Flames, Dark Tranquillity, and Children of Bodom.

name: Swedish Metal
description: Swedish metal is a subgenre of heavy metal music that originated in Sweden in the late 1980s and early 1990s. It is characterized by a melodic sound, often with a strong emphasis on melody and atmosphere, and is often associated with the Gothenburg metal scene. Common elements of Swedish metal include clean vocals, heavy riffs, and a focus on melody and atmosphere. Bands such as In Flames, Dark Tranquillity, and At the Gates are considered to be pioneers of the genre.

name: German Metal
description: German Metal is a subgenre of heavy metal music that originated in Germany in the 1980s. It is characterized by its aggressive sound, often featuring distorted guitars, fast tempos, and harsh vocals. It is also known for its use of keyboards and synthesizers, as well as its incorporation of elements from other genres such as classical music, folk music, and electronic music. German Metal bands often draw influence from the New Wave of British Heavy Metal, as well as from the thrash metal scene in the United States. Notable German Metal bands include Kreator, Sodom, Destruction, and Accept.

name: German Power Metal
description: German Power Metal is a subgenre of heavy metal music that originated in Germany in the 1980s. It is characterized by its fast tempos, melodic guitar riffs, and soaring vocal melodies. The genre is heavily influenced by traditional heavy metal, but also incorporates elements of progressive metal, speed metal, and classical music. German Power Metal bands often feature multiple vocalists, and often incorporate keyboards and synthesizers into their sound. Common lyrical themes include fantasy, mythology, and medieval themes. Notable bands in the genre include Blind Guardian, Helloween, and Gamma Ray.

name: Modern Progressive Rock
description: Modern Progressive Rock is a genre of rock music that combines elements of traditional rock with progressive elements such as complex time signatures, extended instrumental solos, and intricate musical arrangements. It is often characterized by its use of synthesizers, electronic instruments, and other modern production techniques. It is often seen as a more experimental and progressive form of rock music, and is often associated with the progressive rock movement of the late 1960s and early 1970s.

name: Neo-Progressive
description: Neo-Progressive is a subgenre of progressive rock that emerged in the late 1980s and early 1990s. It is characterized by a combination of traditional progressive rock elements such as complex song structures, intricate instrumental passages, and a focus on extended compositions, with modern influences such as synthesizers, electronic drums, and modern production techniques. Neo-Progressive bands often draw from a variety of musical styles, including jazz, classical, and folk, as well as rock. Common lyrical themes include science fiction, fantasy, and philosophy. Notable Neo-Progressive bands include Marillion, IQ, Pendragon, and Arena.

name: Electro
description: Electro is a genre of electronic music that emerged in the early 1980s. It is characterized by a heavy reliance on synthesizers, drum machines, and sequencers, and often features robotic or robotic-sounding vocals. It is often associated with genres such as techno, house, and disco. Electro is often used in film soundtracks, video game soundtracks, and club music. It is also often used in hip-hop and rap music.

name: Filter House
description: Filter House is a genre of electronic music that combines elements of house music with filtered and processed sounds. It is characterized by its use of filtered and distorted basslines, as well as its use of synthesizers and drum machines. The genre often features a heavy emphasis on percussion and rhythm, and often incorporates elements of funk, soul, and disco. Filter House is often seen as a more experimental and abstract form of house music, and is often associated with the early 2000s.

name: Doom Metal
description: Doom metal is a subgenre of heavy metal music that typically features slow tempos, low-tuned guitars, and a much "denser" or "heavier" sound than other metal genres. It often incorporates influences from genres such as blues, classical music, and folk music. The lyrics often focus on despair, death, and the horrors of the natural world. Common themes include depression, fear, grief, and loneliness.

name: Swedish Progressive Metal
description: Swedish Progressive Metal is a subgenre of metal music that combines elements of progressive rock, heavy metal, and melodic death metal. It is characterized by its complex song structures, intricate guitar riffs, and often lengthy instrumental passages. It is often characterized by its use of odd time signatures, polyrhythms, and extended range instruments. It is also known for its use of keyboards and synthesizers, as well as its focus on atmosphere and emotion. It is often seen as a more melodic and accessible form of metal music, and is often seen as a bridge between traditional metal and progressive rock.

name: Detroit Hip Hop
description: Detroit Hip Hop is a genre of rap music that originated in Detroit, Michigan. It is characterized by its hard-hitting beats, aggressive lyrics, and often political themes. Detroit Hip Hop is heavily influenced by the city's industrial and working-class culture, and often features samples from classic Motown records. Artists such as Eminem, Royce da 5'9", and Big Sean are some of the most popular Detroit Hip Hop artists.

name: Hip Hop
description: Hip Hop is a genre of music that originated in the United States in the 1970s. It is characterized by the use of rapping, sampling, and beatboxing, as well as a variety of other musical elements such as synthesizers, drum machines, and turntables. It is often associated with elements of African-American culture, such as graffiti art, breakdancing, and fashion. Hip Hop is a genre that has evolved over time, and today it encompasses a wide range of styles, from the more traditional East Coast and West Coast styles to the more experimental and avant-garde styles of the underground.

name: Rap
description: Rap is a genre of popular music that originated in the United States in the late 1970s. It is characterized by rhyming lyrics spoken rhythmically over a musical backing. Rap is often accompanied by a beat and is part of hip hop culture. It is often used to express social and political issues, and is often seen as a form of protest music. Rap is also known for its use of sampling, which is the reuse of existing recordings in a new song.

name: Mathcore
description: Mathcore is a subgenre of hardcore punk and metalcore that combines elements of math rock, grindcore, and hardcore punk. It is characterized by complex, atypical rhythmic structures, dissonant guitar riffs, and abrupt tempo changes. Mathcore is often associated with chaotic live shows, and its lyrics often focus on personal and political topics.

name: UK Metalcore
description: UK Metalcore is a subgenre of metalcore that originated in the United Kingdom. It is characterized by a combination of heavy metal and hardcore punk influences, with a focus on breakdowns and melodic choruses. It often features screamed vocals, double-bass drumming, and guitar riffs that are heavily distorted and palm-muted. UK Metalcore bands often incorporate elements of other genres such as death metal, thrash metal, and post-hardcore. Common lyrical themes include personal struggles, social issues, and political themes.

name: Italian Adult Pop
description: Italian Adult Pop is a genre of popular music that combines elements of traditional Italian music with modern pop music. It is characterized by its melodic, romantic, and often upbeat sound. It typically features acoustic instruments such as guitars, pianos, and accordions, as well as electronic elements such as synthesizers and drum machines. The lyrics are often romantic and reflective, and the vocal style is often passionate and emotive. Italian Adult Pop is popular in Italy and other parts of Europe, and has been gaining popularity in the United States in recent years.

name: Mexican Pop
description: Mexican Pop is a genre of popular music that originated in Mexico in the late 20th century. It is a fusion of traditional Mexican music with elements of rock, pop, hip hop, and electronic music. It is characterized by its upbeat rhythms, catchy melodies, and often humorous lyrics. Mexican Pop is often seen as a reflection of the country's culture and identity, and is popular among both young and old audiences.

name: Modern Rock
description: Modern Rock is a genre of rock music that emerged in the late 1980s and early 1990s. It is characterized by a harder, edgier sound than traditional rock, often with distorted guitars and a strong emphasis on rhythm. It is often associated with alternative rock, post-grunge, and indie rock, but can also include elements of punk, metal, and pop. Artists associated with modern rock include Foo Fighters, Red Hot Chili Peppers, Linkin Park, and Muse.

name: Medieval Folk
description: Medieval Folk is a genre of music that draws inspiration from the traditional music of the Middle Ages. It typically features acoustic instruments such as lutes, harps, and flutes, as well as vocal harmonies. The lyrics often focus on themes of courtly love, chivalry, and the supernatural. Medieval Folk is often seen as a precursor to the Renaissance and Baroque eras, and is often performed in a theatrical style.

name: Nordic Folk
description: Nordic Folk is a genre of traditional music from the Nordic countries of Scandinavia, including Norway, Sweden, Denmark, Finland, and Iceland. It is characterized by its use of traditional instruments such as the fiddle, accordion, and nyckelharpa, as well as its focus on traditional folk songs and dances. It is often played in a lively, upbeat style, and is often accompanied by singing. Nordic Folk is a popular genre in the Nordic countries, and is often performed at festivals and other events.

name: Rune Folk
description: Rune Folk is a genre of music that combines traditional folk music with elements of Nordic and Celtic music. It is characterized by its use of traditional instruments such as the fiddle, accordion, and flute, as well as its incorporation of Nordic and Celtic melodies and rhythms. Rune Folk often features lyrics in both English and Nordic languages, and its themes often focus on nature, mythology, and folklore.

name: Viking Folk
description: Viking Folk is a genre of music that draws inspiration from the traditional folk music of the Scandinavian countries, particularly Norway, Sweden, and Denmark. It often features traditional instruments such as the fiddle, accordion, and lute, as well as more modern instruments like electric guitar and synthesizers. The lyrics often tell stories of Viking mythology, and the music often has a strong, driving beat. Viking Folk is often associated with the Viking metal genre, but it is distinct in its focus on traditional folk music.

name: Finnish Metal
description: Finnish metal is a subgenre of heavy metal music that originated in Finland in the late 1980s and early 1990s. It is characterized by a combination of melodic and aggressive elements, often featuring fast tempos, growling vocals, and distorted guitars. The genre is heavily influenced by Scandinavian death metal, black metal, and thrash metal, as well as traditional folk music. Finnish metal bands often incorporate elements of progressive metal, symphonic metal, and power metal into their sound. Notable bands in the genre include Children of Bodom, Nightwish, and Stratovarius.

name: Melodic Metal
description: Melodic Metal is a subgenre of heavy metal music that combines the heavy, distorted guitars and aggressive vocals of traditional metal with the melodic, harmonic, and often progressive elements of other genres such as progressive rock, power metal, and symphonic metal. It is characterized by its use of complex guitar riffs, intricate drum patterns, and soaring vocal melodies. Melodic Metal often features extended instrumental passages, multi-part vocal harmonies, and extended song structures. It is often characterized by its use of keyboards and synthesizers to create a more symphonic sound.

name: Cyber Metal
description: Cyber Metal is a subgenre of metal music that combines elements of industrial metal, electronic music, and extreme metal. It is characterized by its heavy use of synthesizers, drum machines, and other electronic instruments, as well as its aggressive and often chaotic sound. The lyrics often focus on themes of technology, science fiction, and dystopian futures. Cyber Metal bands often incorporate elements of other genres such as industrial, techno, and even hip-hop.

name: Slovenian Metal
description: Slovenian Metal is a subgenre of heavy metal music that originated in Slovenia in the late 1980s. It is characterized by a mix of thrash metal, death metal, and black metal, with a strong emphasis on technicality and speed. The lyrics often focus on themes of death, destruction, and the occult. The genre has been heavily influenced by bands such as Sepultura, Slayer, and Death. Slovenian Metal bands have gained a cult following in Europe and beyond, and the genre continues to evolve and grow.

name: American Melodeath
description: American Melodeath is a subgenre of metal music that combines elements of melodic death metal and American metalcore. It is characterized by heavy, distorted guitars, double-bass drumming, and screamed vocals. The genre is often characterized by its use of melodic guitar riffs, breakdowns, and clean vocal choruses. It is also known for its use of blast beats and breakdowns, as well as its incorporation of elements from other genres such as hardcore punk and thrash metal. American Melodeath is often seen as a bridge between the more extreme forms of metal and the more accessible forms of metalcore.

name: Denver Metal
description: Denver Metal is a subgenre of heavy metal music that originated in Denver, Colorado in the late 1980s. It is characterized by a blend of thrash metal, death metal, and hardcore punk, with a focus on aggressive, fast-paced rhythms and heavy guitar riffs. The lyrics often focus on themes of violence, death, and social issues. Denver Metal bands often incorporate elements of groove metal, industrial metal, and alternative metal into their sound. Notable Denver Metal bands include Cephalic Carnage, Havok, and Allegaeon.

name: Technical Death Metal
description: Technical Death Metal is a subgenre of death metal that focuses on complex song structures, intricate rhythms, and technical proficiency. It is characterized by fast tempos, complex guitar riffs, and often incorporates elements of progressive metal and jazz. Vocals are usually guttural and growled, and lyrics often focus on topics such as death, violence, and the occult. Technical Death Metal is often seen as a more extreme version of progressive metal, and is often considered to be one of the most challenging and difficult genres of metal to play.

name: Technical Melodic Death Metal
description: Technical Melodic Death Metal is a subgenre of death metal that combines elements of melodic death metal with technical metal. It is characterized by its use of complex guitar riffs, fast-paced drumming, and harsh vocals. The music often features intricate guitar solos and melodic lead guitar lines, as well as heavy use of double-kick drums and blast beats. The lyrics often focus on themes of death, violence, and despair.

name: Funk Metal
description: Funk Metal is a genre of music that combines elements of funk and heavy metal. It typically features a heavy, distorted guitar sound, funk-style rhythms, and often incorporates rap-style vocals. The genre emerged in the late 1980s and early 1990s, and is often associated with bands such as Faith No More, Red Hot Chili Peppers, and Primus.

name: Instrumental Rock
description: Instrumental Rock is a genre of rock music that is characterized by the absence of vocals. It is typically composed of electric guitars, bass, drums, and sometimes keyboards. Instrumental Rock often has a strong emphasis on melody and improvisation, and can range from mellow and atmospheric to hard-driving and intense. It is often used as a soundtrack for films, television shows, and video games.

name: Shred
description: Shred is a subgenre of heavy metal music that is characterized by fast guitar solos and technical playing. It is often associated with neoclassical metal, which combines elements of classical music with heavy metal. Shred guitarists often use techniques such as sweep picking, tapping, and alternate picking to create complex and fast-paced solos. The genre is also known for its use of complex time signatures and extended range guitars.

name: Finnish Death Metal
description: Finnish Death Metal is a subgenre of death metal music that originated in Finland in the late 1980s and early 1990s. It is characterized by its fast tempos, aggressive guitar riffs, and guttural vocals. The genre is heavily influenced by thrash metal and melodic death metal, and often incorporates elements of black metal and doom metal. Finnish Death Metal bands are known for their technical proficiency and often incorporate complex song structures and intricate guitar solos. Common lyrical themes include death, violence, and the occult.

name: Finnish Melodeath
description: Finnish Melodeath is a subgenre of metal music that originated in Finland in the early 1990s. It is characterized by a combination of melodic guitar riffs, fast-paced drumming, and harsh vocals. The genre is heavily influenced by Scandinavian death metal, but also incorporates elements of power metal, thrash metal, and progressive metal. The lyrics often focus on themes of death, sorrow, and despair. Finnish Melodeath is often considered to be one of the most influential metal genres of the 21st century.

name: Adult Standards
description: Adult Standards is a genre of music that includes popular songs from the 1920s to the 1980s. It includes a variety of styles, including big band, swing, jazz, Broadway show tunes, and traditional pop. It is often referred to as "easy listening" music, as it is generally considered to be relaxing and calming. It is often heard on radio stations that cater to an older demographic.

name: Rock-And-Roll
description: Rock and Roll is a genre of popular music that originated in the United States in the 1950s. It is characterized by a heavy beat, simple chord progressions, and often a strong backbeat. It typically features electric guitars, drums, and bass, as well as vocals. Rock and Roll is often seen as a precursor to other genres such as punk, metal, and alternative rock. It has been a major influence on popular music for decades and continues to be a popular genre today.

name: Rockabilly
description: Rockabilly is a genre of music that originated in the 1950s and is a combination of rock and roll and hillbilly music. It is characterized by a strong backbeat, twangy guitars, and often features vocal harmonies. It is often seen as a precursor to rock and roll and is often associated with artists such as Elvis Presley, Carl Perkins, and Johnny Cash.

name: Polish Prog
description: Polish Prog is a subgenre of progressive rock music that originated in Poland in the late 1960s and early 1970s. It is characterized by its complex, often experimental compositions, often featuring extended instrumental passages, and its use of synthesizers and other electronic instruments. It is heavily influenced by classical music, jazz, and folk music, and often incorporates elements of avant-garde and experimental music. It is often characterized by its use of unusual time signatures and complex arrangements. Polish Prog is often seen as a bridge between the classical and rock music worlds, and is often seen as a precursor to the modern progressive rock movement.

name: Italian Progressive Metal
description: Italian Progressive Metal is a subgenre of metal music that combines elements of progressive rock, heavy metal, and traditional Italian music. It is characterized by complex song structures, intricate guitar work, and often incorporates elements of classical music, jazz, and folk music. The genre is often characterized by its use of odd time signatures, extended instrumental passages, and a focus on melody and atmosphere. It is often seen as a more melodic and accessible form of progressive metal, and is often seen as a bridge between traditional metal and progressive rock.

description: Celtic Metal is a subgenre of heavy metal music that combines traditional Celtic music with heavy metal. It typically features traditional Celtic instruments such as the fiddle, bagpipes, and bodhrán, as well as electric guitars, bass, and drums. The lyrics often focus on Celtic mythology and folklore, and the music often has a strong, driving beat. Celtic Metal bands often incorporate traditional Celtic melodies and rhythms into their songs, and some bands even use traditional Celtic instruments as part of their sound.

name: Dutch Metal

It is characterized by a mix of thrash metal, death metal, and black metal, with a strong emphasis on technical proficiency and complex song structures. The genre is often associated with bands such as Pestilence, Gorefest, and Sinister. Dutch Metal is known for its aggressive sound and dark lyrical themes, as well as its use of complex guitar riffs and solos.

name: Sci-Fi Metal
description: Sci-Fi Metal is a subgenre of metal music that combines elements of science fiction and heavy metal. It typically features futuristic and space-themed lyrics, often with a dark and dystopian atmosphere. Musically, it is characterized by distorted guitars, fast tempos, and aggressive vocals. It often incorporates elements of other metal subgenres such as thrash metal, death metal, and progressive metal. Sci-Fi Metal bands often use synthesizers and sound effects to create a more futuristic sound.

name: Symphonic Metal
description: Symphonic Metal is a subgenre of heavy metal music that combines the heavy guitar riffs and drums of traditional metal with the lush, orchestral sounds of classical music. It often features operatic female vocals, choirs, and keyboards, as well as classical instruments such as violins, cellos, and flutes. Symphonic Metal is known for its epic, grandiose sound and its use of complex musical structures. It is often characterized by its use of heavy guitar riffs, double bass drums, and soaring vocal melodies.

name: Deep Metalcore
description: Deep Metalcore is a subgenre of metalcore that combines elements of metalcore with elements of post-hardcore, progressive metal, and melodic death metal. It is characterized by heavy, distorted guitar riffs, breakdowns, and screamed vocals. Deep Metalcore often features complex song structures, intricate guitar solos, and dynamic drumming. It is often seen as a more technical and progressive version of metalcore, and is often associated with bands such as August Burns Red, The Devil Wears Prada, and Architects.

name: Dark Rock
description: Dark Rock is a genre of music that combines elements of alternative rock, gothic rock, and post-punk. It is characterized by dark, brooding, and often melancholic lyrics, as well as a heavy, distorted sound. Common instruments used in Dark Rock include electric guitars, bass, drums, and keyboards. The genre is often associated with themes of death, despair, and the supernatural.

name: German Alternative Rock
description: German Alternative Rock is a genre of rock music that originated in Germany in the late 1980s and early 1990s. It is characterized by its heavy use of distorted guitars, driving rhythms, and often dark, melancholic lyrics. It is heavily influenced by punk, post-punk, and new wave, as well as other genres such as industrial, gothic, and electronic music.
