name: Medieval Rock
description: Medieval Rock is a genre of music that combines traditional medieval music with modern rock elements. It typically features acoustic instruments such as lutes, harps, and violins, as well as electric guitars, drums, and bass. The lyrics often draw on medieval themes and imagery, and the music often has a folk-like quality. It is often seen as a fusion of traditional and modern music, and is popular among fans of both genres.

name: Old School Thrash
description: Old School Thrash is a subgenre of thrash metal that originated in the early 1980s. It is characterized by its fast tempos, aggressive guitar riffs, and intense vocal delivery. The lyrics often focus on topics such as violence, rebellion, and social issues. Old School Thrash is often seen as a precursor to the more extreme subgenres of metal such as death metal and black metal. It is also known for its influence on the development of the modern metal scene.

name: Power Thrash
description: Power Thrash is a subgenre of thrash metal that combines elements of traditional thrash metal with elements of power metal. It is characterized by fast tempos, aggressive guitar riffs, and often melodic vocal lines. The genre is often characterized by its use of double-bass drumming and its incorporation of elements from other metal genres such as death metal and progressive metal. Power Thrash is often seen as a more accessible form of thrash metal, as it often features more melodic vocal lines and less extreme guitar riffs.

name: Speed Metal
description: Speed Metal is a subgenre of heavy metal music that originated in the early 1980s. It is characterized by fast tempos, aggressive guitar riffs, and complex song structures. It is often associated with thrash metal, but is more melodic and technical than thrash metal. Speed metal bands often use double-kick drumming and fast guitar solos, and the lyrics often focus on themes of violence, aggression, and rebellion.

name: US Power Metal
description: US Power Metal is a subgenre of heavy metal music that originated in the United States in the early 1980s. It is characterized by its fast tempos, melodic guitar riffs, and soaring vocal harmonies. The genre is heavily influenced by traditional heavy metal, but also incorporates elements of progressive metal, speed metal, and thrash metal. US Power Metal bands often feature dual guitar harmonies, complex song structures, and epic lyrics. Common lyrical themes include fantasy, mythology, and heroic tales. Notable US Power Metal bands include Manowar, Iced Earth, and Savatage.

name: Christian Power Metal
description: Christian Power Metal is a subgenre of heavy metal music that combines elements of traditional heavy metal with Christian lyrical themes. It typically features fast-paced, melodic guitar riffs, double-bass drumming, and soaring vocal melodies. The lyrics often focus on themes of faith, hope, and redemption, and often include references to Biblical stories and characters. Christian Power Metal bands often incorporate elements of other metal subgenres, such as thrash metal, progressive metal, and symphonic metal.

name: British Soundtrack
description: The British Soundtrack genre is a style of music that draws heavily from the sounds of classic British film and television scores. It typically features lush orchestral arrangements, often with a strong emphasis on strings, as well as a variety of other instruments such as piano, harpsichord, and synthesizers. The genre often incorporates elements of jazz, classical, and folk music, as well as more modern electronic elements. It is often used to evoke a sense of nostalgia and evoke a sense of Britishness.

name: Soundtrack
description: Soundtrack music is a genre of music that is specifically composed for a movie, television show, video game, or other form of media. It is typically instrumental and often incorporates themes and motifs from the source material. Soundtrack music is designed to evoke emotion and create atmosphere, and can range from orchestral pieces to electronic music.

name: Epicore
description: Epicore is a genre of music that combines elements of metalcore, symphonic metal, and progressive metal. It is characterized by heavy, distorted guitars, double-bass drumming, and soaring, operatic vocals. Epicore often features complex song structures, intricate guitar solos, and dynamic shifts in tempo and intensity. The genre is often associated with themes of fantasy, mythology, and science fiction.

name: Alternative Rock
description: Alternative Rock is a broad genre of rock music that emerged in the 1980s and became widely popular in the 1990s. It is characterized by a combination of punk, indie, and metal influences, and often features distorted guitars, unconventional song structures, and lyrics that explore social and political issues. Alternative Rock bands often experiment with different sounds and styles, and the genre has spawned a variety of subgenres, including grunge, post-punk, emo, and indie rock.

name: Pop Rock
description: Pop Rock is a genre of popular music that combines elements of rock music with pop music. It typically features catchy hooks, upbeat tempos, and a strong emphasis on melody. Pop Rock often incorporates elements of other genres such as punk, hip hop, and electronic music. It is often characterized by its use of synthesizers, drum machines, and other electronic instruments. Pop Rock is often seen as a bridge between mainstream pop and rock music, and is often used to introduce new listeners to rock music.

name: Post-Grunge
description: Post-Grunge is a genre of rock music that emerged in the mid-1990s as a reaction to the heavy metal and grunge music of the early 1990s. It is characterized by a more melodic sound, often featuring distorted guitars, and a more mainstream approach to songwriting. Post-Grunge bands often incorporate elements of alternative rock, hard rock, and pop rock into their sound. Popular Post-Grunge bands include Creed, Nickelback, 3 Doors Down, and Foo Fighters.

name: Funeral Doom
description: Funeral Doom is a subgenre of Doom Metal that is characterized by its slow tempos, heavy use of distortion, and dark, melancholic atmosphere. It is often characterized by its use of funeral-like dirges, often with a somber, mournful tone. Funeral Doom is often seen as a more extreme form of Doom Metal, with its slow tempos and heavy use of distortion creating a sound that is both oppressive and sorrowful. The lyrics of Funeral Doom often focus on themes of death, grief, and despair.

name: Glam Metal
description: Glam Metal is a subgenre of heavy metal music that emerged in the late 1970s and early 1980s. It is characterized by its use of catchy, melodic hooks, and its focus on image and style. Glam Metal bands often feature a combination of male and female vocals, as well as heavy guitar riffs and solos. The genre is known for its use of flashy costumes, makeup, and hair styles, as well as its emphasis on partying and having a good time. Popular Glam Metal bands include Mötley Crüe, Poison, and Bon Jovi.

name: Melodic Thrash
description: Melodic Thrash is a subgenre of Thrash Metal that combines the aggression and speed of Thrash Metal with the melodic elements of traditional Heavy Metal. It is characterized by fast, aggressive riffs, often with a melodic edge, and often incorporates elements of traditional Heavy Metal such as twin guitar harmonies and solos. The vocals are usually harsh and aggressive, but can also be melodic. Melodic Thrash is often seen as a bridge between traditional Thrash Metal and Power Metal.

name: Thrash Metal
description: Thrash metal is a subgenre of heavy metal music characterized by its fast tempo and aggressive musicianship. It typically features fast tempos, low-register guitar riffs, and high-register guitar solos. Thrash metal songs often feature fast drumming, aggressive vocals, and lyrics that focus on social issues and political themes. Common lyrical themes include war, violence, and rebellion. Thrash metal bands often incorporate elements of punk and hardcore punk into their sound. Notable thrash metal bands include Metallica, Slayer, Megadeth, Anthrax, and Exodus.

name: Nu Metal
description: Nu Metal is a genre of rock music that emerged in the late 1990s. It is a fusion of heavy metal, hip hop, and alternative rock. Nu Metal is characterized by its aggressive sound, downtuned guitars, and hip hop-influenced rhythms. It often features rap-style vocals, electronic samples, and turntable scratching. Nu Metal bands often incorporate elements of funk, punk, and industrial music. Popular Nu Metal bands include Korn, Limp Bizkit, Slipknot, and Linkin Park.

name: Rap Metal
description: Rap Metal is a genre of music that combines elements of rap and heavy metal. It typically features rap-style vocals over distorted guitars and hard-hitting drums. The lyrics often focus on topics such as politics, social issues, and personal struggles. Rap Metal is often seen as a bridge between the two genres, as it combines the aggression of metal with the lyrical flow of rap.

name: Operatic Pop
description: Operatic Pop is a genre of music that combines elements of classical opera and pop music. It typically features operatic vocals, often with a strong vibrato, layered over a pop music backing track. The genre often incorporates elements of rock, jazz, and other genres, and can range from light and upbeat to dark and dramatic. It is often used in film and television soundtracks, and has been popularized by artists such as Sarah Brightman, Andrea Bocelli, and Josh Groban.

name: Israeli Metal
description: Israeli Metal is a subgenre of heavy metal music that originated in Israel in the late 1990s. It is characterized by a mix of traditional heavy metal sounds with Middle Eastern influences, such as Arabic and Turkish music. The genre is often characterized by a mix of fast-paced riffs, melodic leads, and aggressive vocals. It is also known for its use of traditional instruments such as the oud, darbuka, and saz. Israeli Metal bands often incorporate lyrics in Hebrew, English, and Arabic.

name: New Wave Pop
description: New Wave Pop is a genre of music that emerged in the late 1970s and early 1980s. It is a combination of pop music and new wave, a genre of rock music that emerged in the late 1970s. New Wave Pop is characterized by its use of synthesizers, electronic drums, and other electronic instruments, as well as its incorporation of elements from punk, funk, and disco. It is often seen as a bridge between the punk and new wave genres, and is known for its upbeat, catchy melodies and lyrics.

name: Soft Rock
description: Soft Rock is a genre of popular music that originated in the late 1960s and early 1970s. It is characterized by its use of acoustic instruments, melodic hooks, and a generally mellow and laid-back sound. Soft Rock songs often feature themes of love, relationships, and nostalgia. Common instruments used in Soft Rock include acoustic guitar, piano, and synthesizers. Artists associated with the genre include Fleetwood Mac, Elton John, and Carole King.

name: Swedish Pop
description: Swedish Pop is a genre of popular music that originated in Sweden in the late 1990s. It is characterized by its upbeat, catchy melodies and often incorporates elements of electronic music, such as synthesizers and drum machines. Swedish Pop is often seen as a subgenre of Europop, and is often associated with the Swedish music scene. It is often seen as a more accessible version of the traditional Swedish folk music, and has been popularized by artists such as ABBA, Ace of Base, and Robyn.

name: Canadian Pop
description: Canadian Pop is a genre of popular music that originated in Canada and is heavily influenced by American and British pop music. It is characterized by its catchy melodies, upbeat rhythms, and often incorporates elements of rock, hip-hop, and R&B. Canadian Pop is often seen as a hybrid of the two genres, combining the best of both worlds. Popular Canadian Pop artists include Justin Bieber, Shawn Mendes, Carly Rae Jepsen, and Alessia Cara.

name: Canadian Singer-Songwriter
description: The Canadian Singer-Songwriter music genre is a style of music that is rooted in folk and country music, but also incorporates elements of rock, pop, and other genres. It is characterized by its lyrical content, which often focuses on personal stories and experiences. The genre is often associated with Canadian artists such as Neil Young, Joni Mitchell, Leonard Cohen, and Gordon Lightfoot. It is often seen as a reflection of the Canadian identity and culture, and is often seen as a more intimate and personal style of music.

name: Classic Canadian Rock
description: Classic Canadian Rock is a genre of music that originated in Canada in the 1960s and 1970s. It is characterized by its hard-driving, blues-influenced sound and often features prominent electric guitar riffs. Classic Canadian Rock bands often draw influence from British Invasion and American blues-rock bands, as well as traditional folk music. Common themes in the lyrics of Classic Canadian Rock songs include patriotism, social issues, and the Canadian landscape. Notable Classic Canadian Rock bands include The Guess Who, Rush, and April Wine.

name: Heartland Rock
description: Heartland Rock is a genre of rock music that originated in the Midwest and Great Lakes regions of the United States in the late 1970s and early 1980s. It is characterized by a straightforward, traditionalist approach to rock music, with an emphasis on simple, direct lyrics and a strong emphasis on melody. The genre is often associated with Bruce Springsteen, Bob Seger, John Mellencamp, and Tom Petty, all of whom are considered to be pioneers of the genre. Heartland Rock is often seen as a reaction to the more experimental and progressive rock music of the 1970s, and is often seen as a more accessible and populist form of rock music.

name: Mellow Gold
description: Mellow Gold is a genre of music that is characterized by its laid-back, relaxed sound. It typically features acoustic instruments, such as guitars, pianos, and strings, as well as soft, soulful vocals. The genre is often associated with singer-songwriters, such as James Taylor, Carole King, and Cat Stevens, and is often seen as a precursor to the folk-rock and soft rock genres. Mellow Gold is often seen as a genre of music that is perfect for relaxing and unwinding.

name: Indie Cafe Pop
description: Indie Cafe Pop is a genre of music that combines elements of indie rock, pop, and folk music. It typically features acoustic instruments, such as guitars, pianos, and drums, as well as electronic elements, such as synthesizers and drum machines. The genre is characterized by its upbeat, catchy melodies and its often dreamy, laid-back atmosphere. It is often associated with coffee shops and cafes, and is often used as background music in these establishments.

name: Pop
description: Pop music is a genre of popular music that originated in its modern form in the 1950s, deriving from rock and roll. Pop music is generally more commercial, melodic, and accessible than other genres of music and often incorporates electronic and urban elements. It typically consists of relatively short songs with a verse-chorus structure and is often characterized by catchy hooks and simple, repetitive melodies. Pop music often features a variety of instruments, including drums, guitars, keyboards, and synthesizers.

name: Grunge
description: Grunge is a subgenre of alternative rock that emerged in the late 1980s and early 1990s in the Pacific Northwest region of the United States, particularly in Seattle and nearby towns. Grunge music is typically characterized by distorted electric guitars, grungy vocals, and a generally "sludgy" sound. It is often associated with the punk and indie rock genres, and is known for its dark, angst-filled lyrics. Grunge bands often drew influence from punk, metal, and classic rock, and the genre is often credited with helping to popularize alternative rock in the 1990s.

name: Permanent Wave
description: Permanent Wave is a genre of music that emerged in the late 1970s and early 1980s. It is a combination of New Wave, Post-Punk, and Synthpop, and is characterized by its use of synthesizers, drum machines, and electronic instruments. The genre is known for its upbeat, danceable sound, and its use of catchy hooks and melodies. It is often associated with the New Romantic movement of the early 1980s.

name: Nightrun
description: Nightrun is a genre of electronic music that combines elements of house, techno, and trance. It is characterized by its dark, driving beats and melodic, atmospheric soundscapes. It often features heavy basslines and complex rhythms, as well as a range of synthesized and sampled sounds. Nightrun is often associated with the underground club scene, and is often played in late-night sets.

name: Sleaze Rock
description: Sleaze Rock is a subgenre of hard rock and heavy metal music that originated in the 1980s. It is characterized by its aggressive, often sexually explicit lyrics and its glam metal-influenced sound. Common lyrical themes include partying, sex, and drugs. Musically, Sleaze Rock is characterized by distorted guitars, pounding drums, and often melodic choruses. It is often associated with the glam metal scene of the 1980s, but has since evolved to include a variety of styles.

name: Swedish Hard Rock
description: Swedish Hard Rock is a style of rock music that originated in Sweden in the late 1960s and early 1970s. It is characterized by its heavy, distorted guitar sound, often with a bluesy influence, and its use of powerful vocal melodies. It is often seen as a precursor to the more popular heavy metal genre. Commonly associated bands include Europe, Yngwie Malmsteen, and The Hellacopters.

name: Gothic Symphonic Metal
description: Gothic Symphonic Metal is a subgenre of heavy metal music that combines elements of gothic rock and symphonic metal. It typically features dark, dramatic melodies, heavy guitar riffs, and operatic female vocals. The genre often incorporates elements of classical music, such as choirs, orchestras, and string sections. It is often characterized by its use of dark, romantic, and sometimes macabre themes.

name: Symphonic Black Metal
description: Symphonic Black Metal is a subgenre of extreme metal that combines elements of black metal with symphonic elements such as classical instruments, choirs, and orchestras. It is characterized by its fast tempos, shrieking vocals, and dark, often Satanic lyrics. The genre is often seen as a combination of classical music and extreme metal, and is often used to create a sense of grandeur and atmosphere.

name: Danish Death Metal
description: Danish Death Metal is a subgenre of death metal that originated in Denmark in the late 1980s. It is characterized by its fast tempos, aggressive guitar riffs, and guttural vocals. The lyrics often focus on themes of death, violence, and the occult. The genre is heavily influenced by thrash metal and traditional heavy metal, and is often seen as a more extreme version of the two. It is also known for its use of blast beats and double-bass drumming.

name: Danish Metal
description: Danish Metal is a subgenre of heavy metal music that originated in Denmark in the late 1980s. It is characterized by a melodic sound, often with a strong emphasis on guitar solos and melodic vocal lines. The genre is heavily influenced by traditional Scandinavian folk music, as well as classic heavy metal bands such as Iron Maiden and Judas Priest. It is also known for its use of keyboards and synthesizers, as well as its often dark and melancholic lyrics. Common bands associated with the genre include Mercyful Fate, King Diamond, and Volbeat.

name: Swedish Power Metal
description: Swedish Power Metal is a subgenre of heavy metal music that originated in Sweden in the late 1980s. It is characterized by its fast tempos, melodic guitar riffs, and soaring vocal melodies. The lyrics often focus on themes of fantasy, mythology, and heroic tales. The genre is heavily influenced by traditional heavy metal, but also incorporates elements of progressive metal, thrash metal, and folk metal. Swedish Power Metal bands often feature multiple vocalists, and often use keyboards and synthesizers to create a more symphonic sound.

name: Glam Rock
description: Glam Rock is a genre of rock music that emerged in the early 1970s in the United Kingdom. It is characterized by an androgynous fashion style, outrageous costumes, and the use of heavy makeup. Musically, Glam Rock is characterized by a heavy guitar-driven sound, often with a strong emphasis on hooks and melodies. It is often associated with the glam metal genre, but is distinct in its own right. Glam Rock is often seen as a precursor to punk rock, and its influence can be heard in many modern rock genres.

name: Finnish Power Metal
description: Finnish Power Metal is a subgenre of heavy metal music that originated in Finland in the early 1990s. It is characterized by its fast-paced, melodic sound, often featuring soaring vocals, heavy guitar riffs, and double-bass drumming. The genre is heavily influenced by traditional heavy metal, but also incorporates elements of progressive metal, symphonic metal, and folk metal. Lyrical themes often focus on fantasy, mythology, and epic battles. Popular Finnish Power Metal bands include Stratovarius, Sonata Arctica, and Nightwish.

name: Norwegian Prog
description: Norwegian Prog is a subgenre of progressive rock music that originated in Norway in the late 1960s and early 1970s. It is characterized by its use of complex musical structures, extended instrumental passages, and a focus on improvisation. It is often characterized by its use of synthesizers, electric guitars, and drums, as well as its incorporation of elements from jazz, classical, and folk music. Norwegian Prog is often seen as a precursor to the more popular progressive rock genre, and is often cited as an influence on the development of the genre.

name: Symphonic Power Metal
description: Symphonic Power Metal is a subgenre of heavy metal music that combines elements of power metal, symphonic metal, and progressive metal. It is characterized by its use of symphonic elements such as choirs, orchestras, and classical instruments, as well as its use of powerful, melodic vocals and fast-paced, technical guitar riffs. It is often characterized by its epic, grandiose sound and its use of fantasy and science fiction themes. Symphonic Power Metal is often seen as a combination of the best elements of power metal and symphonic metal, creating a unique and powerful sound.

name: Meditation
description: Meditation music is a genre of music designed to help the listener relax and focus on the present moment. It typically features calming, ambient sounds such as nature sounds, gentle instrumentals, and soothing vocals. The music is often used for relaxation, stress relief, and to help the listener achieve a meditative state. It can also be used to help with sleep, focus, and concentration.

name: New Age
description: New Age music is a genre of music that is often characterized by its use of synthesizers, electronic instruments, and acoustic instruments. It is often associated with a spiritual or meditative sound, and often incorporates elements of world music, jazz, and classical music. It is often used for relaxation, meditation, and healing.

name: World Fusion
description: World Fusion is a genre of music that combines elements of traditional music from around the world with modern musical styles. It often incorporates elements of jazz, rock, classical, and folk music, as well as traditional instruments from various cultures. World Fusion is a broad term that encompasses a variety of musical styles, including Afro-Cuban, Latin, Middle Eastern, Indian, and African music. It is often used to create a unique sound that is both familiar and exotic.

name: Finnish Doom Metal
description: Finnish Doom Metal is a subgenre of heavy metal music that originated in Finland in the early 1990s. It is characterized by slow tempos, heavy riffs, and dark, melancholic atmosphere. The genre is heavily influenced by traditional doom metal, but also incorporates elements of death metal, gothic metal, and black metal. The lyrics often focus on themes of death, despair, and the occult. Finnish Doom Metal bands include Reverend Bizarre, Swallow the Sun, and Shape of Despair.

name: Melodic Doom
description: Melodic Doom is a subgenre of doom metal that combines the heavy, distorted guitar riffs and slow tempos of traditional doom metal with melodic, often melancholic, lead guitar lines. It is characterized by its use of minor keys, slow tempos, and melancholic atmosphere. The vocals are usually clean and melodic, often with a sense of despair or sorrow. Melodic Doom is often seen as a combination of traditional doom metal and gothic metal, and is often compared to funeral doom.

name: Bow Pop
description: Bow Pop is a genre of music that combines elements of hip-hop, pop, and R&B. It is characterized by its upbeat, catchy melodies and its use of synthesizers and electronic instruments. Bow Pop often features rap verses and choruses that are sung in a melodic, often auto-tuned style. The genre is heavily influenced by the sound of contemporary hip-hop and R&B, but it also incorporates elements of pop music, such as catchy hooks and choruses. Bow Pop is often seen as a more accessible version of hip-hop and R&B, and it has become increasingly popular in recent years.

name: Compositional Ambient
description: Compositional Ambient is a genre of music that combines elements of ambient music with more traditional compositional techniques. It typically features long, slowly evolving soundscapes, often with a focus on texture and atmosphere rather than melody or rhythm. It often incorporates elements of classical, jazz, and world music, as well as field recordings and found sounds. It is often used as a form of background music, but can also be enjoyed as a standalone listening experience.

name: Icelandic Classical
description: Icelandic Classical music is a genre of classical music that is rooted in the traditional music of Iceland. It is characterized by its use of traditional Icelandic instruments such as the langspil, the fiddle, and the hardingfele, as well as its use of traditional Icelandic vocal techniques. It is often characterized by its use of modal scales and its focus on melody and harmony. Icelandic Classical music is often seen as a bridge between traditional Icelandic music and the classical music of Europe.

name: Neo-Classical
description: Neo-Classical music is a genre of music that combines elements of classical music with modern musical styles. It is often characterized by its use of traditional instruments such as the piano, strings, and woodwinds, as well as its incorporation of modern elements such as electronic instruments, synthesizers, and drum machines. Neo-Classical music often has a more contemporary sound than traditional classical music, and is often used in film scores, video game soundtracks, and other media.

name: Neoclassical Darkwave
description: Neoclassical Darkwave is a genre of music that combines elements of classical music, darkwave, and neoclassical music. It typically features dark, atmospheric soundscapes, often with a melancholic or gothic feel. It often incorporates elements of classical music such as strings, piano, and orchestral arrangements, as well as synthesizers and electronic elements. It is often characterized by its slow tempo and minor key melodies.

name: Deep Melodic Death Metal
description: Deep Melodic Death Metal is a subgenre of death metal that combines elements of melodic death metal with a more progressive and atmospheric sound. It is characterized by heavy, distorted guitars, fast-paced drumming, and growled vocals. The melodic elements of the genre are often highlighted by the use of clean vocals, keyboards, and acoustic guitars. The music is often characterized by its dark and melancholic atmosphere, as well as its complex song structures and intricate guitar solos.

name: Groove Metal
description: Groove metal is a subgenre of heavy metal music that combines the aggression and intensity of thrash metal with the rhythm and groove of funk and hip-hop. It is characterized by a heavy, distorted guitar sound, downtuned to a low pitch, and a mid-tempo rhythm. Groove metal bands often feature aggressive, shouted vocals and lyrics that focus on themes of anger, despair, and social alienation. Commonly used instruments include electric guitars, bass guitars, drums, and keyboards.

name: Virginia Metal
description: Virginia Metal is a subgenre of heavy metal music that originated in the state of Virginia in the United States. It is characterized by a blend of traditional heavy metal and hardcore punk, with a focus on aggressive, fast-paced rhythms and aggressive vocals. The genre is often associated with bands such as Lamb of God, GWAR, and Municipal Waste. Virginia Metal is often seen as a more extreme version of thrash metal, with a focus on speed and aggression.

name: Comic Metal
description: Comic Metal is a genre of music that combines elements of heavy metal and comedy. It is characterized by humorous lyrics, often about pop culture topics, and heavy metal instrumentation. The genre often features distorted guitars, double bass drums, and growling vocals. Comic Metal bands often use theatrical elements in their live performances, such as costumes and props.

name: Finnish Hard Rock
description: Finnish Hard Rock is a style of rock music that originated in Finland in the late 1980s. It is characterized by heavy guitar riffs, aggressive vocals, and a fast-paced tempo. The genre is heavily influenced by classic hard rock and heavy metal bands such as Led Zeppelin, Deep Purple, and Black Sabbath. It is also known for its melodic and often melancholic sound, as well as its use of keyboards and synthesizers. Finnish Hard Rock bands often incorporate elements of folk music, such as traditional Finnish instruments and melodies. Popular bands in the genre include HIM, The Rasmus, and Apocalyptica.

name: Finnish Heavy Metal
description: Finnish Heavy Metal is a subgenre of heavy metal music that originated in Finland in the late 1980s. It is characterized by its aggressive sound, fast tempos, and distorted guitars. The genre is heavily influenced by traditional heavy metal, thrash metal, and death metal, but also incorporates elements of traditional Finnish folk music. It is often characterized by its use of melodic vocals, as well as its use of keyboards and synthesizers. Finnish Heavy Metal bands often have a strong emphasis on melody and atmosphere, and often feature complex song structures. Common lyrical themes include fantasy, mythology, and nature.

name: Deathcore
description: Deathcore is a subgenre of metalcore that combines elements of death metal and metalcore. It is characterized by its use of death metal riffs, blast beats, and growled vocals. It also often features breakdowns, which are slow, heavy sections that emphasize the low end of the guitar. Deathcore is often seen as a more extreme version of metalcore, and is often associated with the metalcore scene.

name: Jazz Metal
description: Jazz Metal is a fusion genre that combines elements of jazz and metal music. It typically features complex rhythms, heavy guitar riffs, and improvisational solos. The genre often incorporates elements of funk, progressive rock, and fusion. Jazz Metal is often characterized by its use of odd time signatures, polyrhythms, and extended range instruments. It is often seen as a more extreme version of jazz fusion, with a heavier emphasis on metal elements.

name: North Carolina Metal
description: North Carolina Metal is a subgenre of heavy metal music that originated in North Carolina in the late 1980s and early 1990s. It is characterized by a blend of thrash metal, death metal, and hardcore punk, with a strong emphasis on groove and technicality. The genre is often associated with bands such as Corrosion of Conformity, Death, and Atheist, and is known for its fast tempos, aggressive guitar riffs, and complex song structures. North Carolina Metal is also known for its lyrical themes, which often focus on social and political issues.

name: Persian Alternative
description: The Persian Alternative music genre is a fusion of traditional Persian music with modern alternative rock and pop. It combines traditional Persian instruments such as the tar, setar, and santur with electric guitars, drums, and synthesizers. The genre is characterized by its unique blend of traditional and modern sounds, as well as its incorporation of elements from other genres such as jazz, funk, and hip-hop. Persian Alternative music is often used to express a sense of nostalgia for the past, while also looking to the future.

name: Persian Rock
description: Persian Rock is a genre of music that combines traditional Persian music with elements of rock music. It typically features electric guitars, drums, and bass, as well as traditional Persian instruments such as the tar, setar, and santur. The lyrics are usually in Persian, and the music often has a strong, driving beat. Persian Rock is popular in Iran and among Iranian diaspora communities around the world.

name: French Death Metal
description: French Death Metal is a subgenre of death metal that originated in France in the early 1990s. It is characterized by its fast tempos, aggressive guitar riffs, and harsh vocals. The lyrics often focus on themes of death, violence, and the occult. French Death Metal bands often incorporate elements of black metal, thrash metal, and hardcore punk into their sound. Notable French Death Metal bands include Gojira, Gorod, and Benighted.

name: French Metal
description: French Metal is a subgenre of heavy metal music that originated in France in the late 1980s. It is characterized by a mix of traditional heavy metal, thrash metal, and progressive metal, with a strong emphasis on melody and atmosphere. French Metal bands often incorporate elements of classical music, folk music, and jazz into their sound. The genre is known for its technical proficiency and complex song structures, as well as its use of keyboards and synthesizers. French Metal bands are also known for their use of clean vocals, often sung in French. Notable French Metal bands include Gojira, Dagoba, and Eths.

name: Progressive Groove Metal
description: Progressive Groove Metal is a subgenre of metal music that combines elements of progressive metal and groove metal. It is characterized by its heavy, distorted guitar riffs, complex song structures, and often aggressive vocal delivery. The genre is known for its use of odd time signatures, polyrhythms, and extended instrumental solos. It is also known for its incorporation of elements from other genres such as jazz, funk, and blues.

name: Danish Rock
description: Danish Rock is a genre of rock music that originated in Denmark in the late 1960s and early 1970s. It is characterized by its heavy use of electric guitars, bass, and drums, as well as its incorporation of elements from other genres such as jazz, blues, and folk. Danish Rock is often seen as a precursor to the punk and alternative rock movements of the 1980s and 1990s. It is known for its melodic, often melancholic sound, and its lyrical themes of alienation, rebellion, and social commentary. Notable Danish Rock bands include Gasolin', Savage Rose, and Sort Sol.

name: Funk Rock
description: Funk Rock is a genre of music that combines elements of funk and rock music. It typically features a strong backbeat, funk-style bass lines, and electric guitar riffs. The genre often incorporates elements of soul, jazz, and hip hop. Funk Rock is known for its upbeat, danceable sound and its ability to blend different musical styles.

name: New Age Piano
description: New Age Piano is a genre of music that combines elements of classical, jazz, and contemporary music. It typically features solo piano compositions that are often improvisational in nature and often have a calming, meditative quality. The genre is often associated with relaxation, healing, and spiritual growth. It is often used in yoga classes, massage therapy, and other healing practices.

name: Balkan Folk Metal
description: Balkan Folk Metal is a subgenre of heavy metal music that combines traditional folk music from the Balkans with heavy metal. It typically features traditional instruments such as the gaida (bagpipe), tambura (stringed instrument), and kaval (woodwind instrument) as well as electric guitars, bass, drums, and vocals. The lyrics often focus on themes of Slavic mythology, history, and culture. The genre has become increasingly popular in recent years, with bands such as Orphaned Land, Eluveitie, and Arkona gaining international recognition.

name: Greek Psychedelic Rock
description: Greek Psychedelic Rock is a genre of music that emerged in the late 1960s and early 1970s in Greece. It is characterized by its use of psychedelic elements such as distorted guitars, heavy reverb, and experimental song structures. It is heavily influenced by the psychedelic rock of the 1960s, as well as traditional Greek music. It is often characterized by its use of traditional Greek instruments such as the bouzouki, as well as its incorporation of traditional Greek folk music. It is often seen as a precursor to the Greek New Wave of the 1980s.

name: Greek Rock
description: Greek Rock is a genre of music that combines traditional Greek folk music with rock and roll. It is characterized by its use of traditional Greek instruments such as the bouzouki, the baglamas, and the lyra, as well as electric guitars, drums, and bass. Greek Rock often incorporates elements of traditional Greek music such as the use of Greek scales and rhythms, and often features lyrics in the Greek language. It is a popular genre in Greece and has been gaining popularity in other countries as well.

name: Christian Metalcore
description: Christian Metalcore is a subgenre of metalcore that incorporates Christian themes and imagery into the music. It typically features heavy guitar riffs, breakdowns, and screamed vocals, but also incorporates elements of melodic metalcore, post-hardcore, and hardcore punk. The lyrics often focus on themes of faith, hope, and redemption, and the music often has a positive, uplifting message. Christian Metalcore bands often tour with other Christian bands, and the genre has become increasingly popular in recent years.

name: Christian Rock
description: Christian Rock is a genre of music that combines elements of traditional rock music with Christian lyrical themes. It typically features electric guitars, drums, and bass, as well as other instruments such as keyboards and synthesizers. The lyrics often focus on themes of faith, hope, and love, and are often sung from a Christian perspective. Christian Rock is often seen as a bridge between traditional Christian music and mainstream rock music, and is popular among both Christian and non-Christian audiences.

name: Post-Hardcore
description: Post-hardcore is a genre of rock music that emerged in the late 1980s as a fusion of hardcore punk and alternative rock. It is generally characterized by aggressive, distorted guitars, screamed or shouted vocals, and complex song structures. Post-hardcore often incorporates elements of emo, math rock, and experimental rock. Common lyrical themes include mental health, social alienation, and political and personal issues.

name: Canadian Classical
description: The Canadian Classical music genre is a style of music that is rooted in the classical music traditions of Europe, but with a distinctly Canadian flavor. It is characterized by its use of traditional instruments, such as the piano, strings, and woodwinds, as well as its incorporation of elements from other genres, such as jazz, folk, and world music. Canadian Classical music often features a strong sense of melody and harmony, as well as a focus on improvisation and experimentation. It is often seen as a reflection of the country's diverse cultural heritage, and is often used to express a sense of national pride.

name: Canadian Soundtrack
description: The Canadian Soundtrack is a genre of music that celebrates the unique sound of Canadian music. It is a mix of traditional folk, rock, pop, and country music, with a focus on the distinct sounds of Canadian artists. The genre often features a mix of both English and French lyrics, as well as a variety of instruments, including guitars, banjos, fiddles, and accordions. The Canadian Soundtrack is a celebration of the country's diverse musical heritage, and is often used in film and television soundtracks to evoke a sense of Canadian identity.

name: Middle Earth
description: Middle Earth music is a genre of music that draws inspiration from the works of J.R.R. Tolkien, particularly his fantasy novel The Lord of the Rings. It is characterized by its use of traditional instruments, such as the harp, flute, and drums, as well as its incorporation of Celtic and folk influences. The music often has a mystical, ethereal quality, and is often used to evoke a sense of wonder and adventure. It is often used in film and television soundtracks, as well as in video games and other media.

name: Scorecore
description: Scorecore is a genre of music that combines elements of film score music with electronic dance music. It is characterized by its use of orchestral instruments, such as strings, brass, and woodwinds, as well as synthesizers and drum machines. Scorecore often features a cinematic sound, with a focus on creating an atmosphere or mood. It is often used in video games, films, and television shows.

name: Video Game Music
description: Video game music is a genre of music that is composed specifically for video games. It is often characterized by its use of synthesizers, electronic instruments, and sound effects. It can range from simple, 8-bit chiptune-style music to complex orchestral arrangements. Video game music is often used to create an atmosphere or to enhance the action of a game. It is also used to create a sense of nostalgia for classic games.

name: Progressive Death Metal
description: Progressive death metal is a subgenre of death metal that combines elements of progressive metal with death metal. It is characterized by complex song structures, intricate guitar riffs, and often incorporates elements of jazz, classical, and folk music. The vocals are usually guttural and growled, and the drums are often fast and technical. The overall sound is often chaotic and intense, but with a strong emphasis on melody and atmosphere.

name: German Soundtrack
description: The German Soundtrack genre is a type of music that is inspired by the soundtracks of classic German films. It typically features a mix of orchestral and electronic elements, often with a melancholic or nostalgic feel. It often incorporates elements of classical music, jazz, and ambient music, as well as traditional German folk music. It is often used in film and television soundtracks, as well as in video games and other media.

name: Classic Soundtrack
description: The Classic Soundtrack genre is a collection of music from classic films, television shows, and video games. It typically includes orchestral pieces, as well as popular songs from the era. It is often used to evoke nostalgia and evoke a certain emotion or feeling. It is often used in film and television to set the mood or to create a certain atmosphere.

name: Norwegian Black Metal
description: Norwegian Black Metal is a subgenre of extreme metal music that originated in Norway in the early 1990s. It is characterized by its fast tempos, shrieking vocals, heavily distorted guitars, and raw, lo-fi production. The lyrics often focus on themes of Satanism, death, and the occult. The genre is also known for its use of corpse paint, an extreme form of makeup used to create a corpse-like appearance. Norwegian Black Metal is often associated with the Norwegian black metal scene, which was responsible for a wave of church burnings and murders in the early 1990s.

name: Rap Rock
description: Rap Rock is a genre of music that combines elements of hip hop and rock music. It typically features rap vocals over hard-hitting rock instrumentals, often with distorted guitars and heavy drums. The genre emerged in the late 1990s and early 2000s, and has since become a popular style of music. Artists such as Linkin Park, Limp Bizkit, and Kid Rock are some of the most well-known acts in the genre.

name: Chapman Stick
description: The Chapman Stick is a musical instrument invented by Emmett Chapman in the early 1970s. It is an electric ten-stringed instrument that is played by tapping the strings with both hands. It is often used in a variety of genres, including jazz, rock, funk, and classical music. The Chapman Stick is known for its unique sound, which is created by the combination of the strings being tapped and the sound of the pickups. The instrument is also capable of producing a wide range of tones and textures, making it a versatile instrument for many different styles of music.

name: Black Metal
description: Black Metal is a subgenre of heavy metal music that originated in the early 1980s in Europe. It is characterized by fast tempos, shrieking vocals, heavily distorted guitars, and often dark, occult-inspired lyrics. The genre is often associated with Satanism, paganism, and anti-Christian sentiment. Black Metal bands often employ a "wall of sound" production style, which emphasizes the use of multiple layers of distorted guitars and drums to create a dense, chaotic sound.

name: Folk Black Metal
description: Folk Black Metal is a subgenre of black metal that incorporates traditional folk music elements such as acoustic instruments, traditional melodies, and folk-style singing. It often features a combination of harsh, distorted electric guitars and traditional instruments such as violins, flutes, and drums. The lyrics often focus on pagan and folkloric themes, and the music often has a dark, melancholic atmosphere.

name: Progressive Black Metal
description: Progressive Black Metal is a subgenre of black metal that combines elements of progressive rock and metal with the extreme aggression and speed of traditional black metal. It is characterized by complex song structures, intricate guitar work, and often incorporates elements of jazz, classical, and folk music. The lyrics are often dark and introspective, and the vocals are usually harsh and distorted. Progressive Black Metal bands often experiment with different musical styles and techniques, creating a unique sound that is both aggressive and melodic.

name: Gothic Black Metal
description: Gothic Black Metal is a subgenre of extreme metal music that combines elements of traditional heavy metal with dark, gothic-inspired themes. It typically features fast tempos, shrieking vocals, distorted guitars, and blast beats. The lyrics often focus on themes of death, despair, and the occult. Gothic Black Metal bands often incorporate keyboards and synthesizers to create a dark, atmospheric sound.

name: Portuguese Black Metal
description: Portuguese Black Metal is a subgenre of extreme metal music that originated in Portugal in the early 2000s. It is characterized by its raw, aggressive sound, often featuring fast tempos, distorted guitars, and harsh vocals. The lyrical themes of Portuguese Black Metal often focus on themes of death, destruction, and the occult. It is heavily influenced by Scandinavian Black Metal, but has its own unique sound and style.

name: Portuguese Metal
description: Portuguese Metal is a subgenre of heavy metal music that originated in Portugal in the late 1980s. It is characterized by a mix of traditional heavy metal, thrash metal, and death metal, with a strong emphasis on melody and technicality. The genre is often characterized by its use of Portuguese folk instruments, such as the cavaquinho, and its incorporation of traditional Portuguese music styles, such as fado. Portuguese Metal bands often sing in Portuguese, and the lyrics often focus on themes of Portuguese culture, history, and mythology. It is characterized by its eclectic mix of styles, including elements of folk, jazz, classical, and electronic music. The genre is often described as a combination of traditional Finnish music with modern electronic sounds. Afropop is popular in many African countries and is gaining popularity in other parts of the world.

name: Desert Blues
description: Desert Blues is a genre of music that originated in the Sahara Desert region of North Africa. It is a mix of traditional African music, blues, and rock. It is characterized by its slow, hypnotic rhythms, and its use of traditional instruments such as the karkabou (a type of drum), the guembri (a three-stringed lute), and the tidinit (a single-stringed lute). The lyrics often focus on themes of love, loss, and longing.

name: Griot
description: Griot music is a traditional West African style of music that is typically performed by a single musician or a small group of musicians. It is characterized by its use of call-and-response singing, complex rhythms, and improvisation. The music is often accompanied by a variety of instruments, including drums, bells, and stringed instruments. The lyrics of Griot music often tell stories of the past, and the music is used to pass down oral histories and traditions from generation to generation.

name: Mbalax
description: Mbalax is a popular music genre from Senegal, West Africa. It is a fusion of traditional Wolof music with influences from jazz, soul, funk, and Latin music. It is characterized by its fast tempo, complex polyrhythms, and call-and-response vocals. The lyrics are often in the Wolof language and focus on themes of love, social issues, and politics. Mbalax is often accompanied by traditional instruments such as the sabar drum, tama (talking drum), and kora (harp-lute). It is a popular genre in Senegal and has been popularized by artists such as Youssou N'Dour, Ismael Lo, and Baaba Maal.

name: Musique Peule

It is characterized by its use of traditional instruments such as the kora, ngoni, and balafon, as well as its polyrhythmic and improvisational style. The lyrics of Musique Peule often focus on themes of love, family, and nature, and the music is often used in ceremonies and celebrations.
