Cello music can range from the Baroque period to modern compositions, and can be performed in a variety of styles, from solo recitals to chamber music.

name: Rautalanka
description: Rautalanka is a Finnish style of rock and roll music that originated in the 1950s. It is characterized by its use of electric guitars, often with a twangy sound, and a heavy emphasis on rhythm. The genre is often associated with the Finnish rock band Rautalanka, which was formed in the late 1950s and is credited with popularizing the style. Rautalanka typically features a fast tempo, simple chord progressions, and a catchy melody. The lyrics are often humorous and lighthearted, and the music is often seen as a reflection of the Finnish people's love of life and sense of humor.

name: Cyberpunk
description: Cyberpunk is a genre of electronic music that combines elements of industrial, techno, and alternative rock. It is characterized by its dark, dystopian themes, often featuring lyrics about technology, cybernetics, and virtual reality. It is often characterized by its heavy use of synthesizers, drum machines, and distorted guitars. It is often associated with the cyberpunk subculture, which is a subculture of science fiction and technology enthusiasts.

name: Synthesizer
description: Synthesizer music is a genre of electronic music that is created using synthesizers and other electronic instruments. It is characterized by its use of electronic sounds and effects, often with a focus on creating a futuristic or dream-like atmosphere. Synthesizer music can range from ambient and atmospheric soundscapes to upbeat and energetic dance music. It is often used in film and television soundtracks, video game soundtracks, and as a form of experimental music.

name: Deep Chill-Out
description: Deep Chill-Out is a subgenre of chill-out music that is characterized by its slow tempo, dreamy atmosphere, and ambient soundscapes. It often incorporates elements of downtempo, lounge, and ambient music, and is designed to create a relaxed and calming atmosphere. Deep Chill-Out is often used in yoga classes, meditation, and other relaxation activities.

name: World Chill
description: World Chill is a genre of music that combines elements of world music, chill-out, and ambient music. It is characterized by its relaxed, laid-back atmosphere and its use of traditional instruments and sounds from around the world. It often features a mix of acoustic and electronic instruments, as well as samples from various cultures. World Chill is often used as background music in yoga classes, meditation sessions, and other relaxation activities.

name: LA Indie
description: LA Indie is a genre of music that originated in Latin America in the late 1990s. It is a fusion of indie rock, alternative rock, and Latin American music styles such as cumbia, salsa, and reggaeton. It is characterized by its upbeat, danceable rhythms, and its incorporation of traditional Latin American instruments such as the charango, the quena, and the cajón. La Indie is often seen as a way to express Latin American identity and culture, and its lyrics often focus on social and political issues.

name: Modern Alternative Rock
description: Modern Alternative Rock is a genre of rock music that emerged in the late 1980s and early 1990s. It is characterized by a combination of alternative rock, indie rock, punk rock, and other styles. It is often seen as a more accessible version of alternative rock, with a focus on melody and hooks. Common elements include distorted guitars, heavy drums, and vocal harmonies. Artists in this genre often draw influence from a variety of genres, including pop, hip-hop, and electronic music. Popular artists in this genre include Foo Fighters, The Killers, and Arctic Monkeys.

name: Stomp Pop
description: Stomp Pop is a genre of music that combines elements of folk, rock, and pop music. It is characterized by its upbeat, energetic sound, often featuring acoustic instruments such as banjos, mandolins, and acoustic guitars. It also often features stomping and clapping as part of the rhythm section. The lyrics are often positive and uplifting, and the melodies are often catchy and memorable. Stomp Pop is a great genre for those looking for a fun, upbeat sound.

name: Canadian Post-Rock
description: Canadian Post-Rock is a genre of music that originated in Canada in the late 1990s. It is characterized by its use of unconventional instrumentation, often featuring guitars, drums, and synthesizers, as well as its emphasis on atmosphere and texture. It is often characterized by its slow, dreamy soundscapes, and its use of repetition and layering of sounds. It is often seen as a form of experimental music, and is often compared to ambient music. Canadian Post-Rock is often seen as a reaction to the more mainstream forms of rock music, and is often seen as a way to explore new sonic possibilities.

name: Double Drumming
description: Double Drumming is a style of music that features two drummers playing together in unison. It is often used in jazz, rock, and funk music, and is characterized by complex rhythms and interlocking patterns. The two drummers often play off of each other, creating a unique sound that is both intricate and powerful. Double Drumming is a great way to add texture and depth to any musical performance.

name: Freak Folk
description: Freak folk is a genre of alternative folk music that emerged in the early 2000s. It is characterized by its use of unconventional instrumentation, often including found objects, and its incorporation of elements from other genres such as psychedelia, experimental music, and world music. It is often associated with artists such as Devendra Banhart, Joanna Newsom, and Animal Collective. The genre is known for its lo-fi production and its focus on lyrical content.

name: Indie Rock
description: Indie rock is a genre of alternative rock music that originated in the United States and the United Kingdom in the 1980s. It is characterized by a DIY (do-it-yourself) aesthetic, often featuring lo-fi recording techniques, and a focus on independent record labels and self-released music. Indie rock often incorporates elements of punk, folk, and other genres, and is often seen as a reaction against the mainstream music industry. Indie rock bands often have a strong emphasis on melody and songwriting, and often feature unconventional instrumentation and production techniques.

name: German Techno
description: German Techno is a style of electronic dance music that originated in Germany in the late 1980s. It is characterized by its hard-hitting, repetitive beats and minimalistic sound. It is often associated with the rave and club scenes, and is often used in film and video game soundtracks. German Techno is heavily influenced by the sounds of Detroit Techno, and is often characterized by its use of synthesizers and drum machines. It is often characterized by its dark, industrial sound, and its use of distorted and heavily processed samples.

name: Classic Persian Pop
description: Classic Persian Pop is a genre of music that originated in Iran and is characterized by its melodic, romantic, and often melancholic sound. It is a fusion of traditional Iranian music with Western pop and rock influences. It is often characterized by its use of traditional instruments such as the tar, setar, and santur, as well as modern instruments such as the electric guitar, synthesizer, and drum machine. Classic Persian Pop is often sung in Persian, but can also be sung in English, French, and other languages. It is popular in Iran, the Middle East, and among the Iranian diaspora.

name: Persian Hip Hop
description: Persian Hip Hop is a genre of music that combines traditional Persian music with elements of hip hop. It is characterized by its use of traditional Persian instruments, such as the tar, setar, and santur, as well as modern hip hop elements, such as rap and sampling. Persian Hip Hop often incorporates traditional Persian poetry and lyrics, as well as modern themes and topics. It is a popular genre in Iran and has been gaining popularity in other countries as well.

name: Dutch Indie
description: Dutch Indie is a genre of music that originated in the Netherlands in the late 1990s. It is characterized by its use of electronic instruments, often combined with traditional instruments such as guitars and drums. The genre is heavily influenced by indie rock, post-punk, and alternative rock, and often features dreamy, atmospheric soundscapes. Dutch Indie is often characterized by its melancholic, introspective lyrics and its use of synthesizers and drum machines. Artists associated with the genre include The Gathering, The Black Atlantic, and The Boxer Rebellion.

name: Dutch Indie Rock
description: Dutch Indie Rock is a genre of music that originated in the Netherlands in the late 1990s. It is characterized by its melodic, guitar-driven sound, often featuring a mix of post-punk, alternative rock, and shoegaze influences. The genre is often associated with bands such as The Gathering, The Ex, and The Apers, who are credited with helping to popularize the style. Dutch Indie Rock is known for its catchy hooks, dreamy atmospheres, and often melancholic lyrics.

name: Dutch Pop
description: Dutch Pop is a genre of popular music originating in the Netherlands. It is a mix of traditional Dutch folk music, rock, and pop music. It is characterized by its upbeat, catchy melodies and often incorporates traditional Dutch instruments such as the accordion and the flute. Dutch Pop is often seen as a bridge between traditional Dutch music and modern pop music, and is popular among both young and old audiences.

name: Dutch Rock
description: Dutch Rock is a genre of rock music that originated in the Netherlands in the late 1960s and early 1970s. It is characterized by its heavy use of electric guitars, synthesizers, and drum machines, as well as its incorporation of elements from other genres such as funk, soul, and jazz. Dutch Rock bands often have a more experimental and progressive sound than their British and American counterparts, and often feature complex song structures and extended instrumental passages. Notable Dutch Rock bands include Golden Earring, Focus, and Shocking Blue.

name: Contemporary Country
description: Contemporary Country is a genre of popular music that combines traditional country music with elements of modern pop music. It is often characterized by its use of electric guitars, drums, and synthesizers, as well as its lyrical themes of love, heartache, and life in rural areas. Contemporary Country often features a more upbeat sound than traditional country, and its artists often collaborate with pop and rock musicians. Popular Contemporary Country artists include Carrie Underwood, Blake Shelton, and Luke Bryan.

name: Country
description: Country music is a genre of popular music that originated in the Southern United States in the early 1920s. It takes its roots from genres such as folk music and blues. Characterized by its twangy sound and lyrics that often focus on rural life, country music often tells stories of heartache, love, and loss. It is often accompanied by instruments such as the guitar, banjo, fiddle, and steel guitar. Country music has been popular for decades and continues to be a favorite among many music fans.

name: Country Road
description: Country Road is a genre of music that originated in the Southern United States. It is a blend of traditional country music, folk music, and bluegrass. It is characterized by its simple, traditional instrumentation, often featuring acoustic guitar, banjo, fiddle, and mandolin. The lyrics often focus on themes of love, heartache, and nostalgia. It is often associated with the "outlaw country" movement of the 1970s, which was a reaction to the slick, commercialized country music of the time.

name: Modern Country Rock
description: Modern Country Rock is a genre of music that combines elements of traditional country music with modern rock and roll. It typically features electric guitars, drums, and bass, as well as traditional country instruments such as banjos, fiddles, and steel guitars. The lyrics often focus on themes of love, heartache, and life in the rural South. Artists in this genre include Zac Brown Band, Eric Church, and Miranda Lambert.

name: Redneck
description: Redneck music is a genre of country music that originated in the Southern United States. It is characterized by its twangy sound, often featuring steel guitars, banjos, and fiddles. The lyrics often focus on rural life and the struggles of the working class. Redneck music is often seen as a more traditional form of country music, and is often seen as a more authentic representation of the genre.

name: British Orchestra
description: The British Orchestra music genre is a style of classical music that originated in the United Kingdom. It is characterized by its grandiose and majestic sound, often featuring large ensembles of strings, brass, and woodwinds. This genre is often used in film scores, television shows, and other media, and is known for its sweeping melodies and lush harmonies. It is also often used to evoke a sense of nostalgia and grandeur.

name: Classical
description: Classical music is a broad term that encompasses a wide range of musical styles from the period of 1750 to 1820. It is characterized by its complexity and sophistication, as well as its use of traditional instruments such as the piano, violin, and cello. It is often divided into three distinct periods: the Baroque, Classical, and Romantic. Classical music is known for its structure and form, with pieces often featuring a clear beginning, middle, and end. It is also known for its use of counterpoint, or the simultaneous playing of two or more melodic lines. Famous composers of classical music include Mozart, Beethoven, and Bach.

name: Orchestra
description: Orchestra music is a genre of classical music that is performed by a large ensemble of musicians, typically consisting of strings, brass, woodwinds, and percussion instruments. It is typically written in a symphonic form, with multiple movements and sections. It is often used in film scores, television shows, and other media. It is also used in concert performances, and is often performed by professional orchestras.

name: Acoustic Pop
description: Acoustic Pop is a genre of music that combines elements of acoustic instruments, such as guitars, with elements of pop music. It is often characterized by its mellow, laid-back sound and its use of acoustic instruments. Acoustic Pop often features catchy melodies and simple, yet meaningful lyrics. It is often seen as a more stripped-down version of pop music, with a focus on the songwriting and the emotion of the lyrics.

name: Neo Mellow
description: Neo Mellow is a genre of music that combines elements of alternative rock, pop, and folk music. It is characterized by its mellow, laid-back sound and often features acoustic instruments such as guitars, pianos, and strings. The lyrics are often introspective and reflective, and the overall sound is often dreamy and atmospheric. Neo Mellow is a relatively new genre, having emerged in the early 2000s, and is often seen as a modern take on classic folk and rock music.

name: Armenian Pop
description: Armenian Pop is a genre of popular music that originated in Armenia in the late 1990s. It is a mix of traditional Armenian folk music with modern pop and rock influences. It is characterized by its upbeat, catchy melodies and often incorporates traditional instruments such as the duduk, zurna, and dhol. Armenian Pop is often sung in the Armenian language and is popular among both Armenians and non-Armenians alike.

name: Faroese Rock
description: Faroese Rock is a genre of music that originated in the Faroe Islands, a small archipelago located between Norway and Iceland. It is a blend of traditional Faroese folk music and modern rock and roll. The genre is characterized by its use of traditional Faroese instruments such as the fiddle, accordion, and guitar, as well as its incorporation of modern rock elements such as electric guitars, drums, and synthesizers. Faroese Rock is often characterized by its upbeat, energetic sound and its use of traditional Faroese melodies and rhythms. It is a popular genre in the Faroe Islands and has gained international recognition in recent years.

name: Iranian Metal
description: Iranian Metal is a subgenre of heavy metal music that originated in Iran in the early 2000s. It is characterized by its use of traditional Iranian instruments, such as the tar and the santur, as well as its incorporation of Middle Eastern melodies and rhythms. Iranian Metal bands often sing in both English and Persian, and the lyrics often focus on themes of Iranian culture, history, and politics. The genre has been growing in popularity in recent years, with bands such as Angband, Arashk, and Confess gaining international recognition.

name: Uilleann Pipes
description: Uilleann Pipes is a traditional Irish music genre that is played on a unique set of bagpipes. The instrument is made up of a bellows, three drones, and a chanter, and is played by squeezing the bellows with one arm and using the other arm to press the keys on the chanter. The sound of the Uilleann Pipes is often described as haunting and melancholic, and the music is often used to accompany traditional Irish songs and dances.

name: German Prog
description: German Prog is a subgenre of progressive rock music that originated in Germany in the late 1960s and early 1970s. It is characterized by its use of complex musical structures, often featuring long instrumental passages, and a wide range of musical styles, from classical and jazz to psychedelic rock and folk. German Prog is often associated with the Krautrock movement, which was a reaction to the popular music of the time. It is also known for its use of synthesizers and electronic instruments, as well as its experimental approach to composition.

name: Christian Alternative Rock
description: Christian Alternative Rock is a genre of music that combines elements of alternative rock with Christian themes and lyrics. It typically features distorted guitars, heavy drums, and melodic vocals. The lyrics often focus on themes of faith, hope, and redemption, and the music often has a spiritual or uplifting feel. Christian Alternative Rock is often seen as a bridge between mainstream rock and Christian music, and it has become increasingly popular in recent years.

name: Atmospheric Post-Metal
description: Atmospheric Post-Metal is a subgenre of metal music that combines elements of post-rock, post-metal, and shoegaze. It is characterized by its heavy, distorted guitar riffs, slow tempos, and atmospheric soundscapes. The music often features long, drawn-out songs with multiple sections and layers of sound. It is often characterized by its use of reverb and delay effects, as well as its focus on creating a moody, dreamlike atmosphere.

name: Atmospheric Sludge
description: Atmospheric Sludge is a subgenre of metal music that combines elements of sludge metal, post-metal, and doom metal with atmospheric and ambient elements. It is characterized by slow, heavy riffs, often with a droning quality, and a focus on creating a dark, oppressive atmosphere. The music often incorporates elements of drone, shoegaze, and post-rock, as well as elements of jazz and classical music. It is often characterized by long, drawn-out songs with multiple movements and sections.

name: Progressive Sludge
description: Progressive Sludge is a subgenre of metal music that combines elements of sludge metal, progressive metal, and post-metal. It is characterized by slow, heavy riffs, often with complex time signatures and dissonant chords, as well as a focus on atmosphere and texture. The vocals are usually harsh and aggressive, and the lyrics often deal with dark and personal themes. The music is often experimental and incorporates elements of other genres, such as jazz, classical, and ambient.

name: Sludge Metal
description: Sludge metal is a heavy metal subgenre that combines elements of doom metal, hardcore punk, and Southern rock. It is characterized by slow tempos, heavily distorted guitars, and a thick, heavy sound. The lyrics often focus on themes of despair, suffering, and nihilism. Sludge metal bands often use feedback and distortion to create a thick, oppressive atmosphere. Commonly used instruments include electric guitars, bass guitars, drums, and vocals.

name: Celtic
description: Celtic music is a genre of folk music that originated in the Celtic nations of Ireland, Scotland, Wales, Brittany, Cornwall, and the Isle of Man. It is characterized by its use of traditional instruments such as the fiddle, bagpipes, harp, and accordion, as well as its lyrical themes of love, loss, and nostalgia. Celtic music often incorporates elements of traditional Irish, Scottish, and Welsh folk songs, as well as more modern influences such as rock and pop. It is often performed in a lively, upbeat style, and is often used in films, television shows, and commercials.

name: Industrial
description: Industrial music is a genre of music that emerged in the late 1970s and early 1980s. It is characterized by aggressive, distorted electronic sounds, often created with the use of synthesizers and drum machines. It is often associated with dark, dystopian themes and has been described as a combination of experimental electronic music, punk, and metal. Industrial music has been used in a variety of contexts, from film soundtracks to video game soundtracks, and has been influential in the development of other genres such as industrial rock, industrial metal, and noise music.

name: Industrial Metal
description: Industrial metal is a fusion genre of industrial music and heavy metal music. It typically combines aggressive, distorted guitars, sampling, synthesizers, and drum machines with dark, apocalyptic lyrics and themes. It often features distorted and/or down-tuned guitars, extreme percussion and drum programming, and aggressive vocals. Industrial metal bands often incorporate elements of other genres such as gothic rock, electronic music, and noise rock.

name: Industrial Rock
description: Industrial rock is a fusion genre of industrial music and rock music that originated in the late 1970s. It is characterized by a distorted, mechanical sound, often created with synthesizers and drum machines, and heavily processed guitar and bass. It often incorporates elements of punk rock, noise, and alternative rock, and is often associated with the gothic and cyberpunk subcultures. Industrial rock bands often incorporate elements of performance art and shock tactics into their live shows.

name: Swedish Melodic Rock
description: Swedish Melodic Rock is a style of rock music that originated in Sweden in the late 1970s and early 1980s. It is characterized by its melodic, often keyboard-driven sound, and its use of traditional rock instrumentation such as electric guitars, bass, and drums. It is often associated with the AOR (Album Oriented Rock) genre, and is known for its catchy hooks and choruses. It is also heavily influenced by classic rock, hard rock, and progressive rock. Popular Swedish Melodic Rock bands include Europe, Treat, and H.E.A.T.

name: Icelandic Black Metal
description: Icelandic Black Metal is a subgenre of extreme metal music that originated in Iceland in the early 1990s. It is characterized by its fast tempos, shrieking vocals, and dark, often Satanic lyrical themes. The genre is heavily influenced by Norwegian black metal, and is often associated with the Nordic paganism and Norse mythology. Icelandic black metal bands often incorporate traditional Icelandic instruments such as the langspil and the hurdy-gurdy into their sound. The genre is known for its raw, lo-fi production and its emphasis on atmosphere and emotion.

name: Icelandic Metal
description: Icelandic metal is a subgenre of heavy metal music that originated in Iceland in the late 1980s. It is characterized by its melodic, often melancholic sound, and its use of traditional Icelandic instruments such as the langspil and the hurdy-gurdy. Icelandic metal bands often incorporate elements of folk music, and often sing in Icelandic. The genre is heavily influenced by Scandinavian metal, and is often compared to the music of Norway and Sweden. Notable Icelandic metal bands include Sólstafir, Skálmöld, and Svartidauði.

name: Icelandic Pop
description: Icelandic Pop is a genre of music that originated in Iceland in the late 1980s and early 1990s. It is characterized by its upbeat, catchy melodies and often incorporates elements of rock, folk, and electronic music. Icelandic Pop is often associated with the country's unique culture and landscape, and its lyrics often reflect the country's history and mythology. Artists in this genre include Björk, Sigur Rós, Of Monsters and Men, and Ásgeir.

name: Russian Post-Rock
description: Russian Post-Rock is a genre of music that combines elements of post-rock, ambient, and shoegaze with traditional Russian folk music. It is characterized by its dreamy, atmospheric soundscapes, often featuring reverb-drenched guitars, ethereal vocals, and lush, textured instrumentation. The genre has been popularized by bands such as Auktyon, Motorama, and Pinkshinyultrablast, who have all released critically acclaimed albums in the style.

name: Melodic Deathcore
description: Melodic Deathcore is a subgenre of metalcore that combines elements of melodic death metal and metalcore. It is characterized by its heavy use of distorted guitars, blast beats, and double bass drumming, as well as its incorporation of melodic guitar riffs and solos. It also often features screamed vocals, breakdowns, and growled vocals. The genre is known for its intense and aggressive sound, as well as its incorporation of melodic elements.

name: Progressive Deathcore
description: Progressive deathcore is a subgenre of metalcore and death metal that combines the technicality and complexity of progressive metal with the aggression and heaviness of death metal and metalcore. It is characterized by its use of complex and often dissonant riffs, blast beats, and breakdowns, as well as its use of clean vocals, screamed vocals, and growled vocals. It often features complex song structures, polyrhythms, and tempo changes.

name: Slamming Deathcore
description: Slamming Deathcore is a subgenre of deathcore metal that combines elements of death metal and hardcore punk. It is characterized by heavy breakdowns, blast beats, and guttural vocals. The genre is known for its aggressive and intense sound, often featuring fast tempos and heavy riffs. It is also known for its use of "slams," which are breakdowns that feature heavy, low-tuned guitars and double bass drums. Slamming Deathcore is often associated with the death metal scene, but it has also been embraced by hardcore punk fans.

name: Greek Black Metal
description: Greek Black Metal is a subgenre of black metal music that originated in Greece in the early 1990s. It is characterized by its raw, aggressive sound, often featuring distorted guitars, blast beats, and shrieking vocals. The lyrics often focus on themes of Greek mythology, paganism, and anti-Christianity. Greek Black Metal bands often incorporate traditional Greek instruments such as the bouzouki and the baglamas into their music, creating a unique sound that is distinct from other black metal subgenres.

name: Greek Metal
description: Greek Metal is a subgenre of heavy metal music that originated in Greece in the late 1980s. It is characterized by its use of traditional Greek instruments, such as the bouzouki, and its incorporation of traditional Greek folk music elements. Greek Metal bands often sing in Greek and incorporate traditional Greek melodies and rhythms into their music. The genre is heavily influenced by traditional Greek music, as well as by other metal genres such as thrash metal, death metal, and black metal. Greek Metal bands often have a strong political and social message, and many of their lyrics are about Greek history and mythology.

name: Melodic Black Metal
description: Melodic Black Metal is a subgenre of black metal that combines the traditional elements of black metal with melodic elements from other genres such as power metal, progressive metal, and symphonic metal. It is characterized by fast tempos, shrieking vocals, and heavy guitar riffs. The music often features complex song structures, intricate guitar solos, and symphonic elements such as keyboards and orchestrations. Melodic Black Metal bands often incorporate elements of folk music, classical music, and other genres into their sound.

name: Chanson
description: Chanson is a French music genre that originated in the late Middle Ages. It is typically a solo vocal music style accompanied by instruments such as the guitar, lute, or harpsichord. Chanson is characterized by its poetic lyrics, often about love, and its melodic and often melancholic sound. It is often seen as a precursor to modern pop music.

name: Classic French Pop
description: Classic French Pop is a genre of popular music that originated in France in the 1950s and 1960s. It is characterized by its upbeat, catchy melodies and lyrics that often focus on themes of love, romance, and nostalgia. It is often performed in a light, jazzy style, with instruments such as accordion, piano, and guitar. Classic French Pop is often seen as a precursor to the French chanson style of music, and is still popular today.

name: Vintage French Electronic
description: Vintage French Electronic is a genre of music that combines elements of French electronic music from the 1970s and 1980s with modern production techniques. It is characterized by its use of vintage synthesizers, drum machines, and other electronic instruments, as well as its incorporation of elements of French pop, disco, and funk. The genre is often characterized by its upbeat, danceable rhythms and its melodic, dreamy soundscapes.

name: Gothic Rock
description: Gothic Rock is a subgenre of rock music that emerged in the late 1970s and early 1980s. It is characterized by dark, often morbid, lyrics and a gloomy atmosphere. Musically, it is often based on the post-punk sound of the late 1970s and early 1980s, and is often characterized by the use of synthesizers, drum machines, and heavily distorted guitars. Gothic rock bands often incorporate elements of gothic literature, horror films, and occultism into their music and lyrics.

name: Melodic Groove Metal
description: Melodic Groove Metal is a subgenre of metal music that combines elements of traditional heavy metal with melodic elements and groovy rhythms. It is characterized by heavy guitar riffs, often with a melodic lead guitar line, and a strong rhythm section. The vocals are usually aggressive and powerful, and the lyrics often focus on themes of aggression, despair, and rebellion. The overall sound is often intense and powerful, with a strong emphasis on groove and rhythm.

name: Depressive Black Metal
description: Depressive Black Metal is a subgenre of black metal that focuses on themes of depression, suicide, and nihilism. It is characterized by slow, distorted guitar riffs, shrieking vocals, and often incorporates elements of ambient and drone music. The lyrics often focus on themes of despair, death, and nihilism, and the music is often described as "bleak" and "oppressive".

name: Swedish Black Metal
description: Swedish Black Metal is a subgenre of extreme metal music that originated in Sweden in the early 1990s. It is characterized by its fast tempos, shrieking vocals, heavily distorted guitars, and dark, often Satanic lyrical themes. The genre is heavily influenced by traditional heavy metal, thrash metal, and death metal, as well as by the Norwegian black metal scene. Swedish black metal bands often incorporate elements of folk music, classical music, and ambient music into their sound. The genre is known for its aggressive and often anti-Christian lyrical content, as well as its use of Satanic imagery.

name: Nouvelle Chanson Francaise
description: Nouvelle Chanson Francaise (New French Song) is a genre of French popular music that emerged in the late 1960s and early 1970s. It is characterized by its poetic lyrics, often dealing with social and political issues, and its use of traditional French folk music styles such as chanson and musette. It is often seen as a reaction against the more commercial French pop music of the time. Artists associated with the genre include Jacques Brel, Georges Brassens, and Serge Gainsbourg.

name: Ye Ye
description: Ye Ye is a genre of French popular music that originated in the late 1950s and early 1960s. It is characterized by its upbeat, catchy melodies, and its use of electric guitars, drums, and other instruments. It is often seen as a precursor to the French New Wave of the 1960s and 1970s. The genre is heavily influenced by American rock and roll, jazz, and blues, as well as Latin American music. It is often seen as a bridge between the traditional French chanson and the more modern French pop music.

name: Contemporary Vocal Jazz
description: Contemporary Vocal Jazz is a genre of music that combines elements of jazz, pop, and R&B. It is characterized by its use of improvisation, complex harmonies, and often incorporates elements of funk, soul, and hip-hop. It is often performed by vocalists accompanied by a jazz ensemble, and often features scat singing. Contemporary Vocal Jazz is often seen as a modern take on traditional jazz, and is often seen as a more accessible form of jazz for a wider audience.

name: Lounge
description: Lounge music is a type of easy listening music that is typically characterized by its relaxed, laid-back atmosphere. It often incorporates elements of jazz, bossa nova, and exotica, as well as other genres such as pop, rock, and classical. Lounge music is typically instrumental, but can also include vocals. It is often used in bars, restaurants, and other public spaces to create a relaxed atmosphere.

name: R&B
description: R&B (Rhythm and Blues) is a genre of popular music that originated in African American communities in the 1940s. It combines elements of blues, jazz, gospel, and soul music. R&B is characterized by a strong backbeat, soulful vocals, and often a call-and-response between the lead vocalist and the chorus. It is often associated with romantic and sensual lyrics. Common instruments used in R&B include keyboards, drums, bass, and guitar.

name: Soul
description: Soul music is a genre of popular music that originated in the African American community in the United States in the 1950s and early 1960s. It combines elements of African-American gospel music, rhythm and blues, and jazz. Soul music became popular for dancing and listening in the United States, where record labels such as Motown, Atlantic, and Stax were influential during the Civil Rights Movement. Soul music often has a strong gospel influence, and lyrics are often emotionally charged and deal with personal and social issues. Soul music has been described as having a "deep, heavy, and intense" sound, and its rhythms and melodies are often characterized by call-and-response patterns.

name: EDM
description: EDM (Electronic Dance Music) is a genre of music that is created using electronic instruments and technology. It is characterized by a strong beat and synthesized sounds, and often incorporates elements from other genres such as hip-hop, house, techno, and dubstep. EDM is often used in clubs and festivals, and is popular among younger audiences.

name: Pop Dance
description: Pop Dance is a genre of music that combines elements of pop music with dance music. It is characterized by a strong beat, catchy melodies, and often incorporates elements of hip-hop, R&B, and EDM. Pop Dance is often upbeat and energetic, and is designed to get people on the dance floor. It is often heard in clubs, radio stations, and on streaming services. Popular artists in the Pop Dance genre include Justin Bieber, Ariana Grande, and Lady Gaga.

name: Progressive House
description: Progressive House is a subgenre of House music that emerged in the early 1990s. It is characterized by a slower tempo, deep basslines, and melodic chords. It often incorporates elements of Trance and Techno music, and is often characterized by its use of complex, layered melodies and chord progressions. It is often seen as a more melodic and emotional form of House music, and is often used in clubs and festivals.

name: Progressive Trance
description: Progressive Trance is a subgenre of Trance music that is characterized by a slower tempo (usually around 128-140 BPM), a more melodic sound, and a focus on creating a journey-like atmosphere. It often features long, drawn-out breakdowns and builds, as well as complex and layered melodies. It is often considered to be a more mature and sophisticated form of Trance music, and is popular among Trance fans who prefer a more melodic and emotional sound.

name: Trance
description: Trance is a genre of electronic dance music that originated in the early 1990s. It is characterized by a tempo of around 130-150 beats per minute, repeating melodic phrases, and a musical form that builds up and down throughout a track. Trance music often has a hypnotic, dreamy feel to it, and is often used in clubs and festivals. It is often characterized by a combination of synthesized and acoustic instruments, and often features a strong bassline.

name: Uplifting Trance
description: Uplifting Trance is a subgenre of Trance music that is characterized by its uplifting, euphoric, and anthemic sound. It typically features a driving beat, melodic synths, and soaring lead melodies. Uplifting Trance is often used in film and television soundtracks, as well as in clubs and festivals. It is often associated with the Trance genre, but it is distinct in its own right. Uplifting Trance is often used to evoke a feeling of joy and euphoria, and it is often used to create a sense of energy and excitement.

name: Chillstep
description: Chillstep is a subgenre of electronic music that combines elements of dubstep and chillout music. It is characterized by its slow tempo, deep basslines, and atmospheric melodies. The genre often features vocal samples and synthesizers, as well as a variety of other instruments. It is often used as background music in films, television shows, and video games.

name: Complextro
description: Complextro is a genre of electronic dance music that combines elements of electro house, dubstep, and progressive house. It is characterized by its heavy use of synthesizers, complex drum patterns, and a wide range of sound effects. The tempo of complextro is usually around 128-140 BPM, and the genre often features a wide range of vocal samples and sound effects. The genre is often associated with the use of heavy basslines and distorted synths.

name: Dark Clubbing
description: Dark Clubbing is a genre of electronic music that combines elements of darkwave, industrial, and gothic music with the energy and intensity of club music. It is characterized by heavy, distorted basslines, aggressive synths, and dark, atmospheric soundscapes. It often features distorted vocals and samples from horror films and other dark sources. The tempo is usually fast and the energy is intense, making it a great choice for clubbing and dancing.

name: Electro House
description: Electro House is a genre of electronic dance music that combines elements of house music with electro, and often incorporates a heavy bass line and synthesized sounds. It is characterized by a fast tempo, heavy bass, and a focus on electronic sounds. It often features a four-on-the-floor beat and is often used in clubs and festivals. It is often seen as a more aggressive and energetic version of house music.

name: Filthstep
description: Filthstep is a subgenre of dubstep that is characterized by its heavy, distorted basslines and aggressive, dark sound. It often incorporates elements of other genres such as drum and bass, trap, and grime. It is often characterized by its intense, chaotic energy and its use of heavy, distorted basslines. It is often used in video game soundtracks and in the EDM scene.

name: Gaming EDM
description: Gaming EDM is a genre of electronic dance music that is specifically designed to be used in video games. It typically features a combination of synthesizers, drum machines, and samples, and is often characterized by its upbeat, energetic sound. It is often used in video game soundtracks, as well as in other media such as movies and television shows. Gaming EDM is often used to create a sense of excitement and energy, and can be used to enhance the gaming experience.

name: Experimental Classical
description: Experimental classical music is a genre of classical music that incorporates elements of experimental music, avant-garde, and modern classical music. It is characterized by its use of unconventional techniques, such as extended techniques, improvisation, and the use of electronics and other non-traditional instruments. It often explores new sounds and textures, and often incorporates elements of other genres, such as jazz, rock, and world music. Experimental classical music is often seen as a bridge between traditional classical music and more modern forms of music.

name: Icelandic Experimental
description: Icelandic Experimental music is a genre of music that combines elements of traditional Icelandic folk music with modern experimental music. It is characterized by its use of traditional instruments such as the langspil, as well as modern electronic instruments and sound manipulation techniques. It often features unconventional song structures and improvisation, and is often heavily influenced by ambient and drone music. Icelandic Experimental music is often seen as a reflection of the country's unique landscape and culture, and is often used to explore themes of nature, isolation, and the human experience.

name: Nordic Soundtrack
description: The Nordic Soundtrack is a genre of music that draws inspiration from the traditional folk music of the Nordic countries, such as Sweden, Norway, Finland, and Denmark. It is characterized by its use of traditional instruments, such as the fiddle, accordion, and nyckelharpa, as well as modern electronic elements. The genre often features melancholic melodies and a sense of nostalgia, and is often used in film and television soundtracks.

name: Instrumental Djent
description: Instrumental Djent is a subgenre of metal music that combines elements of progressive metal, mathcore, and post-hardcore. It is characterized by its heavy, distorted guitar riffs, polyrhythmic drumming, and complex song structures. It is often instrumental, but can also include vocals. The genre is heavily influenced by the sound of Meshuggah, and is often associated with the djent guitar technique.

name: Post-Doom Metal
description: Post-Doom Metal is a subgenre of heavy metal music that combines elements of doom metal with other genres such as post-rock, post-metal, and shoegaze. It is characterized by slow, heavy riffs, often with a melancholic atmosphere, and often incorporates elements of ambient music. Post-Doom Metal bands often use unconventional song structures and instrumentation, and often feature extended instrumental passages. The genre is often seen as a bridge between traditional doom metal and more experimental forms of metal.

name: Japanese VGM
description: Japanese VGM (Video Game Music) is a genre of music that originated in Japan and is associated with video games. It is characterized by its upbeat, melodic, and often electronic sound. It often features synthesizers, drum machines, and other electronic instruments, as well as traditional Japanese instruments such as the shamisen and koto. It is often used in video game soundtracks and is popular among fans of video games and anime.

name: Dutch Trance
description: Dutch Trance is a subgenre of Trance music that originated in the Netherlands in the early 2000s. It is characterized by its melodic, uplifting sound and its use of euphoric, trance-like synths and pads. It often features a driving 4/4 beat and a strong bassline. Dutch Trance is often associated with the harder, more aggressive sound of Hardstyle, but it is generally more melodic and uplifting. It is often used in the context of club and festival music, and is popular in the Netherlands and other parts of Europe.

name: Environmental
description: Environmental music is a genre of music that is designed to evoke a sense of natural environment and atmosphere. It often incorporates natural sounds such as birdsong, wind, and water, as well as synthesized sounds that imitate natural sounds. It is often used in soundscapes, soundtracks, and meditation music. It is often associated with ambient music, but is distinct in that it is specifically designed to evoke a sense of nature.

name: Sleep
description: Sleep music is a genre of music designed to help listeners relax and fall asleep. It typically features soft, calming sounds such as gentle piano, strings, and nature sounds like rain or ocean waves. It is often used as background music for meditation, yoga, and massage. Sleep music is often instrumental, but some artists have created vocal versions as well.

name: German Pop
description: German Pop is a genre of popular music that originated in Germany in the late 1950s and early 1960s. It is a blend of traditional German folk music, jazz, rock, and pop music. It is characterized by its catchy melodies, upbeat rhythms, and often humorous lyrics. German Pop is often associated with the Schlager genre, which is a style of popular music that is often performed at festivals and other events. German Pop is also closely related to the Europop genre, which is a style of popular music that is popular throughout Europe.

name: Electro Swing
description: Electro Swing is a genre of music that combines elements of traditional swing jazz with modern electronic dance music. It typically features a combination of live instruments such as horns, drums, and guitars, as well as samples from vintage recordings, and synthesizers. The genre is often characterized by its upbeat, energetic sound, and its use of vintage samples and sounds. It has become popular in recent years, and is often heard in clubs and festivals around the world.

name: Nu Jazz
description: Nu Jazz is a genre of music that combines elements of jazz, funk, soul, and hip-hop. It is characterized by its use of improvisation, syncopated rhythms, and electronic instrumentation. Nu Jazz often features samples of jazz recordings, as well as live instrumentation. It is a modern take on traditional jazz, and is often seen as a bridge between jazz and hip-hop.

name: Oceania Soundtrack
description: The Oceania Soundtrack music genre is a blend of traditional Pacific Island music and modern electronic music. It is characterized by its use of traditional instruments such as ukulele, steel drums, and congas, as well as modern synthesizers and drum machines. The genre often incorporates elements of reggae, dub, and hip-hop, creating a unique and vibrant sound. The music is often upbeat and uplifting, with a focus on creating a positive and uplifting atmosphere.

name: Norwegian Hip Hop
description: Norwegian Hip Hop is a genre of music that originated in Norway in the late 1980s. It is characterized by its use of samples from a variety of sources, including jazz, funk, soul, and reggae, as well as its incorporation of traditional Norwegian folk music. The lyrics often focus on social issues, such as racism, poverty, and inequality. Norwegian Hip Hop is often characterized by its use of double-time flows, and its production often features heavy bass and drums. It has been influenced by a variety of other genres, including American Hip Hop, British Grime, and German Techno.

name: Persian Traditional
description: Persian Traditional music is a genre of music that has been passed down through generations in Iran and other parts of the Middle East. It is characterized by its use of traditional instruments such as the tar, setar, and ney, as well as its use of complex rhythms and melodic improvisation. Persian Traditional music is often performed in a call-and-response style, with the lead singer or instrumentalist taking the lead and the other musicians responding with their own improvisations. It is often accompanied by traditional Persian dance, and is often used to accompany religious ceremonies and celebrations.

name: Pet Calming
description: Pet Calming music is a genre of music specifically designed to help reduce stress and anxiety in animals. It is typically composed of soothing, calming sounds such as gentle piano, strings, and nature sounds. The music is often slow and repetitive, and is designed to help animals relax and feel more at ease. It can be used to help animals during stressful situations such as vet visits, thunderstorms, or fireworks.

name: Ambient IDM
description: Ambient IDM (Intelligent Dance Music) is a genre of electronic music that combines elements of ambient music with elements of IDM. It is characterized by its atmospheric soundscapes, often featuring lush, dreamy soundscapes, and its use of complex rhythms and beats. It is often characterized by its use of synthesizers, samples, and other electronic instruments. Ambient IDM often has a slower tempo than traditional IDM, and its focus is on creating a mood or atmosphere rather than on creating a danceable beat.

name: Greek Downtempo
description: Greek Downtempo is a genre of electronic music that originated in Greece in the late 1990s. It is characterized by its slow, relaxed beats and its use of traditional Greek instruments and samples. It often incorporates elements of traditional Greek music, such as bouzouki, as well as modern electronic sounds. Greek Downtempo is often used as background music in restaurants, bars, and other public spaces. It is also popular among fans of chill-out music.

name: Yacht Rock
description: Yacht Rock is a term used to describe a style of soft rock music that was popular in the late 1970s and early 1980s. It is characterized by its smooth, mellow sound and its use of synthesizers, electric pianos, and saxophones. The genre is often associated with artists such as Michael McDonald, Kenny Loggins, and Hall & Oates. Yacht Rock is often seen as a precursor to the adult contemporary genre.

name: Austrian Orchestra
description: The Austrian Orchestra music genre is a style of classical music that originated in Austria in the late 19th century. It is characterized by its lush, romantic sound, featuring large string sections, woodwinds, brass, and percussion. The music often has a waltz-like feel, with sweeping melodies and lush harmonies. It is often used in film scores and other media, and is a popular choice for wedding music.

name: Ethnotronica
description: Ethnotronica is a genre of music that combines traditional ethnic music with electronic music. It is a fusion of traditional music from around the world with modern electronic production techniques. It often incorporates elements of world music, such as traditional instruments, rhythms, and melodies, as well as electronic elements such as synthesizers, drum machines, and samples. Ethnotronica is a genre that is constantly evolving and is often used to create a unique sound that is both modern and rooted in tradition.

name: Organic Electronic
description: Organic Electronic music is a genre of electronic music that combines elements of organic instruments and sounds with electronic production techniques. It often features a blend of acoustic and electronic instruments, such as acoustic guitars, pianos, strings, and drums, with synthesizers, samplers, and other electronic elements. The genre is characterized by its warm, organic sound, which is often created by layering multiple instruments and sounds. Organic Electronic music is often used in film scores, video game soundtracks, and other media.

name: Organic House
description: Organic House is a subgenre of House music that focuses on creating a more natural and organic sound. It typically incorporates elements of jazz, soul, and funk, as well as organic instruments such as acoustic guitars, pianos, and live drums. It often has a slower tempo than traditional House music, and its production style is often more minimalistic and stripped-down. Organic House is often characterized by its warm, soulful, and melodic sound.

name: Darksynth
description: Darksynth is a genre of electronic music that combines elements of synthwave, darkwave, and horror soundtracks. It is characterized by its heavy use of synthesizers, dark and eerie soundscapes, and often incorporates horror movie sound effects. It is often described as a mix of horror movie soundtracks and 80s synthwave. It is often used in horror films and video games, and has become increasingly popular in recent years.

name: Synthwave
description: Synthwave is a genre of electronic music that emerged in the late 2000s. It is characterized by its heavy use of synthesizers, drum machines, and retro-style production techniques. Synthwave often draws inspiration from 1980s film soundtracks, video game music, and pop culture. It typically features a blend of synthesized and sampled sounds, often with a strong emphasis on melodic hooks and retro-style basslines. Synthwave is often associated with the "outrun" aesthetic, which is inspired by the visual style of 1980s pop culture.

name: Ambient House
description: Ambient House is a genre of electronic music that combines elements of ambient music and house music. It typically features a slow tempo, atmospheric soundscapes, and a focus on texture and atmosphere rather than traditional song structure. Ambient House often incorporates elements of jazz, funk, and soul, as well as samples from other genres. It is often characterized by its dreamy, ethereal sound and its use of synthesizers and drum machines.

name: Garage Rock
description: Garage rock is a raw and energetic style of rock and roll that emerged in the mid-1960s. It is characterized by basic chord structures played on electric guitars and other instruments, sometimes distorted through a fuzzbox, as well as often unsophisticated and occasionally aggressive lyrics and delivery. Garage rock songs often revolve around the traumas of everyday life, with many songs reflecting a fascination with drug use, sexual activity, and rebellion against authority.

name: Sheffield Indie
description: Sheffield Indie is a genre of music that originated in the city of Sheffield, England. It is characterized by its upbeat, guitar-driven sound, often featuring a combination of indie rock, post-punk, and new wave influences. The genre is often associated with the city's vibrant music scene, which has produced a number of successful bands such as Arctic Monkeys, Pulp, and The Long Blondes. Sheffield Indie is known for its catchy melodies, energetic rhythms, and witty lyrics.

name: Arabesk
description: Arabesk is a popular music genre in Turkey and the Middle East. It is a mix of traditional Turkish folk music, Middle Eastern music, and Western pop music. It is characterized by its use of synthesizers, electric guitars, and drum machines, as well as its often melancholic lyrics. It is often associated with the working class and is often seen as a form of protest music.

name: Deep Turkish Pop
description: Deep Turkish Pop is a genre of music that combines traditional Turkish music with modern pop music. It is characterized by its use of traditional Turkish instruments such as the saz, darbuka, and ney, as well as modern electronic instruments. The genre often features traditional Turkish melodies and rhythms, as well as modern pop elements such as synthesizers and drum machines. Deep Turkish Pop is often seen as a bridge between traditional and modern music, and is popular among both young and old audiences.

name: Turkish Folk
description: Turkish Folk music is a genre of traditional music from Turkey that is based on the cultural and social values of the country. It is typically performed by a small ensemble of musicians playing traditional instruments such as the saz (a long-necked lute), the darbuka (a goblet-shaped drum), and the ney (a reed flute). The music is often characterized by its use of improvisation, complex rhythms, and a wide range of vocal styles. It is often accompanied by traditional dances such as the horon and the halay. Turkish Folk music has been influenced by many different cultures, including the Ottoman Empire, the Middle East, and the Balkans.

name: Turkish Pop
description: Turkish Pop is a genre of popular music that originated in Turkey in the late 1960s. It is a blend of traditional Turkish folk music with elements of Western pop music, such as rock, jazz, and hip-hop. It is characterized by its upbeat, catchy melodies and lyrics that often focus on themes of love, romance, and nostalgia. Turkish Pop has become increasingly popular in recent years, with many artists achieving international success.

name: Russian Folk
description: Russian Folk music is a genre of traditional music that originated in the Russian Empire and is still popular in Russia today. It is characterized by its use of traditional instruments such as the balalaika, gusli, and domra, as well as its use of traditional vocal styles. Russian Folk music often features themes of nature, love, and patriotism, and is often accompanied by traditional Russian dances. It is often performed in a lively and upbeat manner, and is often used to celebrate special occasions such as weddings and holidays.

name: French Soundtrack
description: The French Soundtrack genre is a style of music that draws inspiration from the classic French film scores of the 1950s and 1960s. It is characterized by its lush orchestral arrangements, often featuring strings, horns, and woodwinds, as well as its use of jazz and classical elements. It is often used to evoke a sense of nostalgia and romance, and is often used in films and television shows to create a certain atmosphere.

name: Easy Listening
description: Easy Listening is a genre of popular music that is generally light and melodic, often featuring lush orchestral arrangements. It is designed to be pleasant and relaxing, and is often used as background music in restaurants, stores, and other public places. Easy Listening music typically features soft vocals, acoustic instruments, and a steady rhythm. It is often associated with the 1950s and 1960s, but has evolved over the years to include more modern styles.

name: Conscious Hip Hop
description: Conscious Hip Hop is a subgenre of Hip Hop that focuses on socially and politically conscious lyrics. It often addresses topics such as poverty, racism, and other social issues. It is often characterized by its use of complex and poetic lyrics, as well as its focus on social and political issues. Artists in this genre often use their music to express their views on the world and to encourage listeners to think critically about the issues they are discussing.

name: Arabic Jazz
description: Arabic Jazz is a genre of music that combines traditional Arabic music with jazz elements. It is a fusion of jazz improvisation and Middle Eastern rhythms and melodies. It often features instruments such as the oud, qanun, and nay, as well as jazz instruments like the saxophone, trumpet, and piano. The music is often characterized by its use of complex rhythms and improvisation. It is a unique and exciting blend of two distinct musical styles.

name: French Jazz
description: French Jazz is a style of jazz music that originated in France in the early 20th century. It is characterized by its use of traditional French instruments such as the accordion, clarinet, and violin, as well as its incorporation of elements from other genres such as classical music, Latin music, and folk music. French Jazz is often seen as a more lyrical and romantic style of jazz, with a focus on melody and improvisation. It is also known for its use of complex rhythms and harmonies, as well as its use of syncopation.

name: Jazz Trumpet
description: Jazz trumpet is a genre of music that combines elements of jazz and traditional trumpet playing. It is characterized by improvisation, complex rhythms, and a wide range of musical styles. Jazz trumpet players often use a variety of techniques, such as mutes, vibrato, and glissando, to create unique sounds. Jazz trumpet is often associated with swing, bebop, and other jazz styles, but it can also be used in a variety of other genres, such as funk, Latin, and even classical music.

name: French Indie Pop
description: French Indie Pop is a genre of music that combines elements of French pop music with indie rock. It is characterized by its use of catchy melodies, upbeat rhythms, and often dreamy, ethereal soundscapes. It often features a mix of acoustic and electronic instruments, as well as a variety of vocal styles. French Indie Pop is often seen as a more accessible version of French Pop, and is often seen as a bridge between the two genres. It is often seen as a more modern take on French Pop, and is often seen as a way to bring French Pop into the 21st century.

name: French Pop
description: French Pop is a genre of popular music that originated in France in the 1950s. It is characterized by its upbeat, catchy melodies and often incorporates elements of jazz, rock, and other genres. French Pop is often seen as a more sophisticated and romantic style of music than its American counterpart. It is often associated with the French "yé-yé" movement of the 1960s, which featured female singers such as Françoise Hardy and Brigitte Bardot. French Pop has remained popular in France and other parts of Europe, and has seen a resurgence in recent years with the emergence of artists such as Christine and the Queens and Phoenix.

name: French Rock
description: French Rock is a genre of rock music that originated in France in the late 1960s and early 1970s. It is characterized by its heavy use of electric guitars, synthesizers, and drum machines, as well as its incorporation of elements from other genres such as funk, soul, and jazz. French Rock is often seen as a precursor to the New Wave movement of the 1980s, and its influence can be heard in the music of bands such as Daft Punk, Phoenix, and Air.

name: Lithuanian Electronic
description: Lithuanian Electronic music is a genre of electronic music that originated in Lithuania in the early 2000s. It is characterized by its use of synthesizers, drum machines, and other electronic instruments, as well as its incorporation of traditional Lithuanian folk music elements. The genre is often described as having a dark, melancholic sound, with a focus on atmosphere and emotion. It is often associated with the Lithuanian post-rock scene, and has been compared to the music of artists such as Aphex Twin, Autechre, and Boards of Canada.

name: Bossa Nova
description: Bossa Nova is a style of Brazilian music that combines elements of samba and jazz. It originated in the late 1950s and early 1960s in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. It is characterized by its laid-back, relaxed rhythms and melodies, as well as its use of syncopation and improvisation. Bossa Nova is often associated with the beach and is often used in films and television shows to evoke a sense of relaxation and leisure.

name: Cool Jazz
description: Cool Jazz is a style of jazz music that emerged in the late 1940s and early 1950s. It is characterized by a relaxed, laid-back sound, with a focus on subtlety and nuance rather than intense improvisation. Cool Jazz often features a light, airy tone, with a moderate tempo and light swing feel. It is often played with a small ensemble, featuring instruments such as the trumpet, saxophone, piano, and double bass. Cool Jazz is often seen as a bridge between traditional jazz and more modern styles such as bebop and hard bop.

name: Jazz
description: Jazz is a genre of music that originated in the late 19th and early 20th centuries in African American communities in the Southern United States. It is characterized by syncopated rhythms, improvisation, and a wide variety of musical styles. Jazz is often seen as a combination of African and European musical influences, and it has been described as "America's classical music". Jazz has been an important influence on many other genres of music, including rock, pop, and hip hop.

name: Jazz Saxophone
description: Jazz Saxophone is a genre of jazz music that focuses on the saxophone as the primary instrument. It is characterized by improvisation, complex harmonic structures, and a wide range of musical styles. Jazz saxophone can be played in a variety of settings, from small jazz combos to large jazz orchestras. It is often associated with swing, bebop, and other jazz styles. Jazz saxophone players often use a variety of techniques, such as vibrato, glissando, and multiphonics, to create unique sounds.

name: Latin Jazz
description: Latin Jazz is a genre of music that combines elements of Latin American music with jazz. It is a fusion of jazz improvisation with Afro-Cuban rhythms, such as the clave, and other Latin American rhythms. It often features instruments such as the piano, guitar, bass, drums, and percussion, as well as Latin American instruments such as the conga, timbales, and bongos. Latin Jazz is often characterized by its syncopated rhythms, improvisation, and use of Latin American musical elements.

name: Samba-Jazz
description: Samba-Jazz is a fusion genre that combines elements of Brazilian samba and jazz music. It is characterized by a syncopated rhythm, often featuring a combination of acoustic and electric instruments, and a mix of traditional Brazilian and jazz harmonies. The genre is often associated with the bossa nova style, which emerged in the 1950s and 1960s. Samba-Jazz is often seen as a bridge between Brazilian and American music, and has been popularized by artists such as Stan Getz, João Gilberto, and Antonio Carlos Jobim.

name: Anime Score
description: Anime Score is a genre of music that is used as background music in Japanese anime television shows and films. It typically features a mix of traditional Japanese instruments, such as the shamisen, koto, and shakuhachi, as well as modern synthesizers and electronic instruments. The music is often melodic and upbeat, and often incorporates elements of traditional Japanese music, such as taiko drums and folk melodies. Anime Score is often used to create a sense of atmosphere and emotion in the anime, and can range from light and whimsical to dark and dramatic.

name: Japanese Classical
description: Japanese Classical music is a genre of traditional Japanese music that dates back to the 8th century. It is characterized by its use of pentatonic scales, its use of instruments such as the koto, shamisen, and shakuhachi, and its use of traditional Japanese musical forms such as gagaku and shomyo. It is often performed in a ceremonial setting, and is often used in traditional Japanese theater and dance.

name: Japanese Contemporary Classical
description: Japanese Contemporary Classical music is a genre of music that combines traditional Japanese music with modern classical music. It is characterized by its use of traditional Japanese instruments such as the koto, shamisen, and shakuhachi, as well as modern instruments like the piano, synthesizer, and electric guitar. It often incorporates elements of traditional Japanese music such as taiko drumming, gagaku, and shakuhachi melodies. It is often used in film and television soundtracks, as well as in live performances.

name: Japanese Soundtrack
description: The Japanese Soundtrack music genre is a style of music that is heavily influenced by traditional Japanese music. It typically features a combination of traditional Japanese instruments such as the shamisen, koto, and shakuhachi, as well as modern instruments like synthesizers and electric guitars. The genre often incorporates elements of traditional Japanese music such as taiko drums, shamisen melodies, and traditional Japanese scales. It is often used in anime, video games, and other media to create a unique and immersive atmosphere.

name: Belgian Pop
description: Belgian Pop is a genre of popular music that originated in Belgium in the late 1980s and early 1990s. It is characterized by its upbeat, danceable sound and its use of synthesizers and electronic instruments. Belgian Pop is heavily influenced by Eurodance, Europop, and other European dance music styles. It often features catchy melodies, strong hooks, and a heavy emphasis on rhythm. Belgian Pop is often seen as a bridge between mainstream pop and underground dance music, and it has been popular in Belgium and other parts of Europe for decades.

name: G-House
description: G-House is a genre of electronic dance music that combines elements of deep house, hip-hop, and garage. It is characterized by its heavy basslines, syncopated rhythms, and soulful vocal samples. It often features a four-on-the-floor beat and a prominent kick drum. G-House is often associated with the underground club scene and is popular in Europe and the United States.

name: Future Rock
description: Future Rock is a genre of music that combines elements of rock, electronic, and hip-hop. It is characterized by heavy distorted guitars, synthesizers, and drum machines. It often features a mix of live and programmed drums, as well as samples and loops. The genre is often associated with a futuristic sound, and often incorporates elements of dubstep, trap, and other electronic music genres.

name: Slayer
description: Slayer is a thrash metal band from the United States that formed in 1981. Their music is characterized by fast tempos, aggressive musicianship, and dark lyrical themes. The band's musical style has been described as a combination of hardcore punk, thrash metal, and speed metal. Slayer's lyrics often focus on topics such as death, war, violence, and religion. The band has released twelve studio albums, two live albums, and a box set.

name: Ukrainian Metal
description: Ukrainian Metal is a subgenre of heavy metal music that originated in Ukraine in the late 1980s. It is characterized by a mix of traditional heavy metal, thrash metal, and folk metal elements. The lyrics often focus on Ukrainian history, culture, and mythology, and the music often incorporates traditional Ukrainian folk instruments such as the bandura and the sopilka. Ukrainian Metal bands often use Ukrainian language in their lyrics, and the music often has a distinctively Slavic sound.

name: Azeri Traditional
description: Azeri Traditional music is a genre of folk music from Azerbaijan. It is characterized by its use of traditional instruments such as the tar, kamancha, and balaban, as well as its use of traditional vocal styles. The music is often accompanied by traditional dances such as the lezginka and the yalli. It is often performed at weddings and other celebrations, and is a popular form of entertainment in Azerbaijan.

name: Caucasian Classical Piano
description: Caucasian Classical Piano is a genre of music that originated in the Caucasus region of Eurasia. It is a style of classical music that is characterized by its use of traditional instruments, such as the balalaika, domra, and bayan, as well as its use of traditional scales and melodies. name: Sitar

It is characterized by its use of melodic improvisation, complex rhythms, and a wide range of scales and ragas. The sitar is a stringed instrument that is plucked with a plectrum and has a long neck with 20 metal frets. It is usually accompanied by a tabla, a pair of hand drums, and sometimes other instruments such as the harmonium. Sitar music is often used in film soundtracks, and is popular in both India and the West.

name: Classical Cello

The genre is often associated with the Baroque and Classical periods of music, but can also include works from the Romantic and Modern eras.

name: Brazilian Classical

It is characterized by its use of traditional Brazilian instruments, such as the guitar, cavaquinho, and pandeiro, as well as its incorporation of African and European influences. It is often characterized by its use of syncopated rhythms, melodic improvisation, and a focus on melody over harmony. Brazilian Classical music is often seen as a bridge between the traditional folk music of Brazil and the more modern styles of popular music. It is characterized by a more complex harmonic language, larger orchestras, and a greater emphasis on the individual instruments. name: Neoclassicism

It is characterized by a return to the principles of balance, clarity, and economy of material, as well as a focus on formal structures and the use of traditional tonality. Neoclassical composers often use traditional forms such as sonata form, rondo, and variations, as well as modern techniques such as polytonality and atonality. The music often has a strong sense of drama and tension, and often features virtuosic displays of technique.

name: Post-Romantic Era

It is characterized by a more complex harmonic language, a greater emphasis on chromaticism, and a more expansive use of musical forms. It is also marked by a greater focus on the individual composer's personal style and expression. Composers of this era often sought to create music that was more emotionally expressive and less bound by traditional forms. Examples of Post-Romantic Era composers include Gustav Mahler, Richard Strauss, Sergei Rachmaninoff, and Claude Debussy.

name: Russian Romanticism

It is characterized by its use of lush orchestration, chromaticism, and its use of folk melodies. It is often seen as a reaction to the more formal and structured classical music of the time. name: Baroque

Baroque music is often associated with the Baroque period of European history, which was a time of great artistic and cultural achievement. It is also known for its use of counterpoint, fugue, and other forms of musical development. Baroque music is often seen as a bridge between the Renaissance and Classical periods of music.

name: Early Music

It includes music from the Medieval, Renaissance, and Baroque eras, as well as music from the Middle Ages and the Renaissance. Early Music is often performed on period instruments, such as lutes, viols, and harpsichords, and is often characterized by its intricate polyphonic textures and improvisatory nature.

name: French Baroque
description: French Baroque music is a style of music that emerged in France during the 17th and 18th centuries. It is characterized by its ornate and often complex musical structures, as well as its use of the basso continuo, a type of accompaniment that uses a bass line and chords to provide harmonic support. French Baroque music is often highly ornamented and often features a wide range of instruments, including strings, winds, brass, and percussion. It is also known for its use of dance forms, such as the minuet, gavotte, and bourrée.

It is also used to help create a sense of drama and tension during the match.

name: Post-Minimalism
description: Post-Minimalism is a style of music that emerged in the late 1970s and early 1980s. It is a reaction to the minimalist style of music that was popular in the 1960s and 1970s. Post-Minimalism is characterized by a more complex and intricate musical structure, often incorporating elements of jazz, rock, and classical music. It is often characterized by a greater emphasis on melody and harmony, as well as a more expansive use of timbre and texture. Post-Minimalism is often seen as a bridge between the minimalist and modernist styles of music.

name: Dream Trance

The tempo is usually around 130-140 BPM and the music is often quite uplifting and euphoric. Dream Trance is often used in film and television soundtracks, as well as in video games.

name: Contemporary Post-Bop

It is characterized by complex harmonic structures, intricate melodies, and a focus on improvisation. It often features a mix of acoustic and electric instruments, and is often seen as a bridge between traditional jazz and more modern styles such as fusion and jazz-rock.

name: Jazz Funk
description: Jazz Funk is a style of music that combines elements of jazz and funk. It is characterized by a strong groove, often based on syncopated rhythms, and a heavy emphasis on improvisation. Jazz Funk often features electric instruments such as electric bass, electric guitar, and synthesizers, as well as traditional jazz instruments such as saxophone and trumpet. It is often characterized by a fusion of jazz and funk rhythms, as well as a mix of jazz and funk harmonies. Jazz Funk is often seen as a precursor to modern jazz-funk fusion.

name: Jazz Fusion
description: Jazz Fusion is a genre of music that combines elements of jazz with other genres, such as rock, funk, and world music. It is characterized by its use of improvisation, complex time signatures, and extended musical forms. Jazz Fusion often features electric instruments, such as electric guitar, electric bass, and synthesizers, as well as acoustic instruments, such as saxophone, trumpet, and piano. It is often seen as a bridge between jazz and other genres, and is often seen as a way to bring jazz to a wider audience.

name: Soul Jazz

It is characterized by a strong groove, often with a heavy emphasis on the bass and drums, and often featuring horns and other instruments playing improvised solos. Soul Jazz often features vocalists singing in a soulful style, and often incorporates elements of gospel music. name: Classical Era
description: The Classical Era of music is a period of music history that began in the mid-1700s and lasted until the early 1800s. It is characterized by a focus on formal structures, such as sonata form, and a preference for homophonic textures. The Classical Era is often seen as a bridge between the Baroque and Romantic periods, and is known for its balance, clarity, and restraint. Composers of the Classical Era include Haydn, Mozart, and Beethoven.

name: Early Romantic Era
description: The Early Romantic Era of music is a period of music that began in the late 18th century and lasted until the mid-19th century. It is characterized by a focus on emotion and expression, as well as a more expansive harmonic language. Composers of this era often wrote in a more lyrical and expressive style, with a greater emphasis on melody and texture. Instrumental music was often written in a more programmatic style, with a focus on narrative and storytelling. Orchestral music was often written in a larger scale, with more complex textures and larger orchestras. Popular composers of this era include Beethoven, Schubert, Mendelssohn, and Chopin.

name: Metal Guitar
description: Metal Guitar is a genre of music that is characterized by its heavy use of distorted electric guitars, aggressive drumming, and powerful vocals. It is often associated with the hard rock and heavy metal genres, but it can also incorporate elements of other genres such as punk, funk, and blues. Metal Guitar is often characterized by its fast tempos, complex guitar riffs, and intense solos. It is often seen as a more extreme version of hard rock and heavy metal, and is often seen as a more aggressive and intense form of music.

name: Latin Hip Hop
