It is characterized by its heavy use of Latin rhythms and samples, as well as its incorporation of Spanish-language lyrics. name: ECM-Style Jazz
description: ECM-Style Jazz is a jazz subgenre that emerged in the late 1960s and early 1970s. It is characterized by a focus on acoustic instrumentation, a sparse and often minimalistic approach to composition, and a focus on improvisation. It is often associated with the ECM record label, which was founded in 1969 and has released many albums in this style. ECM-Style Jazz is often seen as a reaction to the more commercialized and heavily produced jazz of the time, and is often seen as a more introspective and contemplative style of jazz.

name: Israeli Jazz
description: Israeli Jazz is a genre of music that combines traditional Middle Eastern music with jazz and other Western influences. It is characterized by its use of traditional Middle Eastern instruments such as the oud, the ney, and the darbuka, as well as jazz instruments like the saxophone, trumpet, and piano. The music often features improvisation and complex rhythms, and is often infused with elements of funk, rock, and classical music. name: Etherpop

It is characterized by its dreamy, ethereal soundscapes, often featuring lush, layered synths and heavily reverbed vocals. The genre is often associated with a sense of nostalgia and longing, and its sound is often described as “hazy” and “ethereal.”

name: Float House

The genre is often used in film and television soundtracks, and its sound has been described as "ethereal" and "hypnotic".

name: Lo-Fi House

It typically features a slower tempo, minimal percussion, and a focus on atmosphere and texture. The genre often incorporates elements of jazz, hip-hop, and soul, and often features samples from old records. Lo-Fi House is often characterized by its dreamy, nostalgic sound, and its use of vintage synthesizers and drum machines.

name: House
description: House music is a genre of electronic dance music that originated in the 1980s in Chicago. It is characterized by a repetitive four-on-the-floor beat, a prominent kick drum on every beat, and a variety of electronic synthesizers and samples. House music is often accompanied by a strong bassline and a variety of percussion instruments. It is often characterized by its use of soulful vocals, catchy melodies, and a wide range of musical styles, from disco and funk to jazz and hip-hop. House music is popular in clubs and dance parties around the world.

It is characterized by its heavy use of synthesizers, drum machines, and electronic effects, as well as its fast-paced, energetic sound. It often features a driving 4/4 beat, with a strong emphasis on the bassline and a focus on melodic hooks. It is often characterized by its use of complex and intricate sound design, as well as its use of samples and vocal snippets.

name: Deep Groove House

It is characterized by a deep, driving bassline, a steady 4/4 beat, and a focus on groove and atmosphere. Deep Groove House often features a variety of percussion instruments, such as congas, shakers, and claps, as well as synthesizers and samples. The genre is often associated with a more soulful, melodic sound, and is often used in DJ sets to create a more relaxed atmosphere.

name: Deep House

Deep House often incorporates elements of jazz, soul, and funk, and often features vocal samples and spoken word. It is often seen as a more laid-back and relaxed version of House music, and is often used in chill-out and lounge settings.

The genre is often characterized by its use of tropical-sounding melodies, warm basslines, and a relaxed tempo. name: Hardcore Hip Hop

It is often seen as a more aggressive and confrontational form of rap music, and is often used to express social and political issues. name: Turntablism
description: Turntablism is a form of music that is created using turntables and other sound manipulation tools. Turntablism is often used to create complex and intricate soundscapes, and it is often used to create a unique and creative sound. Turntablism is a form of music that is often used to create a unique and creative sound, and it is often used to create a unique and creative sound.

name: Beatlesque

It is characterized by its use of vocal harmonies, catchy melodies, and simple chord progressions.

name: British Invasion
description: The British Invasion was a musical movement in the 1960s when British rock and pop music acts became popular in the United States and other countries. It was a reaction to the dominance of American rock and roll in the 1950s and early 1960s. The British Invasion was led by the Beatles, who were the most successful and influential of the British acts. Other British Invasion acts included the Rolling Stones, the Kinks, the Who, the Animals, the Dave Clark Five, Herman's Hermits, and the Hollies. These bands and artists brought a new sound to the US, with their unique blend of blues, folk, and rock and roll. They also had a major influence on the development of the genre of rock music.

name: Merseybeat
description: Merseybeat is a style of popular music that originated in Liverpool, England in the early 1960s. It is characterized by a strong backbeat, simple chord progressions, and catchy melodies. It was heavily influenced by American rock and roll, and was popularized by bands such as The Beatles, Gerry and the Pacemakers, and The Searchers. Merseybeat is often seen as a precursor to the British Invasion of the mid-1960s.

name: Popping
description: Popping is a style of dance and music that originated in the late 1970s and early 1980s. It is characterized by its fast-paced, syncopated rhythms and its use of popping and locking techniques. Popping is often combined with other dance styles such as hip-hop, breakdancing, and house. It is often accompanied by electronic music, funk, and soul. Popping is a highly technical dance style that requires a great deal of practice and skill. It is often used in music videos, commercials, and live performances.

name: German Orchestra
description: The German Orchestra music genre is a style of classical music that originated in Germany during the 19th century. It is characterized by its large orchestral sound, with multiple sections of strings, woodwinds, brass, and percussion instruments. This genre is often associated with the works of composers such as Beethoven, Brahms, and Wagner. It is known for its grandiose and dramatic sound, and is often used in film scores and other media.

name: Icelandic Traditional
description: Icelandic traditional music is a genre of folk music that has been passed down through generations in Iceland. It is characterized by its use of traditional instruments such as the fiddle, accordion, and guitar, as well as its unique vocal style. The music often features a call-and-response structure, with the lead singer singing a line and the chorus responding. It is often accompanied by traditional Icelandic dances such as the rímur, a type of epic poem, and the huldufólk, a type of folk dance. Icelandic traditional music is often seen as a reflection of the country’s culture and history, and is still popular today.

name: East Coast Hip Hop
description: East Coast Hip Hop is a genre of hip hop music that originated in the Northeastern United States during the late 1980s and early 1990s. It is characterized by its aggressive lyrical content and hard-hitting beats. East Coast Hip Hop is often associated with the New York City rap scene, and is known for its lyrical complexity and socially conscious themes. It is also known for its use of sampling from classic soul and funk records. East Coast Hip Hop has been influential in the development of other hip hop genres, such as Southern Hip Hop and West Coast Hip Hop.

name: Gangster Rap

Gangster Rap is often associated with the gang culture of the inner-city and is often seen as a reflection of the harsh realities of life in the inner-city. name: Oriental Classical

It is characterized by its use of traditional instruments such as the oud, qanun, and ney, as well as its use of improvisation and ornamentation. It is often characterized by its use of modal scales and its focus on melody over harmony. It is often used in traditional ceremonies and celebrations, as well as in modern popular music.

name: Disco

Disco songs often feature catchy melodies and vocal hooks, as well as a variety of instruments including synthesizers, electric guitars, and horns. The genre is known for its upbeat, energetic sound and its association with the 1970s disco culture.

name: Canadian Hip Hop

It is characterized by its use of samples from classic soul, funk, and jazz records, as well as its lyrical content which often focuses on social issues and the struggles of life in Canada. Canadian Hip Hop is often seen as a more conscious and socially aware form of rap music, with many artists using their music to address issues such as poverty, racism, and inequality. Canadian Hip Hop has also been heavily influenced by the American Hip Hop scene, with many artists taking inspiration from the likes of Nas, Jay-Z, and Eminem.

name: Dark Trap

The lyrics often focus on topics such as drugs, violence, and street life. Dark Trap is often associated with the horrorcore subgenre of hip-hop, and it has been popularized by artists such as 21 Savage, Future, and Lil Uzi Vert.

name: Meme Rap

It is characterized by its humorous and often absurd lyrics, often referencing popular internet memes, and its use of samples from popular songs. Meme Rap often features a heavy use of autotune and other vocal effects, as well as a variety of different production styles. It is often seen as a parody of mainstream rap and hip-hop, and is often used to poke fun at the genre.

name: Vapor Trap

It is characterized by its dreamy, nostalgic, and often melancholic sound, which is created by combining elements of Trap music such as 808 drums, hi-hats, and synths with Vaporwave-style samples and production techniques. The genre often features heavily distorted and manipulated samples, as well as a heavy emphasis on atmosphere and mood.

name: Turkish Instrumental
description: Turkish Instrumental music is a genre of traditional music from Turkey that is characterized by its use of traditional instruments such as the oud, kanun, ney, and saz. It is often characterized by its use of improvisation and complex rhythms. It is often used in traditional ceremonies and celebrations, and is often accompanied by singing and dancing. It is also used in modern Turkish pop music, and has been adapted to other genres such as jazz and classical music.

The genre is heavily influenced by the sounds of the early techno and house music scenes, as well as the more experimental sounds of the German electronic music scene. It is characterized by its melodic and lyrical qualities, as well as its use of traditional British musical forms. It often features virtuosic performances and improvisation.

name: Frankfurt Electronic

name: Minimal Dub

It is characterized by sparse, stripped-down arrangements, often featuring a single bassline, simple drum patterns, and minimal use of effects and samples. The emphasis is on creating a hypnotic, repetitive groove, with minimal changes in the arrangement. Minimal Dub often incorporates elements of other genres such as Reggae, Dubstep, and Ambient.

name: Techno

It is characterized by a repetitive four-on-the-floor beat, synthesizers, and a robotic or futuristic sound. It is often associated with the underground club scene and is known for its use of technology and electronic instruments. name: Uzbek Pop

It is characterized by its upbeat, catchy melodies and often incorporates traditional instruments such as the dutar, doira, and tanbur. name: Deep Uplifting Trance

The genre is often associated with a feeling of euphoria and is often used in film and television soundtracks. Deep Uplifting Trance is often used to create a sense of emotional intensity and is often used to evoke a feeling of joy and happiness.

name: Australian Pop

name: Viral Pop
description: Viral Pop is a genre of music that is characterized by its upbeat, catchy melodies and lyrics that are easy to remember. It often incorporates elements of EDM, hip-hop, and pop music, and is designed to be easily shared and spread across social media platforms. It is often characterized by its use of autotune, synthesizers, and other electronic elements. name: Indie Soul

It is characterized by its eclectic mix of styles, often featuring a mix of live instrumentation and electronic production. Indie Soul often has a laid-back, mellow vibe, with lyrics that are often introspective and reflective. name: Pop EDM
description: Pop EDM is a genre of electronic dance music that combines elements of pop music with EDM. It typically features catchy melodies, upbeat tempos, and a strong focus on hooks and vocal lines. It often incorporates elements of other genres such as hip-hop, house, and trap. Pop EDM is designed to be accessible and appealing to a wide audience, and is often used in radio and television commercials.

name: Country Rock
description: Country Rock is a genre of popular music that combines elements of country music with rock and roll. It typically features electric guitars, drums, and bass, as well as traditional country instruments such as banjos, fiddles, and steel guitars. It often has a strong backbeat and a twangy vocal style. Country Rock is often seen as a bridge between country music and rock and roll, and it has been popular since the 1970s. Artists such as The Eagles, Lynyrd Skynyrd, and The Allman Brothers Band are some of the most well-known Country Rock acts.

name: Turkish Classical
description: Turkish Classical music is a genre of traditional music from Turkey that dates back to the 13th century. It is characterized by its use of complex rhythms, intricate melodies, and improvisation. It is often performed by a small ensemble of musicians, including a lead singer, a stringed instrument (such as the saz or bağlama), a percussion instrument (such as the darbuka or davul), and a wind instrument (such as the ney or zurna). The music is often accompanied by a variety of traditional dances, such as the halay, köçek, and zeybek. Turkish Classical music is an important part of the country's cultural heritage and is still widely performed today.

name: Afghan Pop

It is characterized by its upbeat rhythms, catchy melodies, and use of traditional instruments such as the tabla, harmonium, and sitar. Afghan Pop is popular among both young and old Afghans, and is often used to express political and social issues.

name: Italian Techno
description: Italian Techno is a subgenre of electronic music that originated in Italy in the late 1980s. It is characterized by its fast tempo, heavy basslines, and synthesized sounds. It is often associated with the Italian rave scene and is heavily influenced by the sounds of Detroit techno, Chicago house, and acid house. Italian Techno is often characterized by its use of samples, vocal samples, and melodic elements. It is often seen as a more melodic and accessible version of techno music.

name: Icelandic Indie
description: Icelandic Indie is a genre of music that originated in Iceland in the late 1990s. It is characterized by its dreamy, atmospheric sound, often featuring layered guitars, synths, and ethereal vocals. The genre is heavily influenced by shoegaze, post-rock, and dream pop, and often incorporates elements of folk music. Icelandic Indie bands often explore themes of nature, mythology, and the Icelandic landscape. Notable Icelandic Indie bands include Sigur Rós, Múm, and Of Monsters and Men.

name: Laboratorio
description: Laboratorio is a genre of electronic music that originated in Mexico in the late 1990s. It is characterized by its experimental nature, combining elements of traditional Mexican music with electronic sounds and samples. It is often characterized by its use of synthesizers, drum machines, and other electronic instruments. It is often seen as a fusion of traditional Mexican music and modern electronic music. It is often seen as a way to explore the possibilities of electronic music and to create something new and unique.

name: New Romantic
description: New Romantic is a music genre that emerged in the late 1970s and early 1980s in the United Kingdom. It is a form of synth-pop and post-punk that combines elements of glam rock, art rock, and disco. It is characterized by its use of synthesizers, drum machines, and electronic instruments, as well as its emphasis on fashion and visual style. It is often associated with the flamboyant and androgynous look of its performers, which often included makeup, outrageous costumes, and hairstyles. New Romantic music is often upbeat and melodic, with lyrics that focus on themes of love, romance, and escapism.

name: Carnatic
description: Carnatic music is a form of classical music from South India. It is based on a system of ragas (melodic scales) and talas (rhythmic cycles). It is one of the oldest forms of music in the world, and is still widely performed today. Carnatic music is usually performed by a small ensemble of musicians, including a vocalist, a violinist, a mridangam (a two-headed drum), and a tambura (a drone instrument). The vocalist is usually the leader of the ensemble, and is responsible for setting the tempo and the mood of the performance. The music is often improvisational, and the musicians often interact with each other during the performance.

name: Carnatic Vocal
description: Carnatic vocal music is a form of South Indian classical music that originated in the southern part of India. It is based on a system of ragas (melodic scales) and talas (rhythmic cycles). Carnatic vocal music is usually performed by a solo vocalist accompanied by a group of musicians playing instruments such as the mridangam (a two-headed drum), the ghatam (a clay pot), the veena (a plucked string instrument), and the violin. The vocalist sings in a variety of languages, including Tamil, Telugu, Kannada, and Sanskrit. The music is characterized by its intricate melodic patterns, complex rhythms, and improvisation.

name: Filmi
description: Filmi music is a genre of Indian music that is used in the soundtracks of Bollywood films. It is a blend of traditional Indian music, such as classical, folk, and devotional, with Western influences, such as jazz, rock, and pop. It is characterized by its catchy melodies, energetic rhythms, and use of synthesizers and electronic instruments. It is often used to create a sense of drama and emotion in films.

name: Indian Classical
description: Indian Classical music is a genre of music that has been around for centuries and is still popular today. It is based on two main styles, the Hindustani and Carnatic styles. The Hindustani style is from the northern part of India and is characterized by its use of improvisation and its focus on melody. The Carnatic style is from the southern part of India and is characterized by its focus on rhythm and its use of complex rhythmic patterns. Both styles are based on the raga system, which is a set of melodic rules that govern the composition of a piece. Indian Classical music is often performed with instruments such as the sitar, tabla, and sarod. It is also often accompanied by singing, which is usually in the form of devotional songs or bhajans.

name: Tamil Pop
description: Tamil Pop is a genre of popular music that originated in the Indian state of Tamil Nadu. It is a blend of traditional Tamil folk music and modern Western pop music. It is characterized by its use of traditional Tamil instruments such as the nadaswaram, thavil, and ghatam, as well as modern instruments such as the synthesizer and electric guitar. Tamil Pop is often characterized by its upbeat tempo and catchy melodies. It is popular among both young and old audiences in Tamil Nadu and has become increasingly popular in other parts of India and the world.

name: Deep Minimal Techno
description: Deep Minimal Techno is a subgenre of techno music that focuses on minimalistic, repetitive beats and melodies. It is characterized by its sparse, hypnotic sound, often featuring long, drawn-out grooves and minimal percussion. Deep Minimal Techno is often slower than other forms of techno, and its emphasis on atmosphere and texture makes it a great choice for late-night listening.

name: Minimal Techno
description: Minimal Techno is a subgenre of electronic music that emerged in the late 1990s. It is characterized by a stripped-down, repetitive sound, often with a driving, hypnotic beat. Minimal Techno is often characterized by a focus on texture and atmosphere, rather than melody or structure. It is often characterized by a sparse, minimalistic sound, with a focus on subtle changes in rhythm and texture. It is often associated with the underground club scene, and is often used as a soundtrack for art installations and video art.

name: New French Touch
description: The New French Touch is a genre of electronic music that emerged in the late 1990s and early 2000s. It is characterized by its use of samples, synthesizers, and drum machines, as well as its incorporation of elements from other genres such as hip-hop, funk, and disco. It is often associated with the French house music scene, and is known for its upbeat, danceable sound. Artists associated with the genre include Daft Punk, Justice, and Air.

name: Classic Country Pop
description: Classic Country Pop is a genre of music that combines elements of traditional country music with modern pop music. It typically features a strong vocal performance, often with a twangy, country-style vocal delivery, and instrumentation that includes acoustic and electric guitars, banjos, fiddles, and steel guitars. The lyrics often focus on themes of love, heartache, and nostalgia, and the melodies are often catchy and upbeat. Classic Country Pop is often seen as a bridge between traditional country music and modern pop music, and it has been popularized by artists such as Taylor Swift, Keith Urban, and Lady Antebellum.

name: Nashville Sound
description: The Nashville Sound is a genre of country music that emerged in the 1950s and 1960s. It is characterized by a blend of traditional country music with elements of pop music, such as strings and background vocals. It is often associated with the "countrypolitan" sound, which is a more polished and sophisticated version of traditional country music. The Nashville Sound is often credited with helping to popularize country music and making it more accessible to a wider audience.

name: Outlaw Country
description: Outlaw Country is a subgenre of country music that originated in the late 1960s and early 1970s. It is characterized by a blend of traditional country music and rock and roll, and is often associated with a "rebel" attitude. Outlaw Country is often seen as a reaction to the slick, polished sound of the Nashville establishment. It is characterized by a raw, edgy sound, with lyrics that often deal with themes of rebellion, freedom, and living life on one's own terms. Artists associated with the genre include Willie Nelson, Waylon Jennings, Johnny Cash, and Kris Kristofferson.

name: Texas Country
description: Texas Country is a style of country music that originated in the Lone Star State. It is a blend of traditional country, folk, blues, and rock, and is often characterized by its twangy sound and lyrics about Texas life. It is often referred to as "Red Dirt" music, and is popular in Texas and the surrounding states. Artists such as Pat Green, Robert Earl Keen, and Cory Morrow are some of the most popular Texas Country artists.

name: Electric Bass
description: Electric Bass is a genre of music that focuses on the use of the electric bass guitar as the primary instrument. It is a style of music that is heavily influenced by funk, jazz, and rock music. It is characterized by its heavy use of syncopated rhythms, complex bass lines, and often incorporates elements of improvisation. Electric Bass is often used in a variety of genres, including hip-hop, pop, and electronic music.

name: Disco House
description: Disco House is a genre of electronic dance music that combines elements of disco music with house music. It typically features a four-on-the-floor beat, a prominent bassline, and a strong emphasis on synthesizers and samples. Disco House often incorporates elements of funk, soul, and disco, as well as elements of hip hop and electro. It is characterized by its upbeat, energetic sound and its use of samples from classic disco records.

name: Vocal House
description: Vocal House is a subgenre of House music that incorporates elements of soul, funk, and disco. It is characterized by its use of soulful, often gospel-inspired vocals, as well as its use of synthesizers and drum machines. It is often seen as a more accessible form of House music, as it often features catchy melodies and hooks. It is often seen as a more commercial form of House music, as it often features more radio-friendly vocals and production.

name: German Baroque
description: German Baroque music is a style of music that emerged in Germany during the 17th and 18th centuries. It is characterized by its use of counterpoint, complex harmonic structures, and a wide range of musical forms. It is often associated with the works of composers such as Johann Sebastian Bach, George Frideric Handel, and Dieterich Buxtehude. German Baroque music is known for its use of contrapuntal textures, its emphasis on the bass line, and its use of ornamentation. It is also known for its use of the harpsichord and organ, as well as its use of the chorale.

name: Swedish Electronic
description: Swedish Electronic music is a genre of electronic music that originated in Sweden in the late 1990s. It is characterized by its melodic, dreamy sound, often featuring synthesizers, drum machines, and other electronic instruments. It is often associated with the chillout and downtempo genres, and is often used in film and television soundtracks. Artists in this genre include The Knife, Little Dragon, and Robyn.

name: Swedish Techno
description: Swedish Techno is a subgenre of electronic music that originated in Sweden in the early 1990s. It is characterized by its minimalistic, repetitive, and hypnotic sound. It is often characterized by its use of synthesizers, drum machines, and sequencers. It is often associated with the Swedish rave scene and is heavily influenced by Detroit techno, Chicago house, and acid house. Swedish Techno is often characterized by its dark and melancholic atmosphere, and its focus on atmosphere and texture rather than melody.

name: Classic Azeri Pop
description: Classic Azeri Pop is a genre of music that originated in Azerbaijan in the late 19th century. It is a combination of traditional Azeri folk music and modern pop music. It is characterized by its upbeat tempo, catchy melodies, and use of traditional instruments such as the tar, kamancha, and balaban. The lyrics often focus on themes of love, patriotism, and nostalgia. Classic Azeri Pop is popular throughout the Caucasus region and is often performed at weddings and other celebrations.

name: Jazz Guitar
description: Jazz Guitar is a genre of music that combines elements of jazz and guitar playing. It is characterized by improvisation, complex chord progressions, and a wide range of musical styles. Jazz guitarists often use a variety of techniques such as bending strings, tapping, and using effects pedals to create unique sounds. Jazz guitarists often use a variety of different instruments, including electric guitars, acoustic guitars, and bass guitars. Jazz guitarists often play in a variety of different styles, including swing, bebop, fusion, and Latin jazz.

name: Flamenco Guitar
description: Flamenco guitar is a style of Spanish guitar music that originated in the southern region of Spain. It is characterized by its fast, intricate rhythms and passionate melodies. Flamenco guitar is often accompanied by singing, clapping, and dancing. It is a highly improvisational style of music, with each performance being unique. Flamenco guitar is often used to express emotion and tell stories, and is a popular form of entertainment in Spain.

name: Alternative Dance
description: Alternative Dance is a genre of electronic music that combines elements of alternative rock, indie, and dance music. It is characterized by its use of synthesizers, drum machines, and electronic percussion, as well as its incorporation of elements from other genres such as hip hop, funk, and dubstep. It is often characterized by its upbeat, energetic sound and its use of samples and loops. It is often seen as a bridge between the indie and dance music scenes.

name: Dance-Punk
description: Dance-Punk is a genre of music that combines elements of punk rock and dance music. It typically features fast tempos, distorted guitars, and synthesizers. The lyrics often focus on themes of rebellion and social issues. It is often characterized by its upbeat, energetic sound and its use of electronic instruments.

name: New Rave
description: New Rave is a genre of electronic music that emerged in the early 2000s. It is characterized by a combination of elements from various genres, including electro, punk, indie rock, and pop. It is often characterized by a heavy use of synthesizers, drum machines, and samples, as well as a fast-paced, upbeat tempo. It is often associated with the "rave" scene, and is often seen as a more accessible version of the genre.

name: Santur
description: Santur is a traditional Persian music genre that is played on a santur, a trapezoid-shaped hammered dulcimer. It is characterized by its melodic and harmonic improvisations, and is often accompanied by other instruments such as the tar (a long-necked lute), the ney (a flute), and the tombak (a goblet drum). The santur is typically played with two mallets, and the music is often based on traditional Persian modes and rhythms. Santur music is often used in religious ceremonies, and is also popular in contemporary Iranian music.

name: German Jazz
description: German Jazz is a style of jazz music that originated in Germany in the early 20th century. It is characterized by its use of traditional German folk music elements, such as polka and waltz, as well as its incorporation of classical music elements, such as counterpoint and fugue. German Jazz also features a unique instrumentation, including the use of accordion, tuba, and clarinet. It is often seen as a combination of traditional German music and jazz, and is often seen as a bridge between the two genres.

name: Jazz Trio
description: Jazz Trio is a style of jazz music that is performed by a group of three musicians. It typically consists of a piano, bass, and drums, although other instruments such as guitar, saxophone, or trumpet may be added. The trio format allows for a great deal of improvisation and interaction between the musicians, creating a unique and dynamic sound. Jazz Trio music is often characterized by its swing feel, bluesy melodies, and complex rhythms.

name: Modern Jazz Trio
description: Modern Jazz Trio is a style of jazz music that is characterized by its use of a trio of instruments, typically consisting of a piano, bass, and drums. It is a style of jazz that is often seen as a more contemporary take on the traditional jazz trio format. It is characterized by its use of improvisation, complex rhythms, and a focus on the interplay between the instruments. It is often seen as a more accessible style of jazz, as it is often less complex and more accessible than other jazz styles.

name: Norwegian Jazz
description: Norwegian Jazz is a style of jazz music that originated in Norway in the 1950s. It is characterized by its use of traditional Norwegian folk music elements, such as the Hardanger fiddle, as well as jazz improvisation. Norwegian Jazz is often seen as a combination of traditional Norwegian folk music and modern jazz, and is often seen as a bridge between the two genres. It is often characterized by its use of complex rhythms, improvisation, and a focus on melody. Norwegian Jazz is often seen as a more accessible form of jazz, and is often seen as a way to introduce jazz to a wider audience.

name: Swedish Jazz
description: Swedish Jazz is a style of jazz music that originated in Sweden in the early 20th century. It is characterized by its use of traditional Swedish folk music elements, such as polskas, waltzes, and schottisches, as well as its incorporation of modern jazz elements, such as improvisation and swing. Swedish Jazz is often seen as a bridge between traditional Swedish folk music and modern jazz, and is often performed by small jazz ensembles.

name: Classical Tenor
description: Classical Tenor is a genre of classical music that features the tenor voice as the main vocal part. It is typically performed by a solo tenor, accompanied by a small ensemble of instruments such as strings, piano, and woodwinds. The repertoire of Classical Tenor includes arias from operas, oratorios, cantatas, and other vocal works from the Baroque, Classical, and Romantic eras. The genre is characterized by its expressive and lyrical melodies, as well as its use of ornamentation and vocal technique.

name: Bubblegum Dance
description: The Bubblegum Dance genre is a type of electronic dance music that is characterized by its upbeat, cheerful, and lighthearted sound. It typically features a bouncy, four-on-the-floor beat, bright synthesizers, and catchy vocal hooks. The genre is often associated with the Eurodance and Europop styles of the late 1990s and early 2000s, and is often used in television commercials and video games.

name: Hip House
description: Hip House is a genre of music that combines elements of hip hop and house music. It typically features rap vocals over a four-on-the-floor beat and synthesized basslines. It originated in the late 1980s and early 1990s and was popularized by artists such as Fast Eddie, Tyree Cooper, and Todd Terry. It is characterized by its upbeat, danceable sound and its use of samples from other genres, such as funk, soul, and disco.

name: Dream Pop
description: Dream Pop is a subgenre of alternative rock that emerged in the late 1980s and early 1990s. It is characterized by its ethereal, dreamy soundscapes, often featuring lush layers of guitars, keyboards, and vocals. Dream Pop is often associated with shoegaze and post-rock, and is known for its use of reverb and delay effects. Its lyrics often focus on themes of longing, nostalgia, and escapism. Artists associated with Dream Pop include Cocteau Twins, Slowdive, My Bloody Valentine, and Beach House.

name: Icelandic Rock
description: Icelandic Rock is a genre of music that originated in Iceland in the late 1980s and early 1990s. It is characterized by its heavy use of distorted guitars, driving rhythms, and often melancholic lyrics. It is often compared to the grunge and alternative rock genres, but with a distinct Icelandic flavor. Icelandic Rock bands often draw inspiration from the country's unique landscape and culture, and often incorporate traditional Icelandic instruments and melodies into their music. Notable Icelandic Rock bands include Sigur Rós, Múm, and Of Monsters and Men.

name: Melancholia
description: Melancholia is a genre of music that is characterized by its dark, somber, and often melancholic sound. It typically features slow, minor-key melodies, and often incorporates elements of ambient, classical, and post-rock music. The lyrics often focus on themes of sadness, loss, and despair. Melancholia is often used to evoke a feeling of loneliness and isolation, and can be used to create a mood of introspection and reflection.

name: Nordic Post-Rock
description: Nordic Post-Rock is a genre of music that combines elements of post-rock, ambient, and shoegaze with traditional Nordic folk music. It is characterized by its dreamy, atmospheric soundscapes, often featuring lush layers of guitars, synths, and strings. The music often has a melancholic, introspective feel, and is often instrumental in nature. Nordic Post-Rock is often associated with the Scandinavian countries, but has also been embraced by artists from other parts of the world.

name: Icelandic Electronic
description: Icelandic Electronic music is a genre of electronic music that originated in Iceland in the late 1990s. It is characterized by its experimental and often abstract soundscapes, often featuring elements of ambient, techno, and IDM. It is often characterized by its use of minimalistic and repetitive beats, as well as its incorporation of traditional Icelandic instruments and sounds. Icelandic Electronic music is often seen as a reflection of the country's unique landscape and culture, and has been used in a variety of films, television shows, and video games.

name: German House
description: German House is a subgenre of electronic dance music that originated in Germany in the early 2000s. It is characterized by its use of heavy basslines, distorted synths, and a four-on-the-floor beat. It is often associated with the minimal techno sound, but it also incorporates elements of electro, trance, and tech house. German House is often seen as a more aggressive and intense version of techno, and it has been popularized by artists such as Paul Kalkbrenner, Sven Väth, and Richie Hawtin.

name: Tech House
description: Tech House is a genre of electronic dance music that combines elements of techno and house music. It typically features a 4/4 beat, a driving bassline, and a strong emphasis on percussion. It often incorporates elements of funk, disco, and acid house. Tech House is characterized by its minimalistic, repetitive, and hypnotic sound. It is often used in clubs and festivals, and is popular among DJs and producers.

name: Albanian Pop
description: Albanian Pop is a genre of popular music that originated in Albania in the late 1990s. It is a mix of traditional Albanian folk music, modern pop, and electronic music. It is characterized by its upbeat tempo and catchy melodies. It often features traditional instruments such as the lahuta, the çiftelia, and the zurna, as well as modern instruments such as synthesizers and drum machines. Albanian Pop is popular in Albania and the Albanian diaspora, and has been gaining popularity in other countries in recent years.

name: Classify
description: Classify is a genre of electronic music that combines elements of house, techno, and bass music. It is characterized by its heavy use of synthesizers, drum machines, and samples, as well as its focus on creating a unique and distinct sound. It often features a driving, energetic beat and a range of melodic and percussive elements.

name: Russian Modern Classical
description: Russian Modern Classical music is a genre of classical music that emerged in the late 19th and early 20th centuries in Russia. It is characterized by its use of traditional Russian folk music elements, such as modal scales, and its incorporation of modern Western musical techniques, such as chromaticism and dissonance. It is often seen as a bridge between the traditional Russian classical music of the 19th century and the more modern, avant-garde music of the 20th century. It is often characterized by its use of dissonance, chromaticism, and modal scales, as well as its incorporation of traditional Russian folk music elements. It is often seen as a bridge between the traditional Russian classical music of the 19th century and the more modern, avant-garde music of the 20th century.

name: American Orchestra
description: The American Orchestra music genre is a style of classical music that is rooted in the American musical tradition. It is characterized by its use of large ensembles, often featuring a full orchestra with strings, brass, woodwinds, and percussion. This genre often includes works by American composers, such as Aaron Copland, George Gershwin, and Leonard Bernstein. It is often performed in a concert hall setting, and can range from traditional classical pieces to more modern works.

name: Vocal Trance
description: Vocal Trance is a subgenre of Trance music that features the use of vocals as the main melodic element. It is characterized by its uplifting and euphoric sound, often featuring soaring melodies and lush harmonies. The lyrics are often uplifting and inspirational, and the tempo is usually between 130 and 140 beats per minute. Vocal Trance is often used in clubs and festivals, and is popular among Trance fans.

name: Boogaloo
description: Boogaloo is a genre of Latin music that originated in the 1960s. It is a fusion of Latin music styles such as mambo, cha-cha-cha, and salsa with soul, jazz, and funk. Boogaloo is characterized by its upbeat rhythms and catchy melodies. It is often played with a heavy emphasis on percussion and horns. Boogaloo is popular in Latin American countries and has been gaining popularity in the United States in recent years.

name: Chillhop
description: Chillhop is a genre of music that combines elements of hip-hop, jazz, and electronic music. It is characterized by its laid-back, mellow sound and often features samples from jazz and soul records. It is often instrumental, but can also include vocals. The genre is often associated with lo-fi production and has a strong focus on atmosphere and mood.

name: Jazz Boom Bap
description: Jazz Boom Bap is a genre of hip hop music that combines elements of jazz and traditional hip hop. It is characterized by its use of jazz samples, jazz-influenced drum patterns, and a laid-back, soulful sound. The genre is often associated with the golden age of hip hop, and is often seen as a more mature and sophisticated alternative to the more aggressive and hard-hitting sounds of gangsta rap. Jazz Boom Bap is often seen as a bridge between the two genres, combining the soulful sounds of jazz with the hard-hitting beats of hip hop.

name: Lo-Fi Beats
description: Lo-Fi Beats is a genre of music that is characterized by its low-fidelity production style. It typically features a relaxed, laid-back atmosphere with a focus on creating a mellow, nostalgic vibe. Lo-Fi Beats often incorporates elements of hip-hop, jazz, and soul music, as well as samples from other genres. The production style is often characterized by a lo-fi aesthetic, with a focus on creating a warm, vintage sound.

name: Lo-Fi Jazzhop
description: Lo-Fi Jazzhop is a genre of music that combines elements of jazz and hip-hop. It typically features a laid-back, mellow sound with a heavy emphasis on sampling and looping. The music often has a vintage, nostalgic feel, with a focus on creating a relaxed atmosphere. It often incorporates elements of soul, funk, and R&B, as well as elements of jazz such as improvisation and swing.

name: Abstract Hip Hop
description: Abstract Hip Hop is a genre of music that combines elements of hip hop with experimental and avant-garde sounds. It is characterized by its unconventional production techniques, abstract and often surrealistic lyrical content, and its use of samples from a wide range of sources. Abstract Hip Hop often incorporates elements of jazz, funk, soul, and electronic music, as well as spoken word and poetry. It is often seen as a more experimental and progressive form of hip hop, and is often associated with the underground hip hop scene.

name: Underground Rap
description: Underground Rap is a subgenre of hip hop music that is characterized by its raw, gritty, and often political lyrics. It is often associated with independent labels and DIY production, and is often seen as a reaction to the mainstream hip hop sound. Underground Rap often features complex rhyme schemes, intricate wordplay, and socially conscious lyrics. It is often seen as a more authentic representation of hip hop culture than the mainstream sound.

name: Chinese Classical Performance
description: Chinese Classical Performance is a genre of traditional Chinese music that has been performed for centuries. It is characterized by its use of traditional Chinese instruments such as the erhu, pipa, and guzheng, as well as its use of traditional Chinese musical forms such as the pentatonic scale. It is often performed in a solo or small ensemble setting, and is often accompanied by traditional Chinese dance. The music is often used to evoke a sense of nostalgia and to celebrate Chinese culture and history.

name: Chinese Classical Piano
description: Chinese Classical Piano is a genre of music that combines traditional Chinese music with classical piano. It is characterized by its use of traditional Chinese instruments, such as the guzheng, erhu, and pipa, as well as classical piano. The music often features a combination of both traditional Chinese melodies and classical piano techniques, such as arpeggios and scales. It is often used in film and television soundtracks, as well as in live performances.

name: Persian Electronic
description: Persian Electronic music is a genre of electronic music that combines traditional Persian instruments and melodies with modern electronic production techniques. It is a fusion of traditional Persian music with modern electronic music styles such as house, trance, and techno. It often features traditional Persian instruments such as the tar, setar, and santur, as well as modern electronic instruments such as synthesizers and drum machines. Persian Electronic music is often characterized by its upbeat, energetic sound and its use of traditional Persian melodies and rhythms.

name: Britpop
description: Britpop is a genre of alternative rock music that emerged in the United Kingdom in the mid-1990s. It is characterized by its focus on British culture and the use of traditional British musical influences, such as the use of guitar-driven melodies and lyrics that often focus on British life and culture. It is often seen as a reaction to the American-dominated grunge and alternative rock scenes of the early 1990s. Popular Britpop bands include Oasis, Blur, Pulp, Suede, and Supergrass.

name: Madchester
description: Madchester is a genre of alternative rock music that emerged from Manchester, England in the late 1980s and early 1990s. It is characterized by a fusion of post-punk, indie rock, acid house, and dance music, and is often associated with the "baggy" fashion style. Madchester bands often featured a combination of live instruments and electronic elements, and often had a psychedelic or dreamy sound. Notable Madchester bands include The Stone Roses, The Happy Mondays, and The Charlatans.

name: New Wave
description: New Wave is a genre of popular music that emerged in the late 1970s and early 1980s. It is characterized by synthesizers, electronic drums, and electronic effects, as well as a more experimental approach to songwriting and production. It is often seen as a bridge between punk and pop music, and is known for its catchy hooks and danceable beats. New Wave artists often drew inspiration from a variety of sources, including punk, funk, and disco. Notable New Wave artists include The Talking Heads, Blondie, Devo, and The B-52s.

name: UK Post-Punk
description: UK Post-Punk is a genre of music that emerged in the late 1970s in the United Kingdom. It is a style of rock music that combines elements of punk rock with other genres such as funk, dub, and reggae. Post-punk bands often have a dark, experimental sound and often incorporate elements of art rock, new wave, and avant-garde music. The genre is characterized by its use of angular guitar riffs, synthesizers, and unconventional song structures. Post-punk bands often have a political or social message in their lyrics. Notable UK Post-Punk bands include Joy Division, The Cure, Siouxsie and the Banshees, and Gang of Four.

name: Boom Bap
description: Boom Bap is a style of hip hop music that originated in the late 1980s and early 1990s. It is characterized by its heavy use of samples, hard-hitting drums, and simple, often repetitive, lyrical content. The style is often associated with East Coast hip hop, and is known for its gritty, raw sound. Boom Bap is often seen as a precursor to the more modern styles of hip hop, such as trap and cloud rap.

name: Underground Hip Hop
description: Underground Hip Hop is a subgenre of Hip Hop music that is characterized by its raw, gritty, and often political lyrics. It is often associated with independent labels and DIY production, and is often seen as a reaction to the mainstream commercialization of Hip Hop. Underground Hip Hop often features complex rhyme schemes, intricate wordplay, and socially conscious lyrics. It is often seen as a more authentic representation of Hip Hop culture than the mainstream version.

name: Latin Pop
description: Latin Pop is a genre of popular music that combines Latin American rhythms and styles with elements of pop music. It is characterized by its upbeat, danceable rhythms, catchy melodies, and often romantic lyrics. It is often sung in Spanish, Portuguese, or English, and is popular in Latin America, the United States, and other parts of the world. Latin Pop is heavily influenced by genres such as salsa, merengue, bachata, reggaeton, and cumbia. It is often seen as a fusion of traditional Latin American music and modern pop music.

name: Dark Folk
description: Dark Folk is a genre of music that combines traditional folk music with elements of dark, often gothic, themes. It typically features acoustic instruments such as guitar, banjo, and mandolin, as well as dark, often minor-key melodies and lyrics that explore themes of death, loss, and despair. Dark Folk often incorporates elements of other genres such as blues, country, and rock, and may also include elements of electronic music.

name: Italian Progressive Rock
description: Italian Progressive Rock is a genre of rock music that originated in Italy in the late 1960s and early 1970s. It is characterized by its complex musical structures, often featuring extended instrumental passages, complex time signatures, and a wide range of influences from classical, jazz, and folk music. It is often characterized by its use of synthesizers, Mellotrons, and other electronic instruments, as well as its use of extended vocal techniques. It is also known for its use of complex and often surreal lyrics, often dealing with philosophical and spiritual themes. Notable Italian Progressive Rock bands include PFM, Banco del Mutuo Soccorso, and Le Orme.

name: Preschool Children's Music
description: Preschool Children's Music is a genre of music specifically designed for young children aged 3-5. It typically features upbeat, catchy melodies and simple lyrics that are easy for young children to understand and sing along to. The music often incorporates educational themes, such as counting, colors, animals, and the alphabet. It is often used in classrooms, daycare centers, and other educational settings to help young children learn and have fun.

name: Indie Pop
description: Indie Pop is a genre of alternative music that combines the melodic and lyrical elements of pop music with the DIY aesthetic of independent music. It is characterized by its upbeat, catchy melodies, often featuring synthesizers, drum machines, and other electronic instruments. Indie Pop often has a lo-fi production style, with a focus on songwriting and storytelling. Indie Pop artists often draw influence from a variety of genres, including folk, rock, and hip-hop.

name: Dakke Dak
description: Dakke Dak is a genre of music originating from the Caribbean island of Curaçao. It is a fusion of traditional Caribbean music, such as calypso and soca, with modern electronic music. It is characterized by its upbeat, danceable rhythms and its use of synthesizers and drum machines. The lyrics are often in Papiamentu, the local language of Curaçao. Dakke Dak is popular among young people in Curaçao and is often played at parties and clubs.

name: Hands Up
description: Hands Up is a genre of electronic dance music that originated in Germany in the early 2000s. It is characterized by its fast-paced, high-energy beats and its use of synthesizers and samples. The genre is heavily influenced by Eurodance, Trance, and Hardstyle music, and is often associated with the Eurodance subgenre of Happy Hardcore. It is typically characterized by its use of melodic, uplifting, and often cheesy vocal samples, as well as its heavy use of synthesizers and drum machines. The genre is often associated with the "hands up" dance move, which involves raising one's hands in the air while dancing.

name: Children's Music
description: Children's music is a genre of music specifically designed for children and young people. It is typically upbeat and fun, and often includes educational messages. It can range from nursery rhymes and lullabies to pop songs and hip-hop. It is often used in classrooms, daycare centers, and other educational settings. It is also used in television shows, movies, and video games.

name: Classic Norwegian Pop
description: Classic Norwegian Pop is a genre of music that originated in Norway in the 1950s and 1960s. It is characterized by its upbeat, catchy melodies and often incorporates traditional Norwegian folk music elements. It is often seen as a precursor to the modern Norwegian pop music scene. Classic Norwegian Pop is often characterized by its use of traditional instruments such as the Hardanger fiddle, the accordion, and the langeleik. It is also known for its use of vocal harmonies and its focus on storytelling. Classic Norwegian Pop is often seen as a reflection of the country's culture and history, and is still popular today.

name: Norwegian Gospel
