name: Dirty South Rap
description: Dirty South Rap is a subgenre of hip hop music that originated in the Southern United States in the late 1980s. It is characterized by its heavy use of 808 drum machines, synthesizers, and samples, as well as its lyrical content that often focuses on the struggles of life in the South. It is often associated with the "trap" subgenre, which is characterized by its dark, gritty sound and themes of drug dealing and street life. Dirty South Rap is often credited with popularizing the Southern hip hop sound and helping to bring it to a wider audience.

name: Melodic Rap
description: Melodic Rap is a subgenre of hip hop that combines melodic elements with rap lyrics. It is characterized by its use of melodic hooks, often sung or rapped, and its focus on melody and rhythm. The genre often features a more laid-back, melodic sound than traditional rap, and often incorporates elements of R&B, soul, and pop music. Melodic Rap is often seen as a bridge between traditional rap and more mainstream pop music.

name: Bergen Indie
description: Bergen Indie is a genre of music that originated in Bergen, Norway in the late 1980s. It is characterized by its melodic, dreamy sound, often featuring jangly guitars, synthesizers, and ethereal vocals. The genre is heavily influenced by British indie rock, shoegaze, and post-punk, and is often seen as a precursor to the Norwegian indie rock scene of the 1990s. Bergen Indie bands often have a melancholic, introspective sound, and the lyrics often focus on themes of love, loss, and longing.

name: Balearic
description: Balearic music is a genre of electronic music that originated in the Balearic Islands of Spain in the late 1980s. It is characterized by its relaxed, laid-back sound, often incorporating elements of jazz, funk, and world music. Balearic music is often associated with the beach and summertime, and is often used in chill-out and lounge settings. It is also known for its use of samples from other genres, such as rock, pop, and soul.

name: Gothenburg Indie
description: Gothenburg Indie is a genre of music that originated in Gothenburg, Sweden in the late 1990s. It is characterized by its melodic, guitar-driven sound, often featuring a mix of post-punk, shoegaze, and dream pop influences. The genre is often associated with bands such as The Radio Dept., The Mary Onettes, and The Knife, who all emerged from the Gothenburg music scene in the early 2000s. Gothenburg Indie is known for its melancholic, introspective lyrics and its dreamy, atmospheric soundscapes.

name: Swedish Electropop
description: Swedish Electropop is a genre of electronic music that originated in Sweden in the late 1990s. It is characterized by its use of synthesizers, drum machines, and other electronic instruments, as well as its upbeat, catchy melodies and lyrics. It often incorporates elements of pop, dance, and hip-hop music, and is often seen as a more accessible version of the more experimental electronic music genres. Swedish Electropop is often associated with the Swedish music scene, and is popular in both Sweden and abroad.

name: Swedish Indie Pop
description: Swedish Indie Pop is a genre of music that combines elements of indie rock, pop, and folk music. It is characterized by its melodic, often melancholic sound, and its use of traditional Swedish instruments such as the nyckelharpa and the fiddle. It is often characterized by its use of vocal harmonies and its focus on storytelling. Swedish Indie Pop is often seen as a more accessible version of the traditional Swedish folk music, and is often seen as a bridge between the two genres.

name: Swedish Synthpop
description: Swedish Synthpop is a genre of electronic music that originated in Sweden in the late 1970s and early 1980s. It is characterized by its use of synthesizers and drum machines, as well as its melodic, often melancholic sound. It is heavily influenced by the New Wave and Post-Punk genres, and often incorporates elements of Pop, Disco, and Funk. Swedish Synthpop is often associated with the bands ABBA, The Knife, and Robyn.

name: Intelligent Dance Music
description: Intelligent Dance Music (IDM) is a genre of electronic music that emerged in the early 1990s. It is characterized by its experimental, abstract, and often melancholic soundscapes, often featuring complex and intricate rhythms. IDM is often associated with the more experimental side of electronic music, and is often seen as a bridge between the more traditional electronic music genres and the more experimental and avant-garde forms of electronic music. IDM is often characterized by its use of complex and intricate rhythms, often featuring a wide range of sounds and textures. It is also known for its use of sampling, often from obscure sources, and its use of unconventional sound manipulation techniques.

name: Rave
description: Rave music is a genre of electronic dance music (EDM) that originated in the late 1980s and early 1990s. It is characterized by fast-paced rhythms, synthesized basslines, and repetitive samples. It often incorporates elements of techno, house, and trance music. Rave music is often associated with the rave culture, which includes activities such as dancing, partying, and the use of recreational drugs.

name: Girl Group
description: Girl Group music is a genre of popular music that originated in the 1950s and 1960s. It is characterized by the use of female vocalists singing in harmony, often with a strong beat and catchy melodies. Girl Group music often features themes of love, relationships, and teenage life. It is often seen as a precursor to modern pop music, and has been influential in the development of genres such as R&B, soul, and hip-hop. Girl Group music is often seen as a celebration of female empowerment and solidarity.

name: Belgian Contemporary Classical
description: Belgian Contemporary Classical music is a genre of classical music that is rooted in the traditional classical music of Belgium, but with a modern twist. It is characterized by its use of modern instruments, such as synthesizers, electric guitars, and drum machines, as well as its incorporation of elements from other genres, such as jazz, rock, and electronic music. It often features complex and intricate melodies, as well as a wide range of dynamics and textures. Belgian Contemporary Classical music is often experimental in nature, and is often used to explore new musical ideas and concepts.

name: Minimalism
description: Minimalism is a style of music that emphasizes simplicity and repetition. It is characterized by sparse instrumentation, often featuring only one or two instruments, and minimal melodic and harmonic content. The focus is on creating a hypnotic, trance-like atmosphere through the use of repetition and subtle variations. Minimalism is often associated with the works of composers such as Philip Glass, Steve Reich, and Terry Riley.

name: Elephant 6
description: Elephant 6 is a collective of indie rock bands from Athens, Georgia, and Denver, Colorado, that formed in the early 1990s. The collective is known for its unique sound, which is characterized by a blend of psychedelic, pop, and lo-fi influences. The bands associated with Elephant 6 are often credited with helping to create the "indie rock" genre. The collective's sound is often described as having a "retro" feel, with elements of 1960s pop, garage rock, and psychedelic rock. The bands associated with Elephant 6 have released a number of critically acclaimed albums, including Neutral Milk Hotel's In the Aeroplane Over the Sea, The Apples in Stereo's Fun Trick Noisemaker, and Of Montreal's The Sunlandic Twins.

name: Canadian Electropop
description: Canadian Electropop is a genre of music that combines elements of electronic music with pop music. It typically features synthesizers, drum machines, and other electronic instruments, as well as traditional pop elements such as catchy melodies and vocal hooks. Canadian Electropop often has a more upbeat and energetic sound than other forms of electronic music, and is often characterized by its use of catchy hooks and upbeat rhythms. Artists in this genre include Dragonette, Lights, and Kiesza.

name: Washington Indie
description: Washington Indie is a genre of music that originated in the Pacific Northwest region of the United States. It is characterized by its melodic, often melancholic sound, and its use of acoustic instruments. It often incorporates elements of folk, rock, and pop music, and is often associated with the grunge and alternative rock scenes of the 1990s. Artists associated with the genre include Death Cab for Cutie, Modest Mouse, and The Shins.

name: Classic Soul
description: Classic Soul is a genre of music that originated in the late 1950s and early 1960s. It is a combination of rhythm and blues, gospel, and jazz, and is characterized by its passionate vocals, strong beats, and soulful melodies. Classic Soul is often associated with the Motown sound, and is known for its upbeat, danceable rhythms and catchy hooks. Classic Soul is often credited with helping to bridge the gap between black and white audiences in the United States.

name: Indie R&B
description: Indie R&B is a genre of music that combines elements of traditional R&B with indie rock, hip hop, and electronic music. It is characterized by its soulful, often melancholic sound, and its use of unconventional instrumentation and production techniques. Indie R&B artists often draw inspiration from a variety of genres, including jazz, soul, funk, and hip hop. The genre is often seen as a more experimental and progressive take on traditional R&B, and is often associated with artists such as Frank Ocean, The Weeknd, and Solange.

name: Motown
description: Motown is a genre of popular music that originated in Detroit, Michigan in the late 1950s and early 1960s. It is characterized by a smooth, soulful sound with strong pop and R&B influences. Motown music is often associated with the "Motown Sound," which was developed by the record label Motown Records. The Motown Sound is characterized by a strong rhythm section, melodic hooks, and a focus on vocal harmonies. Motown music is often credited with helping to bridge the gap between black and white audiences in the United States. It has been influential in the development of soul, funk, and disco music.

name: Northern Soul
description: Northern Soul is a genre of music that originated in the late 1960s in the North of England. It is a combination of soul music, Motown, and other American soul styles. It is characterized by its fast tempo, strong beat, and often repetitive lyrics. It is often associated with all-night dance parties, and its popularity has spread to other parts of the world. Northern Soul is often seen as a precursor to the modern dance music scene.

name: Bubblegum Pop
description: Bubblegum Pop is a genre of music that is lighthearted, upbeat, and often catchy. It is characterized by its use of synthesizers, electronic beats, and simple, repetitive lyrics. It is often associated with teen pop and is often seen as a more commercialized version of the genre. Bubblegum Pop is often seen as a genre that is aimed at a younger audience, and is often seen as a genre that is not taken seriously by music critics.

name: Roots Rock
description: Roots Rock is a genre of music that combines elements of rock and roll, folk, blues, country, and other genres of American roots music. It is often characterized by a strong backbeat, simple chord progressions, and a focus on traditional instruments such as acoustic guitar, banjo, and harmonica. It is often seen as a bridge between traditional American roots music and modern rock and roll. Artists associated with the genre include Bob Dylan, Bruce Springsteen, and The Band.

name: Shoegaze
description: Shoegaze is a genre of alternative rock music that emerged in the late 1980s and early 1990s. It is characterized by its ethereal soundscapes, heavy use of guitar effects, and dreamy vocals. Shoegaze music often features a wall of sound created by multiple layers of distorted guitars, bass, and drums. The genre is often associated with the "shoegazing" technique of looking down at one's shoes while playing guitar, hence the name. Shoegaze is often seen as a precursor to the post-rock and dream pop genres.

name: Toronto Indie
description: Toronto Indie is a genre of music that is rooted in the independent music scene of Toronto, Canada. It is characterized by its eclectic mix of styles, ranging from folk, rock, punk, and electronic music. It often features a mix of traditional instruments and modern production techniques, and is often characterized by its DIY ethos. Toronto Indie is often associated with the city's vibrant music scene, and is often seen as a reflection of the city's diverse cultural influences.

name: Pop Soul
description: Pop Soul is a genre of music that combines elements of soul, R&B, and pop music. It is characterized by its upbeat, catchy melodies, and often incorporates elements of funk, hip-hop, and jazz. Pop Soul typically features strong vocal performances, often with a soulful, emotive quality. It is often seen as a bridge between traditional soul music and more contemporary pop music.

name: UK Pop
description: UK Pop is a genre of popular music originating in the United Kingdom. It is a broad genre that encompasses a variety of styles, including pop rock, dance-pop, teen pop, and more. UK Pop is often characterized by its upbeat, catchy melodies, and its use of synthesizers and electronic instruments. It is often seen as a more commercialized version of British rock music, and is often associated with the British Invasion of the 1960s. UK Pop has been popularized by artists such as The Beatles, The Rolling Stones, and more recently, One Direction and Ed Sheeran.

name: Dutch Hip Hop
description: Dutch Hip Hop is a genre of music that originated in the Netherlands in the late 1980s. It is characterized by its use of Dutch language lyrics, often with a heavy emphasis on social and political issues. It is heavily influenced by American hip hop, but also incorporates elements of reggae, dancehall, and other genres. Dutch Hip Hop is often characterized by its hard-hitting beats and aggressive lyrics, and is often seen as a reflection of the struggles of the Dutch youth.

name: Ambient Pop
description: Ambient Pop is a genre of music that combines elements of ambient music with pop music. It typically features lush, atmospheric soundscapes, often with dreamy, ethereal melodies and vocals. The genre often incorporates elements of electronica, chillout, and downtempo music, as well as elements of other genres such as jazz, classical, and folk. Ambient Pop is often characterized by its relaxed, dreamy atmosphere and its focus on creating a mood or atmosphere.

name: Experimental Vocal
description: Experimental vocal music is a genre of music that focuses on the exploration of the human voice as an instrument. It often involves the use of extended vocal techniques, such as vocal layering, vocal looping, vocal sampling, and vocal manipulation. It can also incorporate elements of other genres, such as ambient, electronic, and avant-garde. Experimental vocal music often has an improvisational quality, and can be used to create soundscapes and atmospheres.

name: Arkansas Country
description: Arkansas Country music is a style of country music that originated in the Ozark Mountains of Arkansas. It is a blend of traditional country, bluegrass, folk, and gospel music. It is characterized by its use of acoustic instruments such as the fiddle, banjo, guitar, and mandolin, as well as its focus on traditional vocal harmonies. It is often associated with the "mountain music" of Appalachia, and is known for its upbeat, lively sound. It is also known for its lyrical content, which often focuses on themes of faith, family, and rural life.

name: Chicago Bop
description: Chicago Bop is a style of jazz music that originated in the 1940s in Chicago, Illinois. It is characterized by a fast tempo, complex rhythms, and improvisation. It is often played in a small combo setting, with a rhythm section of drums, bass, and piano, and a lead instrument such as a trumpet or saxophone. The style is heavily influenced by bebop, but has a more relaxed feel and a greater emphasis on swing.

name: Chicago Drill
description: Chicago Drill is a subgenre of hip hop music that originated in Chicago, Illinois. It is characterized by its dark, aggressive lyrical content and trap-influenced beats. The genre is often associated with the city's drill scene, which is a style of rap music that emerged in the early 2010s. The genre is known for its hard-hitting, often violent lyrics, and its heavy use of auto-tune and other vocal effects. Chicago Drill has been heavily influenced by the city's gang culture, and its lyrics often reference gang violence, drugs, and other criminal activities. The genre has been popularized by artists such as Chief Keef, Lil Durk, and G Herbo.

name: Chicago Rap
description: Chicago Rap is a subgenre of hip hop music that originated in Chicago, Illinois. It is characterized by its hard-hitting beats, aggressive lyrics, and often political themes. It is often associated with drill music, a style of rap that originated in Chicago in the early 2010s. Chicago Rap is heavily influenced by the city's culture and history, and often features references to the city's neighborhoods, landmarks, and people. It is also known for its use of sampling, often incorporating classic soul and jazz records. Popular Chicago Rap artists include Chief Keef, Lil Durk, and G Herbo.

name: Drill
description: Drill is a style of trap music that originated in Chicago in the early 2010s. It is characterized by its dark, aggressive lyrical content and trap-influenced beats. Drill is often associated with violence and crime, and its lyrics often focus on gang life, drugs, and street culture. The genre has been popularized by artists such as Chief Keef, Lil Durk, and G Herbo.

name: Crunk
description: Crunk is a type of hip-hop music that originated in the southern United States in the early 2000s. It is characterized by its heavy bass, fast-paced beats, and often explicit lyrics. It is often associated with the "party" or "club" scene, and is often seen as a more aggressive and energetic form of hip-hop. Crunk is often seen as a subgenre of hip-hop, but it has also been described as a fusion of hip-hop and electronic music.

name: Houston Rap
description: Houston Rap is a subgenre of hip hop music that originated in Houston, Texas. It is characterized by its heavy use of chopped and screwed samples, as well as its lyrical content which often focuses on the city's culture and lifestyle. It is also known for its distinctive sound, which is a combination of Southern rap and West Coast G-funk. Houston Rap is often associated with the city's famous Screwed Up Click, which was founded by DJ Screw in the early 1990s. Notable artists in the genre include UGK, Paul Wall, Slim Thug, and Mike Jones.

name: Memphis Hip Hop
description: Memphis Hip Hop is a style of rap music that originated in Memphis, Tennessee in the early 1990s. It is characterized by its heavy use of samples, often from classic soul and funk records, and its hard-hitting, aggressive beats. Memphis Hip Hop is known for its lyrical content, which often focuses on the struggles of inner-city life and the realities of poverty. It is also known for its distinctive vocal delivery, which is often characterized by a deep, gravelly voice. Memphis Hip Hop has been influential in the development of other Southern rap styles, such as crunk and trap.

name: Slap House
description: Slap House is a subgenre of EDM (electronic dance music) that combines elements of house music with trap and hip-hop. It is characterized by heavy basslines, hard-hitting drums, and catchy vocal samples. The genre is often associated with the “slap” sound, which is a percussive sound created by clapping the hands together. Slap House is often used in clubs and festivals, and is popular among younger audiences.

name: Dark Techno
description: Dark Techno is a subgenre of Techno music that is characterized by its dark, brooding, and often sinister sound. It typically features heavy basslines, distorted synths, and industrial-style percussion. Dark Techno often incorporates elements of other genres such as Industrial, EBM, and Dubstep, and is often associated with the darker side of the electronic music scene. It is often used in film and video game soundtracks, and is popular in underground clubs and raves.

name: French Techno
description: French Techno is a style of electronic music that originated in France in the late 1980s and early 1990s. It is characterized by its heavy use of synthesizers, drum machines, and samples, as well as its emphasis on rhythm and groove. It is often characterized by its dark, industrial sound, and its use of repetitive, hypnotic beats. French Techno is often associated with the French house music scene, and is often seen as a precursor to the more popular French house music genre.

name: Industrial Techno
description: Industrial Techno is a subgenre of electronic music that combines elements of industrial music and techno. It is characterized by its dark, aggressive sound, often featuring distorted and distorted synthesizers, heavy drum machines, and samples. It is often associated with the industrial music scene, and is often used in industrial dance clubs. Industrial Techno often has a strong emphasis on rhythm and percussion, and often features a driving, repetitive beat.

name: Comedy Rap
description: Comedy rap is a genre of hip-hop music that combines humorous lyrics with traditional rap elements. It often uses satire and parody to poke fun at popular culture and current events. Comedy rap often features exaggerated, exaggerated, and often absurd lyrics, as well as humorous delivery and production. It is often seen as a subgenre of hip-hop, but it can also be seen as a distinct genre in its own right.

name: Chopped And Screwed
description: Chopped and Screwed is a style of hip-hop music that originated in Houston, Texas. It is characterized by a slowed-down, distorted sound, often with the addition of reverb and echo effects. The tempo of the music is usually around 60-70 beats per minute, and the pitch is often lowered. The lyrics are often chopped up and rearranged, creating a unique sound. The genre has become popular in the Southern United States, and has been embraced by many hip-hop artists.

name: Emo Rap
description: Emo Rap is a subgenre of hip hop music that combines elements of hip hop and emo music. It typically features emotionally charged lyrics that focus on topics such as mental health, depression, anxiety, and loneliness. The production often incorporates elements of trap music, such as heavy bass and 808s, as well as distorted guitars and other rock-inspired instrumentation. Emo Rap is often characterized by its melodic, sing-songy delivery and its use of autotune. It has become increasingly popular in recent years, with artists such as Juice WRLD, Lil Peep, and XXXTentacion leading the way.

name: El Paso Indie
description: El Paso Indie is a genre of music that originated in El Paso, Texas. It is a blend of traditional Mexican music, rock, and punk, with a heavy emphasis on the traditional Mexican sound. The genre is characterized by its use of traditional Mexican instruments such as the vihuela, guitarron, and accordion, as well as its incorporation of punk and rock elements. It is often characterized by its upbeat, energetic sound and its incorporation of traditional Mexican lyrics. El Paso Indie is a popular genre in the El Paso area and is gaining popularity in other parts of the United States.

name: G Funk
description: G Funk is a subgenre of hip hop music that originated in the early 1990s in the West Coast of the United States. It is characterized by a slower tempo, heavy use of synthesizers, and a prominent bassline. The lyrics often focus on themes of partying, gang violence, and drug use. G Funk is heavily influenced by funk, soul, and R&B music, and is often associated with the West Coast hip hop scene. Notable artists associated with G Funk include Dr. Dre, Snoop Dogg, Warren G, and Nate Dogg.

name: Bachata
description: Bachata is a style of Latin American music that originated in the Dominican Republic in the early 1960s. It is a romantic, sensual style of music that combines elements of traditional Latin music with modern influences. It is typically played on acoustic guitar, with a rhythm section of bass, drums, and percussion. The lyrics of Bachata songs often focus on themes of love, heartbreak, and social issues. The genre has become increasingly popular in recent years, with many artists from around the world incorporating Bachata into their music.

name: Bachata Dominicana
description: Bachata Dominicana is a style of music and dance that originated in the Dominican Republic. It is a mix of traditional Spanish guitar and African rhythms, and is characterized by its romantic and sensual lyrics. The music is usually played with two guitars, a bass, and percussion instruments such as bongos, maracas, and güira. The dance is a partner dance that is usually done in a close embrace, and is characterized by its hip movements and sensual body isolations.

name: Tropical
description: Tropical music is a genre of Latin music that originated in the Caribbean and Latin America. It is a fusion of traditional Latin music styles such as salsa, merengue, bachata, and reggaeton, with elements of other genres such as hip hop, R&B, and pop. Tropical music is characterized by its upbeat rhythms and catchy melodies, and often features lyrics in Spanish or Portuguese. It is popular in Latin America, the Caribbean, and the United States.

name: Austrian Techno
description: Austrian Techno is a subgenre of electronic music that originated in Austria in the early 1990s. It is characterized by its hard-hitting, driving beats and its use of synthesizers and samples. It is often characterized by its dark, industrial sound and its use of minimalistic structures. It is heavily influenced by the sounds of Detroit Techno, but has its own unique sound. It is often associated with the underground club scene in Austria and is popular in Europe and North America.

name: Dark Minimal Techno
description: Dark Minimal Techno is a subgenre of techno music that is characterized by its dark, brooding, and minimalistic sound. It typically features sparse, repetitive beats and basslines, and often incorporates elements of industrial music. The sound is often described as hypnotic and hypnotizing, and is often used in clubs and festivals. It is often characterized by its use of minimalistic and repetitive melodies, and its focus on atmosphere and texture.

name: German Dark Minimal Techno
description: German Dark Minimal Techno is a subgenre of techno music that originated in Germany in the early 2000s. It is characterized by its minimalistic, repetitive beats and dark, atmospheric soundscapes. It often features a driving 4/4 beat, with minimalistic percussion and basslines, and often incorporates elements of industrial and experimental music. It is often associated with the Berlin club scene, and is often played in underground clubs and festivals.

name: Harlem Hip Hop
description: Harlem Hip Hop is a subgenre of Hip Hop music that originated in Harlem, New York City. It is characterized by its hard-hitting beats, aggressive lyrics, and street-oriented themes. It often incorporates elements of jazz, funk, and soul music, as well as samples from classic Hip Hop records. Artists associated with the genre include Big L, Cam'ron, Mase, and The Diplomats.

name: Dub
description: Dub is a genre of electronic music that originated in Jamaica in the late 1960s. It is a style of reggae that emphasizes the "dub" sound created by heavily reverberating and echoing drum and bass lines, as well as other instrumentation. Dub music often features a sparse, stripped-down sound, with minimal instrumentation and vocals. It is characterized by its heavy use of echo and reverb effects, as well as its emphasis on bass and rhythm. Dub music is often instrumental, but it can also feature vocal samples and sound effects.

name: Old School Dancehall
description: Old School Dancehall is a genre of Jamaican music that emerged in the late 1970s and early 1980s. It is characterized by its fast-paced rhythms, heavy basslines, and catchy melodies. It is often associated with the sound systems of Jamaica, which were popularized by the legendary King Tubby. Old School Dancehall is heavily influenced by Reggae, Ska, and Dub music, and is often characterized by its use of samples and sound effects. It is often seen as a precursor to modern Dancehall and Reggae music.

name: Tennessee Hip Hop
description: Tennessee Hip Hop is a subgenre of hip hop music that originated in the state of Tennessee. It is characterized by its heavy use of 808s, melodic hooks, and lyrical content that often focuses on the struggles of life in the South. The genre has been popularized by artists such as Young Dolph, Starlito, and Yo Gotti. Tennessee Hip Hop is often characterized by its hard-hitting beats, catchy hooks, and lyrical content that often touches on topics such as poverty, crime, and the struggles of life in the South.

name: Kentucky Hip Hop
description: Kentucky Hip Hop is a subgenre of hip hop music that originated in the state of Kentucky. It is characterized by its heavy use of samples, often from classic soul and funk records, and its lyrical content which often focuses on the struggles of life in Kentucky. The genre has been popularized by artists such as Nappy Roots, R. Prophet, and G-Eazy. Kentucky Hip Hop is often characterized by its laid-back, soulful sound and its use of regional slang.

name: Microhouse
description: Microhouse is a genre of electronic music that combines elements of minimal techno, house, and microsound. It is characterized by its sparse, minimalistic production style, often featuring repetitive, loop-based beats and minimal melodic elements. The genre is often associated with the use of glitchy, experimental sounds and samples, as well as a focus on texture and atmosphere. Microhouse is often seen as a more experimental and abstract form of house music, and is often used in DJ sets to create a unique and interesting atmosphere.

name: NYC Rap
description: NYC Rap is a subgenre of hip hop music that originated in New York City in the late 1980s and early 1990s. It is characterized by its hard-hitting beats, aggressive lyrics, and street-oriented themes. It is often associated with the five boroughs of New York City, and is often seen as a reflection of the city's culture and lifestyle. NYC Rap is often credited with helping to popularize hip hop music in the mainstream. Notable artists in the genre include Nas, Jay-Z, Biggie Smalls, Wu-Tang Clan, and Mobb Deep.

name: Classic Romanian Pop
description: Classic Romanian Pop is a genre of music that originated in Romania in the late 1950s and early 1960s. It is characterized by its upbeat, catchy melodies and lyrics that often focus on themes of love, nostalgia, and patriotism. The genre is heavily influenced by traditional Romanian folk music, as well as by jazz, rock, and other popular music styles. Classic Romanian Pop is often performed with a full band, including drums, bass, guitar, keyboards, and sometimes a string section. It is often accompanied by traditional Romanian dance styles, such as the hora and the sârba.

name: Electroclash
description: Electroclash is a genre of music that combines elements of electronic dance music, punk, and new wave. It emerged in the late 1990s and early 2000s and is characterized by its use of synthesizers, drum machines, and other electronic instruments. It often features a heavy emphasis on irony and campy lyrics. Artists associated with the genre include Peaches, Fischerspooner, and Ladytron.

name: Cali Rap
description: Cali Rap is a subgenre of hip hop music that originated in California in the late 1980s and early 1990s. It is characterized by its laid-back, mellow sound and its focus on the lifestyle of California. Cali Rap often features samples from classic soul and funk records, as well as samples from West Coast hip hop artists such as Dr. Dre, Ice Cube, and Snoop Dogg. The lyrics often focus on topics such as partying, smoking marijuana, and living the good life. Cali Rap is often associated with the G-Funk subgenre, which is characterized by its heavy use of synthesizers and funk samples.

name: DFW Rap
description: DFW Rap is a subgenre of hip hop music that originated in the Dallas-Fort Worth area of Texas. It is characterized by its hard-hitting beats, aggressive lyrics, and a heavy reliance on sampling. The genre is heavily influenced by the Southern rap sound, but also incorporates elements of trap, EDM, and Latin music. Artists associated with the genre include Erykah Badu, Big Tuck, Dorrough Music, and Fat Pimp.

name: Afrofuturism
description: Afrofuturism is a genre of music that combines elements of African and African-American culture with futuristic themes and technology. It often incorporates elements of funk, soul, jazz, hip-hop, and electronic music. Afrofuturism is a way of exploring the African diaspora through a futuristic lens, and it often explores themes of identity, technology, and the future of the African diaspora. It is a genre that celebrates the past, present, and future of African culture.

name: LGBTQ+ Hip Hop
description: LGBTQ+ Hip Hop is a genre of music that celebrates and embraces the LGBTQ+ community. It is a subgenre of hip hop that focuses on themes of gender identity, sexuality, and queer culture. It often features lyrics that are more open and honest about the struggles and joys of being queer. LGBTQ+ Hip Hop artists often use their music to express their own experiences and to create a safe space for other queer people to express themselves. The genre has grown in popularity in recent years, with more and more artists emerging and gaining recognition.

name: Raw Techno
description: Raw Techno is a subgenre of Techno music that is characterized by its minimalistic, stripped-down sound. It is often characterized by its use of repetitive, hypnotic rhythms and a lack of melody. It is often associated with the underground rave scene and is often used as a soundtrack for club nights. It is often characterized by its use of industrial and experimental sounds, as well as its dark and gritty atmosphere.

name: Birmingham Grime
description: Birmingham Grime is a subgenre of UK Grime that originated in Birmingham, England. It is characterized by its hard-hitting, aggressive sound, often featuring heavy basslines and distorted synths. The lyrics are often fast-paced and often focus on topics such as street life, crime, and politics. Birmingham Grime is often seen as a more aggressive and darker version of UK Grime, and is often seen as a reflection of the city's struggles and issues.

name: Grime
description: Grime is a genre of electronic music that originated in the UK in the early 2000s. It is a fusion of UK garage, hip hop, and dancehall, and is characterized by its dark, aggressive sound and fast-paced, syncopated rhythms. Grime lyrics often focus on social and political issues, and the genre has become increasingly popular in recent years.

name: Instrumental Grime
description: Instrumental Grime is a subgenre of Grime music that is characterized by its heavy use of electronic instrumentation and production. It is a fusion of Grime and electronic music, combining the energy and attitude of Grime with the production techniques of electronic music. Instrumental Grime often features a range of sounds, from distorted basslines to complex drum patterns, and often incorporates elements of other genres such as Dubstep, Garage, and Drum & Bass. It is a fast-paced and energetic style of music that has become increasingly popular in recent years.

name: Thai Indie Rock
description: Thai Indie Rock is a genre of music that combines traditional Thai music with modern rock and pop influences. It is characterized by its use of traditional Thai instruments such as the khaen, a bamboo mouth organ, and the phin, a four-stringed lute. The genre also incorporates elements of punk, folk, and alternative rock. The lyrics often focus on social and political issues, and the music is often upbeat and energetic. Thai Indie Rock has become increasingly popular in recent years, with many bands gaining international recognition.

name: Slowcore
description: Slowcore is a subgenre of alternative rock and indie rock that is characterized by slow tempos, minimalist arrangements, and often melancholic lyrics. Slowcore songs often feature sparse instrumentation, with acoustic guitar, bass, and drums being the most common instruments used. The genre is often associated with the American Pacific Northwest music scene of the 1990s, and is sometimes referred to as "sadcore" due to its melancholic nature. Slowcore bands often draw influence from folk, country, and post-rock music.

name: Modern Dream Pop
description: Modern Dream Pop is a genre of music that combines elements of dream pop, shoegaze, and indie rock. It is characterized by its dreamy, ethereal soundscapes, often featuring lush layers of guitars, synths, and vocals. The genre often has a melancholic, introspective feel, and its lyrics often explore themes of longing, nostalgia, and escapism. It is often seen as a more modern take on the classic dream pop sound, with a focus on production and songwriting.

name: Irish Hip Hop
description: Irish Hip Hop is a genre of music that combines traditional Irish music with hip hop elements. It typically features traditional Irish instruments such as the bodhrán, tin whistle, and fiddle, as well as hip hop beats and rap lyrics. Irish Hip Hop artists often draw on Irish culture and history for their lyrics, and the genre has become increasingly popular in recent years.

name: Afroswing
description: Afroswing is a genre of music that combines elements of Afrobeats, hip hop, and UK grime. It originated in the UK and is characterized by its heavy basslines, catchy melodies, and African-inspired rhythms. It is often seen as a fusion of Afrobeats and UK grime, and is popular among both African and British audiences. The genre has seen a surge in popularity in recent years, with artists such as Wizkid, Maleek Berry, and Not3s leading the way.

name: Trap Soul
description: Trap Soul is a genre of music that combines elements of trap music and R&B. It is characterized by its heavy use of 808s, hi-hats, and other trap-style percussion, as well as its incorporation of soulful melodies and vocals. It often features a slow, laid-back tempo and a melancholic atmosphere. Artists such as Bryson Tiller, PartyNextDoor, and Drake are often associated with the genre.

name: UK Hip Hop
description: UK Hip Hop is a genre of music that originated in the United Kingdom in the late 1980s and early 1990s. It is a fusion of hip hop and British culture, combining elements of rap, grime, and other genres. UK Hip Hop is characterized by its lyrical content, which often focuses on social issues, politics, and the British experience. It is also known for its heavy use of sampling, often incorporating classic British music into its production. UK Hip Hop has become increasingly popular in recent years, with artists such as Stormzy, Skepta, and Little Simz gaining international recognition.

name: Bedroom Pop
description: Bedroom Pop is a subgenre of indie pop that is characterized by its lo-fi production, often recorded in a bedroom or home studio. It is typically characterized by its dreamy, mellow sound, often featuring acoustic guitars, synthesizers, and soft vocals. It often incorporates elements of other genres such as dream pop, indie rock, and folk. Bedroom Pop is often seen as a more intimate and personal style of music, as it is often created in a home setting.

name: Alberta Hip Hop
description: Alberta Hip Hop is a subgenre of hip hop music that originated in Alberta, Canada. It is characterized by its lyrical content, which often focuses on topics such as the struggles of life in Alberta, the beauty of the province, and the unique culture of the region. It is also known for its heavy use of samples from classic rock and country music, as well as its incorporation of traditional Indigenous music. Alberta Hip Hop is often characterized by its upbeat, energetic sound, and its use of heavy bass and drums.

name: Baltimore Hip Hop
description: Baltimore Hip Hop is a subgenre of hip hop music that originated in Baltimore, Maryland. It is characterized by its hard-hitting, aggressive sound and its lyrical content which often focuses on the struggles of inner-city life. The genre is heavily influenced by the city's go-go music scene, as well as its long history of jazz and blues. Baltimore Hip Hop is often characterized by its use of samples from classic soul and funk records, as well as its heavy use of drum machines and synthesizers. name: Florida Rap
description: Florida Rap is a subgenre of hip hop music that originated in the state of Florida in the late 1980s and early 1990s. It is characterized by its heavy use of bass, its lyrical content focusing on the struggles of life in the Sunshine State, and its frequent collaborations between local artists. Florida Rap is often associated with the Miami Bass sound, which is characterized by its heavy use of synthesizers and drum machines. It is also known for its lyrical themes of partying, street life, and hustling. Popular Florida Rap artists include Trick Daddy, Trina, Rick Ross, and Plies.

name: Deep Techno
description: Deep Techno is a subgenre of Techno music that is characterized by its dark, atmospheric, and hypnotic sound. It often features deep basslines, minimalistic percussion, and sparse melodies. Deep Techno is often slower than other forms of Techno, and its focus is on creating a moody and hypnotic atmosphere. It is often used in clubs and festivals, and is popular among DJs and producers.

name: Dancehall
description: Dancehall is a genre of Jamaican popular music that originated in the late 1970s. It is a style of Jamaican reggae that is characterized by a deejay singing and rapping over a pre-recorded rhythm or beat. Dancehall is known for its fast-paced rhythms and lyrical content that often focuses on partying, love, and social issues. It is also known for its use of electronic instruments and sound effects, as well as its heavy use of samples from other genres.

name: Soca
description: Soca is a genre of music that originated in Trinidad and Tobago in the 1970s. It is a fusion of calypso and Indian music, and is characterized by its upbeat tempo and energetic rhythms. The lyrics often focus on themes of celebration, love, and partying. The instrumentation typically includes steel drums, synthesizers, and horns. Soca is a popular genre of music in the Caribbean and is often played at carnivals and festivals.

name: Pittsburgh Rap

It is characterized by its hard-hitting beats, aggressive lyrics, and often dark and gritty themes. Pittsburgh Rap is heavily influenced by the city's industrial and working-class culture, and often features references to Pittsburgh's neighborhoods, landmarks, and sports teams. Pittsburgh Rap has been popularized by artists such as Wiz Khalifa, Mac Miller, and Jimmy Wopo.

name: Philly Rap
description: Philly Rap is a subgenre of hip hop music that originated in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. It is characterized by its hard-hitting beats, aggressive lyrics, and often dark and gritty subject matter. Philly Rap is often associated with the city's street culture and is often seen as a reflection of the city's struggles and triumphs. It is often characterized by its use of samples from classic soul and funk records, as well as its incorporation of jazz and blues elements. Philly Rap is often seen as a more aggressive and lyrically-driven style of hip hop than other regional styles.

name: Anti-Folk
description: Anti-Folk is a genre of music that emerged in the late 1980s and early 1990s in the East Village of New York City. It is a blend of folk music and punk rock, and is characterized by its DIY aesthetic, often featuring lo-fi production and unconventional instrumentation. The lyrics are often humorous, ironic, and often deal with topics such as love, heartbreak, and social issues. Anti-Folk is often seen as a reaction to the commercialization of folk music, and is often seen as a more subversive and experimental take on the genre.

name: Modern Power Pop
description: Modern Power Pop is a genre of rock music that combines elements of pop, punk, and alternative rock. It is characterized by catchy melodies, strong hooks, and upbeat tempos. It often features distorted guitars, driving rhythms, and vocal harmonies. It is often seen as a bridge between classic pop and punk, and is often associated with the new wave and post-punk movements of the late 1970s and early 1980s.

name: Vancouver Indie
description: Vancouver Indie is a genre of music that originated in Vancouver, Canada. It is characterized by its eclectic mix of styles, including elements of folk, rock, pop, and electronic music. The genre is often associated with the city's vibrant music scene, which has produced a number of successful indie acts such as The New Pornographers, Destroyer, and The Be Good Tanyas. Vancouver Indie is known for its melodic, dreamy sound, often featuring lush instrumentation and vocal harmonies. It is often described as having a "west coast" feel, with its laid-back, relaxed vibe.

name: Palm Desert Scene
description: The Palm Desert Scene is a genre of music that originated in the Coachella Valley of California in the late 1980s and early 1990s. It is characterized by a blend of punk, hard rock, and psychedelic influences, often featuring heavy guitar riffs and distorted vocals. The genre is often associated with the desert rock movement, which includes bands such as Kyuss, Queens of the Stone Age, and Fu Manchu. name: Stoner Rock
description: Stoner rock is a genre of rock music that combines elements of heavy metal, psychedelic rock, blues-rock, and doom metal. It is characterized by slow tempos, heavily distorted guitars, and a "stoned" atmosphere. The genre is often associated with the stoner culture, and its lyrics often focus on themes of drug use, partying, and hedonism. Stoner rock bands often incorporate elements of sludge metal, grunge, and alternative rock.

name: UK Alternative Pop
description: UK Alternative Pop is a genre of music that emerged in the late 1990s and early 2000s in the United Kingdom. It is a blend of alternative rock, pop, and electronic music, and is characterized by its eclectic sound and its use of synthesizers, drum machines, and other electronic instruments. Artists in this genre often draw influence from a variety of genres, including indie rock, hip hop, and dance music. Common lyrical themes include love, relationships, and social issues. Notable artists in this genre include The 1975, Florence + The Machine, and Arctic Monkeys.

name: Scottish New Wave
description: The Scottish New Wave is a genre of music that emerged in the late 1970s and early 1980s in Scotland. It is characterized by a blend of post-punk, new wave, and indie rock styles, with a focus on lyrical themes of social and political issues. The genre was heavily influenced by the punk and new wave movements of the late 1970s, and was led by bands such as Orange Juice, Josef K, and The Fire Engines. The genre was also heavily influenced by the DIY ethic of punk, and many of the bands released their own records on independent labels. The Scottish New Wave was an important part of the UK post-punk scene, and its influence can still be heard in the music of many modern Scottish bands.

name: ATL Trap
description: ATL Trap is a subgenre of hip hop music that originated in Atlanta, Georgia. It is characterized by its heavy use of 808 drums, hi-hats, and synthesizers, as well as its lyrical content which often focuses on the struggles of life in the city. It is often associated with the trap subgenre of hip hop, which is characterized by its dark and gritty sound. ATL Trap is often credited with helping to popularize trap music and has been influential in the development of other subgenres such as trap-soul and trap-EDM.

name: Dmv Rap
description: Dmv Rap is a subgenre of hip hop music that originated in the Washington, D.C., Maryland, and Virginia (DMV) area. It is characterized by its hard-hitting, aggressive sound and lyrical content that often focuses on the struggles of life in the DMV area. The genre is heavily influenced by the go-go music of the region, and often features samples of go-go songs. It is also known for its use of the "DMV flow," a style of rapping that is characterized by its rapid-fire delivery and intricate rhyme schemes.

name: Canadian Country
description: Canadian Country music is a genre of music that is rooted in traditional country music, but with a distinctly Canadian flavor. It is characterized by its use of traditional instruments such as fiddle, banjo, steel guitar, and mandolin, as well as its focus on stories of rural life in Canada. Canadian Country music often features themes of patriotism, family, and the outdoors, and is often sung in both English and French. Popular Canadian Country artists include Shania Twain, Dean Brody, and Brett Kissel.

name: Country Dawn
description: Country Dawn is a genre of music that combines traditional country music with elements of folk, bluegrass, and Americana. It is characterized by its acoustic instrumentation, heartfelt lyrics, and a focus on storytelling. It often features a mix of traditional and modern country sounds, with a focus on creating a warm, inviting atmosphere. The genre is often associated with artists such as Alison Krauss, Dolly Parton, and Emmylou Harris.

name: Modern Reggae
description: Modern Reggae is a genre of music that combines traditional reggae with elements of other genres, such as hip-hop, R&B, and pop. It is characterized by a heavy bass line, syncopated rhythms, and a focus on lyrical content. The lyrics often focus on social and political issues, as well as love and relationships. Modern Reggae artists often use a variety of instruments, including keyboards, guitars, and drums, to create a unique sound.

name: Nu Disco
description: Nu Disco is a genre of electronic dance music that combines elements of disco, funk, and house music. It is characterized by its upbeat, funky sound and its use of vintage synthesizers and drum machines. Nu Disco often features a strong bassline, catchy melodies, and a variety of vocal samples. It is often seen as a modern take on classic disco music, and is popular in clubs and festivals around the world.

name: Bass Music
description: Bass Music is a broad term used to describe a variety of electronic music genres that focus on heavy basslines and sub-bass frequencies. It is a fusion of styles, drawing from dubstep, drum and bass, garage, grime, and other genres. It is characterized by its heavy, distorted basslines, syncopated rhythms, and often dark, aggressive atmospheres. It is often used in clubs and festivals, and is popular among fans of electronic music.

name: Future Garage
description: Future Garage is a genre of electronic music that combines elements of UK garage, dubstep, and 2-step with a futuristic, experimental sound. It is characterized by its deep, dark, and minimalistic sound, often featuring heavy basslines, syncopated rhythms, and sparse, atmospheric synths. It is often associated with the UK underground music scene, and has been popularized by artists such as Burial, James Blake, and Mount Kimbie.

name: Wonky
description: Wonky is a genre of electronic music that combines elements of hip-hop, dubstep, glitch, and IDM. It is characterized by its off-kilter rhythms, wonky beats, and experimental sound design. Wonky music often features heavy basslines, distorted synths, and chopped-up samples. It is often described as a combination of hip-hop and experimental electronic music.

name: Acid House
description: Acid House is a genre of electronic dance music that originated in the late 1980s in the United Kingdom. It is characterized by its repetitive, hypnotic basslines and squelchy, acidic synthesizer sounds. It is often associated with the rave and club scenes of the late 1980s and early 1990s. The genre is heavily influenced by the use of the Roland TB-303 bass synthesizer and is often accompanied by a four-on-the-floor beat. Acid House is often seen as a precursor to the more popular genres of house and techno.

name: Acid Trance
description: Acid Trance is a subgenre of Trance music that is characterized by its use of acid-like synthesizer sounds and its fast, energetic tempo. It is often characterized by its use of repetitive, hypnotic melodies and its heavy reliance on synthesizers and drum machines. It is often associated with the rave and club scenes, and is often played at high volumes.

name: Bubble Trance
description: Bubble Trance is a subgenre of trance music that is characterized by its upbeat, melodic, and uplifting sound. It typically features a driving 4/4 beat, with a focus on melodic and uplifting synth lines, often with a bouncy bassline. The genre often incorporates elements of other genres such as house, progressive, and electro. Bubble Trance is often used in clubs and festivals, and is popular among trance fans.

name: Hard Trance
description: Hard Trance is a subgenre of Trance music that emerged in the early 1990s. It is characterized by a harder, more aggressive sound than traditional Trance music, with a focus on driving beats and basslines. Hard Trance often features distorted and distorted synth sounds, as well as samples from other genres such as Hardstyle and Hardcore. It is often associated with the rave and club scenes, and is popular in Europe and Japan.

name: Old School Hard Trance
description: Old School Hard Trance is a subgenre of Trance music that emerged in the late 1990s and early 2000s. It is characterized by its hard-hitting, fast-paced beats and its use of distorted basslines and synthesizers. It is often characterized by its use of melodic elements, such as arpeggios and chord progressions, as well as its use of samples from other genres, such as techno and house. It is often seen as a precursor to the harder styles of Trance music, such as Hardstyle and Hard Dance.

name: Jewish Hip Hop
description: Jewish Hip Hop is a genre of music that combines traditional Jewish music with elements of hip hop. It often features rap lyrics in Hebrew, Yiddish, or English, and incorporates traditional Jewish instruments such as the clarinet, violin, and accordion. The genre has been popularized by artists such as Matisyahu, Y-Love, and Kosha Dillz. Jewish Hip Hop is often used to express Jewish identity and culture, and to explore themes of faith, identity, and social justice.

name: Phonk
description: Phonk is a subgenre of hip hop music that originated in Memphis, Tennessee in the early 1990s. It is characterized by its heavy use of synthesizers, drum machines, and chopped and screwed samples. The sound is often dark and aggressive, with lyrics that often focus on topics such as drugs, violence, and sex. It is heavily influenced by the Southern hip hop sound, as well as trap music.

name: Chamber Psych
description: Chamber Psych is a genre of music that combines elements of psychedelic rock with classical chamber music. It typically features lush, orchestral arrangements with a focus on intricate melodies and harmonies. The genre often incorporates elements of folk, jazz, and world music, as well as experimental and avant-garde elements. It is characterized by its dreamy, ethereal soundscapes and its use of reverb and delay effects.

name: Trap Queen

It is characterized by its heavy use of 808 drums, hi-hats, and synthesizers, as well as its lyrical content which often focuses on drug dealing, street life, and hustling. Trap Queen is often associated with the Southern hip hop scene, and is often seen as a more aggressive and darker version of trap music.

name: Ambient
description: Ambient music is a genre of music that emphasizes tone and atmosphere over traditional musical structure or rhythm. It is often intended to induce a sense of calm or relaxation, and is often used as background music. Ambient music is often created with synthesizers, samplers, and digital audio workstations, and often incorporates elements of other genres such as classical, jazz, and world music. Ambient music is typically instrumental, but can also include vocals.

name: Braindance
description: Braindance is a genre of electronic music that emerged in the early 1990s. It is characterized by its use of complex, intricate rhythms and samples, often from obscure sources. It is often associated with the IDM (intelligent dance music) scene, and is often seen as a more experimental form of techno. Braindance is often characterized by its use of abstract soundscapes, glitchy beats, and intricate sound design. It is often seen as a more experimental form of techno, and is often seen as a bridge between the two genres.

name: UK Experimental Electronic
description: UK Experimental Electronic music is a genre of electronic music that originated in the United Kingdom. It is characterized by its experimental nature, often incorporating elements of other genres such as ambient, dubstep, and IDM. It is often characterized by its use of abstract soundscapes, glitchy beats, and unconventional sound design. It is often seen as a more experimental and abstract form of electronic music, and is often used in film and television soundtracks.

name: Classic UK Pop
description: Classic UK Pop is a genre of popular music that originated in the United Kingdom in the late 1950s and early 1960s. It is characterized by its upbeat, catchy melodies and lyrics, often with a strong emphasis on vocal harmonies. Classic UK Pop is often associated with the British Invasion of the 1960s, when British bands such as The Beatles, The Rolling Stones, and The Who gained international fame. It is also associated with the British pop music of the 1970s and 1980s, which included acts such as ABBA, The Police, and Duran Duran. Classic UK Pop is often seen as a precursor to modern pop music, and its influence can still be heard in the music of today.

name: Aggrotech
description: Aggrotech is a subgenre of electronic music that combines elements of industrial, EBM, and synthpop. It is characterized by aggressive, distorted beats, distorted vocals, and dark, often dystopian lyrics. Aggrotech is often associated with the goth and cyberpunk subcultures, and is often used in the soundtracks of video games and movies.

name: Power Noise

It is characterized by distorted and aggressive sounds, often with a heavy emphasis on rhythm and percussion. It is often used in industrial and experimental music, and is often associated with the darker side of electronic music. Power Noise is often used to create a sense of tension and unease, and can be used to create a powerful and intense atmosphere.

name: Lilith
description: Lilith is a genre of music that combines elements of dream pop, shoegaze, and indie rock. It is characterized by its ethereal soundscapes, dreamy melodies, and lush production. The genre often features female vocalists, and its lyrics often explore themes of love, loss, and longing.

name: New Jersey Rap

name: Futurepop
description: Futurepop is a genre of electronic music that combines elements of synthpop, trance, and EBM (electronic body music). It is characterized by its use of synthesizers, sequencers, and drum machines to create a futuristic sound. It often features heavily distorted vocals and a driving beat. The genre is often associated with the late 1990s and early 2000s, when it was popularized by artists such as VNV Nation, Covenant, and Apoptygma Berzerk.

name: Neo-Synthpop

It often features heavy use of synthesizers, drum machines, and other electronic instruments, as well as catchy melodies and vocal hooks. It is often characterized by its upbeat, danceable sound and its use of modern production techniques.

Political Hip Hop is often characterized by its lyrical content, which often contains references to current events and social issues. name: Philly Drill

It is characterized by its dark, aggressive sound and lyrical content that often focuses on street life, crime, and violence. The production style is heavily influenced by trap music, and often features hard-hitting 808s, hi-hats, and snares. The lyrical content often includes references to guns, drugs, and money. The beats are usually slow and relaxed, with a focus on creating a relaxed atmosphere. The lyrics are often introspective and reflective, and the overall sound is often described as "chill".

It is often characterized by its use of ambient sounds, downtempo beats, and dreamy melodies. It is often used as background music in restaurants, bars, and other public spaces. Chill Out music is often associated with the genres of ambient, downtempo, and trip-hop.

name: Experimental Hip Hop

Experimental Hip Hop often features unconventional vocal delivery, complex rhythms, and unconventional instrumentation. name: Japanese Chillhop

It is characterized by its laid-back, mellow sound, often featuring samples of traditional Japanese instruments and sounds. The genre is often associated with the Japanese cityscape, and its sound is often described as “urban, yet tranquil.” It is often used in anime and video game soundtracks, and is popular among fans of Japanese culture.

name: Electronic Trap

It is characterized by heavy 808 bass drums, hi-hats, and synthesizers, as well as samples from hip-hop and R&B. It often features vocal samples and rap verses, and is often characterized by its dark and aggressive sound. name: Canadian Trap

It often features a mix of rap and singing, and often incorporates elements of trap music from the United States. Canadian Trap is often characterized by its dark and gritty sound, and its lyrics often focus on topics such as street life, drugs, and violence.

name: Aussietronica

It is characterized by its use of synthesizers, drum machines, and other electronic instruments, as well as its incorporation of elements from other genres such as hip hop, dub, and house. It is often characterized by its upbeat, melodic sound and its use of samples from a variety of sources. name: Russian EDM

It is characterized by its heavy use of synthesizers, drum machines, and samples, as well as its incorporation of traditional Russian folk music elements. It is often characterized by its high energy and upbeat tempo, as well as its use of traditional Russian instruments such as balalaikas and accordions. Russian EDM has become increasingly popular in recent years, with many Russian DJs and producers gaining international recognition.

name: Sky Room
description: Sky Room is a genre of electronic music that combines elements of ambient, chillout, and downtempo. name: Indiana Hip Hop

name: Brooklyn Drill

It is characterized by its dark, aggressive sound, often featuring hard-hitting 808s, distorted synths, and trap-style hi-hats. The lyrical content of Brooklyn Drill is often violent and nihilistic, with references to guns, drugs, and street life. name: Dubstep

It is characterized by its heavy bass lines, syncopated rhythms, and off-beat drum patterns. It often features a variety of vocal samples, synthesizers, and sound effects. Dubstep is known for its dark, brooding atmosphere and intense energy. name: Bass House

It is characterized by its heavy, distorted basslines, often accompanied by a four-on-the-floor beat. It is often influenced by genres such as dubstep, trap, and UK garage. name: Melbourne Bounce
description: Melbourne Bounce is a style of EDM (electronic dance music) that originated in Melbourne, Australia. It is characterized by its high-energy, upbeat sound, with a focus on catchy melodies and heavy basslines. name: Moombahton

name: Battle Rap

Battle rap is characterized by aggressive, confrontational lyrics that often contain insults and boasts. The lyrics are usually delivered in a fast-paced, rhythmic style and often contain complex rhyme schemes. Battle rap is often used as a platform for rappers to showcase their lyrical skills and to gain recognition in the hip-hop community.

It often features a slower tempo than other hip hop genres, and its lyrical content often focuses on topics such as gang violence, drug use, and street life. name: Australian Indie

name: Viral Trap
description: Viral Trap is a genre of music that combines elements of trap music with elements of EDM and pop music. It is characterized by heavy 808 basslines, hard-hitting drums, and catchy melodies. It often features vocal samples, pitched-up vocal chops, and other vocal effects. The genre has become increasingly popular in recent years, with many artists creating their own unique takes on the sound.

name: LA Pop

It is a fusion of Latin American music styles such as cumbia, salsa, merengue, and reggaeton, with elements of pop, rock, and hip hop. It is characterized by its upbeat rhythms, catchy melodies, and often humorous lyrics. La Pop is popular among young people in Latin America and has become increasingly popular in the United States and Europe.

name: Baton Rouge Rap
