It is characterized by its heavy use of Southern slang, its lyrical content focusing on the struggles of life in the city, and its hard-hitting, aggressive beats. The genre is often associated with the Cash Money Records label, which was founded in Baton Rouge in 1991. Notable artists in the genre include Lil Boosie, Webbie, and Young Bleed.

name: Dusseldorf Electronic
description: Dusseldorf Electronic is a style of electronic music that originated in the German city of Dusseldorf in the late 1970s. It is characterized by its use of synthesizers, drum machines, and sequencers to create a unique sound that is often described as "minimalistic" and "mechanical". The genre is heavily influenced by the work of Kraftwerk, a pioneering electronic music group from Dusseldorf. It is also heavily influenced by the work of other German electronic music artists such as Tangerine Dream, Klaus Schulze, and Cluster. Dusseldorf Electronic is often associated with the Krautrock movement, which was a genre of experimental rock music that emerged in Germany in the late 1960s and early 1970s.

name: Prepared Piano
description: The Prepared Piano music genre is a type of experimental music that involves the alteration of a standard acoustic piano by placing objects on or between the strings or hammers of the instrument. This technique was pioneered by John Cage in the 1940s and has since been used by a variety of composers and performers. The objects used to alter the sound of the piano can range from screws and bolts to rubber erasers and pieces of paper. The resulting sound is often described as being percussive, metallic, and unpredictable.

name: Shimmer Pop
description: Shimmer Pop is a genre of music that combines elements of pop, indie, and electronic music. It is characterized by its dreamy, ethereal sound, often featuring shimmering synths, airy vocals, and a light, upbeat tempo. The genre is often associated with artists such as CHVRCHES, M83, and Beach House.

name: Abstract IDM
description: Abstract IDM (Intelligent Dance Music) is a genre of electronic music that combines elements of ambient, experimental, and techno music. It is characterized by its use of complex rhythms, intricate sound design, and abstract soundscapes. It often features a wide range of tempos, textures, and timbres, and is often characterized by its use of unconventional sound sources and sound manipulation techniques. Abstract IDM is often seen as a more experimental and abstract form of electronic music, and is often seen as a bridge between the more traditional forms of electronic music and the more experimental forms.

name: Drift
description: Drift is a genre of electronic music that combines elements of ambient, downtempo, and chillout music. It is characterized by its slow, dreamy, and often melancholic soundscapes, often featuring lush pads, ethereal synths, and subtle beats. It is often used as a form of relaxation and meditation music, and is often used in film and television soundtracks.

name: Drone
description: Drone music is a genre of experimental music that emphasizes the use of sustained or repeated sounds, notes, or tone-clusters – called drones. It is typically characterized by lengthy audio programs with relatively slight harmonic variations throughout each piece. Drone music often incorporates elements of minimalism, ambient music, and noise music, and can range from soothing and meditative to abrasive and cacophonous.

name: Ambient Folk
description: Ambient Folk is a genre of music that combines elements of folk music with ambient music. It typically features acoustic instruments such as guitars, banjos, and mandolins, as well as electronic elements such as synthesizers, drum machines, and samples. The music is often characterized by its dreamy, atmospheric soundscapes, and its use of reverb and delay effects. Ambient Folk often has a slow, meditative feel, and its lyrics often focus on themes of nature, spirituality, and introspection.

name: Indiecoustica
description: Indiecoustica is a genre of music that combines elements of indie rock and folk music with acoustic instrumentation. It typically features acoustic guitars, banjos, mandolins, and other stringed instruments, as well as drums, bass, and other percussion instruments. The genre is often characterized by its mellow, laid-back sound and its focus on storytelling and emotion. Indiecoustica is often seen as a more accessible version of folk music, and its popularity has grown in recent years.

name: Folk-Pop
description: Folk-Pop is a genre of music that combines elements of folk music with elements of pop music. It typically features acoustic instruments, such as guitars, banjos, and mandolins, as well as electronic instruments, such as synthesizers and drum machines. The lyrics often focus on themes of love, relationships, and life experiences. Folk-Pop is often characterized by its catchy melodies, upbeat rhythms, and simple, yet meaningful lyrics. It is a genre that has been popularized by artists such as Taylor Swift, Ed Sheeran, and Mumford & Sons.

name: Pop Folk
description: Pop Folk is a genre of music that combines elements of folk music with pop music. It typically features acoustic instruments such as guitars, banjos, mandolins, and fiddles, as well as electronic instruments such as synthesizers and drum machines. Pop Folk often has a light, upbeat sound and often incorporates elements of country, rock, and blues. It is often characterized by its catchy melodies and simple, often romantic lyrics. Popular Pop Folk artists include Ed Sheeran, Taylor Swift, and The Lumineers.

name: Stomp And Flutter
description: Stomp and Flutter is a genre of music that combines elements of folk, blues, and rock. It is characterized by its driving rhythms, often featuring a stomping beat and a fluttering guitar riff. The genre is often associated with the American South, and its sound is often described as a mix of country, blues, and rock. It is often played on acoustic instruments such as banjos, mandolins, and guitars.

name: Calming Instrumental
description: Calming Instrumental music is a genre of music that is designed to help listeners relax and reduce stress. It typically features soft, soothing melodies and instrumentation, such as acoustic guitar, piano, strings, and light percussion. The music is often slow and gentle, and can be used to help create a peaceful atmosphere. It is often used in yoga, meditation, and other relaxation activities.

name: Chamber Pop
description: Chamber Pop is a genre of music that combines elements of classical music, pop music, and rock music. It is characterized by the use of orchestral instruments such as strings, horns, and woodwinds, as well as traditional rock instruments such as electric guitars, bass, and drums. The genre is often characterized by lush, layered arrangements and intricate production techniques. It is often seen as a bridge between classical and popular music, and is often used to create a more sophisticated sound.

name: Irish Singer-Songwriter
description: Irish Singer-Songwriter is a genre of music that is rooted in traditional Irish folk music and is characterized by its lyrical content and acoustic instrumentation. It often features a combination of acoustic guitar, banjo, fiddle, and other traditional Irish instruments. The lyrics often focus on themes of love, loss, and nostalgia, and the music often has a melancholic, reflective tone. Irish Singer-Songwriters often draw inspiration from the works of traditional Irish folk musicians, as well as contemporary artists such as Van Morrison, The Pogues, and Damien Rice.

name: ASMR
description: ASMR (Autonomous Sensory Meridian Response) is a genre of music that is designed to create a tingling sensation in the listener. It is often characterized by soft, gentle sounds such as whispering, tapping, and light background music. The goal of ASMR music is to create a calming and relaxing atmosphere, and it is often used to help people relax and reduce stress.

name: Talent Show
description: The Talent Show music genre is a style of music that is typically used in talent shows, such as those seen on television. It is usually upbeat and energetic, and often features a variety of instruments and vocal styles. It is often used to showcase the talents of the performers, and can range from pop, rock, country, and even classical music.

name: French Classical Piano
description: French Classical Piano is a genre of classical music that originated in France during the late 18th and early 19th centuries. It is characterized by its elegant, graceful, and often virtuosic style. It is often performed on the piano, and is known for its intricate melodies, complex harmonies, and ornate ornamentation. It is often associated with the works of composers such as Claude Debussy, Maurice Ravel, and Erik Satie.

name: Sefardi
description: Sefardi music is a genre of traditional Jewish music that originated in the Iberian Peninsula and is still popular among Sephardic Jews today. It is characterized by its use of traditional instruments such as the oud, violin, and qanun, as well as its use of traditional scales and rhythms. It is often accompanied by singing in Ladino, a language derived from Spanish and Hebrew. Sefardi music is often used in religious ceremonies and celebrations, and is known for its soulful and melancholic sound.

name: Indie Pop Rap
description: Indie Pop Rap is a genre of music that combines elements of indie pop and rap. It typically features melodic, catchy hooks and rap verses that are often delivered in a conversational style. The beats are usually upbeat and often incorporate elements of electronic music. The lyrics often focus on topics such as relationships, self-reflection, and social issues. Indie Pop Rap is often seen as a more accessible and less aggressive form of rap music.

name: Oakland Hip Hop
description: Oakland Hip Hop is a style of rap music that originated in Oakland, California. It is characterized by its hard-hitting, aggressive beats and lyrics that often focus on the struggles of life in the inner city. The sound is heavily influenced by Bay Area rap, funk, and soul music. Oakland Hip Hop is known for its lyrical complexity and its ability to blend different styles of music. Artists such as Too Short, E-40, and Mac Dre are some of the most influential figures in the genre.

name: German Dance
description: German Dance is a genre of electronic music that originated in Germany in the late 1980s. It is characterized by its fast tempo, heavy basslines, and synthesized melodies. It is often associated with the Eurodance and Techno genres, and is often seen as a precursor to the Trance genre. German Dance is often characterized by its use of samples from popular songs, as well as its use of vocal samples. It is also known for its use of heavy percussion and its incorporation of elements from other genres, such as Hip-Hop and Reggae.

name: Women's Music
description: Women's Music is a genre of music that was created by and for women in the 1970s. It is a form of music that celebrates and promotes the experiences, perspectives, and values of women. It is often characterized by its use of acoustic instruments, its focus on female vocalists, and its lyrics that address issues of gender, sexuality, and social justice. Women's Music is often associated with the feminist movement and is often used as a tool for empowerment and self-expression.

name: Alternative Emo
description: Alternative Emo is a subgenre of emo music that emerged in the early 2000s. It is characterized by a more melodic and accessible sound than traditional emo, often incorporating elements of pop punk, indie rock, and post-hardcore. Lyrically, it often deals with themes of heartache, loss, and relationships. Bands associated with the genre include Dashboard Confessional, The Get Up Kids, and Saves the Day.

name: Anthem Emo
description: Anthem Emo is a subgenre of emo music that is characterized by its upbeat, anthemic sound. It typically features loud, distorted guitars, driving drums, and passionate vocals. Anthem Emo is often seen as a more accessible version of emo, as it is often more melodic and less aggressive than other subgenres. Anthem Emo bands often focus on themes of love, heartbreak, and relationships, and often feature catchy choruses and sing-alongs.

name: Canadian Pop Punk
description: Canadian Pop Punk is a genre of music that combines elements of punk rock and pop music. It typically features fast tempos, loud guitars, and melodic vocals. The lyrics often focus on topics such as teenage angst, relationships, and social issues. Canadian Pop Punk bands often draw influence from classic punk bands such as The Ramones, The Clash, and The Buzzcocks, as well as more modern acts like Green Day and Blink-182. Canadian Pop Punk bands are often characterized by their high energy live shows and catchy hooks.

name: Canadian Punk
description: Canadian Punk is a genre of punk rock music that originated in Canada in the late 1970s and early 1980s. It is characterized by its fast, aggressive sound and its lyrical themes of social and political issues. Canadian Punk bands often draw influence from other punk genres such as hardcore punk, skate punk, and pop punk. Common lyrical topics include anti-establishment sentiments, anti-consumerism, and anti-authoritarianism. Canadian Punk bands often have a DIY ethic, and many of them are independent and unsigned. Notable Canadian Punk bands include D.O.A., SNFU, The Subhumans, and Dayglo Abortions.

name: Cape Town Indie
description: Cape Town Indie is a genre of music that originated in Cape Town, South Africa. It is a mix of indie rock, folk, and electronic music, with a strong emphasis on African rhythms and melodies. The genre is characterized by its upbeat, energetic sound, and its use of traditional African instruments such as the kora, mbira, and marimba. It often features a mix of English and African languages, and its lyrics often focus on themes of social justice, identity, and the African diaspora.

name: South African Pop
description: South African Pop is a genre of music that combines elements of traditional African music with modern pop music. It is characterized by its upbeat rhythms, catchy melodies, and often incorporates elements of hip-hop, reggae, and other genres. South African Pop is often seen as a reflection of the country's diverse culture and is often used to express social and political issues. Artists such as Yvonne Chaka Chaka, Brenda Fassie, and Ladysmith Black Mambazo are some of the most popular South African Pop artists.

name: South African Pop Dance
description: South African Pop Dance is a genre of music that combines elements of traditional South African music with modern pop and dance music. It is characterized by its upbeat, energetic sound and its use of traditional African instruments such as the mbira, marimba, and kalimba. It often features a mix of traditional African rhythms and modern electronic beats, and its lyrics often focus on themes of love, joy, and celebration. South African Pop Dance is popular among young people in South Africa and is often heard at parties and clubs.

name: Pop House
description: Pop House is a genre of electronic dance music that combines elements of pop music with house music. It typically features a 4/4 beat, a strong bassline, and a catchy melody. It often incorporates elements of other genres such as hip-hop, R&B, and funk. Pop House is often characterized by its upbeat, positive energy and its use of vocal samples. It is often seen as a more accessible version of house music, as it is often more radio-friendly and easier to dance to.

name: Korean Jazz
description: Korean Jazz is a genre of music that combines traditional Korean music with jazz elements. It is characterized by its use of traditional Korean instruments such as the gayageum, haegeum, and janggu, as well as jazz instruments like the piano, saxophone, and drums. Korean Jazz often features improvisation and incorporates elements of traditional Korean music such as taepyeongso, pansori, and folk songs. It is a unique blend of traditional and modern music that has become increasingly popular in recent years.

name: Diva House
description: Diva House is a subgenre of house music that emerged in the late 1980s and early 1990s. It is characterized by its strong female vocal presence, often featuring diva-style vocals and soulful melodies. It is often seen as a combination of house and R&B, with a focus on female vocalists. It is often characterized by its use of samples from classic soul and disco records, as well as its use of synthesizers and drum machines.

name: Tribal House
description: Tribal House is a subgenre of House music that combines traditional African and Latin American rhythms with modern electronic music production. It is characterized by its heavy use of percussion, often featuring congas, bongos, and other hand drums, as well as samples of traditional instruments. It also often incorporates elements of tribal chants and vocal samples. Tribal House is often seen as a more organic and soulful version of House music, and is popular in clubs and festivals around the world.

name: Candy Pop
description: Candy Pop is a genre of music that is characterized by its upbeat, cheerful, and lighthearted sound. It typically features bright, catchy melodies and lyrics that are often about love and relationships. The instrumentation is often synthesized and includes elements of pop, dance, and electronic music. It is often associated with the Japanese idol music scene and is popular among teenage girls.

name: Baltimore Indie
description: Baltimore Indie is a genre of music that originated in Baltimore, Maryland in the early 2000s. It is characterized by a mix of indie rock, punk, and hip-hop influences, often featuring a lo-fi production style. The genre is known for its DIY ethos and its focus on local artists. It has been described as a "melting pot" of genres, with bands often blending elements of punk, hip-hop, folk, and electronic music. Baltimore Indie is often associated with the city's DIY music scene, which has produced a number of notable acts such as Beach House, Future Islands, and Dan Deacon.

name: Sunshine Pop
description: Sunshine Pop is a genre of music that emerged in the mid-1960s. It is characterized by its bright, upbeat sound, often featuring lush vocal harmonies, jangly guitars, and a strong melodic sensibility. It is often seen as a precursor to the power pop genre, and is often associated with the California Sound. Sunshine Pop is often seen as a combination of folk, rock, and pop, and is often seen as a more optimistic and cheerful version of the folk-rock genre. It is often seen as a reaction to the darker and more serious sounds of the British Invasion.

name: Jazz Blues
description: Jazz Blues is a genre of music that combines elements of jazz and blues. It is characterized by a strong blues influence, often featuring a 12-bar blues progression, and a jazz-influenced improvisation style. Jazz Blues often features a combination of electric and acoustic instruments, including electric guitar, piano, saxophone, and drums. It is a popular genre of music that has been around since the early 20th century.

name: Piano Blues
description: Piano Blues is a style of blues music that is characterized by its use of the piano as the primary instrument. It originated in the early 20th century in the southern United States and is closely related to ragtime and boogie-woogie. Piano Blues is often characterized by its slow, soulful melodies and its use of improvisation. It is often associated with the classic blues singers of the 1920s and 1930s, such as Bessie Smith, Ma Rainey, and Blind Lemon Jefferson.

name: Soul Blues
description: Soul Blues is a genre of music that combines elements of blues, soul, and R&B. It is characterized by its strong, soulful vocals, often accompanied by a horn section, and a heavy emphasis on the groove. It typically features a slower tempo than traditional blues, and often incorporates elements of funk and gospel. Soul Blues is often seen as a bridge between traditional blues and modern R&B, and is often credited with helping to create the sound of modern soul music.

name: Belgian EDM
description: Belgian EDM is a style of electronic dance music that originated in Belgium in the late 1990s. It is characterized by its hard-hitting, high-energy sound, often featuring distorted basslines, heavy drums, and melodic synth leads. It is heavily influenced by the early rave and techno scenes, and is often associated with the Belgian New Beat movement. Belgian EDM is often characterized by its dark, industrial sound, and is often seen as a precursor to the harder styles of EDM such as hardstyle and hardcore.

name: Norwegian Singer-Songwriter
description: Norwegian Singer-Songwriter is a genre of music that is characterized by its intimate, acoustic sound and thoughtful, introspective lyrics. It is often performed solo, with just a guitar or piano accompaniment. The genre is rooted in the traditional folk music of Norway, but has been modernized and adapted to fit the contemporary music scene. It is often characterized by its melancholic and reflective nature, and its focus on personal stories and experiences. Common themes include love, loss, and nature.

name: Brighton Indie
description: Brighton Indie is a genre of music that originated in the city of Brighton, England. It is characterized by its upbeat, melodic sound, often featuring jangly guitars, driving rhythms, and catchy hooks. It is heavily influenced by the indie rock and post-punk scenes of the 1980s and 1990s, as well as the mod revival of the late 1970s. Artists associated with the genre include The Kooks, The Maccabees, and The Rifles.

name: Modern Blues Rock
description: Modern Blues Rock is a genre of music that combines elements of traditional blues music with modern rock and roll. It typically features electric guitars, drums, and bass, as well as elements of blues such as slide guitar, harmonica, and bluesy vocal styles. It often has a more aggressive sound than traditional blues, and is often characterized by its heavy use of distortion and overdrive. It is a popular genre of music that has been embraced by many rock and blues fans alike.

name: Hi-NRG
description: Hi-NRG (High Energy) is a genre of dance music that originated in the early 1980s. It is characterized by a fast tempo (usually around 140-160 beats per minute), synthesizers, and a strong, driving beat. Hi-NRG is often associated with the gay club scene, and its sound is heavily influenced by disco, funk, and electronic music. Hi-NRG is often used in remixes of popular songs, and is often used in film and television soundtracks.

name: Big Band
description: Big Band music is a style of jazz music that originated in the 1930s and 1940s. It is characterized by large ensembles of brass, woodwind, and percussion instruments, as well as a rhythm section of piano, bass, and drums. Big Band music often features a vocalist, and is known for its swing-style rhythms and arrangements. It is often associated with the swing and jazz eras of the 1930s and 1940s, and is still popular today.

name: Harlem Renaissance
description: The Harlem Renaissance was a period of artistic, cultural, and social expression that began in the 1920s and lasted until the mid-1930s. It was a time of great creativity and innovation in African American music, literature, and art. Musically, the Harlem Renaissance was characterized by a mix of jazz, blues, and spirituals, as well as a new style of music called "stride piano." Stride piano was a style of jazz piano playing that combined elements of ragtime and blues. It was characterized by a strong left-hand rhythm and a right-hand melody that was often improvised. Other popular genres of music during the Harlem Renaissance included swing, big band, and gospel.

name: Stride
description: Stride is a jazz piano style that originated in the 1920s and 1930s. It is characterized by a fast-paced, syncopated rhythm and a strong left-hand accompaniment. The right hand plays a melody that is often improvised. Stride is often associated with the Harlem Renaissance and is considered to be a precursor to modern jazz. It is also known for its use of improvisation and syncopation.

name: Swing
description: Swing is a style of jazz music that originated in the 1920s and 1930s. It is characterized by a strong rhythm section, improvisation, and a call-and-response between the lead instruments and the rhythm section. Swing is often played in a fast tempo and features a variety of instruments, including saxophones, trumpets, trombones, and drums. Swing is often associated with the big band era, and is still popular today.

name: Teen Pop
description: Teen Pop is a genre of popular music that is targeted towards teenagers and young adults. It is typically upbeat and catchy, and often incorporates elements of pop, dance, and R&B. It is often characterized by its use of synthesizers, drum machines, and other electronic instruments. It is often seen as a more commercialized version of pop music, and is often associated with teen idols and boy bands.

name: German Romanticism
description: German Romanticism is a style of music that emerged in the early 19th century and is characterized by its emotional intensity, its focus on the individual, and its use of expressive melodies and harmonies. It is often associated with the works of composers such as Beethoven, Schubert, Mendelssohn, and Brahms. German Romanticism is characterized by its use of chromaticism, its emphasis on the expression of emotion, its use of large-scale forms, and its use of programmatic elements. It is also known for its use of the orchestra, its use of the piano, and its use of the human voice.

name: Nottingham Indie
description: Nottingham Indie is a genre of music that originated in Nottingham, England in the late 1980s and early 1990s. It is characterized by its upbeat, guitar-driven sound, often featuring jangly guitars, melodic bass lines, and a strong emphasis on rhythm. The genre is heavily influenced by the post-punk and new wave sounds of the 1980s, as well as the indie rock of the 1990s. Nottingham Indie bands often draw from a wide range of influences, including punk, ska, reggae, and folk. Notable Nottingham Indie bands include The Primitives, The Wonder Stuff, and The Long Blondes.

name: Italian Tenor
description: Italian Tenor is a genre of classical music that features the voice of a tenor singing in the Italian language. It is characterized by its passionate and emotive style, often featuring operatic arias and traditional Italian folk songs. It is often accompanied by a full orchestra or a small ensemble of instruments. The genre has been popular since the 19th century and is still widely performed today.

name: Fado
description: Fado is a traditional Portuguese music genre that is characterized by its melancholic and emotional sound. It is typically performed by a solo singer accompanied by a Portuguese guitar, classical guitar, and sometimes a string quartet. The lyrics of Fado songs often focus on themes of longing, sadness, and nostalgia. Fado has been recognized by UNESCO as an Intangible Cultural Heritage of Humanity.

name: Pop Violin
description: Pop Violin is a genre of music that combines elements of pop music with the sound of the violin. It typically features a mix of classical and modern styles, often with a strong emphasis on the violin as the lead instrument. The genre often incorporates elements of other genres such as rock, hip-hop, and electronic music. Pop Violin is often used in film and television soundtracks, as well as in live performances.

name: American Post-Rock
description: American Post-Rock is a genre of music that combines elements of rock, jazz, and classical music. It is characterized by its use of extended instrumental passages, complex arrangements, and often unconventional instrumentation. It is often characterized by its use of repetition, drones, and ambient textures. It is often seen as a more experimental form of rock music, and is often used to create a sense of atmosphere and emotion.

name: Folktronica
description: Folktronica is a genre of music that combines elements of folk music and electronic music. It typically features acoustic instruments such as guitars, banjos, and mandolins, as well as electronic elements such as synthesizers, drum machines, and samples. The genre is often characterized by its use of organic and electronic sounds, as well as its incorporation of traditional folk music elements. Folktronica is often seen as a bridge between traditional folk music and modern electronic music.

name: Shamanic
description: Shamanic music is a genre of music that is inspired by the spiritual practices of shamans, or spiritual healers, from various cultures around the world. It typically features a combination of traditional instruments, such as drums, rattles, and flutes, as well as modern electronic elements. The music is often used to induce a trance-like state, allowing the listener to enter a meditative state and connect with the spiritual realm. Shamanic music is often used in healing ceremonies, rituals, and other spiritual practices.

name: Polish Classical Piano
description: Polish Classical Piano is a genre of classical music that originated in Poland and is characterized by its lyrical melodies, intricate harmonies, and virtuosic technique. It is often performed on the piano and is known for its expressive and emotional qualities. The genre is rooted in the works of Polish composers such as Fryderyk Chopin, Ignacy Jan Paderewski, and Karol Szymanowski. It is often characterized by its use of rubato, a tempo fluctuation that allows for a more expressive interpretation of the music.

name: Arab Electronic
description: Arab Electronic music is a genre of electronic music that combines traditional Middle Eastern and North African musical elements with modern electronic music production techniques. It is characterized by its use of traditional instruments such as the oud, qanun, and tabla, as well as synthesizers, drum machines, and other electronic instruments. The genre often incorporates elements of hip-hop, trap, and EDM, and is often characterized by its heavy use of Middle Eastern and North African vocal samples. Arab Electronic music has become increasingly popular in recent years, with artists such as Omar Souleyman, A-WA, and 47Soul gaining international recognition.

name: Christmas Instrumental
description: Christmas Instrumental music is a genre of music that is composed and performed without lyrics or vocals. It typically features traditional Christmas carols and holiday songs arranged for instruments such as piano, strings, brass, woodwinds, and percussion. It is often used as background music for holiday events, or as a way to create a festive atmosphere.

name: Belgian Indie
description: Belgian Indie is a genre of music that originated in Belgium in the late 1990s and early 2000s. It is characterized by its eclectic mix of styles, including elements of rock, pop, folk, and electronic music. The genre is often associated with the Belgian indie rock scene, which is known for its DIY approach and its focus on creating unique and innovative sounds. Belgian Indie is often characterized by its use of unconventional instrumentation, such as the use of synthesizers, drum machines, and samples. It is also known for its use of unconventional song structures and its focus on experimentation.

name: Belgian Rock
description: Belgian Rock is a genre of rock music that originated in Belgium in the late 1960s and early 1970s. It is characterized by its heavy use of distorted guitars, driving rhythms, and often political lyrics. It is heavily influenced by British and American rock music, but also incorporates elements of jazz, funk, and folk music. Belgian Rock bands often feature multiple vocalists and a wide range of instrumentation, including keyboards, horns, and strings. Notable Belgian Rock bands include The Scabs, The Kids, and TC Matic.

name: Doo-Wop
description: Doo-wop is a style of vocal-based rhythm and blues music popular in the 1950s and 1960s. It features simple, catchy melodies and tight harmonies, often with a call-and-response structure. Doo-wop is characterized by its use of nonsense syllables, light instrumentation, and vocal harmonies arranged by a lead singer. It is often considered a precursor to rock and roll.

name: UK Funky
description: UK Funky is a genre of electronic dance music that originated in the UK in the early 2000s. It is a fusion of house, garage, and Afrobeat, and is characterized by its syncopated rhythms, heavy basslines, and soulful vocal samples. It is often associated with the UK's grime and dubstep scenes, and has been described as a "more soulful, more melodic, and more accessible" version of those genres.

name: Nederpop
description: Nederpop is a genre of Dutch popular music that emerged in the late 1960s and early 1970s. It is characterized by its use of English-language lyrics, often with a strong influence from British and American pop music. It is often seen as a precursor to the Dutch New Wave of the 1980s. Nederpop is characterized by its catchy melodies, simple chord progressions, and often humorous lyrics. It is often seen as a bridge between the traditional Dutch folk music and the more modern pop music of the time.

name: Belgian Dance
description: The Belgian Dance music genre is a style of electronic dance music that originated in Belgium in the late 1980s. It is characterized by its fast-paced, upbeat rhythms and its use of synthesizers and drum machines. It is often associated with the Belgian New Beat scene, which was popular in the late 1980s and early 1990s. Belgian Dance music is heavily influenced by genres such as techno, house, and trance, and is often characterized by its heavy use of samples and its incorporation of elements from other genres. It is often seen as a precursor to the modern EDM scene.

name: Big Room
description: Big Room is a subgenre of EDM (electronic dance music) that is characterized by its high energy, big drops, and anthemic melodies. It is often associated with the mainstage sound of large EDM festivals, and is characterized by its use of powerful basslines, heavy synths, and a four-on-the-floor beat. Big Room is often seen as a more commercialized version of EDM, and is often used in radio and club playlists.

name: Taiwan Classical Performance
description: Taiwan Classical Performance is a genre of traditional Chinese music that originated in Taiwan. It is characterized by its use of traditional Chinese instruments such as the erhu, pipa, and guzheng, as well as its incorporation of elements from Taiwanese folk music. The genre is often used to accompany traditional Chinese operas, and is known for its melodic and lyrical qualities. It is also often used in film and television soundtracks.

name: Scandipop
description: Scandipop is a genre of music that originated in Scandinavia in the late 1990s. It is a mix of pop, dance, and electronic music, often featuring catchy melodies and upbeat rhythms. It is characterized by its use of synthesizers, drum machines, and other electronic instruments. Scandipop is often seen as a more modern and upbeat version of traditional Scandinavian music. It has become increasingly popular in recent years, with many Scandinavian artists achieving international success.

name: Polish Classical
description: Polish Classical music is a genre of classical music that originated in Poland during the late 18th century. It is characterized by its use of folk elements, such as traditional Polish folk songs and dances, as well as its use of harmonic and melodic elements from the Baroque and Classical periods. It is often considered to be a bridge between the Baroque and Classical periods, and is known for its use of chromaticism, modal scales, and its emphasis on melody. Notable composers of Polish Classical music include Fryderyk Chopin, Karol Szymanowski, and Ignacy Jan Paderewski.

name: Modern Alternative Pop
description: Modern Alternative Pop is a genre of music that combines elements of alternative rock, pop, and electronic music. It is characterized by its use of synthesizers, drum machines, and other electronic instruments, as well as its incorporation of elements from other genres such as hip hop, R&B, and indie rock. It is often characterized by its upbeat, catchy melodies and its focus on modern production techniques. Artists in this genre include Halsey, The 1975, and Billie Eilish.

name: Vapor Pop
description: Vapor Pop is a genre of music that combines elements of vaporwave, synthpop, and chillwave. It is characterized by its dreamy, nostalgic sound, often featuring heavily-processed vocals, synthesizers, and samples. The genre often has a lo-fi aesthetic, and its lyrics often focus on themes of escapism, nostalgia, and the future.

name: Dangdut
description: Dangdut is a popular music genre in Indonesia that combines traditional Malay, Arabic, and Indian influences. It is characterized by its fast tempo, heavy percussion, and melodic vocals. It is often accompanied by traditional instruments such as the gendang (drum), gong, and flute. Dangdut is often performed at weddings, festivals, and other celebrations. It is also popular in Malaysia, Singapore, and Brunei.

name: Indonesian Pop
description: Indonesian Pop (or Pop Indo) is a genre of popular music originating in Indonesia. It is a blend of traditional Indonesian music with modern pop, rock, and hip-hop influences. It is characterized by its upbeat, catchy melodies and often incorporates traditional instruments such as the gamelan and kendang. Pop Indo is often used in Indonesian films and television shows, and is popular among young people in Indonesia.

name: Indonesian Emo
description: Indonesian Emo is a genre of music that originated in Indonesia in the early 2000s. It is a combination of emo, punk, and pop music, with a focus on emotional lyrics and melodic guitar riffs. The genre is characterized by its upbeat, energetic sound and its use of traditional Indonesian instruments such as the gamelan. Indonesian Emo bands often incorporate elements of traditional Indonesian music into their songs, creating a unique sound that is both modern and rooted in the country's culture.

name: Indonesian Indie
description: Indonesian Indie is a genre of music that originated in Indonesia in the late 1990s. It is a blend of traditional Indonesian music with modern influences from rock, pop, jazz, and other genres. The sound is often characterized by acoustic guitars, traditional instruments, and a mix of traditional and modern vocal styles. It is often seen as a way for Indonesian musicians to express their own unique identity and culture. Indonesian Indie is often seen as a way to bridge the gap between traditional and modern music in Indonesia.

name: Indonesian Pop Punk
description: Indonesian Pop Punk is a genre of music that combines elements of punk rock and pop music. It is characterized by fast tempos, loud guitars, and catchy melodies. The lyrics often focus on themes of teenage angst, rebellion, and love. The genre has been popular in Indonesia since the early 2000s and has been influenced by bands such as Blink-182, Green Day, and Sum 41.

name: Classic Indonesian Rock
description: Classic Indonesian Rock is a genre of rock music that originated in Indonesia in the late 1960s and early 1970s. It is characterized by its heavy use of electric guitars, drums, and bass, as well as its incorporation of traditional Indonesian instruments and melodies. The genre is heavily influenced by Western rock music, but also incorporates elements of traditional Indonesian music such as gamelan and keroncong. Classic Indonesian Rock is often seen as a precursor to the more modern Indonesian rock scene, and is still popular today.

name: Indonesian Rock
description: Indonesian Rock is a genre of music that originated in Indonesia in the late 1960s and early 1970s. It is a blend of traditional Indonesian music, such as gamelan, with Western rock and roll. It is characterized by its heavy use of electric guitars, drums, and bass, as well as its incorporation of traditional Indonesian instruments and melodies. It is often seen as a form of protest music, as it was used to express the frustrations of the youth of Indonesia during the period of political unrest in the late 1960s and early 1970s.

name: Nantes Indie
description: Nantes Indie is a genre of music that originated in the city of Nantes, France. It is characterized by a mix of indie rock, post-punk, and electronic music. The genre is often characterized by its use of synthesizers, drum machines, and other electronic instruments, as well as its incorporation of elements from other genres such as jazz, funk, and hip-hop. Nantes Indie is often seen as a more experimental and eclectic form of indie rock, and is often associated with the city's vibrant music scene.

name: Malaysian Pop
description: Malaysian Pop is a genre of popular music that originated in Malaysia in the late 1990s. It is a mix of traditional Malay music, Western pop, and other influences from around the world. The genre is characterized by its upbeat, catchy melodies and often incorporates elements of traditional Malay instruments such as the gendang, gong, and rebana. Malaysian Pop is often seen as a reflection of the country's diverse culture and is popular among both young and old.

name: Kawaii Future Bass
description: Kawaii Future Bass is a genre of electronic music that combines elements of Future Bass, Trap, and J-Pop. It is characterized by its upbeat, melodic sound, often featuring bright synths, bouncy basslines, and catchy vocal samples. The genre often incorporates elements of Japanese culture, such as traditional instruments and vocal samples. Kawaii Future Bass is often seen as a more accessible version of Future Bass, with its focus on catchy melodies and upbeat vibes.

name: Melodic Dubstep
description: Melodic Dubstep is a subgenre of Dubstep that combines the heavy bass and syncopated rhythms of traditional Dubstep with melodic elements such as piano, strings, and vocal samples. It is often characterized by its slower tempo and more melodic sound. Melodic Dubstep often features a wide range of musical influences, from classical to pop, and is often used in film and television soundtracks.

name: Progressive Post-Hardcore
description: Progressive post-hardcore is a genre of music that combines elements of post-hardcore, progressive rock, and metalcore. It is characterized by its heavy, distorted guitar riffs, complex drum patterns, and often aggressive vocals. The genre is known for its experimentation with different musical styles, often incorporating elements of jazz, classical, and electronic music. It is also known for its use of unconventional song structures and time signatures. Progressive post-hardcore is often seen as a more progressive and experimental version of post-hardcore, and is often seen as a bridge between post-hardcore and metalcore.

name: Screamo
description: Screamo is a genre of music that combines elements of hardcore punk and emo. It is characterized by screamed vocals, distorted guitars, and fast tempos. The lyrics often focus on personal and social issues, such as mental health, relationships, and politics. The genre originated in the early 1990s and has since evolved to include a variety of subgenres.

name: K-Pop
description: K-Pop is a genre of popular music originating in South Korea. It is characterized by a wide variety of audiovisual elements, including strong beats, catchy melodies, and often incorporates elements from a range of genres including hip hop, R&B, and EDM. K-Pop is often known for its use of choreographed dance routines, and its use of visuals, such as music videos and live performances. name: Rumba

It is typically played with a combination of percussion instruments, such as congas, bongos, and claves, as well as guitars, bass, and horns. Rumba is often used in Latin dance styles, such as salsa and cha-cha-cha.

name: Glitch

It often incorporates elements of hip-hop, dubstep, and IDM, and is often characterized by its use of chopped up samples, stuttering rhythms, and distorted sounds. Glitch music is often experimental and abstract, and is often used to create a sense of disorientation and confusion.

name: Chiptune

It is characterized by its 8-bit sound, which is created by the limited number of channels and the limited range of frequencies available on the sound chips. Chiptune music often has a retro, nostalgic feel to it, and is often used in video games and other media.

The genre is characterized by its use of acoustic instruments, such as guitars, banjos, and mandolins, as well as its incorporation of traditional Appalachian music. name: Italian Baroque
description: Italian Baroque music is a style of music that flourished in Italy during the 17th and 18th centuries. It is characterized by its ornate and often complex melodic lines, as well as its use of counterpoint and polyphony. It is also known for its use of the basso continuo, a type of accompaniment that uses a bass line and chords to provide harmonic structure. Italian Baroque music often features a wide range of instruments, including strings, winds, brass, and percussion. It is also known for its use of ornamentation, such as trills, mordents, and turns.

The resulting song often has a unique sound that is a combination of the original songs. It is characterized by its jangly, melodic guitar sound, often with a strong emphasis on vocal harmonies. It is characterized by its eclectic mix of styles, including punk, indie rock, post-punk, new wave, and grunge. name: Drum And Bass
description: Drum and Bass (also known as DnB) is a genre of electronic music that originated in the UK in the early 1990s. It is characterized by fast breakbeats (typically between 160–180 beats per minute) with heavy bass and sub-bass lines. It often features samples and synthesized effects, as well as vocals from MCs. Drum and Bass is known for its energetic and intense sound, and is often used in clubs, raves, and festivals.

name: French DnB

It is characterized by its heavy use of French-language samples, as well as its incorporation of French-style melodies and rhythms. French DnB typically features a fast tempo, with a focus on complex drum patterns and basslines. It often incorporates elements of other genres, such as hip-hop, jazz, and funk. name: Future House

It is characterized by its use of melodic synths, deep basslines, and a 4/4 beat. It often features vocal samples and chopped up vocal hooks, as well as a variety of percussion elements. name: Vaporwave

It is characterized by a nostalgic, dreamy sound, often featuring samples from 1980s and 1990s pop music, as well as synthesizers and other electronic instruments. The genre is often associated with a visual aesthetic of pastel colors, neon lights, and retro imagery. Lyrically, Vaporwave often focuses on themes of consumerism, nostalgia, and escapism.

name: Chamber Orchestra
description: Chamber Orchestra music is a type of classical music that is performed by a small ensemble of musicians, usually between 10 and 40 players. It is typically performed in a chamber setting, such as a small concert hall or a private home. The music is usually written for a specific combination of instruments, such as strings, woodwinds, brass, and percussion. Chamber Orchestra music is often more intimate and delicate than larger orchestral works, and often features soloists or small groups of instruments. It is often used in film scores, television shows, and other media.

name: Italian Orchestra

It is characterized by a large ensemble of instruments, including strings, brass, woodwinds, and percussion. The music is often upbeat and lively, and often features a wide range of musical styles, from classical to folk. It is often used in film scores, television shows, and other media.

It typically includes violins, violas, cellos, and double basses, as well as other instruments such as harps, lutes, and guitars. This genre of music is often used in film scores, television shows, and other media. It is characterized by its lush, romantic sound and its ability to evoke emotion.

It typically features a singer-songwriter performing solo or with a small band, often accompanied by acoustic guitar, piano, and/or other instruments. The lyrics are often personal and introspective, and the music is often melodic and melancholic. The genre has been popularized by artists such as Boudewijn de Groot, Herman van Veen, and Janis Ian.

name: Wave

It is characterized by its use of synthesizers, drum machines, and other electronic instruments, as well as its atmospheric, dreamy, and often melancholic soundscapes. Wave music often incorporates elements of ambient, new age, and synth-pop, and is often associated with the genres of chillwave and dream pop. It is often characterized by its slow, hypnotic rhythms and its lush, ethereal soundscapes.

name: Witch House
description: Witch House is a dark, experimental electronic music genre that emerged in the late 2000s. It is characterized by its slow, distorted beats, heavy use of samples, and ethereal, often occult-inspired lyrics. The genre is heavily influenced by hip-hop, industrial, and gothic music, and often incorporates elements of trap, drone, and noise. Witch House is often associated with the visual aesthetic of vaporwave, and is often seen as a spiritual successor to the witch house subgenre of witch house.

name: Emo

It is often associated with the punk and indie rock genres, and is often seen as a more melodic and emotionally charged version of punk rock.

name: Rock Drums

It is often associated with rock music, but can also be found in other genres such as funk, jazz, and hip-hop. Rock drums typically feature a driving beat, often with a backbeat on the snare drum, and a heavy emphasis on the kick drum. The drums are often played with a lot of energy and power, and the cymbals are often used to create a sense of excitement and tension. Rock drums are often used to create a powerful and driving sound, and are often used to create a sense of urgency and intensity.

name: NZ Pop

name: Southern Rock

Characteristic features of Southern Rock include a strong backbeat, twangy guitars, and a prominent vocal style that often incorporates a drawl or Southern accent. Popular Southern Rock bands include Lynyrd Skynyrd, The Allman Brothers Band, and The Marshall Tucker Band.

It is characterized by its slow, bluesy rhythms, twangy guitars, and soulful vocals. It is often associated with artists such as Creedence Clearwater Revival, The Allman Brothers Band, and Lynyrd Skynyrd.

name: Fake
description: Fake music is a genre of music that is created to sound like a particular style or genre, but is not actually that style or genre. It is often used to parody or satirize a particular style or genre, or to create a humorous effect. The vocals are usually screamed or shouted, and the lyrics often focus on themes of darkness, despair, and nihilism. The drums are usually fast and intense, and the bass is often distorted and heavy. Blackgaze is often seen as a more accessible version of black metal, and has gained a large following in recent years.

name: Cascadian Black Metal
description: Cascadian Black Metal is a subgenre of black metal that originated in the Pacific Northwest region of the United States. It is characterized by its use of atmospheric and melodic elements, often incorporating elements of folk and ambient music. The lyrics often focus on themes of nature, the environment, and the struggle between man and nature. Musically, Cascadian Black Metal is often slower and more melodic than traditional black metal, and often features acoustic guitars, keyboards, and other instruments.

name: Portland Metal
description: Portland Metal is a subgenre of heavy metal music that originated in Portland, Oregon in the early 2000s. It is characterized by a mix of thrash metal, death metal, and hardcore punk, with a focus on aggressive, fast-paced rhythms and heavy riffs. The genre is often associated with bands such as Red Fang, Lord Dying, and Witch Mountain, who have all released albums in the Portland Metal style. Portland Metal is known for its intense live performances and its DIY ethos, with many bands self-releasing their music and booking their own shows.

name: USBM
description: USBM (or Unblack Metal) is a subgenre of metal music that combines elements of black metal with Christian themes and lyrics. It is characterized by its use of distorted guitars, blast beats, and harsh vocals, but with a lyrical focus on Christian themes and messages. The genre has been around since the early 1990s and has seen a resurgence in recent years.

name: French Black Metal
description: French Black Metal is a subgenre of extreme metal music that originated in France in the early 1990s. It is characterized by its raw, aggressive sound, often featuring fast tempos, shrieking vocals, and heavily distorted guitars. The lyrics often focus on themes of death, destruction, and the occult. French Black Metal bands often incorporate elements of traditional folk music, such as acoustic guitars and traditional instruments, into their sound. The genre has been influential in the development of other extreme metal genres, such as death metal and blackened death metal.

name: French Shoegaze
description: French Shoegaze is a subgenre of shoegaze, a type of alternative rock music that emerged in the late 1980s and early 1990s. French Shoegaze is characterized by its dreamy, ethereal soundscapes, heavy use of reverb and delay, and often incorporates elements of post-rock, dream pop, and ambient music. The genre is heavily influenced by the shoegaze sound of the UK, but has a distinct French flavor, often featuring French lyrics and instrumentation. French Shoegaze bands often use a variety of instruments, including guitars, keyboards, and drums, to create a lush, layered sound.

name: Post-Black Metal
description: Post-Black Metal is a subgenre of metal music that combines elements of black metal with other genres such as post-rock, shoegaze, and ambient music. It is characterized by its atmospheric soundscapes, often featuring heavily distorted guitars, blast beats, and harsh vocals. Post-Black Metal bands often explore themes of nature, spirituality, and personal introspection. The genre has been described as "a more melodic, atmospheric, and introspective take on the traditional black metal sound."

name: Ambient Worship
description: Ambient Worship is a genre of music that combines elements of ambient music with traditional Christian worship music. It typically features a mix of ambient soundscapes, electronic beats, and traditional worship elements such as hymns and choruses. The goal of this genre is to create a peaceful and reflective atmosphere for worship and meditation. Ambient Worship music is often used in churches, retreats, and other spiritual gatherings.

name: Space Ambient
description: Space Ambient is a genre of electronic music that is characterized by its slow, dreamy, and atmospheric soundscapes. It often incorporates elements of ambient, drone, and minimalism, and is often inspired by science fiction and space exploration. It is often used to create a sense of awe and wonder, and to evoke a feeling of being in a vast and mysterious universe.

name: British Post-Rock
description: British Post-Rock is a genre of music that emerged in the late 1990s and early 2000s. It is characterized by its experimental, instrumental sound, often featuring long, drawn-out compositions with multiple layers of sound. It is heavily influenced by ambient, jazz, and classical music, as well as rock and roll. British Post-Rock bands often use unconventional instruments and sound manipulation techniques to create unique sonic textures. The genre is often associated with the UK's independent music scene, and is often seen as a reaction to the mainstream music of the time.

name: Cosmic Post-Rock
description: Cosmic Post-Rock is a genre of music that combines elements of post-rock, ambient, and space rock. It is characterized by its expansive soundscapes, often featuring long, drawn-out instrumental passages that evoke a sense of exploration and discovery. The music often incorporates elements of drone, shoegaze, and psychedelia, creating a dreamy, ethereal atmosphere. It is often instrumental, but can also feature vocals, samples, and other sound effects.

name: Cosmic American
description: Cosmic American music is a genre of music that combines elements of country, folk, rock, and blues. It is often characterized by its use of reverb-drenched guitars, pedal steel, and a laid-back, dreamy atmosphere. It is often seen as a bridge between traditional country music and the more experimental sounds of psychedelic rock. Artists associated with the genre include Gram Parsons, The Byrds, and Neil Young.

name: Jam Band
description: Jam Band music is a genre of music that is improvisational and often incorporates elements of rock, jazz, blues, funk, reggae, and folk. It is characterized by extended instrumental improvisation, often with multiple musicians playing together in a live setting. Jam Band music is often associated with the Grateful Dead, Phish, and Widespread Panic, but there are many other bands that fall into this genre. Jam Band music is often seen as a communal experience, with fans often attending multiple shows and trading live recordings of shows.

name: Hauntology
description: Hauntology is a genre of music that combines elements of nostalgia, surrealism, and the supernatural. It often draws on elements of classic pop, folk, and ambient music, as well as samples from older recordings. The genre is characterized by a dream-like atmosphere, often with a melancholic or eerie feel. It is often associated with the work of artists such as Boards of Canada, Burial, and The Caretaker.

name: Neo-Kraut
description: Neo-Kraut is a genre of electronic music that combines elements of Krautrock, a genre of experimental rock music that originated in Germany in the late 1960s and early 1970s, with modern electronic music production techniques. It is characterized by its hypnotic, repetitive rhythms, heavy use of synthesizers, and often minimalistic arrangements. Artists in this genre often draw inspiration from the original Krautrock bands such as Kraftwerk, Can, and Neu!, as well as more contemporary electronic music such as ambient, techno, and IDM.

name: Iranian Experimental
description: Iranian Experimental music is a genre of music that combines traditional Iranian music with elements of experimental music. It is characterized by its use of traditional instruments such as the tar, setar, and santur, as well as modern instruments such as synthesizers and samplers. It often incorporates elements of jazz, classical, and electronic music, as well as traditional Iranian folk music. Iranian Experimental music is often improvisational in nature, and is often used to explore the boundaries of traditional Iranian music.

name: Livetronica
description: Livetronica is a genre of electronic music that combines elements of live instrumentation with electronic production. It is a hybrid of live performance and electronic music production, often featuring live drums, guitar, bass, and keyboards alongside synthesizers, samplers, and other electronic elements. Livetronica often incorporates elements of jam band music, funk, jazz, and other genres. It is typically performed live, with the musicians improvising and interacting with each other and the audience.

name: Avant-Garde Black Metal
description: Avant-Garde Black Metal is a subgenre of extreme metal music that combines elements of black metal with experimental and avant-garde music. It is characterized by its unconventional song structures, unconventional instrumentation, and its use of dissonance and atonality. It often incorporates elements of classical music, jazz, and folk music, as well as other genres. It is often characterized by its dark, chaotic, and often chaotic sound.

name: Baroque Pop
description: Baroque Pop is a genre of popular music that combines elements of classical music with modern pop music. It is characterized by its use of complex instrumentation, ornate melodies, and lush arrangements. It often features strings, horns, and other classical instruments, as well as electric guitars, synthesizers, and drum machines. Baroque Pop is often seen as a bridge between classical and popular music, and is often used to create a more dramatic and emotional sound. Artists such as The Beatles, The Beach Boys, and The Zombies are often cited as early pioneers of the genre.

name: Dark Jazz
description: Dark Jazz is a genre of music that combines elements of jazz, blues, and soul with darker, more experimental sounds. It often features a slower tempo and a more somber mood, with a focus on improvisation and atmosphere. Dark Jazz often incorporates elements of hip-hop, electronica, and ambient music, creating a unique sound that is both haunting and captivating.

name: Birmingham Metal
description: Birmingham Metal is a subgenre of heavy metal music that originated in Birmingham, England in the late 1980s. It is characterized by a combination of thrash metal and traditional heavy metal influences, with a focus on technicality and speed. Birmingham Metal bands often feature complex guitar riffs, fast tempos, and aggressive vocals. Common lyrical themes include politics, social issues, and personal struggles. Notable Birmingham Metal bands include Napalm Death, Bolt Thrower, and Benediction.

name: UK Doom Metal
description: UK Doom Metal is a subgenre of heavy metal music that originated in the United Kingdom in the late 1980s. It is characterized by slow tempos, heavy riffs, and dark, often melancholic lyrics. The genre is heavily influenced by traditional doom metal, but also incorporates elements of gothic rock, progressive rock, and psychedelic rock. UK Doom Metal bands often feature female vocalists, and the music often has a strong sense of atmosphere and emotion. Common lyrical themes include death, despair, and the occult.

name: Canadian Psychedelic Rock
description: Canadian Psychedelic Rock is a genre of music that emerged in the late 1960s and early 1970s in Canada. It is characterized by its use of psychedelic elements such as distorted guitars, heavy reverb, and experimental song structures. It often incorporates elements of folk, blues, and jazz, as well as other genres. Canadian Psychedelic Rock bands often have a unique sound that is distinct from other psychedelic rock bands from other countries. Notable Canadian Psychedelic Rock bands include The Guess Who, The Band, and The Ugly Ducklings.

name: Space Rock
description: Space Rock is a genre of music that combines elements of psychedelic rock, progressive rock, and electronic music. It typically features extended instrumental passages, often with heavy use of synthesizers and effects, and often has a dreamy, otherworldly atmosphere. Space Rock often incorporates elements of science fiction and fantasy, and is often characterized by its use of extended instrumental passages, often with heavy use of synthesizers and effects. It is often associated with the psychedelic and progressive rock genres, and is often seen as a precursor to the ambient and electronic music genres.

name: Progressive Trance House
description: Progressive Trance House is a subgenre of electronic dance music that combines elements of progressive house and trance. It is characterized by its melodic, uplifting sound and its use of complex, layered melodies and rhythms. It often features a 4/4 beat and a tempo of around 128-140 BPM. It is often characterized by its use of synthesizers, samples, and effects to create a unique sound. It is often used in clubs and festivals and is popular among DJs and producers.

name: British Choir
description: British Choir music is a genre of choral music that originated in the United Kingdom. It is typically performed by a choir of four to eight voices, and often includes a soloist. The music is usually written in a traditional style, with a focus on harmony and counterpoint. It often features a variety of instruments, including strings, brass, and percussion. British Choir music is often performed in churches, cathedrals, and other religious settings, as well as in concert halls and other venues.

name: Choral
description: Choral music is a genre of music that is performed by a choir, typically consisting of voices accompanied by instruments. It is often written for religious purposes, but can also be written for secular purposes. Choral music can range from simple arrangements of folk songs to complex works that require a large choir and orchestra. It is often performed in churches, concert halls, and other public venues.

name: Early Music Choir
description: Early Music Choir is a genre of music that focuses on the performance of music from the Medieval, Renaissance, and Baroque eras. This type of music is typically performed by a choir, and often includes a variety of instruments such as lutes, viols, recorders, and harpsichords. The repertoire of Early Music Choir includes sacred and secular works from composers such as Palestrina, Monteverdi, and Bach. This genre of music is often performed in a historically-informed manner, with attention to period performance practices and instrumentation.

name: Early Music Ensemble
description: Early Music Ensemble is a genre of music that focuses on the performance of music from the Medieval, Renaissance, and Baroque periods. It is typically performed on period instruments, such as lutes, viols, harpsichords, and recorders, and often includes vocalists. The music is often performed in a historically informed manner, with attention to the original performance practices of the time period. Early Music Ensemble performances often feature improvisation and ornamentation, as well as the use of period-specific techniques and styles.

name: Indie Psych-Pop
description: Indie Psych-Pop is a genre of music that combines elements of indie rock, psychedelic rock, and pop music. It typically features dreamy, ethereal soundscapes, often with a strong emphasis on melody and catchy hooks. The genre often incorporates elements of shoegaze, dream pop, and synth-pop, as well as elements of folk, jazz, and world music. Indie Psych-Pop is often characterized by its use of reverb-drenched guitars, lush vocal harmonies, and experimental production techniques.

name: Bath Indie
description: Bath Indie is a genre of music that originated in the city of Bath, England in the late 1990s. It is characterized by its upbeat, melodic sound, often featuring jangly guitars, driving rhythms, and catchy hooks. The genre is heavily influenced by indie rock, punk, and post-punk, as well as elements of folk, ska, and reggae.
