name: R&B en Espanol
description: R&B en Espanol is a genre of music that combines elements of traditional R&B with Latin music. It is a fusion of R&B, hip-hop, reggaeton, salsa, and other Latin music styles. It is characterized by its smooth, soulful sound and its incorporation of Latin rhythms and instruments. It is often sung in both English and Spanish, and its lyrics often focus on themes of love, relationships, and social issues. Artists in this genre include Prince Royce, J Balvin, and Ozuna.

name: Minimal Melodic Techno
description: Minimal Melodic Techno is a subgenre of techno music that combines elements of minimal techno and melodic techno. It is characterized by its minimalistic approach to production, often featuring repetitive, hypnotic rhythms and melodies. The genre is often characterized by its use of synthesizers, drum machines, and other electronic instruments to create a soundscape that is both melodic and driving. It is often seen as a more accessible form of techno music, as it often features more melodic elements than traditional techno.

name: Streichquartett
description: Streichquartett is a genre of classical music written for two violins, a viola, and a cello. It is typically written in four movements, with each instrument taking a solo role in turn. The genre originated in the 18th century and has since been adapted and expanded upon by composers from all over the world. Streichquartett is often used to explore complex musical ideas and to create a unique soundscape.

name: Danish Modern Jazz
description: Danish Modern Jazz is a style of jazz music that originated in Denmark in the 1950s and 1960s. It is characterized by its use of modern jazz techniques, such as improvisation, polyrhythms, and extended harmonies, combined with traditional Danish folk music elements. It is often seen as a bridge between traditional jazz and more modern styles, such as free jazz and fusion. It is often characterized by its use of unusual instrumentation, such as the saxophone, flute, and accordion, as well as its incorporation of traditional Danish folk music elements.

name: Italian Classical Piano
description: Italian Classical Piano is a genre of classical music that focuses on the works of Italian composers from the Baroque, Classical, and Romantic eras. It is characterized by its lyrical melodies, intricate harmonies, and often virtuosic technique. It is often performed on the piano, but can also be performed on other instruments such as the harpsichord, organ, and strings. The genre is often associated with the works of composers such as Antonio Vivaldi, Domenico Scarlatti, Gioachino Rossini, and Giuseppe Verdi.

name: German Indie
description: German Indie is a genre of music that originated in Germany in the late 1990s and early 2000s. It is characterized by its use of electronic instruments, often combined with traditional rock instruments, and its focus on creating a unique sound. German Indie often incorporates elements of punk, post-punk, and alternative rock, as well as elements of hip-hop, techno, and other electronic genres. It is often characterized by its use of unconventional song structures, experimental production techniques, and its focus on creating a unique sound. German Indie is often associated with the DIY (do-it-yourself) ethos, and many of its artists are independent and self-produced.

name: German Singer-Songwriter
description: The German Singer-Songwriter music genre is a style of music that originated in Germany in the late 1960s and early 1970s. It is characterized by its focus on personal lyrics, often with a melancholic or introspective tone, and often featuring acoustic instruments such as guitar, piano, and harmonica. The genre is heavily influenced by folk music, and often features a combination of traditional German folk instruments and modern instruments. It is often seen as a reaction to the more commercialized pop music of the time. German Singer-Songwriters often write and perform their own songs, and often have a strong political or social message in their lyrics.

name: Classical Bass
description: Classical Bass is a genre of music that focuses on the use of the double bass as a solo instrument. It is a style of music that combines elements of classical music with jazz, folk, and other genres. It is often characterized by its use of improvisation, complex rhythms, and extended techniques. Classical Bass music is often performed in a chamber setting, with the double bass as the lead instrument.

name: Jazz Brass
description: Jazz Brass is a genre of jazz music that incorporates brass instruments such as trumpets, trombones, and tubas. It is characterized by a strong, driving rhythm section, often featuring a walking bass line, and a mix of improvisation and composition. Jazz Brass often features a combination of swing, bebop, and funk elements, and is often played in a loud, energetic style.

name: Syrian Pop
description: Syrian Pop is a genre of popular music that originated in Syria in the 1950s. It is a mix of traditional Arabic music, Western pop, and jazz. It is characterized by its upbeat rhythms, catchy melodies, and use of traditional instruments such as the oud, qanun, and nay. Syrian Pop is often seen as a bridge between traditional and modern music, and has been popularized by artists such as Asala, George Wassouf, and Najwa Karam.

name: Galante Era
description: The Galante Era is a genre of Latin music that emerged in the late 1990s and early 2000s. It is characterized by its upbeat, danceable rhythms and its incorporation of elements from other genres such as reggaeton, hip-hop, and R&B. The genre is named after Puerto Rican singer and producer Eddie Dee, who is credited with popularizing the sound. The Galante Era is known for its catchy hooks, heavy bass lines, and its use of synthesizers and samples. It is often associated with the rise of the Latin urban music scene in the United States.

name: Japanese Classical Performance
description: Japanese Classical Performance is a genre of traditional Japanese music that dates back to the Edo period (1603-1868). It is characterized by its use of traditional instruments such as the shamisen, koto, and shakuhachi, as well as its use of traditional vocal styles. The music is often slow and meditative, and is often used in traditional ceremonies and rituals. It is also used in modern contexts, such as in film soundtracks and video games.

name: Classical Countertenor
description: Classical countertenor is a vocal style that is characterized by a high-pitched, light, and airy sound. It is often used in Baroque and Renaissance music, as well as in some contemporary classical works. Countertenors are typically male singers who use a falsetto technique to reach the higher notes. The range of a countertenor is usually between the tenor and alto ranges, and they often sing in a light, lyrical style. Countertenors are often used in choral works, as well as in operas and oratorios.

name: Cambridge Choir
description: The Cambridge Choir is a style of choral music that originated in the city of Cambridge, England. It is characterized by its use of traditional English choral music, often with a focus on sacred music. The style is often performed in a cappella, with a focus on four-part harmony and intricate counterpoint. The repertoire of the Cambridge Choir includes works from the Renaissance, Baroque, Classical, and Romantic periods, as well as contemporary works.

name: French Orchestra
description: The French Orchestra music genre is a style of classical music that originated in France during the 19th century. It is characterized by its lush, romantic sound, featuring large string sections, woodwinds, and brass instruments. The music often has a grand, sweeping quality, with sweeping melodies and lush harmonies. It is often used in film scores and other orchestral works.

name: Nordic Classical Piano
description: Nordic Classical Piano is a genre of music that combines elements of classical music with traditional Nordic folk music. It is characterized by its use of traditional Nordic instruments such as the Hardanger fiddle, the nyckelharpa, and the kantele, as well as classical piano. The music often has a melancholic and reflective quality, and is often used to evoke a sense of nostalgia and longing. It is often used in film and television soundtracks, as well as in live performances.

name: Classical Organ
description: Classical Organ music is a genre of music that is performed on the organ, a keyboard instrument that produces sound by driving wind through pipes. It is typically associated with the Baroque, Classical, and Romantic periods of music, and is often used in religious settings. It is characterized by its use of counterpoint, fugue, and other contrapuntal techniques, as well as its use of the organ's full range of sounds. It is often performed in churches, cathedrals, and other religious venues, and is often used to accompany hymns and other religious music.

name: Historically Informed Performance
description: Historically Informed Performance (HIP) is a style of classical music performance that seeks to recreate the sound of music from a particular period in history. It is based on the idea that the performance of music should be informed by the practices and conventions of the time in which it was composed. HIP performances use period instruments, techniques, and styles of playing to recreate the sound of the original performance. This style of performance has become increasingly popular in recent years, as it allows for a more authentic and immersive experience for the listener.

name: Harpsichord
description: Harpsichord music is a genre of classical music that originated in the Baroque period of the 17th and 18th centuries. It is characterized by its use of the harpsichord, a keyboard instrument that produces a plucked sound. Harpsichord music is often characterized by its intricate counterpoint and complex rhythms. It is often used in Baroque operas, concertos, and chamber music.

name: Italian Opera
description: Italian Opera is a genre of classical music that originated in Italy during the late 16th century. It is characterized by its use of arias, recitatives, and choruses, as well as its use of the orchestra and chorus to create a dramatic effect. Italian Opera is often associated with grandiose and passionate performances, and is often seen as a representation of Italian culture and history. It is also known for its use of elaborate costumes and sets, as well as its use of elaborate vocal techniques.

name: Baroque Ensemble
description: The Baroque Ensemble music genre is a style of classical music that originated in the 17th century. It is characterized by its ornate and complex musical structures, often featuring multiple instruments and vocalists. The music is often highly ornamented and often includes counterpoint, fugues, and other contrapuntal techniques. It is often performed by small ensembles, such as string quartets, and is often accompanied by a harpsichord or other keyboard instrument.

name: Baroque Singing
description: Baroque singing is a style of vocal music that originated in the late 16th century and was popular throughout the 17th and 18th centuries. It is characterized by its ornate, complex melodic lines and its use of ornamentation. Baroque singing is often performed with a small ensemble of instruments, such as a harpsichord, lute, or theorbo. The vocal style is typically lyrical and expressive, with a wide range of dynamics and ornamentation. Baroque singing is often associated with the works of composers such as Bach, Handel, and Vivaldi.

name: Canzone D'Autore
description: Canzone D'Autore is an Italian music genre that focuses on the lyrics and the story behind the song. It is a form of singer-songwriter music that is often characterized by its poetic lyrics and melodic instrumentation. The genre is often associated with the Italian singer-songwriter tradition, and is often seen as a more sophisticated and mature form of Italian popular music. It is often seen as a bridge between traditional Italian folk music and modern pop music.

name: Canzone Genovese
description: The Canzone Genovese is a traditional music genre from the Italian city of Genoa. It is a type of folk music that is characterized by its upbeat, cheerful melodies and lyrics that often tell stories of love, family, and life in the city. The genre is usually performed with an acoustic guitar, mandolin, and accordion, and is often accompanied by a chorus of singers. The Canzone Genovese is a popular genre in Italy and is often performed at festivals and other events.

name: Italian Indie Pop
description: Italian Indie Pop is a genre of music that combines elements of indie rock, pop, and Italian folk music. It is characterized by its upbeat, melodic sound and often features acoustic guitars, synthesizers, and electronic drums. The lyrics are often in Italian and the music often has a dreamy, romantic feel. It is often seen as a more accessible version of the Italian indie rock scene.

name: Musica Sarda
description: Musica Sarda is a traditional folk music genre from the island of Sardinia, Italy. It is characterized by its use of traditional instruments such as the launeddas (a type of triple clarinet), the tenore (a type of four-part vocal harmony), and the accordion. The music is often accompanied by a dance called the ballu tundu, which is a type of circle dance. Musica Sarda is typically upbeat and lively, and often features lyrics about love, nature, and the island of Sardinia.

name: American 21st Century Classical
description: American 21st Century Classical music is a genre of contemporary classical music that has emerged in the United States since the turn of the 21st century. It is characterized by its use of modern technology, its incorporation of popular music styles, and its exploration of new musical forms. It often features a mix of traditional classical instruments and electronic instruments, and often incorporates elements of jazz, rock, and other popular music styles. It is often experimental in nature, and often incorporates elements of improvisation. It is often characterized by its use of extended techniques, its exploration of new tonal and harmonic possibilities, and its use of unconventional forms and structures.

name: Russian Romance
description: Russian Romance is a genre of music that originated in Russia in the 19th century. It is characterized by its romantic, lyrical, and often melancholic melodies. It is often performed by a solo singer accompanied by a piano or orchestra. The lyrics of Russian Romance songs often focus on themes of love, longing, and nostalgia. The genre has been popularized by Russian singers such as Alla Pugacheva, Valery Leontiev, and Lyudmila Zykina.

name: English Baroque
description: English Baroque music is a style of music that emerged in England during the late 17th and early 18th centuries. It is characterized by its grandiose, ornate, and often complex musical structures. It is heavily influenced by the Italian Baroque style, but also incorporates elements of the French Baroque and German Baroque styles. English Baroque music is often characterized by its use of counterpoint, fugues, and complex harmonic progressions. It is also known for its use of the harpsichord, organ, and other keyboard instruments. English Baroque composers include Henry Purcell, George Frideric Handel, and John Blow.

name: Barockinterpreten
description: Barockinterpreten is a genre of classical music that focuses on the interpretation of Baroque music. It is characterized by its use of historically informed performance practices, such as ornamentation, improvisation, and the use of period instruments. The genre is often associated with the works of composers such as Johann Sebastian Bach, George Frideric Handel, Antonio Vivaldi, and Claudio Monteverdi. Barockinterpreten performances often feature a combination of solo and ensemble playing, and may include vocalists, instrumentalists, and dancers.

name: Classical Oboe
description: Classical Oboe music is a genre of classical music that features the oboe as the primary instrument. It includes works from the Baroque, Classical, and Romantic eras, as well as modern compositions. The genre is characterized by its melodic and lyrical qualities, as well as its use of ornamentation and virtuosic technique. It often features solo oboe pieces, as well as works for oboe and orchestra.

name: Hungarian Classical Performance
description: The Hungarian Classical Performance music genre is a style of classical music that originated in Hungary in the 19th century. It is characterized by its use of folk melodies, often with a strong emphasis on the violin, and its use of the cimbalom, a traditional Hungarian instrument. The genre is often seen as a combination of the classical and folk music of Hungary, and is often performed with a full orchestra. It is often seen as a representation of Hungarian culture and identity.

name: Musique Ancienne
description: Musique Ancienne (or Early Music) is a genre of music that encompasses music composed and performed prior to the Classical period (generally before 1750). It includes music from the Medieval, Renaissance, and Baroque eras, as well as some music from the Classical period. It is typically performed on period instruments, such as lutes, viols, and harpsichords, and often features vocalists singing in Latin or other languages of the time. Musique Ancienne is often characterized by its intricate polyphony and complex rhythms.

name: British Blues
description: British Blues is a style of blues music that originated in the United Kingdom in the 1960s. It is characterized by a combination of traditional blues styles with elements of British rock and roll, folk, and jazz. British Blues is often seen as a precursor to the British Invasion of the 1960s, as it helped to popularize blues music in the UK. British Blues musicians often used electric guitars, drums, and bass, as well as traditional blues instruments such as the harmonica and slide guitar. British Blues is known for its heavy, driving rhythms and often features extended guitar solos. Notable British Blues musicians include Eric Clapton, John Mayall, and Alexis Korner.

name: Czech Classical
description: Czech Classical music is a genre of classical music that originated in the Czech Republic in the 19th century. It is characterized by its use of folk elements, such as folk melodies, rhythms, and instrumentation, as well as its use of traditional forms, such as the symphony, concerto, and sonata. It is often considered to be a part of the larger Central European classical tradition, and is closely related to the music of other Central European countries, such as Austria, Hungary, and Poland. Notable Czech Classical composers include Bedřich Smetana, Antonín Dvořák, and Leoš Janáček.

name: Classical Clarinet
description: Classical Clarinet music is a genre of music that focuses on the sound of the clarinet as a solo instrument. It is typically written in a classical style, often featuring intricate melodies and complex harmonies. It can range from Baroque to modern compositions, and often includes works from the Romantic period. It is often performed by professional clarinetists, and can be heard in concert halls, recitals, and chamber music performances.

name: Historic Orchestral Performance
description: Historic Orchestral Performance is a genre of classical music that focuses on the performance of orchestral works from the past. This genre includes works from the Baroque, Classical, Romantic, and Modern eras, as well as works from the 20th and 21st centuries. It is characterized by its use of traditional instruments, such as strings, woodwinds, brass, and percussion, as well as its adherence to the original scores and performance practices of the time. Historic Orchestral Performance is often performed in a concert hall setting, and is often used to recreate the sound of a particular era or composer.

name: French Romanticism
description: French Romanticism is a style of music that emerged in the early 19th century and is characterized by its expressive melodies, lush harmonies, and a focus on emotion and atmosphere. It is often associated with the works of composers such as Hector Berlioz, Franz Liszt, and Claude Debussy. French Romanticism is known for its use of chromaticism, modal harmony, and extended tonal structures, as well as its use of the orchestra to create a sense of grandeur and drama. It is also known for its use of programmatic elements, such as the use of descriptive titles and the incorporation of literary and visual elements into the music.

name: American Modern Classical
description: American Modern Classical music is a genre of music that combines elements of traditional classical music with modern American influences. It is often characterized by its use of dissonance, extended techniques, and a focus on timbre and texture. It often incorporates elements of jazz, minimalism, and experimental music, as well as traditional classical forms. It is often seen as a reaction to the traditionalism of the classical music world, and is often seen as a way to bring classical music into the modern era.

name: Cancion Melodica
description: Cancion Melodica is a genre of Latin music that is characterized by its melodic and romantic sound. It is often referred to as "romantic music" and is popular in Latin America, Spain, and other Spanish-speaking countries. It typically features a combination of acoustic instruments such as guitars, pianos, and violins, as well as electronic instruments such as synthesizers and drum machines. The lyrics of Cancion Melodica songs are often romantic and sentimental in nature, and the melodies are often slow and gentle.

name: Mariachi
description: Mariachi is a traditional style of Mexican music that originated in the state of Jalisco in the 19th century. It is typically performed by a small ensemble of musicians, usually wearing traditional charro outfits, and playing a variety of instruments including guitars, violins, trumpets, and vihuelas. The music is characterized by its upbeat, festive sound, and often features lyrics about love, patriotism, and other topics. Mariachi is often associated with celebrations such as weddings, birthdays, and religious festivals.

name: Ranchera
description: Ranchera is a popular Mexican music genre that originated in the early 20th century. It is characterized by its romantic lyrics, passionate vocals, and traditional Mexican instruments such as the guitar, vihuela, and accordion. Ranchera music is often associated with the mariachi style of music, and is often performed at weddings, festivals, and other celebrations. It is a popular genre of music in Mexico and Latin America, and has been covered by many international artists.

name: Regional Mexican
description: Regional Mexican music is a genre of Mexican music that originated in the early 20th century. It is a mix of traditional Mexican music, such as mariachi, norteño, and ranchera, as well as more modern styles such as cumbia, banda, and duranguense. Regional Mexican music is popular throughout Mexico and the United States, and is often heard in Latin American countries. It is characterized by its upbeat rhythms and lyrics that often tell stories of love, heartbreak, and nostalgia. Regional Mexican music is often accompanied by traditional instruments such as the guitar, accordion, and violin.

name: Baltic Classical
description: The Baltic Classical music genre is a style of classical music that originated in the Baltic region of Europe. It is characterized by its use of traditional folk melodies, often with a strong emphasis on the use of the minor key. It is often performed with a combination of strings, woodwinds, and brass instruments, and often features a soloist or small ensemble. The style is often seen as a bridge between the traditional folk music of the region and the more formal classical music of the rest of Europe.

name: Italian Soprano
description: Italian Soprano is a genre of classical music that features the voice of a female soprano singing in the Italian language. It is characterized by its lyrical, expressive melodies and its use of vibrato. It is often associated with the operatic repertoire of the 19th and early 20th centuries, and is often performed in a traditional operatic style. It is also sometimes referred to as "Bel Canto" or "Bel Cantare" (beautiful singing).

name: Contrabass
description: Contrabass is a genre of music that focuses on the use of the double bass as the main instrument. It is often characterized by its low, deep tones and its ability to provide a strong rhythmic foundation for other instruments. It is often used in jazz, classical, and folk music, as well as in other genres such as rock and pop. It is also used in film scores and soundtracks.

name: Brazilian Classical Piano
description: Brazilian Classical Piano is a genre of music that combines elements of classical music with the rhythms and melodies of Brazilian music. It is characterized by its use of traditional Brazilian instruments such as the cavaquinho, pandeiro, and berimbau, as well as classical instruments such as the piano, strings, and woodwinds. The genre is often characterized by its use of syncopated rhythms, improvisation, and melodic ornamentation. It is often performed in a solo piano setting, but can also be performed with a full orchestra. Brazilian Classical Piano is a popular genre in Brazil and is often used in film scores, television shows, and other media.

name: Jazz Double Bass
description: Jazz Double Bass is a genre of jazz music that focuses on the double bass as the primary instrument. It is characterized by a strong, driving rhythm section, often featuring walking bass lines and complex harmonic structures. The double bass is used to provide a melodic and harmonic foundation for the other instruments in the ensemble, as well as to provide a rhythmic pulse. Jazz Double Bass often features improvisation and soloing, as well as a variety of musical styles, including swing, bebop, and Latin jazz.

name: West African Jazz
description: West African Jazz is a genre of music that combines traditional West African rhythms and melodies with jazz improvisation. It is characterized by its use of polyrhythms, improvisation, and a wide range of instruments, including drums, bass, guitar, saxophone, and keyboards. The genre is heavily influenced by traditional African music, as well as jazz, funk, and soul. West African Jazz is often seen as a bridge between African and Western musical styles, and is popular in many parts of the world.

name: Balkan Brass
description: Balkan Brass is a style of music originating from the Balkans region of Eastern Europe. It is a mix of traditional Balkan folk music and modern brass band music, and is characterized by its fast tempo, energetic rhythms, and improvisation. It is often played by large brass bands, and is popular at festivals and weddings. The music is often accompanied by traditional Balkan dances, such as the kolo.

name: Turkish Modern Jazz
description: Turkish Modern Jazz is a genre of jazz music that combines traditional Turkish music with modern jazz elements. It is characterized by its use of traditional Turkish instruments such as the oud, kanun, and darbuka, as well as modern jazz instruments like the saxophone, trumpet, and piano. It often features improvisation and complex rhythms, and is heavily influenced by the traditional music of the Middle East and North Africa. Turkish Modern Jazz has been popularized by artists such as Burhan Öçal, Erkan Oğur, and Omar Faruk Tekbilek.

name: Chamber Choir
description: Chamber Choir is a type of choral music that is performed by a small group of singers, usually between 8 and 16 voices. It is characterized by its intimate sound and its focus on blending the voices together to create a unified sound. Chamber Choir music is often performed a cappella, without accompaniment, and often features intricate harmonies and complex rhythms. It is often performed in a more intimate setting than larger choral ensembles, such as a church or a small concert hall.

name: Contemporary Choir
description: Contemporary Choir is a genre of music that combines traditional choral singing with modern musical styles. It typically features a large choir of singers, often accompanied by a band or orchestra, and is often performed in churches or other religious settings. Contemporary Choir music often incorporates elements of popular music, such as rock, pop, jazz, and hip-hop, as well as classical and folk music. It is often characterized by its uplifting and inspirational sound.

name: Danish Choir
description: The Danish Choir music genre is a type of choral music that originated in Denmark. It is characterized by its use of traditional Danish folk songs and hymns, as well as classical and contemporary compositions. The genre is often performed by large choirs, with a focus on vocal harmony and blending. The music is often accompanied by instruments such as the organ, piano, and strings. The genre is often used in religious services, as well as in concerts and other performances.

name: Italian Renaissance
description: Italian Renaissance music is a style of music that was popular during the Renaissance period in Italy, from the late 15th century to the early 17th century. It is characterized by its polyphonic texture, with multiple voices singing in harmony, and its use of imitation and counterpoint. It is also known for its use of homophonic texture, with a single melody line accompanied by chords. Instruments used in Italian Renaissance music include the lute, harpsichord, organ, and viola da gamba. The music of the period was often used in religious settings, and was heavily influenced by the works of composers such as Palestrina, Monteverdi, and Gabrieli.

name: Impressionism
description: Impressionism is a musical style that emerged in the late 19th century and is characterized by its use of subtle, often dream-like harmonies, its focus on atmosphere and mood, and its use of non-traditional musical forms. It is often associated with the works of French composers such as Claude Debussy and Maurice Ravel, who sought to create music that evoked a sense of atmosphere and emotion. Impressionist music often features a wide range of tonal colors, and often utilizes extended chords and chromaticism. It is often characterized by its use of non-traditional instrumentation, such as the use of the celesta, harp, and flute.

name: Spanish Jazz
description: Spanish Jazz is a genre of music that combines traditional Spanish music with jazz elements. It is characterized by its use of flamenco rhythms, Latin American rhythms, and improvisation. It often features a combination of acoustic and electric instruments, including guitars, bass, drums, and percussion. Spanish Jazz often incorporates elements of Latin American music, such as salsa, bossa nova, and tango. It is a vibrant and energetic style of music that is popular in Spain and Latin America.

name: Italian Violin
description: Italian Violin is a genre of music that originated in Italy and is characterized by its use of the violin as the main instrument. It is often played in a fast and lively tempo and features intricate melodies and improvisation. It is often accompanied by other instruments such as the mandolin, guitar, and accordion. The genre has been popularized by many Italian composers and performers, including Niccolò Paganini, Antonio Vivaldi, and Giuseppe Tartini.

name: Radio Symphony
description: Radio Symphony is a genre of music that combines elements of classical music with modern electronic production techniques. It is characterized by lush orchestral arrangements, often featuring a full orchestra, combined with electronic elements such as synthesizers, drum machines, and sound effects. The genre is often used in film and television soundtracks, as well as in video game music. Radio Symphony is a relatively new genre, having only emerged in the late 1990s.

name: German Choir
description: The German Choir music genre is a type of choral music that originated in Germany. It is characterized by its use of four-part harmony and its focus on traditional German folk songs and hymns. The genre is often performed by a choir of male and female voices, accompanied by a piano or organ. It is often performed in churches and other religious settings, as well as in concert halls and other public venues.

name: Khaleeji Iraqi
description: Khaleeji Iraqi is a genre of traditional music from Iraq. It is characterized by its use of traditional instruments such as the oud, qanun, and nay, as well as its use of traditional vocal styles. It is often accompanied by a variety of percussion instruments, such as the daf and tabla. The music is typically upbeat and celebratory, and often includes improvisation. It is often used in weddings and other festive occasions.

name: British Modern Classical
description: British Modern Classical is a genre of music that combines elements of classical music with modern influences. It is often characterized by its use of traditional instruments such as strings, woodwinds, and brass, as well as modern electronic instruments. It often features complex and intricate melodies, as well as a wide range of dynamics and textures. It is often seen as a bridge between classical and contemporary music, and is often used in film and television soundtracks.

name: Classical Mezzo-Soprano
description: Classical Mezzo-Soprano is a genre of classical music that features the mezzo-soprano voice as the main vocal range. This genre is characterized by its use of the mezzo-soprano's lower range and its ability to convey emotion and drama. It is often used in operas, oratorios, and other large-scale works. The repertoire of this genre includes works from the Baroque, Classical, and Romantic periods, as well as modern works. It is often performed with a full orchestra or chamber ensemble.

name: Classical Baritone
description: Classical Baritone is a genre of classical music that features the baritone voice as the main instrument. It is characterized by its rich, deep, and powerful sound. It is often used to perform operatic arias, oratorios, and other classical works. It is also used in choral music, and is often featured in musical theater. The baritone range is typically between the tenor and bass ranges, and is often used to provide a strong foundation for the other voices in a choir or ensemble.

name: Madrigal
description: Madrigal music is a form of Renaissance vocal music that originated in Italy during the late 15th century. It is a polyphonic style of music, meaning that it is composed of multiple independent vocal parts. Madrigals are usually written for four to six voices, and are often set to a poem or text in the vernacular language. The music is typically light and lyrical, and often includes intricate counterpoint and imitation between the voices. Madrigals were popular in the 16th and 17th centuries, and were often performed in private homes or at court.

name: Renaissance
description: Renaissance music is a style of European music from the period of the Renaissance, roughly 1400-1600. It is characterized by its use of polyphony, or multiple voices, and its use of imitation, where one voice will imitate the melody of another. It is also known for its use of modal scales, which are scales that are based on the modes of the church. Renaissance music is often seen as the bridge between the medieval and baroque periods of music.

name: Baroque Woodwind
description: Baroque woodwind music is a genre of classical music that originated in the 17th and 18th centuries. It is characterized by its use of woodwind instruments such as the flute, oboe, bassoon, and recorder. The music is often characterized by its ornate and intricate melodies, as well as its use of counterpoint and fugue. It is often used in concertos, sonatas, and other forms of chamber music.

name: Classical Flute
description: Classical Flute music is a genre of music that is typically performed on the flute, a woodwind instrument. It is characterized by its melodic and lyrical qualities, as well as its use of ornamentation and improvisation. Classical Flute music is often associated with the Baroque and Classical periods of music, and is often performed in a chamber music setting. It is also often used in orchestral works, and can be found in a variety of musical styles, from folk to jazz.

name: Poezja Spiewana
description: Poezja Spiewana (Polish for "sung poetry") is a genre of music that combines elements of poetry and song. It originated in Poland in the 1960s and is characterized by its use of poetic lyrics set to music. The lyrics are often written in a poetic form, such as a sonnet or a villanelle, and the music is usually folk-inspired. The genre has been popularized by artists such as Marek Grechuta, Czesław Niemen, and Ewa Demarczyk.

name: Sung Poetry
description: Sung Poetry is a genre of music that combines spoken word poetry with musical accompaniment. It is often characterized by its use of poetic lyrics, often with a narrative or story-telling element, and its use of musical elements such as rhythm, melody, and harmony. The genre has its roots in folk music, but has been adapted to a variety of styles, including jazz, blues, and rock. Sung Poetry is often used to express personal feelings and emotions, and to tell stories. It is often used to explore social and political issues, and to create a sense of community.

name: Classic Girl Group
description: The Classic Girl Group genre is a style of popular music that originated in the 1950s and 1960s. It is characterized by a vocal harmony style featuring three or more female singers singing in unison. The genre is often associated with upbeat, catchy melodies and lyrics that focus on themes of love, relationships, and teenage life. Classic Girl Group songs often feature a call-and-response structure, with the lead singer singing a line and the other singers responding with a phrase or chorus. The genre is also known for its use of handclaps, finger snaps, and other percussive elements. Classic Girl Group songs are often credited with helping to shape the sound of modern pop music.

name: Vocal Harmony Group
description: Vocal harmony group music is a genre of music that features multiple singers singing in harmony with each other. This type of music is often characterized by its intricate harmonies and tight vocal arrangements. It is often performed by a group of singers, usually three to five people, who sing in unison or in harmony with each other. This genre of music is often used in a cappella performances, as well as in musical theater and film soundtracks.

name: Italian Baroque Ensemble
description: The Italian Baroque Ensemble is a genre of music that originated in Italy during the Baroque period (1600-1750). It is characterized by its use of instruments such as the harpsichord, lute, viola da gamba, and organ, as well as its use of polyphonic textures and contrapuntal writing. The music is often characterized by its ornate and elaborate ornamentation, as well as its use of improvisation and ornamentation. It is often performed in a chamber setting, with a small group of musicians playing together.

name: Klezmer
description: Klezmer is a genre of traditional Jewish music that originated in Eastern Europe. It is characterized by its lively, upbeat rhythms and its use of traditional instruments such as the clarinet, violin, accordion, and tsimbl (a type of hammered dulcimer). Klezmer music is often used to accompany Jewish weddings and other celebrations, and is often played in a celebratory, improvisational style.

name: Rai
description: Rai is a popular Algerian music genre that originated in the 1920s. It is a mix of traditional Algerian folk music, Arabic music, and Western influences. It is characterized by its use of electric instruments, synthesizers, and drum machines, as well as its use of poetic lyrics. Rai is often associated with the Algerian diaspora, and is popular in North Africa, the Middle East, and Europe.

name: Classic Venezuelan Pop
description: Classic Venezuelan Pop is a genre of music that originated in Venezuela in the 1950s and 1960s. It is characterized by its upbeat rhythms, catchy melodies, and romantic lyrics. It is often performed with traditional instruments such as the cuatro, maracas, and tambora. Classic Venezuelan Pop is a popular genre of music in Venezuela and is often used in celebrations and festivals. It is also popular in other Latin American countries.

name: Nueva Cancion
description: Nueva Cancion is a genre of Latin American music that emerged in the 1960s and 1970s. It is characterized by its socially conscious lyrics, often focusing on issues of social justice, human rights, and political struggle. Musically, it is a fusion of traditional Latin American folk music with elements of rock, jazz, and other genres. It is often performed with acoustic instruments such as guitars, charangos, and quenas. It is a popular genre in Latin America and has been influential in the development of other genres such as nuevo tango and Latin rock.

name: Trova
description: Trova is a traditional Cuban music genre that originated in the 19th century. It is a style of music that combines elements of Spanish and African music, and is characterized by its romantic lyrics and slow, melancholic melodies. The lyrics often tell stories of love, loss, and longing, and the music is usually performed by a solo singer accompanied by a guitar. Trova is still popular in Cuba today, and is often performed in public squares and parks.

name: Avant-Garde
description: Avant-Garde music is a genre of experimental music that pushes the boundaries of traditional music and often incorporates elements of noise, improvisation, and unconventional instrumentation. It is often characterized by its avant-garde approach to composition, which often involves the use of unconventional techniques and sounds. Avant-Garde music often challenges the listener to think outside the box and explore new sonic possibilities.

name: Russian Contemporary Classical
description: Russian Contemporary Classical music is a genre of classical music that emerged in the late 20th century and is still evolving today. It is characterized by its use of modern techniques and instruments, as well as its incorporation of elements from other genres such as jazz, folk, and rock. It often features a mix of traditional Russian folk music and modern classical music, and is often performed by ensembles of both Russian and international musicians. It is often seen as a bridge between the traditional and the modern, and is a reflection of the changing cultural landscape of Russia.

name: Caucasian Classical
description: Caucasian Classical music is a genre of traditional music from the Caucasus region of Eurasia. It is characterized by its use of traditional instruments such as the tar, duduk, and balaban, as well as its use of polyphonic singing. It is often characterized by its use of modal scales and its improvisational nature. It is often used in folk dances and rituals, and is often seen as a representation of the culture and history of the region.

name: Ghent Indie
description: Ghent Indie is a genre of music that originated in the city of Ghent, Belgium. It is a mix of indie rock, post-punk, and alternative rock, with a strong emphasis on melody and atmosphere. The genre is characterized by its use of reverb-heavy guitars, driving bass lines, and dreamy vocals. It often features a mix of both electronic and acoustic instruments, and is often described as having a "hazy" or "dreamy" sound. Ghent Indie is often associated with the city's vibrant music scene, and is often seen as a reflection of the city's unique culture.

name: OK Indie
description: OK Indie is a genre of music that combines elements of indie rock, pop, and alternative music. It is characterized by its upbeat, melodic sound and often features catchy hooks and sing-along choruses. The genre is often associated with bands such as Vampire Weekend, The Strokes, and The Shins. It is a relatively new genre, having emerged in the early 2000s, and is often seen as a more accessible version of indie rock.

name: Philly Indie
description: Philly Indie is a genre of music that originated in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. It is a blend of indie rock, punk, and hip-hop, with a focus on DIY production and DIY promotion. It is characterized by its raw, lo-fi sound, often featuring distorted guitars, heavy drums, and samples. It is often lyrically driven, with themes of social justice, mental health, and personal growth. Philly Indie is often associated with the city's vibrant DIY music scene, which has produced a number of notable acts such as The War on Drugs, Hop Along, and The Districts.

name: American Primitive
description: American Primitive is a style of acoustic guitar music that emerged in the late 1960s and early 1970s. It is characterized by its use of open tunings, fingerpicking, and a focus on melody and improvisation. It is often associated with the folk revival of the 1960s and 1970s, and is heavily influenced by blues, ragtime, and Appalachian music. It is often seen as a precursor to the New Age and Americana genres.

name: Drone Folk
description: Drone Folk is a genre of music that combines elements of folk music with drone music. It typically features acoustic instruments such as guitars, banjos, and mandolins, as well as drones created with synthesizers, samplers, and other electronic instruments. Drone Folk often has a slow, hypnotic feel, with repetitive melodies and minimalistic arrangements. The genre has been described as a combination of traditional folk music and ambient music, and is often used to create a dreamy, ethereal atmosphere.

name: Pop Ambient
description: Pop Ambient is a subgenre of ambient music that combines elements of traditional ambient music with elements of pop music. It is characterized by its use of melodic and harmonic elements, often with a focus on creating a dreamy, ethereal atmosphere. Pop Ambient typically features lush, atmospheric soundscapes, often with a slow tempo and minimalistic instrumentation. It often incorporates elements of electronic music, such as synthesizers and drum machines, as well as acoustic instruments like piano and strings. Pop Ambient is often used in film and television soundtracks, as well as in video games and other media.

name: Canadian House
description: Canadian House is a genre of electronic dance music that originated in Canada in the late 1990s. It is characterized by its use of synthesizers, drum machines, and samples, as well as its incorporation of elements from other genres such as hip hop, funk, and soul. Canadian House is often characterized by its upbeat, energetic sound, and its focus on creating a party atmosphere. It is often seen as a more accessible version of the more underground genres of house music, such as tech house and deep house.

name: Warm Drone
description: Warm Drone is a genre of ambient music that combines elements of drone music with warm, melodic textures. It is characterized by its slow, hypnotic rhythms and its use of drones, pads, and other soundscapes to create a dreamy, ethereal atmosphere. The genre often incorporates elements of classical, jazz, and world music, as well as field recordings and found sounds. Warm Drone is often used to create a calming, meditative atmosphere, and is often used in film and television soundtracks.

name: Armenian Folk
description: Armenian Folk music is a traditional genre of music that has been passed down through generations of Armenians. It is characterized by its use of traditional instruments such as the duduk, zurna, and dhol, as well as its use of vocal harmonies and improvisation. It is often accompanied by traditional dances such as the kochari and the yarkhushta. Armenian Folk music is often used to tell stories and express emotions, and is often used in celebrations and ceremonies.

name: Russian Folk Metal
description: Russian Folk Metal is a subgenre of heavy metal music that combines traditional Russian folk music with heavy metal instrumentation. It typically features traditional Russian instruments such as the balalaika, gusli, and zhaleika, as well as traditional Russian singing styles. The lyrics often focus on Russian history, mythology, and folklore. The genre has become increasingly popular in recent years, with bands such as Arkona, Alkonost, and Butterfly Temple gaining international recognition.

name: Russian Metal
description: Russian Metal is a subgenre of heavy metal music that originated in Russia in the late 1980s. It is characterized by a mix of traditional heavy metal, thrash metal, and folk music elements. The lyrics often focus on Russian history, culture, and mythology, and the music often features traditional Russian instruments such as balalaikas and accordions. Russian Metal bands often incorporate traditional Russian folk songs into their music, and some bands even sing in Russian.

name: Jazz Tuba
description: Jazz Tuba is a genre of jazz music that features the tuba as the lead instrument. It is a unique blend of jazz, classical, and traditional music styles, and is often characterized by a strong, driving rhythm section and a melodic, improvisational soloing style. Jazz Tuba is often performed in small ensembles, featuring a tuba, a rhythm section, and a few horns. The music is often upbeat and energetic, and can range from traditional jazz standards to more modern, experimental compositions.

name: Alternative Americana
description: Alternative Americana is a genre of music that combines elements of traditional Americana music with alternative rock, folk, and country. It often features acoustic instruments, such as banjos, mandolins, and acoustic guitars, as well as electric guitars, drums, and bass. The lyrics often focus on themes of love, loss, and nostalgia, and the music often has a melancholic, introspective feel. Artists in this genre include Wilco, Ryan Adams, and The Avett Brothers.

name: Gothic Americana
description: Gothic Americana is a genre of music that combines elements of traditional Americana music with dark, gothic themes. It often features acoustic instruments such as banjos, mandolins, and acoustic guitars, as well as electric guitars, drums, and bass. The lyrics often focus on dark themes such as death, loss, and despair. The music is often slow and melancholic, and can be both haunting and beautiful.

name: French Contemporary Classical
description: French Contemporary Classical music is a genre of classical music that emerged in the late 20th century. It is characterized by its use of modern techniques and instruments, as well as its incorporation of elements from other genres such as jazz, rock, and world music. It is often characterized by its use of extended techniques, improvisation, and electronic sounds. It is often seen as a reaction to the traditionalism of the French classical music tradition. French Contemporary Classical music is often seen as a bridge between the traditional and the modern, and is often seen as a way to bring classical music to a wider audience.

name: Sound Art
description: Sound Art is a genre of experimental music that combines elements of sound, technology, and visual art. It is often created using a variety of sound sources, including field recordings, found sounds, and synthesizers. Sound Art often explores the relationship between sound and space, and can be used to create immersive sonic environments. It is often used in installations, performances, and multimedia works.

name: Norske Viser
description: Norske Viser is a traditional Norwegian folk music genre that dates back to the 19th century. It is characterized by its simple, melodic tunes and lyrics that often tell stories of love, nature, and everyday life. The music is usually performed with a fiddle, accordion, and guitar, and is often accompanied by singing. Norske Viser is a beloved genre in Norway, and is still performed and enjoyed today.

name: Nordnorsk Musikk
description: Nordnorsk Musikk is a genre of traditional Norwegian folk music from the northern regions of Norway. It is characterized by its use of traditional instruments such as the Hardanger fiddle, the langeleik, and the bukkehorn, as well as its use of traditional vocal styles. It is often performed in a lively and upbeat manner, and is often accompanied by dancing. Nordnorsk Musikk is an important part of Norwegian culture and is still performed in many parts of the country today.

name: Acousmatic
description: Acousmatic music is a genre of electronic music that is composed and performed using only recorded sounds. It is typically created by manipulating and combining sounds from a variety of sources, such as field recordings, synthesizers, and found objects. Acousmatic music is often abstract and experimental in nature, and is often used in film, television, and multimedia projects.

name: Free Improvisation
description: Free improvisation is a genre of music that is created spontaneously and without any predetermined structure or plan. It is often characterized by a lack of traditional musical elements such as harmony, melody, and rhythm, and instead relies on the creative interplay between the musicians to create a unique sound. Free improvisation is often associated with jazz, but can also be found in other genres such as classical, folk, and experimental music.

name: Musique Concrete
description: Musique Concrete is a genre of experimental music that emerged in the 1950s. It is characterized by the use of recorded sounds, often manipulated and combined to create new sonic textures. These sounds can be sourced from any type of sound, including natural sounds, field recordings, and electronically generated sounds. Musique Concrete is often used to create soundscapes, sound collages, and other abstract sound pieces. It is a form of avant-garde music that has been influential in the development of many other genres, including electronic music, ambient music, and hip-hop.

name: Free Folk
description: Free Folk is a genre of music that is rooted in traditional folk music, but with a modern twist. It is often characterized by its use of acoustic instruments, such as guitars, banjos, and mandolins, as well as its incorporation of elements from other genres, such as jazz, blues, and rock. Free Folk is often seen as a more experimental and improvisational form of folk music, and is often used to explore themes of social and political issues. It is often seen as a more accessible form of folk music, as it is often more accessible to a wider range of listeners.

name: One-Person Band
description: The One-Person Band music genre is a style of music that is performed by a single musician who plays multiple instruments simultaneously. This style of music is often associated with street performers, buskers, and folk musicians. The musician typically plays a combination of drums, guitar, harmonica, and other instruments, often using a variety of techniques such as looping and overdubbing to create a full sound. The One-Person Band genre is often characterized by its DIY aesthetic and its use of improvisation.

name: Underground Power Pop
description: Underground Power Pop is a genre of music that combines elements of power pop, punk, and alternative rock. It is characterized by its upbeat, melodic sound, often featuring distorted guitars, driving rhythms, and catchy hooks. The lyrics often focus on themes of teenage angst, rebellion, and love. It is often seen as a more underground, DIY version of power pop, and is often associated with the punk and indie rock scenes.

name: Pop Quebecois
description: Pop Quebecois is a genre of popular music originating in Quebec, Canada. It is a blend of traditional French-Canadian folk music, rock, and pop music. It is characterized by its use of traditional instruments such as the fiddle, accordion, and harmonica, as well as its incorporation of elements of French-Canadian culture. It is often sung in French, and its lyrics often focus on themes of love, family, and nostalgia. Popular artists in the genre include Celine Dion, Garou, and Les Cowboys Fringants.

name: Isle Of Wight Indie
description: The Isle of Wight Indie music genre is a style of music that originated on the Isle of Wight, a small island off the south coast of England. It is a mix of indie rock, folk, and pop, with a strong emphasis on melody and harmony. The genre is characterized by its upbeat, catchy melodies, often featuring acoustic guitars, keyboards, and drums. It is often described as having a "summery" sound, with a relaxed, laid-back feel. The genre has been popularized by bands such as The Bees, The Levellers, and The Wombats.

name: Swiss Indie
description: Swiss Indie is a genre of music that originated in Switzerland in the late 1990s. It is characterized by its use of electronic instruments, often combined with traditional Swiss folk instruments, and its incorporation of elements from various other genres, such as rock, pop, and jazz. Swiss Indie is often characterized by its upbeat, melodic sound, and its focus on creating a unique and distinct sound. It is often seen as a more experimental and creative form of music, and is often seen as a way to express the unique culture of Switzerland.

name: Early Avant Garde
description: Early Avant Garde music is a genre of experimental music that emerged in the early 20th century. It is characterized by its use of unconventional and often dissonant harmonies, extended techniques, and a focus on timbre and texture rather than traditional melodic and harmonic structures. It often incorporates elements of other genres such as jazz, classical, and folk music, as well as elements of chance and improvisation. Early Avant Garde composers such as Arnold Schoenberg, Igor Stravinsky, and John Cage are considered pioneers of the genre.

name: African-American Classical
description: African-American Classical music is a genre of music that combines elements of classical music with African-American musical styles such as jazz, blues, and gospel. It is a unique blend of classical music and African-American musical traditions, and is often characterized by its use of improvisation, syncopation, and polyrhythms. African-American Classical music is often performed by ensembles that include both classical and African-American instruments, such as the piano, violin, cello, saxophone, and drums. It is a genre that has been embraced by both classical and African-American audiences, and is often seen as a bridge between the two genres.

name: Japanese Electronic
description: Japanese Electronic music is a genre of electronic music that originated in Japan in the late 1980s. It is characterized by its use of synthesizers, drum machines, and other electronic instruments, as well as its incorporation of traditional Japanese musical elements such as taiko drums, shamisen, and koto. It is often characterized by its upbeat, melodic sound and its use of sampling and looping techniques. It has been heavily influenced by genres such as techno, house, and trance, and has spawned a number of subgenres such as J-pop, J-core, and J-trance.

name: Japanese House
description: Japanese House is a genre of electronic music that originated in Japan in the late 1990s. It is characterized by its dreamy, ethereal soundscapes, often featuring heavily processed vocals, synthesizers, and drum machines. The genre is heavily influenced by shoegaze, dream pop, and ambient music, and often incorporates elements of traditional Japanese music such as taiko drums and koto. Japanese House is often seen as a more experimental and abstract form of electronic music, and is often used in film and television soundtracks.

name: Brazilian Boogie
description: Brazilian Boogie is a genre of music that originated in Brazil in the late 1970s and early 1980s. It is a blend of funk, soul, disco, and Brazilian rhythms such as samba and bossa nova. It is characterized by its upbeat, danceable rhythms and its use of synthesizers and electric guitars. It is often seen as a precursor to the more modern Brazilian genres of funk carioca and axé.

name: San Diego Indie
description: San Diego Indie is a genre of music that is rooted in the independent music scene of San Diego, California. It is characterized by its eclectic mix of styles, ranging from folk, rock, punk, and hip-hop. It is often characterized by its DIY approach to production and promotion, as well as its focus on local artists. San Diego Indie is often seen as a more laid-back and relaxed version of the indie music scene, with a focus on creating music that is both creative and accessible.

name: Proto-Techno
description: Proto-Techno is a genre of electronic music that emerged in the late 1980s and early 1990s. It is characterized by its use of synthesizers, drum machines, and sequencers to create a sound that is both futuristic and retro. It is often seen as a precursor to the more popular techno genre, and is often characterized by its use of repetitive, hypnotic rhythms and minimalistic melodies. Proto-Techno is often seen as a bridge between the early electronic music of the 1970s and the more modern techno of the 1990s.

name: Australian Reggae Fusion
description: Australian Reggae Fusion is a genre of music that combines elements of reggae, ska, dub, and other Caribbean-influenced genres with elements of rock, pop, and other contemporary styles. It is a unique blend of styles that has been developed in Australia over the past few decades. The genre is characterized by its upbeat rhythms, catchy melodies, and positive vibes. It is often seen as a way to bring together different cultures and styles, and is popular among both young and old audiences.

name: Jazz Vibraphone
description: Jazz Vibraphone is a genre of jazz music that features the vibraphone as the primary instrument. It is characterized by a light, airy sound, often with a swinging, syncopated rhythm. The vibraphone is used to create melodic lines, as well as to provide a percussive accompaniment to the other instruments in the ensemble. Jazz Vibraphone is often played in a small group setting, with the vibraphone taking the lead role. It is a popular style of jazz music, and has been performed by many renowned jazz musicians, including Lionel Hampton, Milt Jackson, and Bobby Hutcherson.

name: Modern Chamber Music
description: Modern Chamber Music is a genre of classical music that is characterized by its use of small ensembles of instruments, often including strings, woodwinds, brass, and percussion. It is typically written for a small group of performers, usually between two and eight musicians, and often features a combination of traditional and modern instruments. The music is often characterized by its use of complex rhythms, intricate counterpoint, and extended techniques. It is often seen as a bridge between traditional classical music and more modern styles such as jazz and rock.

name: Hangpan
description: Hangpan is a genre of music that originated in the Philippines. It is a fusion of traditional Filipino folk music and modern electronic music. The genre is characterized by its use of traditional instruments such as the kulintang, gong, and agung, as well as modern electronic instruments such as synthesizers and drum machines. Hangpan is often upbeat and energetic, and its lyrics often focus on themes of love, friendship, and social justice.

name: French Folk Pop
description: French Folk Pop is a genre of music that combines traditional French folk music with modern pop music. It typically features acoustic instruments such as the accordion, fiddle, and guitar, as well as electronic elements like synthesizers and drum machines. The lyrics are often in French, and the melodies are often inspired by traditional French folk music. name: Experimental Guitar
description: Experimental Guitar is a genre of music that focuses on the exploration of the sonic possibilities of the guitar. It is often characterized by the use of extended techniques such as alternate tunings, prepared guitars, and the use of effects pedals. It can range from ambient soundscapes to more aggressive and distorted sounds. Experimental Guitarists often use a variety of techniques to create unique and interesting sounds, such as looping, sampling, and live processing.

name: Tzadik
description: Tzadik is a genre of Jewish music that combines traditional Jewish melodies with modern musical styles. It is often characterized by a combination of traditional Jewish instruments such as the violin, clarinet, and accordion, with modern instruments such as electric guitar, drums, and synthesizers. The music is often upbeat and joyful, and often incorporates elements of jazz, rock, and world music. Tzadik is often used in Jewish celebrations and ceremonies, and is a popular genre of music in Israel.

name: Contemporary Classical Piano
description: Contemporary Classical Piano is a genre of music that combines elements of classical music with modern influences. It is often characterized by its use of traditional classical instruments such as the piano, strings, and woodwinds, but with a more modern approach to composition and performance. This genre often incorporates elements of jazz, minimalism, and other modern styles, while still maintaining the structure and form of traditional classical music. Contemporary Classical Piano is often seen as a bridge between the traditional and the modern, and is a popular choice for film and television soundtracks.

name: Downtempo Bass

It is characterized by its relaxed, chilled-out atmosphere and its heavy, low-end basslines. It often features a variety of synthesizers, samples, and drum machines, as well as a variety of vocal samples. name: Desi Pop
description: Desi Pop is a genre of music that combines traditional Indian music with modern pop music. It is a fusion of traditional Indian instruments, such as the sitar, tabla, and harmonium, with modern electronic instruments and production techniques. Desi Pop is often characterized by its upbeat, danceable rhythms and catchy melodies. It is popular in India, Pakistan, and other South Asian countries, as well as in the diaspora.

name: Bhajan
description: Bhajan is a devotional music genre that originated in India. It is typically sung in praise of Hindu deities and is often accompanied by instruments such as the harmonium, tabla, and dholak. Bhajan lyrics often contain spiritual and religious themes, and are often written in Sanskrit, Hindi, or other regional languages. name: Classic Bollywood
description: Classic Bollywood music is a genre of Indian film music that has been popular since the 1940s. It is characterized by its use of traditional Indian instruments, such as the sitar, tabla, and harmonium, as well as its use of classical Indian ragas. It is often accompanied by elaborate choreography and colorful costumes. Classic Bollywood music is often used in Indian films to create a romantic or emotional atmosphere. It is also used to create a sense of nostalgia for the past.

name: Ghazal
description: Ghazal is a form of classical music originating in the Indian subcontinent. It is a poetic form of music that is traditionally sung in Urdu, Hindi, and Persian. Ghazals are typically composed of couplets that are linked thematically and musically. The lyrics often focus on themes of love, longing, and loss. The music is typically accompanied by instruments such as the sitar, tabla, and harmonium. Ghazal is a popular genre of music in South Asia and is often performed at weddings and other special occasions.

name: Bhangra
description: Bhangra is a traditional folk music and dance genre from the Punjab region of India and Pakistan. It is characterized by its upbeat, energetic rhythms and its use of traditional Punjabi instruments such as the dhol, tumbi, and algoza. Bhangra is often performed at weddings and other celebrations, and is a popular form of entertainment in South Asia. Bhangra music has also been incorporated into modern pop music, and is often used in Bollywood films.

name: Punjabi Pop
description: Punjabi Pop is a genre of music that originated in the Punjab region of India and Pakistan. It is a fusion of traditional Punjabi folk music with modern Western pop music. Punjabi Pop is characterized by its upbeat, danceable beats, and its use of traditional Punjabi instruments such as the dhol, tumbi, and sarangi. It is often sung in the Punjabi language, but can also be sung in English, Hindi, and other languages. description: Indian Instrumental music is a genre of music that is based on traditional Indian instruments and melodies. It is often used in film soundtracks, and is often used to create a peaceful and calming atmosphere. It is also used in yoga and meditation classes, as well as in traditional Indian ceremonies.

name: Chutney
description: Chutney is a genre of music that originated in Trinidad and Tobago in the late 19th century. It is a fusion of Indian and African musical styles, and is characterized by its use of Indian instruments such as the dholak, tabla, and harmonium, as well as African percussion instruments. Desi Trap often incorporates elements of hip-hop, rap, and EDM, and is often characterized by its high energy and upbeat tempo. name: Hindi Hip Hop
description: Hindi Hip Hop is a genre of music that combines traditional Indian music with elements of hip hop. name: Swedish Tropical House
description: Swedish Tropical House is a subgenre of EDM that combines elements of tropical house, deep house, and pop music. It is characterized by its bright, upbeat sound, often featuring steel drums, marimbas, and other tropical-sounding instruments. It also often incorporates elements of hip-hop and R&B, as well as Latin and Caribbean influences. The genre was popularized by Swedish producers such as Avicii, Axwell, and Sebastian Ingrosso.

name: Classic Bhangra

It is characterized by its upbeat, energetic rhythms and its use of traditional Punjabi instruments such as the dhol, tumbi, and algoze. It is a fusion of traditional Pakistani folk music with elements of western pop music, such as rock and roll, jazz, and disco. name: Lo-Fi Cover
description: Lo-Fi Cover is a genre of music that takes popular songs and re-imagines them in a lo-fi, stripped-down style. It often features minimal instrumentation, such as acoustic guitar, piano, and/or synthesizers, and is often recorded with a lo-fi aesthetic. The genre is often used to create a nostalgic, dreamy atmosphere, and can be used to create a unique take on a classic song.

It is popular in Latin America, the Caribbean, and the United States. It has become increasingly popular in recent years, with artists such as Daddy Yankee, J Balvin, and Ozuna leading the way.

name: Chicago Indie

name: K-Pop Boy Group
description: K-Pop Boy Group is a genre of music originating from South Korea that is characterized by its catchy melodies, upbeat rhythms, and often complex choreography. K-Pop Boy Groups have become increasingly popular in recent years, with many of them achieving international success.

name: Southern Soul

It is characterized by its strong, soulful vocals, its heavy use of horns, and its funky, danceable rhythms. Southern Soul is often associated with the "deep soul" sound of the 1960s and 1970s, and is often seen as a precursor to modern R&B. It is often seen as a more traditional, roots-based form of soul music, and is often seen as a bridge between the classic soul of the 1960s and the modern R&B of today.

name: Lo-Fi VGM
description: Lo-Fi VGM (Video Game Music) is a genre of music that combines elements of lo-fi hip hop and video game music. It typically features a combination of samples from classic video game soundtracks, often with a laid-back, chill-out vibe. The genre is often characterized by its use of 8-bit and 16-bit sound chips, as well as its incorporation of jazz, funk, and soul elements. Lo-Fi VGM is often used as background music in video games, as well as in streaming services such as Twitch and YouTube.

name: Shiver Pop
description: Shiver Pop is a genre of music that combines elements of indie rock, dream pop, and shoegaze. It is characterized by its dreamy, ethereal soundscapes, often featuring reverb-drenched guitars, shimmering synths, and airy vocals. The genre is often associated with a sense of nostalgia and longing, and its sound is often described as "hazy" and "ethereal".

name: Rap Conscient
description: Rap Conscient is a French hip-hop subgenre that focuses on conscious and socially conscious lyrics. It is characterized by its positive and uplifting messages, often addressing social issues such as poverty, racism, and inequality. The beats are usually upbeat and the lyrics are often poetic and thought-provoking. The genre has been popularized by French rappers such as MC Solaar, IAM, and La Rumeur.

name: Deep Southern Trap
description: Deep Southern Trap is a subgenre of hip hop music that originated in the Southern United States. It is characterized by its heavy use of 808 drums, hi-hats, and synthesizers, as well as its lyrical content which often focuses on topics such as drug use, street life, and violence. It is often associated with the trap music scene in Atlanta, Georgia, and is heavily influenced by Southern hip hop, crunk, and gangsta rap.

name: West End
description: West End is a genre of music that originated in the late 1970s and early 1980s in the West End of London. It is a fusion of soul, funk, disco, and jazz, and is characterized by its upbeat, danceable rhythms and its use of synthesizers and electronic instruments. It is often associated with the London club scene of the time, and is often seen as a precursor to the acid jazz and house music genres.

name: Lullaby
description: Lullaby is a genre of music that is specifically designed to help people relax and fall asleep. It typically features gentle, soothing melodies and rhythms, often with a slow tempo and minimal instrumentation. Lullabies are often used to help babies and young children drift off to sleep, but they can also be used to help adults relax and unwind. Common instruments used in lullaby music include acoustic guitar, piano, strings, and woodwinds.

name: Nursery
description: Nursery music is a genre of music specifically designed for young children. It typically features simple, repetitive melodies and lyrics that are easy to remember and sing along to. Nursery music often includes traditional nursery rhymes, as well as original compositions that are designed to be fun and engaging for young children. The genre is often used in educational settings, such as preschools and daycares, to help children learn and develop.

name: Portuguese Pop

It is characterized by its upbeat, danceable rhythms and catchy melodies. It often features traditional instruments such as the guitar, accordion, and mandolin, as well as modern synthesizers and drum machines. name: Gypsy Punk

It is characterized by its fast tempo, distorted guitars, and often incorporates traditional instruments such as accordions, violins, and mandolins. It is often associated with the Romani people and their culture, and is often seen as a form of protest music.

name: Theme
description: Theme music is a genre of music that is used to accompany a visual medium such as a film, television show, video game, or advertisement. It is typically instrumental and often incorporates recognizable melodies and motifs from the source material. Theme music is often used to create a sense of atmosphere and to establish a mood for the audience. It can also be used to introduce characters or to signify a change in the plot.

name: Baglama
description: Baglama is a traditional Turkish folk music genre that is played on a stringed instrument of the same name. It is a long-necked lute with three strings and a fretted fingerboard. The instrument is usually played with a pick and is used to accompany vocalists or instrumentalists. Baglama music is characterized by its improvisational nature and its use of microtonal intervals. It is often played in a fast tempo and is often accompanied by a davul (drum) and zurna (double-reed wind instrument). Baglama music is popular throughout Turkey and is often used in weddings and other celebrations.

name: Mexican Metal
description: Mexican Metal is a subgenre of heavy metal music that originated in Mexico in the late 1980s. It is characterized by its aggressive sound, often featuring distorted guitars, double bass drumming, and growled vocals. It is heavily influenced by thrash metal, death metal, and black metal, as well as traditional Mexican music. Mexican Metal bands often incorporate traditional Mexican instruments such as the vihuela, guitarron, and jarana into their sound. The genre has become increasingly popular in recent years, with bands such as Brujeria, Maldito, and Here Comes the Kraken gaining international recognition.

name: Ectofolk
description: Ectofolk is a genre of music that combines elements of folk, rock, and electronic music. It typically features acoustic instruments such as guitars, banjos, and mandolins, as well as electronic elements such as synthesizers, drum machines, and samples. The genre is often characterized by its use of unconventional song structures, experimental production techniques, and a wide range of influences from various musical styles. Ectofolk is often seen as a bridge between traditional folk music and modern electronic music.

name: Country Pop

It typically features a mix of acoustic instruments, such as guitars, banjos, and fiddles, with modern production techniques, such as synthesizers, drum machines, and vocal effects. Country Pop often features a strong vocal presence, with lyrics that focus on themes of love, heartbreak, and nostalgia.
