name: Jazz Quartet
description: Jazz Quartet is a style of jazz music that is performed by a small ensemble of four musicians. It typically consists of a double bass, drums, piano, and a lead instrument such as a saxophone, trumpet, or guitar. The music is usually improvised and often includes a combination of swing, bebop, and other jazz styles. Jazz Quartet music is often used in small venues such as clubs, restaurants, and private parties.

name: Modular Synth
description: Modular synth music is a genre of electronic music that is created using modular synthesizers. These synthesizers are composed of individual modules that can be connected together to create complex sounds and textures. Modular synth music is often characterized by its experimental nature, as the modular synthesizers allow for a wide range of sonic possibilities. It is often used in experimental and ambient music, as well as in soundtracks for films and video games.

name: Louisiana Blues
description: Louisiana Blues is a style of blues music that originated in the state of Louisiana in the early 20th century. It is characterized by a mix of African-American and Cajun influences, and is often played on acoustic guitar, harmonica, and fiddle. It is known for its slow, soulful rhythms and its use of minor chords and blues scales. Louisiana Blues often features call-and-response vocals, and is often accompanied by a washboard or other percussion instruments. It is a popular style of music in the region, and is often played at festivals and other events.

name: Polish Electronica
description: Polish Electronica is a genre of electronic music that originated in Poland in the late 1990s. It is characterized by its use of synthesizers, drum machines, and other electronic instruments to create a unique sound. It often incorporates elements of traditional Polish music, such as folk melodies and rhythms, as well as elements of other genres, such as hip-hop and techno. Polish Electronica is often characterized by its upbeat, energetic sound, and its use of samples and loops to create a unique soundscape.

name: Swamp Blues
description: Swamp Blues is a style of blues music that originated in the Louisiana bayou region in the early 20th century. It is characterized by its slow, soulful rhythms, and its use of slide guitar, accordion, and other Cajun instruments. It is often associated with the music of the Louisiana swamp people, and is heavily influenced by the African-American music of the region. It is often seen as a precursor to the more modern Zydeco music.

name: Swamp Pop
description: Swamp Pop is a genre of music that originated in the Acadiana region of Louisiana in the 1950s. It is a blend of Cajun, rhythm and blues, country, and rock and roll. It is characterized by its slow, soulful sound and its use of accordion, steel guitar, and saxophone. It is often referred to as "the music of the bayou" and is popular in Louisiana and the Gulf Coast region.

It is typically characterized by its relaxed, laid-back atmosphere and its use of smooth, melodic instrumentation. name: Elektropunk
description: Elektropunk is a genre of electronic music that combines elements of punk rock and electronic music. It typically features distorted guitars, synthesizers, drum machines, and other electronic instruments. The sound is often aggressive and chaotic, and the lyrics often focus on themes of rebellion and social change. It is often associated with the cyberpunk subculture.

The genre is characterized by its use of acoustic instruments, such as guitars, banjos, and mandolins, as well as its incorporation of traditional Tasmanian folk music. It is characterized by its use of traditional Israeli melodies, rhythms, and harmonies, as well as its incorporation of classical piano techniques. The genre often features improvisation and a wide range of musical styles, from traditional folk to jazz and classical. It is often performed by solo pianists, but can also be performed by ensembles. The genre has become increasingly popular in recent years, and is often used in film and television soundtracks.

name: Breakcore
description: Breakcore is a genre of electronic music that combines elements of hardcore, jungle, and drum and bass. It is characterized by fast tempos, heavy basslines, and distorted samples. Breakcore often incorporates elements of other genres such as hip hop, dubstep, and industrial music. It is often associated with the rave and underground scenes. Breakcore is known for its experimental and chaotic nature, and its use of extreme tempos and distorted samples.

name: Drill And Bass
description: Drill and Bass is a genre of electronic music that emerged in the early 1990s. It is characterized by fast tempos, heavy use of drum machines, and complex, syncopated rhythms. It often features samples from other genres, such as hip-hop, funk, and jazz. The genre is heavily influenced by the UK rave scene and is often associated with the breakbeat and jungle genres. It is often characterized by its aggressive, hard-hitting sound and its use of complex, syncopated rhythms.

name: Collage Pop
description: Collage Pop is a genre of music that combines elements of various musical styles, often from different eras, to create a unique sound. It typically features a mix of samples, loops, and live instrumentation, often with a strong emphasis on rhythm and groove. The genre is often characterized by its eclectic nature, with artists often combining elements of hip-hop, funk, soul, jazz, and electronic music. Collage Pop is often seen as a form of experimental music, as it often pushes the boundaries of traditional genres and creates something entirely new.

name: French Post-Rock
description: French Post-Rock is a genre of music that combines elements of post-rock, ambient, and experimental music. It is characterized by its use of repetitive, often minimalistic, instrumentation and soundscapes, often featuring guitars, synthesizers, and drum machines. It is often characterized by its slow, dreamy, and atmospheric sound, and its use of reverb and delay effects. French Post-Rock is often seen as a more accessible version of the more experimental post-rock genres, and is often seen as a bridge between the two.

name: Belgian Electronic
description: Belgian Electronic music is a genre of electronic music that originated in Belgium in the late 1980s and early 1990s. It is characterized by its use of synthesizers, drum machines, and samples, as well as its incorporation of elements from other genres such as hip hop, funk, and jazz. Belgian Electronic music is often characterized by its upbeat, energetic sound and its use of complex rhythms and melodies. It is often associated with the Belgian New Beat scene, which was popular in the late 1980s and early 1990s.

name: Grave Wave
description: Grave Wave is a dark, melancholic, and atmospheric subgenre of synthwave music. It is characterized by its heavy use of synthesizers, drum machines, and other electronic instruments, as well as its dark and often melancholic atmosphere. It often incorporates elements of horror, sci-fi, and dystopian themes, and its sound is often described as a mix of synthwave, darkwave, and gothic rock.

name: Abstract Beats
description: Abstract Beats is a genre of electronic music that focuses on creating unique and experimental soundscapes. It often incorporates elements of hip-hop, ambient, and experimental music, and is characterized by its abstract and often chaotic sound. Abstract Beats producers often use a variety of sound sources, including field recordings, found sounds, and synthesizers, to create their music. The genre is often characterized by its experimental nature, and producers often strive to create something unique and unexpected.

name: Canadian Americana
description: Canadian Americana is a genre of music that combines elements of traditional Americana music with a distinctly Canadian flavor. It typically features acoustic instruments such as guitar, banjo, mandolin, and fiddle, as well as elements of folk, country, blues, and rock. The lyrics often focus on themes of Canadian identity, nature, and the outdoors. Canadian Americana artists often draw inspiration from traditional Canadian folk music, as well as Americana and roots music.

name: Abstract
description: Abstract music is a genre of music that is characterized by its experimental and avant-garde approach. It is often characterized by its lack of traditional musical structure and its use of unconventional sounds and textures. Abstract music often incorporates elements of other genres such as ambient, noise, and drone music. It is often used to create a sense of atmosphere or to evoke a certain emotion. Abstract music is often used in film and television soundtracks, as well as in video games and other media.

name: Deep IDM
description: Deep IDM (Intelligent Dance Music) is a subgenre of electronic music that combines elements of ambient, downtempo, and experimental music. It is characterized by its slow tempo, intricate soundscapes, and often abstract sound design. Deep IDM often features complex rhythms, intricate melodies, and a wide range of sound sources, from field recordings to synthesizers. It is often seen as a more cerebral and introspective form of electronic music, and is often used in film soundtracks and video game soundtracks.

name: Swedish Indie Folk
description: Swedish Indie Folk is a genre of music that combines traditional Swedish folk music with modern indie rock. It typically features acoustic instruments such as guitars, banjos, and mandolins, as well as traditional Swedish instruments like the nyckelharpa and the hurdy-gurdy. The lyrics often focus on themes of nature, love, and nostalgia, and the melodies are often melancholic and reflective. The genre has become increasingly popular in recent years, with many Swedish artists gaining international recognition.

name: Bossa Nova Jazz
description: Bossa Nova Jazz is a style of Brazilian music that combines elements of jazz and traditional Brazilian rhythms. It originated in the late 1950s and early 1960s in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. It is characterized by its laid-back, relaxed feel, its syncopated rhythms, and its use of the guitar as the lead instrument. Bossa Nova Jazz is often seen as a precursor to modern jazz-fusion, and its influence can be heard in many contemporary jazz styles.

name: Brazilian Jazz
description: Brazilian Jazz is a genre of music that combines traditional Brazilian rhythms and melodies with jazz improvisation. It is a fusion of jazz and Brazilian music styles such as samba, bossa nova, and choro. It is characterized by its use of complex rhythms, improvisation, and a wide range of instruments. Brazilian Jazz often features a combination of acoustic and electric instruments, including guitar, bass, drums, percussion, and keyboards. It is often characterized by its upbeat, lively sound and its use of syncopated rhythms.

name: Panpipe
description: Panpipe music is a genre of traditional folk music from South America, particularly Peru, Bolivia, and Ecuador. It is characterized by its use of the panpipe, a wind instrument made of several pipes of different lengths and sizes, which are played together to create a melodic sound. The music is often upbeat and lively, and often features traditional instruments such as drums, flutes, and guitars. It is often used in traditional dances and celebrations, and is a popular form of entertainment in many Latin American countries.

name: Romanian Folk
description: Romanian Folk music is a traditional style of music that has been passed down through generations in Romania. It is characterized by its use of traditional instruments such as the cobza, taragot, and cimbalom, as well as its use of vocal harmonies and improvisation. It is often accompanied by traditional dances such as the hora, sârba, and brâul. The music is often upbeat and lively, and is often used to celebrate special occasions such as weddings and festivals.

name: Dixieland
description: Dixieland is a style of jazz music that originated in New Orleans in the early 1900s. It is characterized by a collective improvisation style, a strong backbeat, and a syncopated rhythm. It is often played with a combination of brass instruments, such as trumpets, trombones, and clarinets, as well as drums and a piano. It is often associated with the traditional jazz of New Orleans, and is often referred to as "hot jazz" or "traditional jazz".

name: New Orleans Jazz
description: New Orleans Jazz is a style of music that originated in the early 1900s in New Orleans, Louisiana. It is a combination of African-American music, European-American music, and Caribbean music. It is characterized by a syncopated rhythm, improvisation, and collective group improvisation. It is often played on traditional instruments such as the trumpet, trombone, clarinet, saxophone, banjo, and piano. It is also known for its use of call-and-response vocals and collective improvisation. It is a popular genre of music that is still played today in many cities around the world.

name: Finnish Jazz
description: Finnish Jazz is a style of jazz music that originated in Finland in the early 20th century. It is characterized by its use of traditional Finnish folk music elements, such as the kantele, a traditional Finnish stringed instrument, as well as other traditional instruments like the jouhikko and the harmonium. Finnish Jazz also incorporates elements of classical music, such as counterpoint and polyphony, as well as modern jazz elements like improvisation and swing. It is often characterized by its melancholic and introspective sound, as well as its use of traditional Finnish melodies.

name: Finnish Progressive Rock
description: Finnish Progressive Rock is a genre of rock music that originated in Finland in the late 1960s and early 1970s. It is characterized by its complex and often experimental song structures, its use of synthesizers and other electronic instruments, and its incorporation of elements from jazz, classical, and folk music. The genre is often seen as a fusion of progressive rock and psychedelic rock, and is often associated with the bands Wigwam, Tasavallan Presidentti, and Pekka Pohjola.

name: Cantautor
description: Cantautor is a Spanish music genre that combines elements of folk, rock, and pop music. It is characterized by its poetic lyrics and often political themes. The genre originated in the 1960s and 1970s in Spain and Latin America, and is often associated with singer-songwriters such as Joan Manuel Serrat, Victor Jara, and Mercedes Sosa. Cantautor songs often focus on social issues, such as poverty, injustice, and inequality. The genre has been popularized by artists such as Manu Chao, Calle 13, and Silvio Rodriguez.

name: Electro Jazz
description: Electro Jazz is a genre of music that combines elements of jazz and electronic music. It typically features a combination of live instruments, such as drums, bass, guitar, and keyboards, with electronic elements, such as synthesizers, samplers, and drum machines. The genre often incorporates elements of funk, hip-hop, and house music, as well as other genres. It is characterized by its use of improvisation, complex rhythms, and a wide range of sounds.

name: Tucson Indie
description: Tucson Indie is a genre of music that originated in Tucson, Arizona. It is a blend of folk, rock, and country music, with a strong emphasis on storytelling and lyrics. It often features acoustic instruments such as guitars, banjos, and mandolins, as well as electric instruments such as electric guitars and synthesizers. Tucson Indie is known for its laid-back, relaxed sound, and its focus on the beauty of the Southwest. It is often characterized by its use of reverb and delay effects, as well as its incorporation of traditional Mexican and Native American music.

name: Edmonton Indie
description: Edmonton Indie is a genre of music that originated in Edmonton, Alberta, Canada. It is characterized by its eclectic mix of styles, including folk, rock, punk, and electronic music. The genre is often associated with the city's vibrant music scene, which has produced a number of successful bands and artists. Edmonton Indie is known for its DIY attitude and its focus on creating unique and innovative sounds. It is often characterized by its use of unconventional instruments, such as synthesizers, drum machines, and samplers. Edmonton Indie is also known for its lyrical content, which often focuses on themes of social justice, environmentalism, and personal growth.

name: Latin Alternative
description: Latin Alternative is a genre of music that combines traditional Latin music with elements of alternative rock, hip hop, electronica, and other genres. It is a broad term that encompasses a variety of styles, including rock en español, reggaeton, Latin ska, Latin funk, Latin punk, Latin rap, Latin metal, Latin jazz, and Latin pop. It is often characterized by its use of Spanish lyrics, Latin rhythms, and a mix of traditional and modern instrumentation.

name: Veracruz Indie
description: Veracruz Indie is a genre of Mexican music that combines traditional Mexican folk music with modern indie rock. It is characterized by its use of traditional instruments such as the jarana, guitar, and accordion, as well as modern instruments like electric guitar, bass, and drums. The genre is heavily influenced by the traditional music of Veracruz, a state in Mexico, and is often sung in Spanish. It is a popular genre in Mexico and has been gaining popularity in the United States in recent years.

name: Classic Dubstep
description: Classic Dubstep is a genre of electronic dance music that originated in the late 1990s in the United Kingdom. It is characterized by its heavy basslines, syncopated rhythms, and dark, atmospheric soundscapes. Classic Dubstep is often characterized by its use of syncopated drum patterns, deep basslines, and a variety of sound effects. It is often associated with the darker side of electronic music, and is often used in film and video game soundtracks.

name: Jazz Drums
description: Jazz Drums is a genre of music that combines elements of jazz and drumming. It is characterized by improvisation, syncopation, and complex rhythms. Jazz drummers often use a variety of techniques, such as brush strokes, rim shots, and cymbal rolls, to create a unique sound. Jazz drumming is often used to accompany other jazz instruments, such as the piano, saxophone, and trumpet. Jazz drummers often use a variety of percussion instruments, such as congas, bongos, and timbales, to create a unique sound.

name: Power Pop
description: Power Pop is a genre of popular music that originated in the late 1960s and early 1970s. It is characterized by a strong emphasis on melodic hooks, catchy choruses, and a strong backbeat. Power Pop is often described as a combination of the Beatles and the Beach Boys, with elements of punk and new wave. It is typically upbeat and often features electric guitars, keyboards, and vocal harmonies. Power Pop is often seen as a bridge between classic rock and modern pop music.

name: Pub Rock
description: Pub Rock is a style of rock music that originated in the United Kingdom in the early 1970s. It is characterized by its stripped-down, basic sound, often featuring a simple guitar-bass-drums lineup, and is often seen as a precursor to punk rock. Pub Rock bands typically played in pubs and clubs, and their music was often characterized by a raw, energetic sound and a focus on catchy, sing-along choruses. Common lyrical themes include working-class life, drinking, and relationships. Notable Pub Rock bands include Dr. Feelgood, Eddie and the Hot Rods, and Ducks Deluxe.

name: Zolo
description: Zolo is a genre of music that originated in Zimbabwe in the late 1980s. It is a fusion of traditional African music, reggae, and hip hop. It is characterized by its upbeat, danceable rhythms and its use of traditional African instruments such as the mbira, marimba, and hosho. The lyrics often focus on social and political issues, and the music is often used as a form of protest.

name: Italian Romanticism
description: Italian Romanticism is a style of music that emerged in the early 19th century and is characterized by its expressive melodies, lush harmonies, and passionate, often melancholic moods. It is heavily influenced by the operatic tradition of Italy, and often features sweeping orchestral arrangements and lush vocal lines. It is often associated with the works of composers such as Giuseppe Verdi, Giacomo Puccini, and Vincenzo Bellini.

name: Canadian Experimental
description: Canadian Experimental music is a genre of music that is characterized by its use of unconventional sounds, structures, and instrumentation. It often incorporates elements of improvisation, noise, and electronic music. Canadian Experimental music is often experimental in nature, and can range from ambient soundscapes to avant-garde noise. It is often associated with the Canadian music scene, and is often seen as a reflection of the country's diverse cultural influences.

name: Vintage Classical Singing
description: Vintage Classical Singing is a genre of music that encompasses traditional classical singing styles from the 19th and early 20th centuries. It is characterized by its use of operatic and art song techniques, as well as its focus on the beauty of the human voice. It often features arias, duets, and other vocal works from the classical repertoire, as well as traditional folk songs and spirituals. It is often performed in a more intimate setting than traditional classical music, and is often accompanied by a piano or other small ensemble.

name: Classical Guitar
description: Classical guitar is a genre of music that is typically performed on a nylon-stringed acoustic guitar. It is characterized by its use of complex musical forms, intricate fingerpicking techniques, and a wide range of musical styles. Classical guitar music is often based on the works of classical composers such as Bach, Beethoven, and Mozart, as well as modern composers such as John Williams and Joaquín Rodrigo. It is also heavily influenced by folk music from around the world, including flamenco, tango, and Latin American music. Classical guitar music is often performed solo, but can also be performed in ensembles with other instruments.

name: Guitarra Clasica
description: Guitarra Clasica is a genre of classical guitar music that originated in Spain and Latin America. It is characterized by its intricate melodies, complex rhythms, and use of traditional Spanish and Latin American instruments. The genre is often associated with the works of composers such as Francisco Tárrega, Joaquín Rodrigo, and Agustín Barrios Mangoré. Guitarra Clasica is often performed in a solo setting, but can also be performed in ensembles. The genre is known for its expressive and emotive qualities, and is often used to evoke a sense of nostalgia or longing.

name: Historic Classical Performance
description: Historic Classical Performance is a genre of classical music that focuses on the performance of classical music from the Baroque, Classical, and Romantic eras. This genre is characterized by its use of period instruments and historically informed performance practices. It is often performed in a style that is faithful to the original compositions, and is intended to recreate the sound and feel of the original performances.

name: Kora
description: Kora is a traditional West African music genre that originated in the Mande Empire of West Africa. It is typically played on a 21-stringed harp-lute instrument called the kora, and is accompanied by percussion instruments such as the djembe and dunun. Kora music is characterized by its complex rhythms and improvisational nature, and is often used to accompany traditional dances and ceremonies. It is also known for its use of call-and-response singing, in which a lead singer is accompanied by a chorus of singers.

name: Psychedelic Soul
description: Psychedelic Soul is a genre of music that combines elements of soul, funk, and psychedelic rock. It emerged in the late 1960s and early 1970s and is characterized by its use of psychedelic elements such as distorted guitars, trippy sound effects, and heavy reverb. It also often incorporates elements of jazz, blues, and Latin music. Psychedelic Soul is known for its soulful, funky grooves and its psychedelic, trippy soundscapes.

name: New Orleans Blues
description: The New Orleans Blues is a style of blues music that originated in the city of New Orleans, Louisiana. It is characterized by a heavy emphasis on the piano, horns, and drums, as well as a strong influence from jazz and gospel music. The style is often characterized by a slow, soulful groove, with a focus on improvisation and call-and-response vocals. The lyrics often focus on themes of heartache, loss, and struggle, as well as the joys of life in the city.

name: Latin Rock
description: Latin Rock is a genre of music that combines elements of traditional Latin music with rock music. It typically features electric guitars, drums, and Latin percussion instruments such as congas, bongos, and timbales. It often incorporates elements of salsa, merengue, cumbia, and other Latin American styles. Latin Rock is often characterized by its upbeat rhythms and passionate lyrics, and it has been popularized by artists such as Santana, Los Lobos, and Ozomatli.

name: Musica Andina
description: Musica Andina is a genre of traditional music from the Andes region of South America. It is characterized by its use of traditional instruments such as the charango, quena, and zampoña, as well as its incorporation of traditional rhythms and melodies. It is often performed in a style that is both lively and melodic, and often includes vocal harmonies. Musica Andina is often used to accompany traditional dances, such as the huayno and the cueca. It is also used to accompany traditional festivals and celebrations.

name: Southampton Indie
description: Southampton Indie is a genre of music that originated in the city of Southampton, England. It is characterized by its upbeat, melodic sound, often featuring jangly guitars, driving rhythms, and catchy hooks. The genre is heavily influenced by the indie rock and post-punk scenes of the 1980s and 1990s, as well as the mod revival of the early 2000s. It is often associated with bands such as The Rifles, The Delays, and The Subways.

name: Indie Electronica
description: Indie Electronica is a genre of music that combines elements of indie rock and electronic music. It typically features a combination of acoustic instruments, synthesizers, drum machines, and other electronic elements. The genre is often characterized by its use of unconventional sounds, experimental production techniques, and a wide range of influences from various genres. Indie Electronica often has a lo-fi, DIY aesthetic, and is often associated with the independent music scene.

name: Vintage Hollywood
description: Vintage Hollywood music is a genre of music that is inspired by the classic soundtracks of Hollywood films from the 1930s to the 1960s. It typically features lush orchestral arrangements, often with a jazzy or swing feel, and often incorporates elements of classical music. It is often used in films and television shows to evoke a sense of nostalgia and glamour.

name: French Reggae
description: French Reggae is a genre of music that combines elements of traditional French music with the rhythms and sounds of reggae. It is a fusion of French chanson, Caribbean zouk, and Jamaican reggae. It is characterized by its upbeat, danceable rhythms, and its use of traditional French instruments such as the accordion, violin, and guitar. French Reggae is often sung in French, but can also include English and Creole lyrics. It is popular in France, the Caribbean, and other French-speaking countries.

name: Welsh Folk
description: Welsh Folk music is a traditional genre of music that originated in Wales. It is characterized by its use of traditional instruments such as the harp, fiddle, and accordion, as well as its use of traditional Welsh language lyrics. It is often performed in a lively, upbeat style, and is often accompanied by dancing. It is a popular genre of music in Wales, and is often performed at festivals and other events.

name: Power Blues-Rock
description: Power Blues-Rock is a genre of music that combines elements of blues and rock music. It typically features electric guitars, drums, and vocals, and often incorporates elements of funk, soul, and jazz. The sound is characterized by a heavy, distorted guitar sound, often with a driving rhythm section and powerful vocals. It is often seen as a bridge between blues and rock, and is often seen as a more aggressive form of blues-rock.

name: Norwegian Classical
description: Norwegian Classical music is a genre of music that emerged in the 19th century and is characterized by its use of traditional Norwegian folk music elements. It is often characterized by its use of traditional instruments such as the Hardanger fiddle, the langeleik, and the bukkehorn, as well as its use of traditional Norwegian folk songs and dances. It is often seen as a combination of traditional Norwegian folk music and classical music, and is often seen as a reflection of Norwegian culture and identity.

name: Exotica
description: Exotica is a genre of music that emerged in the 1950s and is characterized by its use of exotic instrumentation and rhythms. It often incorporates elements of jazz, Latin, and Hawaiian music, as well as other world music influences. It is often associated with the "space age" of the 1950s and 1960s, and is often used in film and television soundtracks.

name: Australian Post-Punk
description: Australian Post-Punk is a genre of music that emerged in the late 1970s and early 1980s in Australia. It is characterized by its dark, edgy sound, often featuring distorted guitars, driving rhythms, and a mix of punk, new wave, and experimental influences. The genre is often associated with bands such as The Birthday Party, The Scientists, and The Go-Betweens. It is also known for its DIY aesthetic, with many bands self-releasing their music on small labels.

name: Garage Psych
description: Garage Psych is a genre of music that combines elements of psychedelic rock and garage rock. It typically features distorted guitars, heavy reverb, and a driving rhythm section. The genre is often characterized by its raw, lo-fi production and its emphasis on improvisation and experimentation. Garage Psych often incorporates elements of other genres such as surf rock, blues, and folk. It is often associated with the 1960s and 1970s, but has seen a resurgence in recent years.

name: Melbourne Indie
description: Melbourne Indie is a genre of music that originated in Melbourne, Australia. It is characterized by its upbeat, melodic sound, often featuring guitars, synthesizers, and drum machines. The genre is heavily influenced by indie rock, post-punk, and new wave, and often incorporates elements of electronic music, hip-hop, and pop. Artists in the genre often explore themes of love, relationships, and identity.

name: Acoustic Chill
description: Acoustic Chill is a genre of music that combines acoustic instruments with chillout, downtempo, and ambient music. It typically features acoustic guitars, pianos, and other stringed instruments, as well as electronic elements such as synthesizers, drum machines, and samples. The music is often mellow and relaxing, with a focus on creating a peaceful atmosphere. It is often used in yoga classes, meditation, and other relaxation activities.

name: Australian Blues
description: Australian Blues is a style of music that originated in Australia in the 1950s and 1960s. It is a mix of traditional blues, jazz, and country music, with a unique Australian flavor. It is characterized by its use of slide guitar, harmonica, and a strong rhythm section. The lyrics often focus on the struggles of everyday life, and the music is often upbeat and lively. It is a popular genre in Australia, and has been gaining popularity in other countries as well.

name: Outsider
description: Outsider music is a genre of music that is characterized by its experimental, avant-garde, and often bizarre sound. It is often created by musicians who are not part of the mainstream music industry, and who are often self-taught or have limited access to traditional musical instruments and recording equipment. Outsider music often incorporates elements of noise, improvisation, and found sounds, and is often characterized by its lo-fi production quality. It is often seen as a form of outsider art, and is often created by individuals who are not necessarily musicians, but who are driven by a creative impulse to create something unique and unusual.

name: British Dance Band
description: British Dance Band music is a style of popular music that emerged in the United Kingdom in the early 20th century. It is characterized by a combination of jazz, ragtime, and popular music, and is often performed by large ensembles of musicians. The style was popularized by the emergence of the "British Dance Band" record label in the 1920s, which released recordings of popular dance bands from the era. The music is often characterized by a strong rhythm section, with a focus on the piano, drums, and brass instruments. The style is often seen as a precursor to modern jazz and swing music.

name: Coverchill
description: Coverchill is a genre of music that combines elements of chillout, downtempo, and cover songs. It is characterized by its relaxed, laid-back atmosphere and its use of familiar melodies and lyrics from popular songs. Coverchill often features acoustic instruments, such as guitars, pianos, and strings, as well as electronic elements, such as synthesizers and drum machines. The genre is often used as background music in restaurants, cafes, and other public spaces.

name: Ethio-Jazz
description: Ethio-Jazz is a genre of music that combines traditional Ethiopian music with jazz and funk influences. It originated in the 1960s and has since become a popular genre in Ethiopia and around the world. It is characterized by its use of traditional Ethiopian instruments such as the masenqo (a one-stringed bowed lute), the krar (a five-stringed lyre), and the washint (a bamboo flute). The music is often characterized by its upbeat rhythms and improvisational solos. Ethio-Jazz has been popularized by artists such as Mulatu Astatke, Mahmoud Ahmed, and Alemayehu Eshete.

name: Post-Punk
description: Post-punk is a genre of rock music that emerged in the late 1970s as a reaction against the perceived excesses of punk rock. Post-punk bands typically incorporated elements of funk, jazz, and dub into their sound, as well as incorporating more experimental and avant-garde elements. Post-punk bands often featured angular, dissonant guitar riffs, and often used synthesizers and drum machines to create a more electronic sound. Post-punk bands often had a dark, brooding sound, and often explored themes of alienation, nihilism, and despair.

name: Copla
description: The Copla is a traditional Spanish music genre that originated in the 19th century. It is characterized by its romantic lyrics and melodic structure. It is usually sung in a duet or trio, accompanied by a guitar or bandurria. The lyrics often tell stories of love, loss, and nostalgia. The Copla is a popular genre in Spain and Latin America, and is often performed at festivals and celebrations.

name: Acoustic Rock
description: Acoustic Rock is a genre of music that combines elements of rock music with acoustic instruments such as acoustic guitar, piano, and sometimes drums. It is often characterized by its mellow, laid-back sound and often incorporates elements of folk, blues, and country music. Acoustic Rock is often seen as a more stripped-down version of rock music, with a focus on the songwriting and the emotion of the lyrics. Popular artists in this genre include John Mayer, Jason Mraz, and Ed Sheeran.

name: Brazilian Reggae
description: Brazilian Reggae is a genre of music that combines elements of traditional Brazilian music with the rhythms and sounds of reggae. It is characterized by its upbeat, danceable rhythms and its incorporation of traditional Brazilian instruments such as the berimbau, pandeiro, and cavaquinho. The lyrics often focus on themes of social justice, peace, and love. Brazilian Reggae has become increasingly popular in recent years, with artists such as Seu Jorge, Natiruts, and O Rappa gaining international recognition.

name: Reggae Gaucho
description: Reggae Gaucho is a fusion of traditional Uruguayan folk music and reggae. It is a unique blend of the two genres, combining the upbeat rhythms of reggae with the traditional sounds of Uruguayan folk music. The genre is characterized by its use of traditional Uruguayan instruments such as the charango, guitar, and bombo drum, as well as its incorporation of reggae elements such as skanking guitar riffs and dub-style bass lines. Reggae Gaucho is a popular genre in Uruguay, and is often performed at festivals and concerts.

name: Rock Gaucho
description: Rock Gaucho is a genre of music that originated in the southern Brazilian state of Rio Grande do Sul. It is a mix of traditional Brazilian folk music, rock, and country music. It is characterized by its upbeat rhythms, electric guitars, and accordion-driven melodies. The lyrics often focus on the rural life of the gauchos, the cowboys of the region. Rock Gaucho is popular in Brazil and has been gaining international recognition in recent years.

name: Pop Nacional
description: Pop Nacional is a genre of popular music from Brazil that combines elements of traditional Brazilian music with modern pop music. It is characterized by its upbeat rhythms, catchy melodies, and often incorporates elements of samba, bossa nova, and other Brazilian styles. It is often seen as a more accessible version of traditional Brazilian music, and is popular among both young and old audiences.

name: Brazilian Punk
description: Brazilian Punk is a genre of music that originated in Brazil in the late 1970s and early 1980s. It is a mix of punk rock, hardcore punk, and other styles of music. It is characterized by its fast tempo, aggressive sound, and often political lyrics. It is often associated with the punk scene in Brazil, which is known for its DIY ethic and its focus on social issues. Brazilian Punk bands often incorporate elements of traditional Brazilian music, such as samba and bossa nova, into their sound.

name: Cowpunk
description: Cowpunk is a genre of music that combines elements of punk rock and country music. It typically features loud, distorted guitars, fast tempos, and a twangy, country-influenced vocal style. The lyrics often focus on themes of rebellion, rural life, and working-class pride. Cowpunk is often seen as a precursor to the alternative country and Americana genres.

name: Hard Rock Brasileiro
description: Hard Rock Brasileiro is a Brazilian rock music genre that emerged in the late 1970s and early 1980s. It is characterized by its heavy guitar riffs, aggressive vocals, and a strong influence from British and American hard rock and heavy metal. The genre is often associated with the Brazilian rock scene of the 1980s, which was heavily influenced by the punk and new wave movements of the time. Hard Rock Brasileiro is often seen as a precursor to the thrash metal and death metal genres that emerged in the 1990s.

name: Rhode Island Rap
description: Rhode Island Rap is a subgenre of hip hop music that originated in the state of Rhode Island. It is characterized by its hard-hitting beats, aggressive lyrics, and often incorporates elements of trap music. The genre is heavily influenced by the East Coast hip hop sound, and is often associated with the city of Providence. Artists such as Providence's own B.A.M. and Providence's own Bigga B have helped to popularize the genre.

name: Funk Carioca
description: Funk Carioca, also known as Baile Funk, is a Brazilian music genre that originated in Rio de Janeiro in the late 1970s. It is a mix of Miami bass, electro, hip hop, and traditional Brazilian rhythms such as samba and maracatu. It is characterized by its heavy bass lines, repetitive lyrics, and a fast-paced beat. It is often associated with the favelas of Rio de Janeiro, and its lyrics often focus on themes of poverty, crime, and violence.

name: French Hip Hop
description: French Hip Hop is a genre of music that originated in France in the late 1980s. It is characterized by its use of French language, samples from French music, and references to French culture. It is heavily influenced by American hip hop, but also incorporates elements of traditional French music such as chanson and musette. French Hip Hop is often political in nature, with lyrics that address social and political issues. It is also known for its use of clever wordplay and witty punchlines.

name: Pop Urbaine
description: Pop Urbaine is a genre of French-language music that combines elements of hip-hop, R&B, and pop music. It is characterized by its catchy melodies, upbeat rhythms, and often incorporates rap and spoken word. It is often seen as a more accessible version of hip-hop, and is popular among young people in France and other French-speaking countries.

name: Rap Francais
description: Rap Francais is a French hip-hop music genre that originated in the late 1980s. It is characterized by its use of French language and its focus on social and political issues. It is often seen as a form of protest music, and its lyrics often address topics such as racism, poverty, and social injustice. It is also known for its use of samples from other genres, such as jazz, funk, and reggae. Rap Francais has been a major influence on the French music scene, and has been embraced by both French and international audiences.

name: Rap Marseille
description: Rap Marseille is a French hip-hop genre that originated in the city of Marseille in the late 1980s. It is characterized by its hard-hitting beats, aggressive lyrics, and its use of slang and local dialects. It is often seen as a reflection of the city's working-class culture and its struggles with poverty and crime. It is also known for its use of samples from classic French songs and its incorporation of traditional Mediterranean music.

name: Melbourne Bounce International
description: Melbourne Bounce International is a style of electronic dance music that originated in Melbourne, Australia. It is characterized by its high-energy, upbeat sound, which is often accompanied by a heavy bassline and a four-on-the-floor beat. It is heavily influenced by Dutch and German house music, as well as electro and progressive house. It is often characterized by its use of vocal samples, catchy melodies, and a wide variety of synthesizers and drum machines. It is popular in clubs and festivals around the world, and is often seen as a more accessible form of EDM.

name: Brega Romantico
description: Brega Romantico is a Brazilian music genre that combines elements of pop, rock, and funk. It is characterized by its romantic lyrics and upbeat rhythms. It is often associated with the Brazilian state of Maranhão, where it originated in the late 1980s. The genre has since spread throughout Brazil and is popular among young people. It is often seen as a more accessible version of traditional Brazilian music, as it incorporates elements of modern pop music.

name: Funk Paulista
description: Funk Paulista is a Brazilian music genre that originated in the state of São Paulo in the late 1990s. It is a mix of funk carioca, hip hop, and electronic music, and is characterized by its heavy bass lines, repetitive beats, and often explicit lyrics. The genre is heavily influenced by the culture of São Paulo, and its lyrics often focus on themes such as poverty, crime, and the struggles of everyday life. It is a popular genre in Brazil, and has been gaining international recognition in recent years.

name: Rave Funk
description: Rave Funk is a genre of electronic dance music that combines elements of funk, disco, and rave music. It is characterized by its upbeat, energetic sound and its use of synthesizers, drum machines, and samples. It often features a four-on-the-floor beat and a heavy bassline. name: Nordic House

name: Samba

Samba is often performed in a large ensemble, with multiple singers and instrumentalists, and is often accompanied by a samba school, a group of dancers and musicians who perform in parades and festivals. German Hip Hop is often seen as a reflection of the country's social and political climate, and its lyrics often address issues such as racism, poverty, and social injustice. name: German Heavy Metal

It is characterized by its aggressive sound, fast tempos, and distorted guitars. It is often associated with the New Wave of British Heavy Metal, and is often referred to as "Teutonic Thrash Metal". German Heavy Metal bands often incorporate elements of traditional heavy metal, speed metal, and thrash metal, as well as incorporating elements of classical music, folk music, and progressive rock. Common lyrical themes include fantasy, mythology, and Germanic folklore. Notable German Heavy Metal bands include Accept, Kreator, Destruction, Sodom, and Running Wild.

name: Grimewave

It is characterized by its dark, gritty, and often violent lyrical content, as well as its heavy use of samples from horror films and video games. It is often associated with horrorcore, a subgenre of hip hop that focuses on horror-themed lyrics. Grimewave is often produced with a lo-fi aesthetic, and its instrumentals often feature distorted synths and heavy bass. It is often seen as a darker, more aggressive version of horrorcore.

name: Coco

Coco is characterized by its upbeat rhythms and melodic lines, often featuring horns, percussion, and electric guitar. name: Manguebeat
description: Manguebeat is a Brazilian music genre that emerged in the early 1990s in the city of Recife, in the northeastern state of Pernambuco. It is a fusion of traditional Brazilian rhythms such as maracatu, coco, and frevo, with modern electronic music, rock, and hip-hop. The genre is characterized by its fast-paced, upbeat rhythms and its use of traditional Brazilian instruments such as the zabumba, the agogô, and the reco-reco. It is often associated with the tropicalismo movement, which sought to combine traditional Brazilian music with modern influences.

name: Nova Musica Pernambucana
description: Nova Musica Pernambucana is a genre of Brazilian music that originated in the state of Pernambuco in the Northeast of Brazil. It is a fusion of traditional Brazilian music styles such as forró, maracatu, and frevo with modern electronic music. The genre is characterized by its upbeat rhythms, catchy melodies, and use of traditional instruments such as the accordion, cavaquinho, and zabumba. name: Bandolim
description: Bandolim is a style of Brazilian instrumental music that originated in the early 20th century. It is characterized by its fast-paced, syncopated rhythms and its use of the bandolim, a small, four-stringed mandolin-like instrument. The style is often associated with the choro genre, which is a type of Brazilian popular music. Bandolim music is often played in a trio format, with the bandolim taking the lead role, accompanied by a cavaquinho (a small four-stringed guitar) and a pandeiro (a type of tambourine). The style is often improvisational and often features virtuosic solos from the bandolim player.

name: Choro
description: Choro is a Brazilian musical genre which originated in the 19th century. It is a combination of European and African musical elements, and is often considered the first urban popular music of Brazil. It is characterized by its fast-paced, syncopated rhythms, improvisation, and use of instruments such as the cavaquinho, flute, guitar, and pandeiro. Choro is often performed in small ensembles, and is known for its lively, upbeat sound.

name: Choro Contemporaneo

Choro Contemporaneo is a more modern take on the traditional style, incorporating elements of jazz, classical, and other genres. name: Ska

It is characterized by a walking bass line accented with rhythms on the off-beat. Ska music features horns, usually trumpets and trombones, playing the melody and rhythm. The tempo of ska is usually up-tempo and the lyrics often focus on themes of love and social issues.

name: Swedish House

It is characterized by its upbeat, energetic sound and its use of traditional instruments such as the accordion, mandolin, and tambourine. The lyrics often focus on themes of love, family, and the beauty of the Puglia region. It is a popular genre among young people in the region and has been gaining popularity in other parts of Italy and the world.

name: Christchurch Indie
description: Christchurch Indie is a genre of music that originated in Christchurch, New Zealand. It is characterized by its upbeat, melodic sound, often featuring jangly guitars, driving rhythms, and catchy hooks. The genre is heavily influenced by the indie rock and post-punk sounds of the 1980s, as well as the alternative rock of the 1990s. It is often characterized by its DIY aesthetic, with many bands recording their own albums and releasing them independently. The genre has seen a resurgence in recent years, with many bands from Christchurch gaining international recognition.

name: Lo-Fi Emo
description: Lo-Fi Emo is a subgenre of emo music that combines elements of lo-fi production with the emotional and often confessional lyrics of emo music. It is characterized by its lo-fi production quality, often featuring distorted guitars, drum machines, and other electronic elements. The lyrics often focus on themes of heartache, loneliness, and depression.

name: Japanese Jazz
description: Japanese Jazz is a genre of jazz music that has been heavily influenced by traditional Japanese music. It is characterized by a mix of traditional Japanese instruments such as the shamisen, koto, and shakuhachi, as well as jazz instruments like the saxophone, piano, and drums. The music often features a blend of traditional Japanese melodies and rhythms with jazz improvisation. It is often seen as a bridge between traditional Japanese music and jazz, and is popular among both Japanese and international audiences.

name: Japanese Chill Rap
description: Japanese Chill Rap is a genre of music that combines elements of hip-hop, R&B, and electronic music with traditional Japanese instruments and melodies. It is characterized by its laid-back, mellow sound and often incorporates elements of jazz, soul, and funk. The lyrics are often in Japanese and focus on themes of love, life, and nostalgia. Artists in this genre include KOHH, Yonezu Kenshi, and KOHEI JAPAN.

name: Japanese New Wave
description: The Japanese New Wave is a genre of music that emerged in the late 1970s and early 1980s in Japan. It is characterized by its experimental, avant-garde sound, often incorporating elements of punk, funk, jazz, and electronic music. It is often associated with the Japanese underground music scene, and is known for its use of synthesizers, drum machines, and other electronic instruments. Artists associated with the genre include Yellow Magic Orchestra, P-Model, and Plastics.

name: Shibuya-Kei
description: Shibuya-kei is a Japanese music genre that emerged in the late 1980s and early 1990s. It is characterized by its eclectic mix of styles, including elements of jazz, pop, funk, and electronic music. It is often associated with the city of Shibuya in Tokyo, and is known for its bright, upbeat sound. It is often seen as a precursor to the J-pop genre, and has been influential in the development of other genres such as chillwave and vaporwave.

name: Techno Kayo
description: Techno Kayo is a genre of electronic music that originated in Japan in the late 1990s. It is characterized by its fast-paced, upbeat sound, often featuring heavy use of synthesizers and drum machines. It is heavily influenced by the sounds of traditional Japanese music, such as taiko drums, shamisen, and koto. It is often described as a fusion of traditional Japanese music and modern electronic music.

name: Nu-Cumbia
description: Nu-Cumbia is a modern, electronic-based style of music that combines traditional cumbia rhythms with elements of hip-hop, reggaeton, and other Latin American genres. It is characterized by its upbeat, danceable rhythms and its incorporation of modern production techniques. Nu-Cumbia is popular in Latin America and has been gaining popularity in the United States in recent years.

The genre is heavily influenced by indie rock, pop, and folk music, and often incorporates elements of jazz, blues, and hip-hop. The sound is often characterized by fast, aggressive riffs, double-bass drumming, and shouted vocals. The lyrical themes often focus on social issues, such as poverty, racism, and violence. It is characterized by its upbeat, catchy melodies and often incorporates traditional instruments such as the shamisen, koto, and taiko drums. name: Idol Kayo

name: Zambian Hip Hop
description: Zambian Hip Hop is a genre of music that originated in Zambia in the late 1990s. It is a fusion of traditional Zambian music with elements of hip hop, such as rap, sampling, and scratching. Zambian Hip Hop is characterized by its use of local languages, such as Bemba, Nyanja, and Tonga, as well as English. It is often characterized by its upbeat, danceable beats and its socially conscious lyrics. name: Rhode Island Indie

It is often characterized by its use of samples from classic video games and other electronic music, as well as its use of geeky and nerdy references in its lyrics. name: Pirate
description: Pirate music is a genre of music that is inspired by the culture of pirates and the Caribbean. It typically features a combination of traditional Caribbean instruments such as steel drums, marimbas, and accordions, as well as more modern instruments such as electric guitars and synthesizers. The lyrics often focus on themes of adventure, rebellion, and freedom. Pirate music is often upbeat and lively, and is often used in films and television shows to evoke a sense of adventure and excitement.

name: Jazz Rock

Jazz Rock often incorporates elements of funk, soul, and blues, and is often characterized by extended improvisation and complex musical structures. name: Rochester Ny Indie

name: Black Comedy

name: Comedy
description: Comedy music is a genre of music that is designed to make people laugh. It often uses humorous lyrics, sound effects, and musical styles to create a lighthearted atmosphere. name: Art Punk
description: Art Punk is a genre of music that combines elements of punk rock with art rock, experimental music, and avant-garde. It is characterized by its use of unconventional instrumentation, complex rhythms, and often surreal lyrics. Art Punk bands often draw inspiration from the punk and post-punk movements of the 1970s and 1980s, as well as from the art rock of the 1960s. Common themes in Art Punk include anti-establishment, anti-consumerism, and social and political commentary. Notable Art Punk bands include The Talking Heads, Devo, and The Residents.

name: Nice Indie

It is characterized by its mellow, laid-back sound and often features acoustic instruments such as guitars, pianos, and drums. The lyrics are often introspective and thoughtful, and the melodies are often catchy and memorable. name: Hardcore Punk
description: Hardcore punk is a fast, aggressive, and often politically charged style of punk rock that emerged in the late 1970s. It is characterized by loud, distorted guitars, shouted vocals, and fast tempos. The lyrics often deal with social and political issues, and the music is often aggressive and confrontational. Hardcore punk bands often play short, fast songs with few or no breaks between them. The genre is often associated with the DIY (do-it-yourself) ethic, and many bands are self-produced and self-promoted.

name: Swedish Hardcore
description: Swedish Hardcore is a subgenre of hardcore punk that originated in Sweden in the late 1980s. It is characterized by its fast tempos, aggressive vocals, and distorted guitars. The lyrics often focus on social and political issues, and the music is often characterized by its heavy use of distortion and feedback. Swedish Hardcore bands often incorporate elements of thrash metal, death metal, and grindcore into their sound.

name: Swedish Post-Hardcore

It is characterized by its heavy, distorted guitar riffs, aggressive vocals, and intense drumming. The genre often incorporates elements of punk, metal, and hardcore, and is often lyrically focused on themes of social and political issues. Swedish Post-Hardcore bands often have a melodic and atmospheric sound, and are known for their intense live performances. Notable bands in the genre include Refused, Cult of Luna, and Breach.

name: Umea Hardcore

The lyrics often focus on social and political issues, and the music is often seen as a form of protest. Umea Hardcore bands often incorporate elements of thrash metal, crust punk, and d-beat into their sound. Notable bands in the genre include Refused, Abhinanda, and Raised Fist.

name: Vegan Straight Edge
description: Vegan Straight Edge is a subgenre of hardcore punk music that promotes a vegan lifestyle and abstinence from drugs and alcohol. It is characterized by its fast-paced, aggressive sound and lyrics that focus on animal rights, environmentalism, and social justice. The genre has been around since the early 1990s and has seen a resurgence in recent years. It is often associated with the straight edge movement, which promotes a drug-free lifestyle.

name: Ska Punk
description: Ska Punk is a genre of music that combines elements of ska and punk rock. It typically features fast tempos, offbeat guitar riffs, and horns. The genre is often characterized by its upbeat, energetic sound and its fusion of different musical styles. Ska Punk often incorporates elements of reggae, rocksteady, and other genres. It is often associated with the punk subculture and is often seen as a form of protest music.

name: Christian Relaxative

It is designed to provide a calming and peaceful atmosphere for prayer, meditation, and relaxation. The music typically features gentle instrumentation such as acoustic guitars, pianos, and strings, as well as soothing vocals. It is often used in churches, retreats, and other spiritual settings.

name: LDS

It is typically characterized by its religious themes and its use of traditional hymns and folk music. LDS music often includes spirituals, hymns, and other religious music, as well as original compositions. It is often performed in church services, at church events, and in other religious settings.

name: SLC Indie

The sound is often characterized by acoustic guitars, banjos, and mandolins, as well as a variety of other instruments. The lyrics often focus on themes of love, loss, and the struggles of everyday life. The genre has been popularized by bands such as The National Parks, The Moth & The Flame, and Fictionist.

name: Dinner Jazz
description: Dinner Jazz is a genre of jazz music that is typically played in a relaxed, mellow style. It is often used as background music in restaurants and other social settings. It typically features a combination of acoustic instruments such as piano, guitar, bass, and drums, as well as occasional horns and strings. The music is usually slow and melodic, with a focus on improvisation and subtlety. Dinner Jazz is often seen as a more accessible form of jazz, as it is less complex and more accessible to a wider audience.

name: Gambian Pop

It is characterized by its upbeat rhythms and catchy melodies. The lyrics often focus on themes of love, social issues, and politics. name: Ballet Class
description: The Ballet Class music genre is a type of classical music specifically composed for use in ballet classes. It is typically light and melodic, with a steady tempo and a focus on rhythm and phrasing. It is often used to accompany barre exercises, center work, and adagio combinations. It is usually instrumental, but some pieces may include vocals.

name: Art Song
description: Art song is a type of classical music that is composed for solo voice and piano accompaniment. It is usually based on a poem or text in a foreign language, such as German, French, or Italian. Art songs are typically composed in a lyrical, expressive style and often feature intricate melodic lines. They are usually performed in a recital setting, with the singer and pianist working together to create a unified interpretation of the song.

name: Turkish Alt Pop
description: Turkish Alt Pop is a genre of music that combines traditional Turkish music with modern pop music. It is characterized by its use of traditional instruments such as the saz, darbuka, and oud, as well as modern electronic instruments. It often features a mix of traditional Turkish melodies and rhythms with modern pop production techniques. The lyrics are often in Turkish, but some artists also sing in English. Turkish Alt Pop is a relatively new genre, but it has quickly gained popularity in Turkey and around the world.

name: Indie Folk Argentino

It is characterized by its use of acoustic instruments such as guitars, mandolins, and accordions, as well as its incorporation of traditional Argentine rhythms and melodies. The lyrics often focus on themes of love, nostalgia, and social issues. Indie Folk Argentino is a relatively new genre, but it has quickly gained popularity in Argentina and beyond.

name: Spanish Pop Rock

It typically features upbeat rhythms, catchy melodies, and often incorporates traditional Spanish instruments such as the guitar, flamenco, and castanets. The lyrics are usually in Spanish and often focus on themes of love, relationships, and life in general. name: Arab Groove
description: Arab Groove is a genre of music that combines traditional Middle Eastern and North African music with modern electronic music. It is characterized by its use of traditional instruments such as the oud, qanun, and tabla, as well as modern electronic instruments such as synthesizers and drum machines. The genre often features a mix of traditional and modern sounds, as well as a variety of vocal styles. It is often used in film soundtracks, television shows, and video games.

name: Steelpan
description: Steelpan music is a genre of music originating from Trinidad and Tobago. It is characterized by the use of steel drums, or pans, as the main instrument. The steel drums are usually played in an ensemble, with other instruments such as bass, guitar, and percussion. The music is often upbeat and lively, and is often used in calypso and soca music. Steelpan music is also popular in other Caribbean countries, as well as in the United States and Europe.

name: Vienna Indie

It is characterized by its use of unconventional instruments, such as synthesizers, drum machines, and samplers, as well as its incorporation of elements from other genres, such as jazz, classical, and folk. name: Belarusian Electronic

The genre is heavily influenced by the sounds of the Soviet Union, as well as modern electronic music. name: Polish Post-Punk

It is characterized by its dark, brooding sound, often featuring distorted guitars, synthesizers, and drum machines. The lyrics often focus on themes of alienation, despair, and social criticism. The genre is heavily influenced by punk, new wave, and experimental music, and is often seen as a reaction to the oppressive political climate in Poland during the 1980s.

name: Polish Rock

It is a mix of traditional Azeri folk music and modern pop music, often incorporating elements of jazz, rock, and hip hop. The genre is characterized by its upbeat, danceable rhythms and catchy melodies. name: Pakistani Folk
description: Pakistani folk music is a genre of traditional music that is rooted in the cultural heritage of the country. It is a mix of traditional and modern styles, and is often characterized by its use of traditional instruments such as the sitar, tabla, and harmonium. It is often accompanied by singing and dancing, and is often used to tell stories or express emotions. Pakistani folk music is often used in films, television, and other media, and is a popular form of entertainment in the country.

name: Qawwali
description: Qawwali is a form of Sufi devotional music that originated in South Asia. It is characterized by its use of complex vocal harmonies, improvisation, and a call-and-response structure. The lyrics are typically in Urdu, Punjabi, or Persian and often focus on themes of love, devotion, and longing for God. Qawwali is often performed at religious ceremonies and festivals, and is often accompanied by a tabla and harmonium.

name: Halloween
description: Halloween music is a genre of music that is typically used to create a spooky, eerie, or creepy atmosphere. It often features dark, minor-key melodies, sound effects, and samples from horror films. It can range from classical music to electronic music, and is often used in haunted houses, Halloween parties, and other Halloween-themed events.

name: Indian Percussion
description: Indian Percussion is a genre of music that is based on traditional Indian rhythms and percussion instruments. It is characterized by its use of tabla, dholak, mridangam, ghatam, and other Indian percussion instruments. The music is often improvisational and can range from traditional folk music to modern fusion. It is often used in film soundtracks, Bollywood music, and other forms of popular music.

name: Tabla
description: Tabla is a genre of Indian classical music that is characterized by its fast-paced, rhythmic beats. It is typically played on a pair of hand drums called tablas, which are made of wood and have a variety of different sizes and shapes. The tabla is usually accompanied by other instruments such as the harmonium, sitar, and sarangi. Tabla music is often used in Indian classical dance performances, and it is also popular in Bollywood films. The genre is known for its intricate rhythms and complex patterns, and it is often used to create a sense of energy and excitement.

name: Finnish Blues
description: Finnish Blues is a genre of music that originated in Finland in the early 20th century. It is a mix of traditional Finnish folk music and American blues music. It is characterized by its use of minor keys, slow tempos, and a melancholic feel. The lyrics often focus on themes of love, loss, and longing. The instrumentation typically includes acoustic guitar, harmonica, and sometimes a washboard. Finnish Blues has been popularized by artists such as J. Karjalainen, Pepe Ahlqvist, and Erja Lyytinen.

name: Finnish Indie
description: Finnish Indie is a genre of music that originated in Finland in the late 1990s. It is characterized by its use of electronic instruments, often combined with acoustic instruments, and its focus on creating a unique sound. The genre is heavily influenced by indie rock, post-rock, and shoegaze, and often features dreamy, atmospheric soundscapes. It is often characterized by its use of reverb and delay effects, as well as its use of unconventional song structures. Finnish Indie is often seen as a more experimental and progressive form of indie rock, and is often seen as a reflection of the country's unique culture and history.

name: Finnish New Wave

It is characterized by its use of synthesizers, drum machines, and electronic instruments, as well as its incorporation of elements from punk, new wave, and post-punk. The genre is often associated with the Finnish band Hanoi Rocks, who were one of the first bands to incorporate these elements into their sound. name: CCM

It is typically performed by artists who are members of the Christian faith, and it is often characterized by its use of strong vocal harmonies, simple melodies, and lyrics that focus on themes of faith, hope, and love. name: Christian Pop
description: Christian Pop is a genre of popular music that is rooted in Christian themes and values. It is typically characterized by upbeat, catchy melodies and lyrics that focus on themes of faith, hope, and love. It often incorporates elements of other popular music genres such as pop, rock, and hip-hop. It typically includes elements of gospel, folk, and classical music, as well as traditional instruments from various cultures. The lyrics are often focused on praising God and expressing faith. World Worship music is often used in churches and other religious settings to create a global atmosphere of worship.

It is characterized by its use of acoustic instruments, often accompanied by a singer-songwriter's personal lyrics and stories. It often features a mix of acoustic guitar, piano, and other instruments, as well as a variety of vocal styles. name: Worship

Worship music is often characterized by its lyrical content, which is focused on expressing love and devotion to God, and its musical style, which is often upbeat and celebratory.

name: German Opera
description: German Opera is a genre of classical music that originated in Germany during the 17th century. It is characterized by its use of the German language, its focus on grandiose and dramatic stories, and its use of the orchestra and chorus to create a powerful and emotive sound. German Opera is often divided into two main categories: Singspiel and Grand Opera. Singspiel is a lighter form of opera that often includes spoken dialogue and comedic elements, while Grand Opera is a more serious and dramatic form of opera that is usually sung throughout. German Opera is known for its use of leitmotifs, or recurring musical themes, to represent characters and ideas. It is also known for its use of the orchestra to create a powerful and emotive sound.

name: Middle Eastern Traditional
description: Middle Eastern traditional music is a genre of music that has been passed down through generations in the Middle East. It is characterized by its use of traditional instruments such as the oud, qanun, and ney, as well as its use of complex rhythms and scales. It is often accompanied by singing and/or chanting, and is often used to express religious and cultural themes. It is a genre that is deeply rooted in the history and culture of the Middle East, and is still widely performed today.

name: Lebanese Indie
description: Lebanese Indie is a genre of music that combines traditional Middle Eastern sounds with modern indie rock. It is characterized by its use of traditional instruments such as the oud, buzuq, and qanun, as well as electric guitars, synthesizers, and drum machines. The genre often features a mix of traditional and modern vocal styles, and its lyrics often focus on themes of identity, politics, and social issues. Lebanese Indie is a relatively new genre, but it has quickly gained popularity in the Middle East and beyond.

name: Gospel Singers
description: Gospel Singers is a genre of Christian music that is rooted in the traditional African-American spirituals and hymns of the African-American church. It is characterized by its strong vocal harmonies, often accompanied by piano, organ, or guitar. Gospel Singers often incorporate elements of blues, jazz, and soul music into their sound. The lyrics of Gospel Singers are typically focused on praising God and expressing faith in Jesus Christ.

name: South African Choral
description: South African Choral music is a genre of music that is rooted in the traditional choral music of South Africa. It is characterized by its use of traditional African instruments, such as drums, marimbas, and mbiras, as well as its incorporation of traditional African vocal techniques. South African Choral music often features a combination of solo and group singing, and is often accompanied by traditional African dance. It is often performed in a call-and-response style, with the lead singer singing a phrase and the chorus responding. South African Choral music is often used to celebrate important events, such as weddings, funerals, and other important occasions.

name: South African Gospel
description: South African Gospel is a genre of Christian music that originated in South Africa. It is a blend of traditional African music, gospel, and contemporary styles. It is characterized by its upbeat rhythms, soulful melodies, and powerful vocals. The lyrics often focus on themes of faith, hope, and love. South African Gospel is often performed in churches and other religious settings, but it has also become popular in mainstream music venues. It is a vibrant and uplifting genre that has been embraced by many South Africans.

name: Kabyle
description: Kabyle music is a genre of traditional music from the Kabyle people of Algeria. It is characterized by its use of traditional instruments such as the bendir (frame drum), tbal (hand drum), and ghaita (double-reed pipe). The music is often accompanied by singing and dancing, and is often used to celebrate special occasions such as weddings and religious festivals. The lyrics of Kabyle music often focus on themes of love, family, and the beauty of nature.

name: Belgian Modern Jazz
description: Belgian Modern Jazz is a style of jazz music that emerged in Belgium in the late 1950s and early 1960s. It is characterized by its use of complex harmonies, improvisation, and a focus on collective improvisation. It is often seen as a bridge between traditional jazz and the avant-garde. Belgian Modern Jazz is heavily influenced by American jazz, but also incorporates elements of European classical music, as well as African and Latin American rhythms. It is often seen as a more experimental and progressive form of jazz, and is often associated with the free jazz movement.

name: Tollywood
description: Tollywood is a genre of music that originated in the Telugu-speaking region of India. It is a blend of traditional Indian music with modern influences from genres such as hip-hop, rap, and EDM. It is characterized by its upbeat, energetic sound and its use of traditional Indian instruments such as the tabla, sitar, and harmonium. It is often used in Telugu-language films and is popular in the Telugu-speaking states of India.

name: Tamil Hip Hop
description: Tamil Hip Hop is a genre of music that combines traditional Tamil music with elements of hip hop. It is a fusion of Tamil folk music and rap, and often includes elements of reggae, dancehall, and other genres. The lyrics are usually in Tamil, and the beats are often heavily influenced by hip hop. Tamil Hip Hop is popular in India, Sri Lanka, and other countries with large Tamil populations. It has become increasingly popular in recent years, with many artists gaining recognition for their work.

name: Brazilian Techno
description: Brazilian Techno is a style of electronic music that combines elements of Brazilian music with techno and house music. It is characterized by its use of traditional Brazilian rhythms, such as samba and bossa nova, as well as its incorporation of modern electronic production techniques. It is often characterized by its upbeat, energetic sound and its use of samples from Brazilian music. It is popular in clubs and festivals around the world.

name: Welsh Hip Hop
description: Welsh Hip Hop is a genre of music that originated in Wales in the early to mid 80s, with the first Welsh language recordings being released in 1986 and reggae influenced Hip-hop records from Just The Duce aka DJ Jaffa and MC Eric (later of Technotronic) and Time To Panic with Benji Webbe (later of Skindred) coming later that decade. Welsh Hip-hop is often characterized by its focus on Welsh culture, humour and history, with many different regional accents and idiosyncrasies. Along with Welsh Grime and other forms of Rap music, It has become increasingly popular in recent years, both in Wales and internationally, with old skool artists such as 4Dee and Xenith gaining greater recognition alongside many of the newer artists.

name: Malayalam Pop
description: Malayalam Pop is a genre of popular music that originated in the Indian state of Kerala. It is a fusion of traditional Malayalam folk music with modern Western pop music. It is characterized by its upbeat rhythms, catchy melodies, and use of traditional instruments such as the tabla, mridangam, and harmonium. It is often accompanied by traditional dance forms such as Kathakali and Mohiniyattam. Malayalam Pop is popular among the youth of Kerala and is often used in films and television shows.

name: Acid Techno
description: Acid Techno is a subgenre of techno music that emerged in the late 1980s and early 1990s. It is characterized by its use of the Roland TB-303 bass synthesizer and its signature squelching acid sound. It is often characterized by its repetitive, hypnotic, and minimalistic nature, and its use of distorted and distorted vocal samples. It is often associated with the rave and club scenes, and is often played at underground parties.

name: Vietnamese Hip Hop
description: Vietnamese Hip Hop is a genre of music that combines traditional Vietnamese music with modern hip hop elements. It typically features rap lyrics in both English and Vietnamese, as well as traditional Vietnamese instruments such as the đàn tranh and đàn bầu. The genre has become increasingly popular in recent years, with many Vietnamese artists gaining international recognition.

name: Marathi Pop
description: Marathi Pop is a genre of popular music that originated in the Indian state of Maharashtra. It is a fusion of traditional Marathi folk music with modern pop, rock, and hip-hop influences. The genre is characterized by its upbeat, danceable rhythms and catchy melodies. It often features traditional instruments such as the tabla, harmonium, and dholak, as well as modern electronic instruments.
