name: Classic Kollywood
description: Classic Kollywood music is a genre of Indian film music that originated in the Tamil film industry in the 1950s. It is characterized by its melodic, romantic, and often upbeat sound, as well as its use of traditional Indian instruments such as the sitar, tabla, and harmonium. Classic Kollywood music often features a mix of classical Indian and Western musical styles, and is often used to accompany romantic scenes in Tamil films. The genre has been popularized by legendary composers such as Ilaiyaraaja, A. R. Rahman, and M. S. Viswanathan.

name: Classic Konkani Pop
description: Classic Konkani Pop is a genre of music that originated in the Indian state of Goa. It is a fusion of traditional Konkani folk music and modern pop music. It is characterized by its upbeat tempo, catchy melodies, and use of traditional instruments such as the tambura, harmonium, and tabla. The lyrics are often in Konkani, a language spoken in Goa, and often include themes of love, nature, and spirituality. Classic Konkani Pop is popular among both young and old, and is often performed at weddings and other celebrations.

name: Samurai Trap
description: Samurai Trap is a genre of music that combines elements of traditional Japanese music with modern trap music. It typically features a combination of traditional Japanese instruments such as the shamisen, koto, and taiko drums, as well as modern trap elements such as 808s, hi-hats, and synths. The genre is characterized by its hard-hitting, aggressive sound and its use of traditional Japanese melodies and rhythms.

name: Kollywood
description: Kollywood is a term used to refer to the Tamil-language film industry based in Chennai, India. The music associated with this genre is typically characterized by its use of traditional Indian instruments, such as the tabla, mridangam, and veena, as well as modern electronic instruments. It is often characterized by its use of catchy melodies, upbeat rhythms, and a mix of traditional and modern sounds. Kollywood music is often used in Tamil-language films, and is popular throughout India and other parts of the world.

name: Kannada Pop
description: Kannada Pop is a genre of music that originated in the Indian state of Karnataka. It is a fusion of traditional Kannada folk music with modern pop music. It is characterized by its upbeat tempo, catchy melodies, and use of traditional instruments such as the tabla, harmonium, and flute. name: Indian Electronic
description: Indian Electronic music is a genre of music that combines traditional Indian music with modern electronic music production techniques. It is a fusion of traditional Indian instruments and rhythms with modern electronic sounds and production techniques. It often incorporates elements of Indian classical music, folk music, and Bollywood music, as well as elements of hip-hop, dubstep, and other genres. Indian Electronic music is often characterized by its use of traditional Indian instruments such as the sitar, tabla, and sarangi, as well as its incorporation of modern electronic sounds and production techniques. It is a genre that is constantly evolving and has seen a surge in popularity in recent years.

name: Reggae Rock
description: Reggae Rock is a genre of music that combines elements of reggae and rock music. It typically features a strong reggae rhythm section, with electric guitars, drums, and bass playing a more rock-oriented style. Reggae Rock often incorporates elements of ska, dub, and other genres, and often features socially conscious lyrics. Reggae Rock is often associated with the punk and alternative rock scenes, and is popular among fans of both genres.

name: West Coast Reggae
description: West Coast Reggae is a style of reggae music that originated in California in the late 1970s. It is characterized by its laid-back, relaxed sound, often featuring a heavy emphasis on bass and drums. The genre is heavily influenced by the sounds of Jamaica, but also incorporates elements of funk, soul, and hip-hop. West Coast Reggae is often associated with the "California sound" and is popular in the beach cities of California. It is also popular in Hawaii, where it is known as "Island Reggae".

name: Indian Violin
description: Indian Violin is a genre of music that combines traditional Indian music with Western classical music. It is characterized by the use of the violin as the main instrument, often accompanied by tabla, sitar, and other traditional Indian instruments. The music is often improvisational and incorporates elements of both Indian and Western classical music. It is often used in film soundtracks, as well as in live performances.

name: Anime Latino
description: Anime Latino is a genre of music that combines Latin American music styles with Japanese anime music. It is a fusion of Latin American rhythms, such as salsa, merengue, cumbia, and reggaeton, with the melodic and harmonic elements of Japanese anime music. The genre is characterized by its upbeat, energetic sound and its use of Latin American instruments, such as the guitar, maracas, and bongos. Anime Latino is often used as the soundtrack for anime series and films, and is popular among anime fans.

name: Malian Blues
description: Malian Blues is a genre of music that originated in Mali, West Africa. It is a mix of traditional African music, blues, and jazz. It is characterized by its slow, soulful rhythms and its use of traditional African instruments such as the kora, ngoni, and balafon. The lyrics often focus on themes of love, loss, and social issues. It is a popular genre in Mali and has been gaining popularity in the West in recent years.

name: Musique Touareg
description: Musique Touareg is a genre of music from the Tuareg people of the Sahara Desert. It is a mix of traditional African music, Arabic music, and modern Western influences. It is characterized by its use of traditional instruments such as the tinde (a drum), the tidinit (a lute-like instrument), and the tehardent (a stringed instrument). The music is often accompanied by singing and clapping. It is often used to express the culture and history of the Tuareg people, as well as to celebrate special occasions.

name: Western Saharan Folk
description: Western Saharan Folk music is a genre of traditional music from the Western Sahara region of North Africa. It is characterized by its use of traditional instruments such as the tbal (a drum), the ardin (a stringed instrument), and the gasba (a flute). The music is often accompanied by singing and clapping, and is often used to celebrate special occasions such as weddings and religious festivals. The music is typically upbeat and lively, and often incorporates elements of other North African music styles such as Gnawa and Chaabi.

name: Experimental Rock
description: Experimental rock is a genre of rock music that pushes the boundaries of traditional rock music by incorporating elements from other genres, such as jazz, classical, electronic, and avant-garde. It often features unconventional song structures, extended instrumental sections, and unusual sounds and textures. Experimental rock artists often explore new sonic territory and challenge the conventions of traditional rock music. Examples of experimental rock artists include Radiohead, Sonic Youth, and The Flaming Lips.

name: Krautrock
description: Krautrock is a genre of experimental rock music that originated in Germany in the late 1960s and early 1970s. It is characterized by its use of electronic instruments, repetitive rhythms, and a heavy emphasis on improvisation. Krautrock bands often drew influence from a variety of genres, including jazz, classical, and avant-garde music. The genre is often associated with the German bands Can, Kraftwerk, and Neu!.

name: Rock Progressif Francais
description: Rock Progressif Francais (RPF) is a French progressive rock music genre that emerged in the late 1960s and early 1970s. It is characterized by its complex musical structures, often featuring extended instrumental passages, and its use of a variety of instruments, including electric guitars, keyboards, and drums. RPF is often associated with the French avant-garde and is heavily influenced by classical music, jazz, and world music. It is also known for its use of extended improvisation and its focus on creating a unique sound. RPF is often seen as a bridge between classical and rock music, and is often seen as a precursor to the progressive rock movement of the 1970s.

name: Berlin School
description: The Berlin School is a style of electronic music that originated in the 1970s in Berlin, Germany. It is characterized by its use of synthesizers, sequencers, and drum machines to create a hypnotic, repetitive sound. The genre is often associated with the work of pioneering German electronic musicians such as Klaus Schulze, Tangerine Dream, and Kraftwerk. The Berlin School is often seen as a precursor to the modern electronic music genres of ambient, trance, and techno.

name: Ambient Industrial
description: Ambient Industrial is a genre of electronic music that combines elements of ambient music and industrial music. It typically features dark, atmospheric soundscapes, often with a heavy emphasis on rhythm and percussion. It often incorporates elements of noise, drone, and field recordings, as well as samples from other genres such as techno, dub, and hip-hop. Ambient Industrial is often used in film and video game soundtracks, and is often associated with the horror and sci-fi genres.

name: British Industrial
description: British Industrial music is a genre of electronic music that originated in the United Kingdom in the late 1970s. It is characterized by its use of heavy, distorted synthesizers and drum machines, as well as its dark, often dystopian themes. It is heavily influenced by industrial, punk, and post-punk music, and often incorporates elements of noise, ambient, and experimental music. It is often associated with the industrial music scene in the UK, and has been a major influence on many other genres, including industrial metal, industrial rock, and industrial hip-hop.

name: Dark Ambient
description: Dark Ambient is a genre of music that is characterized by its dark, eerie, and often unsettling soundscapes. It often incorporates elements of drone, industrial, and classical music, as well as field recordings and soundscapes. It is often used to create a sense of dread and unease, and can be used to evoke a range of emotions from fear to sadness. Dark Ambient is often used in film and video game soundtracks, as well as in horror and suspense stories.

name: Dub Metal
description: Dub Metal is a genre of music that combines elements of heavy metal and dub music. It typically features distorted guitars, heavy drum beats, and dub-style bass lines. The genre often incorporates elements of reggae, ska, and hip-hop. Dub Metal is characterized by its heavy, distorted sound and its use of dub-style production techniques. It is often seen as a fusion of metal and dub music, and is often used to create a unique and powerful sound.

name: New Isolationism
description: The New Isolationism music genre is a style of music that focuses on creating a sense of solitude and introspection. It is characterized by minimalistic instrumentation, often featuring sparse, ambient soundscapes and minimal beats. The music often has a dreamy, ethereal quality, and is often used to evoke a sense of loneliness and introspection. It is often associated with the post-rock and ambient genres, and is often used in film and television soundtracks.

name: Rajasthani Folk
description: Rajasthani Folk music is a traditional form of music from the Indian state of Rajasthan. It is characterized by its use of traditional instruments such as the sarangi, dholak, and harmonium, as well as its use of traditional vocal styles. Rajasthani Folk music is often accompanied by traditional dance forms such as Ghoomar, Kalbeliya, and Bhavai. The lyrics of Rajasthani Folk songs often tell stories of love, devotion, and the struggles of everyday life. The music is often upbeat and lively, and is often used to celebrate special occasions such as weddings and festivals.

name: Tamil Indie
description: Tamil Indie is a genre of music that combines traditional Tamil folk music with modern indie rock and pop influences. It is characterized by its use of traditional Tamil instruments such as the nadaswaram, thavil, and ghatam, as well as modern instruments like electric guitars, synthesizers, and drum machines. The genre often features lyrics in Tamil, and is often used to express social and political issues. Tamil Indie is popular among young people in India, and has been gaining popularity in the West in recent years.

name: World Devotional
description: World Devotional music is a genre of music that combines traditional spiritual and religious music from around the world with modern musical styles. It often incorporates elements of folk, classical, jazz, and world music, and is often used as a form of meditation or prayer. It is often used in yoga, meditation, and other spiritual practices, and is often used to create a peaceful and calming atmosphere.

name: Sarod
description: Sarod is a classical Indian music genre that originated in the 19th century. It is a stringed instrument that is played with a bow and is similar to the sitar. The sound of the sarod is characterized by a deep, resonant tone and a wide range of expression. It is often used in Hindustani classical music, as well as in film soundtracks and other forms of popular music. The sarod is traditionally played with a combination of plucking and strumming techniques, and is often accompanied by tabla and other percussion instruments.

name: Dutch Jazz
description: Dutch Jazz is a style of jazz music that originated in the Netherlands in the 1950s. It is characterized by its use of traditional Dutch folk music elements, such as the accordion, as well as a more modern jazz sound. Dutch Jazz is often seen as a combination of traditional Dutch folk music and jazz, and is often seen as a more accessible form of jazz. It is often seen as a more accessible form of jazz, as it is often more melodic and less improvisational than other forms of jazz.

name: Dhrupad
description: Dhrupad is a form of Hindustani classical music that originated in the Indian subcontinent. It is one of the oldest forms of North Indian classical music and is considered to be the foundation of Hindustani classical music. Dhrupad is characterized by its slow tempo, deep and meditative mood, and its use of long, sustained notes. It is traditionally performed by a vocalist accompanied by two percussionists playing the pakhawaj and the tabla. The lyrics of Dhrupad are typically in Sanskrit and are based on ancient Hindu texts. Dhrupad is often performed in a call-and-response format, with the vocalist singing a line and the percussionists responding with a rhythmic pattern.

name: Sound Team
description: Sound Team is a genre of music that combines elements of electronic, hip-hop, and rock music. It is characterized by its heavy use of synthesizers, drum machines, and samples, as well as its incorporation of elements from various other genres. It is often characterized by its upbeat, energetic sound, and its focus on creating a unique and interesting soundscape.

name: Jazz Violin
description: Jazz Violin is a genre of music that combines traditional jazz elements with the sound of the violin. It is a unique blend of improvisation, swing, and bebop, with the violin taking the lead role. Jazz Violin often features complex rhythms, intricate melodies, and a wide range of musical styles. It is often performed in small ensembles, with the violinist taking the lead role. Jazz Violin is a great way to explore the possibilities of the violin and to create a unique sound.

name: Healing
description: Healing music is a genre of music that is designed to help the listener relax and reduce stress. It typically features soothing sounds and melodies, often with a slow tempo and minimal instrumentation. It can be instrumental or vocal, and often incorporates elements of nature, such as birdsong, water, and wind. Healing music is often used in therapeutic settings, such as massage, yoga, and meditation.

name: Zen
description: Zen music is a type of music that is designed to help the listener achieve a state of relaxation and inner peace. It is often characterized by its slow, calming tempo and its use of natural sounds such as birdsong, running water, and wind chimes. It is often used in meditation, yoga, and other forms of relaxation.

name: Scottish Singer-Songwriter
description: The Scottish Singer-Songwriter music genre is a style of music that is rooted in traditional Scottish folk music, but with a modern twist. It is characterized by acoustic instruments, often featuring the guitar, and often includes elements of traditional Scottish music such as bagpipes, fiddles, and accordions. The lyrics are often personal and reflective, and the melodies are often melancholic and haunting. The genre has been popularized by artists such as Eddi Reader, Karine Polwart, and King Creosote.

name: St Louis Rap
description: St Louis Rap is a subgenre of hip hop music that originated in St Louis, Missouri. It is characterized by its hard-hitting beats, aggressive lyrics, and a unique style of delivery. The genre is heavily influenced by the city's blues and jazz heritage, as well as its history of gang violence. St Louis Rap is often characterized by its use of samples from classic blues and jazz records, as well as its incorporation of elements from other genres such as funk, soul, and rock. name: Canadian Latin

It is a fusion of Latin American music, such as salsa, merengue, bachata, and reggaeton, with Canadian musical styles, such as rock, pop, folk, and hip-hop. It is a mix of traditional Swedish folk music and modern indie rock, characterized by its use of traditional instruments such as the fiddle, accordion, and nyckelharpa. The genre is often upbeat and energetic, with a focus on traditional melodies and rhythms. It has become increasingly popular in recent years, with many bands and artists emerging from the region.

It is characterized by its raw, lo-fi sound, often featuring distorted guitars, pounding drums, and shouted vocals. The genre draws influence from classic rock and roll, punk, and garage rock, as well as more modern styles such as indie rock and post-punk. It is often characterized by its use of Swedish language lyrics, and its focus on themes of love, relationships, and nostalgia. name: Png Pop

Chilean Rock is often seen as a fusion of traditional Latin American music and rock, and is known for its energetic and passionate sound. It is often characterized by its upbeat, danceable sound and its use of modern production techniques. It is often characterized by its slow, meditative, and calming sound. It is often used in traditional Japanese ceremonies and rituals, as well as in modern music. The music is characterized by its fast tempo and heavy percussion, and the dance style is characterized by its intricate hand and arm movements. Azonto has become popular in many African countries, as well as in Europe and the United States.

The sound is often characterized by acoustic guitars, banjos, and mandolins, as well as a variety of other instruments. The lyrics often focus on themes of love, loss, and the struggles of everyday life. The genre has been popularized by local bands such as The 4onthefloor, The Cactus Blossoms, and The Pines.

name: Experimental Club

It is characterized by its experimental nature, often featuring unconventional sounds, samples, and rhythms. It is often characterized by its use of heavy basslines, distorted synths, and complex drum patterns. It is often seen as a more experimental and avant-garde version of club music, and is often used in live performances.

name: Bulgarian Electronic

The genre is often characterized by its upbeat, energetic sound, and its use of traditional Bulgarian rhythms and melodies. name: Deep Funk House

name: Breaks

name: Bristol Electronic

name: Footwork

name: Argentine Rock

name: Rock Nacional

It is a blend of indie rock, folk, and Americana, with a focus on storytelling and lyrical content. The genre is characterized by its use of acoustic instruments, such as guitars, banjos, and mandolins, as well as its incorporation of traditional Appalachian music. It is often described as having a "rootsy" sound, and is often compared to the music of the American South. Charlotte NC Indie is often associated with the city's vibrant music scene, and is a popular genre among local musicians.

name: Australian Post-Hardcore
description: Australian Post-Hardcore is a subgenre of post-hardcore music that originated in Australia in the early 2000s. It is characterized by its heavy, distorted guitar riffs, aggressive vocals, and intense drumming. The genre often incorporates elements of punk, metal, and alternative rock, and is often lyrically focused on social and political issues. It is often seen as a more melodic and accessible version of hardcore punk, and is often associated with the Australian hardcore punk scene. Popular bands in the genre include Parkway Drive, The Amity Affliction, and Hands Like Houses.

name: Nu-Metalcore
description: Nu-Metalcore is a subgenre of metalcore that combines elements of nu metal and metalcore. It typically features heavy distorted guitars, double bass drumming, and screamed vocals. Nu-Metalcore often incorporates elements of rap, hip-hop, and electronic music, as well as more traditional metalcore elements such as breakdowns and melodic choruses. It is often characterized by its aggressive and intense sound.

name: Post-Post-Hardcore
description: Post-Post-Hardcore is a genre of music that emerged in the early 2000s as a continuation of the post-hardcore sound. It is characterized by a more melodic and experimental approach to the genre, often incorporating elements of indie rock, shoegaze, and dream pop. The sound is often characterized by heavy, distorted guitars, dynamic drumming, and emotionally charged vocals. Post-Post-Hardcore bands often explore themes of alienation, anxiety, and depression, and often have a more introspective and melancholic sound.

name: Australian Metalcore
description: Australian Metalcore is a subgenre of metalcore that originated in Australia in the early 2000s. It is characterized by a mix of metalcore, hardcore punk, and melodic death metal influences. It is often characterized by heavy breakdowns, screamed vocals, and a mix of clean and unclean vocals. It is also known for its use of dual guitar harmonies and melodic leads. Common lyrical themes include personal struggles, social issues, and political themes. Popular Australian Metalcore bands include Parkway Drive, I Killed the Prom Queen, and The Amity Affliction.

name: Dissonant Death Metal
description: Dissonant death metal is a subgenre of death metal that is characterized by its use of dissonant chords and atonal melodies. It is often characterized by its chaotic and unpredictable nature, as well as its use of extreme tempo changes and abrupt transitions. It is often associated with bands such as Deathspell Omega, Ulcerate, and Gorguts.

name: Florida Death Metal
description: Florida Death Metal is a subgenre of death metal that originated in the state of Florida in the late 1980s and early 1990s. It is characterized by its fast tempos, heavily distorted guitars, and guttural vocals. The genre is often associated with bands such as Death, Morbid Angel, and Obituary, who are credited with pioneering the sound. Florida Death Metal is known for its technicality and complexity, as well as its use of blast beats and double-bass drumming. It is also known for its dark and often violent lyrical themes, which often focus on death, religion, and the occult.

name: German Metalcore
description: German Metalcore is a subgenre of metalcore that originated in Germany in the early 2000s. It is characterized by a mix of metalcore and melodic death metal, with a focus on heavy breakdowns and aggressive vocals. The genre is often characterized by its use of double-bass drumming, blast beats, and breakdowns. It also often features clean singing and melodic guitar riffs. German Metalcore bands often draw influence from other genres such as hardcore punk, thrash metal, and groove metal.

name: Nintendocore
description: Nintendocore is a genre of music that combines elements of punk, metal, and electronic music with samples and sound effects from classic Nintendo video games. It typically features heavy distorted guitars, fast-paced drumming, and 8-bit sound effects. The genre is heavily influenced by the chiptune and video game music of the 1980s and 1990s, and often features references to classic Nintendo games such as Super Mario Bros., The Legend of Zelda, and Metroid.

name: Boston Hardcore
description: Boston Hardcore is a subgenre of hardcore punk that originated in the Boston, Massachusetts area in the early 1980s. It is characterized by its fast tempos, aggressive musicianship, and often political lyrics. The sound is heavily influenced by the punk and hardcore scenes of the late 1970s and early 1980s, and is often associated with bands such as SSD, DYS, and Gang Green. Boston Hardcore is known for its DIY ethic and its close-knit community of fans and musicians.

name: Chaotic Hardcore
description: Chaotic Hardcore is a subgenre of hardcore punk that is characterized by its fast, aggressive, and chaotic sound. It often features distorted guitars, shouted vocals, and intense drumming. The lyrics are often politically charged and often focus on social issues. The genre is heavily influenced by the early punk and hardcore punk scenes of the late 1970s and early 1980s.

name: Melodic Hardcore
description: Melodic Hardcore is a subgenre of hardcore punk that combines melodic elements with the aggression and intensity of hardcore punk. It typically features fast tempos, loud distorted guitars, and powerful vocals. The lyrics often focus on personal and political topics, and the music often has a strong sense of melody and emotion. Melodic Hardcore bands often draw influence from other genres such as punk rock, post-hardcore, and metalcore.

name: American Metalcore
description: American Metalcore is a subgenre of heavy metal music that combines elements of hardcore punk and metalcore. It is characterized by its aggressive sound, fast tempos, breakdowns, and screamed vocals. It often features a mix of clean and distorted guitar riffs, double bass drumming, and breakdowns. It is often associated with the New Wave of American Heavy Metal, which emerged in the early 2000s.

name: Connecticut Hardcore
description: Connecticut Hardcore is a subgenre of hardcore punk that originated in the state of Connecticut in the late 1980s and early 1990s. It is characterized by its fast tempos, aggressive vocals, and heavy breakdowns. The lyrics often focus on social and political issues, as well as personal struggles. Connecticut Hardcore bands often incorporate elements of metal and thrash into their sound, creating a unique blend of punk and metal. name: Metallic Hardcore
description: Metallic Hardcore is a subgenre of hardcore punk that combines elements of heavy metal and hardcore punk. It is characterized by its aggressive sound, which often features distorted guitars, double-bass drumming, and screamed vocals. The genre is heavily influenced by thrash metal and crossover thrash, and often incorporates breakdowns and blast beats. Lyrically, metallic hardcore often focuses on themes of social and political issues, as well as personal struggles.

name: Japanese Metalcore
description: Japanese Metalcore is a subgenre of metalcore that originated in Japan. It is characterized by a mix of metalcore and Japanese traditional music, such as taiko drums, shamisen, and koto. It is often characterized by heavy breakdowns, blast beats, and screamed vocals. It is also known for its use of traditional Japanese instruments, such as the shamisen and taiko drums, as well as its incorporation of traditional Japanese melodies and rhythms.

name: Japanese Punk Rock
description: Japanese Punk Rock is a genre of music that originated in Japan in the late 1970s. It is characterized by its fast-paced, aggressive sound and often incorporates elements of punk, rock, and metal. It is often associated with the DIY ethic of punk, and its lyrics often focus on social and political issues. It is also known for its use of Japanese language and cultural references. name: West Virginia Metal
description: West Virginia Metal is a subgenre of heavy metal music that originated in the state of West Virginia in the United States. It is characterized by a mix of thrash metal, death metal, and hardcore punk, with a strong emphasis on groove and technicality. The genre is often characterized by its fast tempos, aggressive guitar riffs, and intense vocal delivery. It is also known for its use of breakdowns and blast beats. Common lyrical themes include social and political issues, as well as personal struggles.

name: Cosmic Black Metal
description: Cosmic Black Metal is a subgenre of black metal that incorporates elements of space-themed atmospheres and cosmic themes. It often features heavily distorted guitars, blast beats, and shrieking vocals. The lyrics often focus on themes of outer space, the universe, and the unknown. Cosmic Black Metal bands often use synthesizers and keyboards to create a dark, eerie atmosphere. The genre is heavily influenced by the works of bands such as Burzum, Emperor, and Darkthrone.

name: New Jersey Hardcore
description: New Jersey Hardcore is a subgenre of hardcore punk that originated in the 1980s in the state of New Jersey. It is characterized by its fast tempos, aggressive vocals, and heavy breakdowns. The lyrics often focus on social and political issues, and the music is often characterized by its heavy use of distortion and feedback. name: Blackened Deathcore

It is characterized by its fast tempos, blast beats, and extreme low-end guitar tones. The vocals are usually a combination of death metal growls and screams, as well as black metal shrieks. The lyrics often focus on dark and nihilistic themes.

name: Brutal Deathcore
description: Brutal Deathcore is a subgenre of death metal and metalcore that combines elements of both genres. It is characterized by its extreme heaviness, fast tempos, and aggressive vocal delivery. The music often features blast beats, breakdowns, and guttural vocals. It is often lyrically focused on topics such as death, violence, and the occult.

name: Trancecore
description: Trancecore is a subgenre of electronic music that combines elements of trance and hardcore. It is characterized by its fast tempo, heavy basslines, and melodic synths. It often features distorted vocals and samples from other genres, such as metal and punk. Trancecore is often associated with the rave and club scenes, and is popular among fans of electronic music.

name: Buffalo NY Metal

It is characterized by a blend of thrash metal, hardcore punk, and traditional heavy metal influences. The sound is often characterized by aggressive, fast-paced riffs, shouted vocals, and a strong emphasis on groove and rhythm. name: Christian Hardcore

It is characterized by aggressive, fast-paced music with distorted guitars and shouted vocals. The lyrics often focus on themes of faith, redemption, and hope, and often contain references to scripture. The genre has been around since the 1980s and has seen a resurgence in recent years.

name: Slovenian Pop

It is characterized by its upbeat, catchy melodies and lyrics that often focus on themes of love, relationships, and partying. It is heavily influenced by Europop, dance, and hip-hop music, and often features synthesizers and electronic beats. name: Slovenian Rock
description: Slovenian Rock is a genre of rock music that originated in Slovenia in the late 1980s. It is heavily influenced by punk, metal, and alternative rock, and is often seen as a combination of these genres. name: British Indie Rock
description: British Indie Rock is a genre of alternative rock music that originated in the United Kingdom in the late 1980s. It is characterized by its use of guitar-driven melodies, often with a strong emphasis on melody and song structure. It typically features a combination of indie rock, post-punk, and new wave influences, and often incorporates elements of other genres such as folk, electronica, and hip hop. name: New Jersey Punk
description: New Jersey Punk is a style of punk rock music that originated in the state of New Jersey in the late 1970s and early 1980s. It is characterized by its fast, aggressive sound and often political lyrics. The genre is heavily influenced by the hardcore punk scene of New York City, but has its own distinct sound and style. name: Christian Punk

It typically features fast-paced, aggressive music with lyrics that focus on Christian themes such as faith, hope, and redemption. The genre has its roots in the punk rock movement of the late 1970s and early 1980s, and has since grown to include a wide variety of styles and subgenres. name: Emo Punk
description: Emo Punk is a genre of music that combines elements of punk rock and emo. It is characterized by its fast-paced, aggressive sound, often featuring distorted guitars, heavy drums, and passionate, often confessional lyrics. It is often associated with the mid-2000s emo revival, and is often seen as a more aggressive version of emo.

name: BC Underground Hip Hop
description: BC Underground Hip Hop is a subgenre of hip hop music that originated in British Columbia, Canada. It is characterized by its hard-hitting beats, aggressive lyrics, and often dark and gritty production. The lyrics often focus on topics such as poverty, crime, and social issues. The sound is heavily influenced by classic East Coast hip hop, but with a distinctly West Coast flavor. Artists in this genre include Swollen Members, Sweatshop Union, and Moka Only.

name: Scam Rap
description: Scam Rap is a genre of hip-hop music that focuses on the hustle and grind of the street life. It often features stories of hustlers, con artists, and other criminals, and often includes references to money, drugs, and other illicit activities. The lyrics often contain braggadocious boasts and boastful tales of success. The beats are usually hard-hitting and often feature samples from classic hip-hop songs.

name: Gainesville Indie
description: Gainesville Indie is a genre of music that originated in Gainesville, Florida in the late 1990s. It is characterized by a mix of punk, folk, and alternative rock influences, often featuring acoustic guitars, melodic vocals, and a DIY aesthetic. The genre is often associated with the Gainesville-based record label No Idea Records, which released albums by bands such as Hot Water Music, Against Me!, and Less Than Jake. Gainesville Indie is known for its energetic live shows and its focus on community and collaboration.

name: Classic Hardstyle
description: Classic Hardstyle is a subgenre of hardstyle music that originated in the Netherlands in the early 2000s. It is characterized by its hard-hitting kick drums, distorted basslines, and melodic synths. Classic Hardstyle is often faster than other hardstyle genres, with tempos ranging from 150 to 160 BPM. It is also known for its use of reverse bass, which is a technique that involves playing a bassline in reverse. Classic Hardstyle is often considered to be the original hardstyle sound, and is still popular today.

name: Euphoric Hardstyle
description: Euphoric Hardstyle is a subgenre of hardstyle music that is characterized by its uplifting and melodic sound. It is often characterized by its use of euphoric synths, melodic breakdowns, and uplifting melodies. It is often seen as a more accessible form of hardstyle, as it is less aggressive and more melodic than other hardstyle subgenres. Euphoric Hardstyle is often used in festivals and events, and is popular among both hardstyle and EDM fans.

name: Welsh Rock
description: Welsh Rock is a genre of music that originated in Wales in the late 1960s and early 1970s. It is a blend of traditional Welsh folk music and rock music, and is characterized by its use of electric guitars, drums, and bass. It is often seen as a precursor to the punk rock movement, and is known for its energetic and often political lyrics. Welsh Rock bands such as Manic Street Preachers, Stereophonics, and Super Furry Animals have achieved international success.

name: Antiviral Pop
description: Antiviral Pop is a genre of music that combines elements of pop music with a darker, more experimental sound. It often features heavy synths, distorted guitars, and electronic drums. The lyrics often focus on themes of isolation, anxiety, and depression. The genre has been popularized by artists such as Billie Eilish, Halsey, and The 1975.

name: Japanese Math Rock
description: Japanese Math Rock is a genre of rock music that originated in Japan in the late 1980s. It is characterized by complex, atypical rhythmic structures, angular melodies, and extended, often dissonant, chords. It is often associated with the post-rock and indie rock genres, and is often instrumental. The genre is heavily influenced by progressive rock, jazz, and punk rock, and is often characterized by a heavy use of syncopation, odd time signatures, and complex guitar riffs.

name: Math Rock
description: Math rock is a genre of rock music that is characterized by complex, atypical rhythmic structures, counterpoint, odd time signatures, angular melodies, and extended, often dissonant, chords. It is often associated with indie rock and post-hardcore. Math rock is often instrumental, but vocals may be included. The genre is often characterized by a focus on technical precision and experimentation, and is often seen as a reaction against traditional rock music.

name: Japanese Guitar
description: Japanese Guitar is a genre of music that combines traditional Japanese instruments and melodies with modern rock and pop guitar styles. It is characterized by its use of traditional Japanese instruments such as the shamisen, koto, and shakuhachi, as well as modern electric guitars, bass, and drums. The genre often features a mix of traditional Japanese melodies and modern rock and pop elements, creating a unique sound that is both familiar and exotic. It is often used in anime and video game soundtracks, as well as in live performances.

name: Hip Hop Tuga
description: Hip Hop Tuga is a Portuguese hip hop music genre that originated in Portugal in the early 2000s. It is characterized by its use of Portuguese slang and references to Portuguese culture, as well as its incorporation of traditional Portuguese music styles such as fado and morna. The genre is heavily influenced by American hip hop, but also incorporates elements of reggae, dancehall, and trap. It is often characterized by its hard-hitting beats and aggressive lyrics.

name: Trap Tuga
description: Trap Tuga is a Portuguese hip-hop and trap music genre that originated in Portugal in the early 2010s. It is characterized by its heavy use of 808 bass, trap-style hi-hats, and melodic synths. The lyrics often focus on topics such as money, drugs, and street life. Trap Tuga is often seen as a more aggressive and darker version of the traditional Portuguese hip-hop sound. It has become increasingly popular in Portugal and is now being heard in clubs and on the radio.

name: South African Hip Hop
description: South African Hip Hop is a genre of music that originated in South Africa in the late 1980s. It is a fusion of traditional African music, jazz, and rap. It is characterized by its use of African languages, its incorporation of traditional African instruments, and its focus on social and political issues. South African Hip Hop is often seen as a form of protest music, as it often speaks out against the injustices of the South African government and its people. It is also known for its upbeat, danceable beats and its use of samples from other genres.

name: South African Trap
description: South African Trap is a genre of hip-hop music that originated in South Africa. It is characterized by its heavy use of 808s, trap drums, and melodic synths. It often features a mix of English and African languages, and its lyrics often focus on topics such as money, power, and street life. South African Trap has become increasingly popular in recent years, with artists such as Nasty C, A-Reece, and Emtee leading the way.

name: Jawaiian
description: Jawaiian is a genre of music that combines traditional Hawaiian music with reggae and hip-hop. It originated in Hawaii in the late 1990s and has since become popular in other parts of the world. The genre is characterized by its upbeat, danceable rhythms, and its incorporation of traditional Hawaiian instruments such as the ukulele and steel guitar. Jawaiian lyrics often focus on themes of love, peace, and unity.

name: Riddim
description: Riddim is a genre of Jamaican dancehall music that is characterized by a repetitive two-bar rhythm pattern. It is often accompanied by a heavy bassline and a variety of vocal samples and sound effects. Riddim is often used as a foundation for other genres of music, such as reggae, dub, and hip-hop. It is also used as a basis for remixes and mashups.

name: Japanese Boom Bap
description: Japanese Boom Bap is a subgenre of hip hop music that originated in Japan in the early 2000s. It is characterized by its heavy use of samples from classic hip hop records, often from the golden age of hip hop in the late 1980s and early 1990s. It is also known for its hard-hitting drums, often with a heavy emphasis on the snare and kick drum. The genre is heavily influenced by the classic New York hip hop sound, but with a distinctly Japanese flavor. It is often characterized by its use of traditional Japanese instruments, such as the shamisen, koto, and taiko drums.

name: Russian Alt Pop
description: Russian Alt Pop is a genre of music that combines elements of alternative rock, pop, and electronic music with traditional Russian folk music. It is characterized by its use of traditional Russian instruments such as balalaikas, bayans, and domras, as well as modern electronic production techniques. The genre has become increasingly popular in recent years, with artists such as Little Big, IC3PEAK, and Monetochka gaining international recognition.

name: Russian Electronic

It is often characterized by its dark, melancholic sound, and its use of distorted basslines and heavy beats. name: Kolsche Karneval
description: Kolsche Karneval is a traditional music genre from the Cologne region of Germany. It is a type of carnival music that is typically played during the annual carnival season in the city of Cologne. The music is characterized by its upbeat, cheerful sound and its use of traditional instruments such as accordions, clarinets, and drums. It is often accompanied by singing and dancing. The lyrics of Kolsche Karneval songs often focus on themes of love, friendship, and celebration.

name: Anarcho-Punk
description: Anarcho-punk is a subgenre of punk rock that developed in the early 1980s. It is characterized by its lyrical content which often focuses on anarchist and anti-authoritarian themes, as well as its DIY ethic and its rejection of mainstream culture. Musically, it is often characterized by fast tempos, distorted guitars, and aggressive vocals. It is closely related to the hardcore punk and crust punk genres. name: Russian Trap

It often features a mix of Russian and English lyrics, and samples from Russian folk music. It has become increasingly popular in Russia and other parts of the world, and has been described as a mix of trap, hip-hop, and EDM.

name: Neue Deutsche Welle
description: Neue Deutsche Welle (New German Wave) is a genre of German music that emerged in the late 1970s and early 1980s. It is a combination of punk, new wave, and electronic music, and is characterized by its use of synthesizers, drum machines, and electronic sounds. The lyrics often focus on social and political issues, and the music often has a danceable, upbeat feel. The genre was popular in Germany and other parts of Europe, and some of its most famous artists include Nena, Trio, and D.A.F.

name: Derby Indie

It is a mix of indie rock, post-punk, and alternative rock, with a strong emphasis on melody and atmosphere. The genre is characterized by its use of reverb-heavy guitars, driving bass lines, and often sparse, atmospheric drumming. The genre is often characterized by its upbeat, danceable sound, and its use of catchy melodies and hooks. It is often seen as a combination of traditional Russian music and modern electronic music.

name: Barnalog
description: Barnalog is a genre of music that combines elements of traditional bluegrass and folk music with modern electronic music production. It is characterized by its use of acoustic instruments such as banjos, mandolins, and fiddles, as well as electronic elements such as synthesizers, drum machines, and samples. The genre is often upbeat and energetic, and often incorporates elements of hip-hop and other genres.

name: Russian Indie

The lyrics often focus on social and political issues, and the music often has a melancholic and dreamy feel. name: German Pop Rock

name: Liedermacher
description: Liedermacher is a German music genre that is often referred to as "songwriter music". It is a form of folk music that is characterized by its poetic lyrics and often political messages. The genre is often associated with protest songs and social commentary. It is typically performed solo, with the singer accompanying themselves on guitar or piano. The lyrics are often personal and introspective, and the music is often simple and melodic.

It is typically characterized by its use of traditional instruments such as the violin, accordion, and clarinet, as well as its use of traditional vocal styles. It is often performed in a lively, upbeat style, and is often accompanied by dancing. It is often used to celebrate special occasions such as weddings, holidays, and other important events.

It is characterized by its use of samples from classic German pop and rock songs, as well as its focus on social and political issues. Oldschool Deutschrap is often seen as the foundation of the modern German hip hop scene, and its influence can still be heard in the music of today.

name: Mandolin
description: Mandolin music is a genre of folk music that originated in the 18th century in Europe. It is typically played on a small, stringed instrument called a mandolin. The music is characterized by its bright, cheerful sound and often features intricate melodies and complex rhythms. It is often played in a duo or trio setting, with the mandolin taking the lead role. Mandolin music is popular in many countries, including the United States, Italy, and Greece.

It typically features acoustic instruments such as ukulele, steel guitar, and slack key guitar, as well as electric instruments like bass and drums. The genre often incorporates elements of reggae, folk, and jazz, and is often characterized by its laid-back, relaxed vibe. name: OPM
description: OPM (Original Pilipino Music) is a genre of music that originated in the Philippines. It is a mix of traditional Filipino music, such as folk and indigenous music, as well as modern influences from around the world. OPM is characterized by its upbeat, melodic sound and often incorporates elements of jazz, rock, and pop. It is often sung in Tagalog, the national language of the Philippines. name: Pinoy Reggae

The genre is characterized by its upbeat, danceable rhythms and its incorporation of traditional Filipino instruments such as the kulintang, gong, and agung. name: Pinoy Rock
description: Pinoy Rock is a genre of Filipino rock music that originated in the Philippines in the late 1960s. It is characterized by its heavy use of electric guitars, bass guitars, drums, and vocals, as well as its incorporation of traditional Filipino instruments such as the kulintang and the kubing. Pinoy Rock is heavily influenced by Western rock music, but also incorporates elements of traditional Filipino music, such as the use of indigenous instruments and vocal styles. It is often characterized by its upbeat, energetic sound and its lyrics, which often focus on themes of love, friendship, and Filipino culture.

name: Tagalog Rap
description: Tagalog Rap is a genre of music that originated in the Philippines. It is a fusion of traditional Filipino music and hip-hop, and is characterized by its fast-paced, rhythmic beats and lyrics that are often in Tagalog, the national language of the Philippines. Tagalog Rap is often seen as a form of protest music, as it often speaks to the struggles of the Filipino people and their culture. It is also known for its use of sampling, which often includes traditional Filipino instruments and melodies.

name: South African Alternative
description: South African Alternative music is a genre of music that originated in South Africa in the late 1990s. It is a fusion of traditional African music, jazz, rock, and hip-hop. It is characterized by its use of African rhythms, instruments, and vocal styles, as well as its incorporation of elements from other genres. It is often seen as a form of protest music, as it often deals with issues of social injustice and inequality. description: Korean Indie Folk is a genre of music that combines traditional Korean folk music with modern indie rock and pop influences. It typically features acoustic instruments such as the gayageum (a traditional Korean zither) and the haegeum (a two-stringed fiddle), as well as electric guitars, drums, and synthesizers. The genre often incorporates traditional Korean vocal styles, such as pansori (a type of narrative singing) and jeongga (a type of lyrical singing). Korean Indie Folk is often characterized by its upbeat, melodic sound and its use of traditional Korean instruments and vocal styles.

name: Korean Singer-Songwriter
description: Korean Singer-Songwriter is a genre of music that is characterized by its intimate, personal lyrics and acoustic instrumentation. It is often associated with the Korean indie music scene and is often seen as a more introspective and personal style of music. The genre often features solo artists or small groups of musicians, and the lyrics often focus on themes of love, heartbreak, and personal growth. The instrumentation is usually acoustic, featuring guitars, pianos, and other stringed instruments. The genre has become increasingly popular in recent years, with many Korean artists gaining international recognition.

name: Korean OST
description: Korean OST (Original Soundtrack) is a genre of music that is featured in Korean television dramas, films, and other media. It typically consists of melodic, sentimental ballads and instrumentals that are used to underscore the emotions of the characters and the story. The genre often features traditional Korean instruments such as the gayageum, haegeum, and janggu, as well as modern instruments such as the piano, guitar, and synthesizer. Korean OSTs are often performed by popular K-pop artists, and have become increasingly popular in recent years.

name: Japanese Folk
description: Japanese Folk music is a genre of traditional music from Japan that dates back centuries. It is characterized by its use of traditional instruments such as the shamisen, koto, and shakuhachi, as well as its use of traditional vocal styles. It is often performed in a call-and-response style, with the lead singer singing a phrase and the chorus responding. It is often accompanied by traditional dance and is often used to tell stories or express emotions. It is a genre that is deeply rooted in Japanese culture and is still popular today.

name: Japanese Beats
description: Japanese Beats is a genre of music that combines traditional Japanese music with modern electronic music. It is characterized by its use of traditional Japanese instruments such as the shamisen, koto, and taiko drums, as well as modern electronic elements such as synthesizers, drum machines, and samples. The genre often features a mix of traditional and modern sounds, creating a unique and eclectic sound. It is often used in anime and video game soundtracks, as well as in popular music.

name: Korean Old School Hip Hop

name: Japanese Shoegaze

The genre has been popularized by bands such as Boris, Mono, and My Bloody Valentine, and has been embraced by a wide range of artists from around the world.

name: Mandopop

name: Turbo Folk

name: Rap Montrealais

name: Classic Schlager

name: Rap Calme

name: Japanese IDM
description: Japanese IDM (Intelligent Dance Music) is a genre of electronic music that originated in Japan in the late 1990s. It is characterized by its experimental, abstract, and often complex soundscapes, often featuring a combination of traditional Japanese instruments and modern electronic production techniques. It is often characterized by its use of glitchy, distorted sounds, and its incorporation of elements from other genres such as hip-hop, jazz, and ambient music. It is often seen as a more experimental and abstract form of electronic music, and is often seen as a bridge between traditional Japanese music and modern electronic music.

name: Japanese Techno
description: Japanese Techno is a genre of electronic music that originated in Japan in the late 1980s. It is characterized by its fast-paced, upbeat sound and its use of synthesizers and drum machines. It often incorporates elements of traditional Japanese music, such as taiko drums and shamisen. It is often associated with the Japanese underground club scene and is popular in both Japan and abroad.

name: German DnB
description: German DnB is a subgenre of drum and bass music that originated in Germany. It is characterized by its hard-hitting, fast-paced beats and heavy basslines. It often incorporates elements of techno, trance, and dubstep, as well as other electronic music genres. German DnB is known for its intense energy and often features complex, layered rhythms and soundscapes. It is often associated with the rave and club scenes in Germany.

name: GbVfi
description: GbVfi (or Guided by Voices-influenced) is a genre of indie rock music that is heavily influenced by the lo-fi, DIY aesthetic of the American indie rock band Guided by Voices. It is characterized by its use of short, melodic songs with simple, often repetitive lyrics, and its reliance on lo-fi production techniques such as distorted guitars, tape hiss, and minimal overdubs. The genre is often associated with the mid-1990s indie rock scene, and is often seen as a precursor to the lo-fi indie rock of the 2000s.

name: Dark Black Metal
description: Dark Black Metal is a subgenre of extreme metal music that emerged in the early 1990s. It is characterized by its fast tempos, shrieking vocals, and heavily distorted guitars. The lyrics often focus on themes of death, despair, and the occult. Dark Black Metal bands often use keyboards and synthesizers to create a dark, atmospheric sound. The genre is often associated with Satanism and anti-Christian themes.

name: American Grindcore
description: American Grindcore is a subgenre of extreme metal music that combines elements of grindcore, hardcore punk, and death metal. It is characterized by its fast tempos, heavily distorted guitars, and blast beats. The lyrics often focus on social and political issues, and the vocals are usually screamed or shouted. The genre originated in the United States in the late 1980s and early 1990s, and has since spread to other countries.

name: Brutal Death Metal
description: Brutal Death Metal is a subgenre of death metal that is characterized by its intense and aggressive sound. It is often characterized by fast tempos, heavily distorted guitars, deep guttural vocals, and complex song structures. It is often associated with themes of violence, death, and destruction. It is also known for its use of blast beats and breakdowns.

name: Crust Punk
description: Crust punk is a style of punk rock that emerged in the early 1980s in the UK. It is characterized by a raw, aggressive sound, often with distorted guitars and fast tempos. The lyrics often focus on social and political issues, such as poverty, war, and environmental destruction. The style is heavily influenced by hardcore punk, thrash metal, and anarcho-punk. It is often associated with the DIY ethic, and is often seen as a more extreme version of punk rock.

name: Deathgrind
description: Deathgrind is a subgenre of extreme metal music that combines elements of death metal and grindcore. It is characterized by fast tempos, blast beats, and heavily distorted guitars. The vocals are usually guttural and growled, and the lyrics often focus on death, violence, and gore. Deathgrind is often considered to be a more extreme version of death metal, and it is often associated with bands such as Napalm Death, Carcass, and Terrorizer.

name: Grindcore
description: Grindcore is an extreme subgenre of heavy metal and hardcore punk that originated in the early 1980s. It is characterized by fast tempos, heavily distorted guitars, blast beats, and vocals that range from shouted to screamed. Grindcore lyrics often focus on political and social issues, and the lyrics are often confrontational and aggressive. Grindcore is often associated with other extreme metal genres such as death metal and black metal.

name: New York Death Metal
description: New York Death Metal is a subgenre of death metal that originated in the New York City area in the late 1980s and early 1990s. It is characterized by a fast, aggressive sound, often featuring blast beats, double bass drumming, and extreme vocal styles. The lyrics often focus on themes of death, violence, and the occult. The genre is heavily influenced by thrash metal, hardcore punk, and traditional heavy metal. Notable bands in the genre include Suffocation, Immolation, and Incantation.

name: Powerviolence
description: Powerviolence is a genre of hardcore punk and extreme metal music that combines elements of thrashcore, grindcore, and hardcore punk. It is characterized by its fast tempos, heavy riffs, and aggressive vocals. The genre is known for its chaotic and often dissonant sound, as well as its lyrical themes of social alienation, political oppression, and personal angst. Powerviolence is often associated with the DIY punk scene and is often seen as a more extreme version of hardcore punk.

name: Australian Hardcore
description: Australian Hardcore is a style of punk rock music that originated in Australia in the late 1980s. It is characterized by fast tempos, aggressive vocals, and distorted guitars. The lyrics often focus on social and political issues, and the music is often associated with the DIY ethic of punk. It is heavily influenced by the American hardcore punk scene, but has its own unique sound and style.

name: Minneapolis Punk
description: Minneapolis Punk is a genre of punk rock music that originated in Minneapolis, Minnesota in the late 1970s and early 1980s. It is characterized by its fast, aggressive sound and its DIY ethic. The genre is heavily influenced by the punk rock of the late 1970s, as well as the hardcore punk of the early 1980s. It is also known for its political and social commentary, often addressing issues such as racism, sexism, and classism. Minneapolis Punk bands often feature a mix of punk, hardcore, and metal elements, and often incorporate elements of funk, jazz, and reggae. Notable bands in the genre include Hüsker Dü, The Replacements, and Soul Asylum.

name: Argentine Punk
description: Argentine Punk is a style of punk rock that originated in Argentina in the late 1970s. It is characterized by its aggressive, fast-paced sound and its lyrics, which often focus on social and political issues. The genre is heavily influenced by British and American punk, as well as Latin American music styles such as cumbia and tango. Argentine Punk bands often incorporate traditional instruments such as the charango and the bombo legüero into their sound. The genre has been influential in the development of other Latin American punk styles, such as Chilean Punk and Mexican Punk.

name: Latincore
description: Latincore is a fusion genre of Latin music and hardcore punk. It combines the fast tempos and aggressive instrumentation of hardcore punk with the rhythms and melodies of Latin music, such as salsa, cumbia, and reggaeton. It is often characterized by heavy guitar riffs, fast drumming, and shouted vocals. The lyrics often focus on social and political issues, such as immigration, poverty, and racism.

name: Emocore
description: Emocore is a subgenre of punk rock and alternative rock that emerged in the mid-1980s. It is characterized by its emotionally charged lyrics, often dealing with topics such as heartbreak, loneliness, and depression. Musically, Emocore is often characterized by its fast tempos, distorted guitars, and melodic vocals. It is often associated with the DIY ethic of punk rock, and is often seen as a precursor to the emo and post-hardcore genres.

name: Orgcore
description: Orgcore is a subgenre of hardcore punk that emerged in the early 2000s. It is characterized by its fast tempos, aggressive vocals, and heavy use of distortion. The lyrics often focus on topics such as animal rights, environmentalism, and anti-capitalist themes. Musically, it is heavily influenced by classic hardcore punk bands such as Minor Threat, Black Flag, and Bad Brains. It is also known for its DIY ethic and its emphasis on creating a community of like-minded individuals.

name: Cavernous Death Metal
description: Cavernous Death Metal is a subgenre of death metal that is characterized by its dark, oppressive atmosphere and its use of reverberating, echoing guitar riffs and drum patterns. It is often characterized by its slow, heavy, and repetitive riffs, and its use of low-pitched growls and screams. It is often associated with the occult and horror themes, and its lyrics often focus on death, despair, and the macabre.

name: Irish Black Metal
description: Irish Black Metal is a subgenre of black metal that originated in Ireland in the early 2000s. It is characterized by its use of traditional Irish instruments such as the tin whistle, bodhrán, and uilleann pipes, as well as its incorporation of Celtic and folk influences. Irish Black Metal bands often use Gaelic lyrics and themes, and often incorporate traditional Irish melodies into their music. The genre is known for its raw, aggressive sound and its use of blast beats and tremolo picking.

name: Irish Death Metal
description: Irish Death Metal is a subgenre of death metal that originated in Ireland in the early 1990s. It is characterized by its fast tempos, aggressive guitar riffs, and growled vocals. The lyrics often focus on themes of Irish mythology, Celtic history, and Irish folklore. Irish Death Metal bands often incorporate traditional Irish instruments such as the tin whistle, bodhrán, and uilleann pipes into their music. The genre has been popularized by bands such as Primordial, Cruachan, and Mourning Beloveth.

name: Irish Metal
description: Irish Metal is a subgenre of heavy metal music that originated in Ireland in the late 1980s and early 1990s. It is characterized by a blend of traditional Irish folk music with heavy metal, often featuring traditional instruments such as the tin whistle, fiddle, and bodhrán. Irish Metal bands often incorporate Celtic mythology and imagery into their lyrics and artwork. The genre is often associated with bands such as Primordial, Cruachan, and Waylander.

name: Black Thrash
description: Black Thrash is a subgenre of thrash metal that combines elements of traditional thrash metal with black metal. It is characterized by fast tempos, aggressive guitar riffs, and harsh vocals. The lyrics often focus on themes of death, destruction, and the occult. It is characterized by its fast tempo and complex rhythms, as well as its use of traditional instruments such as the kora, balafon, and djembe. The lyrics of Wassoulou songs often focus on themes of love, social justice, and the struggles of everyday life. name: Bandoneon

The instrument is played with both hands, with the left hand playing the melody and the right hand playing the accompaniment. This genre of music is often characterized by its use of ornamentation, improvisation, and contrapuntal textures. NWOTHM bands often draw influence from the classic heavy metal bands of the 1980s, such as Iron Maiden, Judas Priest, and Dio. It typically features a mix of traditional African instruments, such as kalimbas, talking drums, and balafons, with electric guitars, synthesizers, and other modern instruments. Afro Psych is a vibrant and eclectic genre that is gaining popularity in the music world.

It is a fusion of traditional African music, jazz, highlife, funk, and psychedelic rock. The genre is often associated with the music of Fela Kuti, who is credited with popularizing the style. name: Powwow

The music is often accompanied by traditional instruments such as drums, rattles, and flutes. The songs are usually in a call-and-response format, with a lead singer and a chorus of singers. Powwow music is an important part of many Native American cultures and is used to celebrate special occasions, such as weddings, births, and other important events.

The genre is often characterized by its use of traditional folk instruments, such as the kannel (a type of zither), as well as its incorporation of traditional Estonian folk music. name: Yoik
description: Yoik is a traditional form of music from the Sámi people of northern Scandinavia. It is a form of vocal music that is used to express emotions and tell stories. Yoik is traditionally performed by a solo singer, but can also be performed by a group. The lyrics of a yoik are often improvised and can be about anything from nature to personal experiences. The music is characterized by a repetitive, chant-like melody and a strong sense of rhythm. Yoik is an important part of Sámi culture and is still performed today.

name: UKHC

name: Psych Gaze

It is characterized by its dreamy, ethereal soundscapes, often featuring heavily distorted guitars, reverb-drenched vocals, and lush, layered production. It typically features militaristic percussion, martial drums, and martial-style vocals, as well as synthesizers, samples, and other electronic elements. It is characterized by a strong beat, twangy guitars, and a focus on traditional country instrumentation such as fiddles, steel guitars, and harmonicas. The lyrics often focus on themes of heartache, drinking, and lost love. Honky Tonk is often seen as a precursor to modern country music.

name: Khaliji
description: Khaliji music is a genre of music originating from the Persian Gulf region. It is characterized by its upbeat rhythms and traditional instruments such as the oud, buzuq, and qanun. It is often accompanied by traditional dance styles such as the dabke. The lyrics of Khaliji music often focus on themes of love, nostalgia, and patriotism. It is popular throughout the Middle East and North Africa, and has been gaining popularity in the West in recent years.

name: Musique Mariage Algerien
description: Musique Mariage Algerien is a genre of Algerian wedding music that is typically played at weddings and other celebratory events. It is a mix of traditional Algerian music, modern pop, and traditional folk music. It is characterized by its upbeat rhythms and lively melodies, often featuring traditional instruments such as the oud, darbuka, and qanun. The lyrics often focus on themes of love, joy, and celebration.

name: Korean Classical Performance
description: Korean Classical Performance is a genre of traditional Korean music that dates back to the Joseon Dynasty (1392-1910). It is characterized by its use of traditional instruments such as the gayageum (12-string zither), haegeum (two-stringed fiddle), and daegeum (bamboo flute). The music is often performed in a slow, meditative style, and is often accompanied by traditional Korean dance. It is a genre that is deeply rooted in Korean culture and history, and is still performed today in both traditional and modern contexts.

name: Korean Classical Piano
description: Korean Classical Piano is a genre of music that combines traditional Korean music with classical piano. It is characterized by its use of traditional Korean instruments such as the gayageum, haegeum, and janggu, as well as classical piano. The music often features a combination of traditional Korean melodies and rhythms with classical piano techniques, such as arpeggios, scales, and chords. It is a genre that is both modern and traditional, and is often used in film and television soundtracks.

name: Egyptian Alternative

It is characterized by its use of traditional instruments such as the oud, tabla, and qanun, as well as modern instruments such as electric guitars, synthesizers, and drum machines. The genre often incorporates elements of jazz, funk, and hip-hop, and is often heavily influenced by traditional Egyptian folk music. name: Traditional Ska
description: Traditional Ska is a style of music that originated in Jamaica in the late 1950s. It is a combination of Caribbean mento and calypso with American jazz and rhythm and blues. It is characterized by a walking bass line accented with rhythms on the off-beat. The tempo is usually up-tempo and the music is often accompanied by horns, guitars, and keyboards. The lyrics often focus on social and political issues. Traditional Ska is the foundation of the Ska, Rocksteady, and Reggae genres.

name: Moroccan Pop

It is characterized by its upbeat rhythms, catchy melodies, and a mix of traditional and modern instruments. The lyrics are usually in Moroccan Arabic, but may also include French, Spanish, and English. name: Nightcore

The genre is often associated with the anime and video game music scenes, and is often used in fan-made remixes of popular songs.
