It is characterized by its use of Flemish dialects and slang, as well as its focus on social and political issues. The genre has become increasingly popular in recent years, with many artists gaining international recognition. Vlaamse Rap is often characterized by its hard-hitting beats, aggressive lyrics, and its incorporation of traditional Flemish folk music.

name: Belgian Post-Rock
description: Belgian Post-Rock is a genre of music that combines elements of post-rock, ambient, and experimental music. It is characterized by its use of atmospheric soundscapes, often featuring long, drawn-out compositions with minimalistic instrumentation. The genre is heavily influenced by the shoegaze and post-rock scenes of the 1990s, and often incorporates elements of jazz, classical, and electronic music. Belgian Post-Rock is often characterized by its dreamy, ethereal soundscapes, and its focus on creating a sense of atmosphere and emotion.

name: Flemish Folk
description: Flemish Folk is a genre of traditional music from the Flanders region of Belgium. It is characterized by its use of traditional instruments such as the accordion, fiddle, and bagpipes, as well as its use of traditional vocal styles. The music often has a strong danceable beat and is often accompanied by clapping and stomping. It is often performed in a festive atmosphere and is often used to celebrate special occasions such as weddings and festivals.

name: Irish Indie
description: Irish Indie is a genre of music that originated in Ireland in the late 1980s and early 1990s. It is characterized by its use of traditional Irish instruments such as the fiddle, tin whistle, and bodhrán, as well as electric guitars, bass, and drums. Irish Indie is often associated with the Celtic rock and folk rock genres, and is known for its upbeat, energetic sound. Popular Irish Indie bands include The Cranberries, The Frames, and The Corrs.

name: Salsa Choke
description: Salsa Choke is a style of music that originated in Colombia in the late 1990s. It is a fusion of traditional salsa music with elements of hip-hop, reggaeton, and other Latin American genres. It is characterized by its fast-paced rhythms, heavy percussion, and catchy melodies. The lyrics often focus on themes of love, partying, and having a good time.

name: Indie Fuzzpop
description: Indie Fuzzpop is a genre of music that combines elements of indie rock, pop, and shoegaze. It is characterized by its dreamy, ethereal sound, often featuring distorted guitars, reverb-drenched vocals, and a heavy emphasis on atmosphere. The genre is often seen as a bridge between indie rock and shoegaze, combining the melodic sensibilities of the former with the sonic experimentation of the latter.

name: Cincinnati Indie
description: Cincinnati Indie is a genre of music that originated in Cincinnati, Ohio. It is a blend of indie rock, folk, and Americana, with a focus on storytelling and lyrical content. The sound is often characterized by acoustic guitars, banjos, mandolins, and other stringed instruments, as well as a variety of percussion instruments. The lyrics often focus on themes of love, loss, and nostalgia, and the music often has a melancholic feel. Cincinnati Indie is often compared to the music of artists such as Ryan Adams, The Avett Brothers, and The Head and the Heart.

name: Puerto Rican Indie
description: Puerto Rican Indie is a genre of music that combines traditional Puerto Rican music with modern indie rock. It is characterized by its use of traditional instruments such as the cuatro, güiro, and maracas, as well as electric guitars, synthesizers, and drum machines. The genre often incorporates elements of reggae, ska, and hip-hop, and is often sung in Spanish. Puerto Rican Indie is a vibrant and diverse genre that has been gaining popularity in recent years.

name: Fidget House
description: Fidget House is a genre of electronic dance music that originated in the UK in the early 2000s. It is characterized by its fast tempo, heavy basslines, and distorted synths. It is often associated with the electroclash and nu-rave scenes, and is often seen as a precursor to the dubstep genre. Fidget House is known for its use of samples, often from classic house and techno records, as well as its use of vocal snippets and sound effects. It is often seen as a more aggressive and energetic form of house music.

name: Go-Go
description: Go-Go is a subgenre of funk music that originated in Washington, D.C. in the late 1960s. It is characterized by a heavy beat, call-and-response vocals, and a strong emphasis on percussion. It is often associated with the city's African American community and is often seen as a form of expression for the city's youth. Go-Go is often seen as a precursor to hip-hop and has been sampled by many hip-hop artists.

name: Croatian Indie
description: Croatian Indie is a genre of music that originated in Croatia in the late 1990s. It is a mix of alternative rock, indie rock, post-rock, and electronic music. It is characterized by its experimental nature, often incorporating elements of jazz, classical, and folk music. The lyrics are often poetic and introspective, and the instrumentation is often minimalistic. The genre has been gaining popularity in recent years, with many Croatian indie bands gaining international recognition.

name: Croatian Hip Hop
description: Croatian Hip Hop is a genre of music that originated in Croatia in the late 1990s. It is characterized by its use of samples from traditional Croatian folk music, as well as its incorporation of elements from other genres such as reggae, funk, and jazz. The lyrics often focus on topics such as social issues, politics, and everyday life. The genre has become increasingly popular in recent years, with many Croatian artists gaining international recognition.

name: Serbian Hip Hop
description: Serbian Hip Hop is a genre of music that originated in Serbia in the early 1990s. It is characterized by its use of samples from traditional Serbian folk music, as well as its incorporation of elements from other genres such as jazz, funk, and reggae. The lyrics often focus on social and political issues, and the music is often characterized by its hard-hitting beats and aggressive delivery. Serbian Hip Hop has become increasingly popular in recent years, and has been embraced by both the mainstream and underground music scenes in Serbia.

name: Yugoslav New Wave
description: The Yugoslav New Wave was a genre of popular music that emerged in the former Yugoslavia in the late 1970s and early 1980s. It was a blend of rock, pop, and folk music, with influences from jazz, blues, and classical music. The genre was characterized by its use of synthesizers, electric guitars, and drum machines, as well as its incorporation of traditional folk instruments such as the accordion and tamburitza. The lyrics often dealt with themes of love, freedom, and social justice. The Yugoslav New Wave was popular throughout the former Yugoslavia and was a major influence on the development of rock music in the region.

name: Serbian Alternative Rock
description: Serbian Alternative Rock is a genre of rock music that originated in Serbia in the late 1980s and early 1990s. It is characterized by its heavy use of distorted guitars, aggressive vocals, and a mix of traditional Serbian folk music with modern rock influences. The genre is often associated with the punk and grunge movements of the 1990s, and is known for its dark, brooding sound. It has been described as a mix of "hardcore punk, post-punk, and gothic rock." Popular Serbian Alternative Rock bands include Partibrejkers, Ekatarina Velika, and Darkwood Dub.

name: Serbian Indie
description: Serbian Indie is a genre of music that originated in Serbia in the early 2000s. It is a mix of alternative rock, post-punk, and electronic music, with influences from traditional Serbian folk music. The genre is characterized by its use of synthesizers, drum machines, and electronic effects, as well as its often melancholic and introspective lyrics. Serbian Indie bands often incorporate traditional Serbian instruments such as the gusle and tamburica into their music. The genre has become increasingly popular in recent years, with bands such as Partibrejkers, Darkwood Dub, and Repetitor gaining international recognition.

name: Balkan Trap
description: The Balkan Trap music genre is a style of electronic music that originated in the Balkans region of Europe. It is characterized by a mix of traditional Balkan folk music with modern electronic production techniques, such as trap beats, synthesizers, and samples. The genre has become popular in recent years, with artists such as Gogol Bordello, Balkan Beat Box, and Shantel leading the way. The music is often characterized by its upbeat, energetic sound, and its use of traditional Balkan instruments such as the accordion, clarinet, and tambura.

name: Croatian Pop
description: Croatian Pop is a genre of popular music that originated in Croatia in the late 1980s. It is a mix of traditional Croatian folk music, rock, and pop music. It is characterized by its upbeat, catchy melodies and often incorporates traditional instruments such as the tamburica, accordion, and violin. It is often sung in Croatian, but some songs are also sung in English. Popular Croatian Pop artists include Severina, Magazin, and Novi Fosili.

name: Croatian Rock
description: Croatian Rock is a genre of rock music that originated in Croatia in the late 1960s and early 1970s. It is characterized by its heavy use of electric guitars, bass, drums, and keyboards, as well as its incorporation of traditional Croatian folk music elements. The genre is often associated with the New Wave of British Heavy Metal, and is known for its hard-driving, energetic sound. It has been a major influence on the development of Croatian popular music, and has been cited as an influence on the development of other genres such as punk rock and alternative rock.

name: Yugoslav Rock
description: Yugoslav Rock is a genre of rock music that originated in the former Yugoslavia in the 1960s and 1970s. It is characterized by its use of traditional folk music elements, such as traditional instruments, vocal styles, and lyrical themes. It is often seen as a combination of rock and folk music, and is heavily influenced by the traditional music of the region. It is often seen as a precursor to the punk and new wave movements of the 1980s.

name: Korean Trap
description: Korean Trap is a subgenre of hip-hop music that originated in South Korea. It is characterized by its heavy use of 808 bass, trap-style hi-hats, and synthesizers. It often features a mix of Korean and English lyrics, and often incorporates elements of EDM, K-pop, and traditional Korean music. It is often associated with the Korean hip-hop scene, and is popular among both Korean and international audiences.

name: British Black Metal
description: British Black Metal is a subgenre of extreme metal music that originated in the United Kingdom in the early 1990s. It is characterized by its fast tempos, aggressive guitar riffs, and dark, often Satanic lyrical themes. It is often associated with the Norwegian black metal scene, but has its own distinct sound and style. British black metal bands often incorporate elements of folk music, classical music, and progressive rock into their sound. The genre is known for its raw, lo-fi production and its emphasis on atmosphere and emotion.

name: Slavic Folk Metal
description: Slavic Folk Metal is a subgenre of metal music that combines traditional Slavic folk music with heavy metal. It typically features traditional instruments such as the bagpipes, accordion, and balalaika, as well as metal elements such as distorted guitars, double bass drums, and growling vocals. The lyrics often focus on Slavic mythology, history, and culture. The genre has become increasingly popular in recent years, with bands such as Arkona, Korpiklaani, and Alkonost leading the way.

name: Seattle Metal
description: Seattle Metal is a subgenre of heavy metal music that originated in Seattle, Washington in the late 1980s and early 1990s. It is characterized by its aggressive sound, often featuring distorted guitars, fast tempos, and intense vocals. It is also known for its melodic elements, which often incorporate elements of traditional metal, punk, and hardcore. Seattle Metal bands often draw influence from the grunge scene of the city, and many of the bands from the genre have gone on to become major influences in the metal world.

name: Death 'N' Roll
description: Death 'N' Roll is a subgenre of heavy metal music that combines elements of death metal and hard rock. It is characterized by a heavy, distorted guitar sound, fast tempos, and aggressive vocals. The lyrics often focus on themes of death, violence, and the occult. Death 'N' Roll is often seen as a bridge between the two genres, combining the speed and aggression of death metal with the catchiness and accessibility of hard rock.

name: Technical Groove Metal
description: Technical Groove Metal is a subgenre of metal music that combines elements of groove metal, thrash metal, and progressive metal. It is characterized by its heavy, distorted guitar riffs, complex drum patterns, and aggressive vocals. The music often features intricate guitar solos and technical drumming, as well as a wide range of tempos and time signatures. The lyrics often focus on themes of aggression, violence, and social issues.

name: New Wave Of Thrash Metal
description: The New Wave of Thrash Metal is a subgenre of heavy metal music that emerged in the early 2000s. It is characterized by a faster tempo, more aggressive guitar riffs, and a more intense vocal delivery than traditional thrash metal. The genre is often associated with bands such as Lamb of God, Trivium, and Killswitch Engage. The New Wave of Thrash Metal is often seen as a revival of the classic thrash metal sound of the 1980s, but with a modern twist.

name: Italian Black Metal
description: Italian Black Metal is a subgenre of black metal that originated in Italy in the early 1990s. It is characterized by its raw, aggressive sound, often featuring distorted guitars, blast beats, and shrieking vocals. The lyrics often focus on themes of death, destruction, and the occult. The genre has been heavily influenced by the Norwegian black metal scene, but has also incorporated elements of traditional Italian folk music and classical music.

name: Melodic Progressive Metal
description: Melodic Progressive Metal is a subgenre of metal music that combines elements of progressive metal with melodic elements. It is characterized by complex song structures, intricate guitar riffs, and often incorporates elements of classical music, jazz, and folk music. The vocals are usually clean and melodic, and the lyrics often focus on philosophical and spiritual themes. Melodic Progressive Metal is often seen as a bridge between traditional metal and progressive metal, and is often seen as a more accessible form of progressive metal.

name: Neo-Trad Metal
description: Neo-Trad Metal is a subgenre of heavy metal music that combines traditional heavy metal elements with modern production techniques. It typically features a mix of classic metal riffs, melodic vocals, and aggressive drumming. The genre is often characterized by its use of double-kick drums, palm-muted guitar riffs, and soaring vocal melodies. It is also known for its incorporation of elements from other genres, such as progressive metal, power metal, and thrash metal.

name: German Pagan Metal
description: German Pagan Metal is a subgenre of metal music that combines elements of traditional German folk music with heavy metal. It typically features traditional instruments such as the hurdy-gurdy, bagpipes, and flutes, as well as distorted electric guitars and drums. The lyrics often focus on Germanic mythology, folklore, and nature. The genre is often associated with bands such as Falkenbach, Moonsorrow, and Finsterforst.

name: Oulu Metal
description: Oulu Metal is a subgenre of metal music that originated in the city of Oulu, Finland. It is characterized by a heavy, aggressive sound, often featuring distorted guitars, double-bass drumming, and harsh vocals. The genre is heavily influenced by Scandinavian death metal, thrash metal, and black metal, but also incorporates elements of hardcore punk and melodic death metal. Oulu Metal bands often have a strong DIY ethic, and many of them are self-released. Notable bands in the genre include Impaled Nazarene, Turmion Kätilöt, and Mokoma.

name: Brazilian Groove Metal
description: Brazilian Groove Metal is a subgenre of heavy metal music that originated in Brazil in the early 2000s. It combines elements of traditional heavy metal with a more modern, groove-oriented sound. The genre is characterized by its heavy, distorted guitar riffs, aggressive drumming, and intense vocal delivery. It often features a mix of clean and distorted vocals, as well as a variety of other instruments such as keyboards, synthesizers, and samples. The lyrics often focus on themes of social and political issues, as well as personal struggles.

name: Brazilian Thrash Metal
description: Brazilian Thrash Metal is a subgenre of Thrash Metal that originated in Brazil in the late 1980s. It is characterized by its fast tempos, aggressive guitar riffs, and often political lyrics. The genre is heavily influenced by the classic thrash metal bands of the 1980s such as Metallica, Slayer, and Megadeth, as well as the Brazilian punk scene. Brazilian Thrash Metal bands often incorporate elements of traditional Brazilian music such as samba and bossa nova into their sound. The genre has become increasingly popular in recent years, with bands such as Sepultura, Nervosa, and Ratos de Porão gaining international recognition.

name: Metal Mineiro
description: Metal Mineiro is a heavy metal music genre that originated in the Brazilian state of Minas Gerais. It is characterized by its aggressive sound, fast tempos, and heavy guitar riffs. The lyrics often focus on themes of social injustice, politics, and religion. The genre has been influenced by a variety of other metal genres, including thrash metal, death metal, and black metal. It is often associated with the city of Belo Horizonte, which is considered the birthplace of the genre.

name: Neo-Trad Doom Metal
description: Neo-Trad Doom Metal is a subgenre of heavy metal music that combines traditional doom metal with elements of traditional heavy metal and hard rock. It is characterized by slow tempos, heavy riffs, and a focus on atmosphere and emotion. The genre often features lyrics that are dark and introspective, and instrumentation that is often heavily distorted and layered. Commonly used instruments include electric guitars, bass, drums, and keyboards.

name: Austrian Metal
description: Austrian Metal is a subgenre of heavy metal music that originated in Austria in the late 1980s and early 1990s. It is characterized by a melodic, mid-tempo sound, often featuring clean vocals and a mix of traditional heavy metal and thrash metal influences. The genre is often associated with bands such as Pungent Stench, Belphegor, and Hollenthon. Austrian Metal is known for its technical proficiency and melodic approach, as well as its use of keyboards and synthesizers to create a unique sound.

name: Arab Metal
description: Arab Metal is a subgenre of metal music that combines traditional Middle Eastern music with heavy metal. It typically features traditional Middle Eastern instruments such as the oud, the qanun, and the darbuka, as well as electric guitars, bass, and drums. The lyrics are often in Arabic, and the themes often focus on Middle Eastern culture and politics. Arab Metal bands often incorporate elements of traditional Middle Eastern music, such as maqam, into their sound.

name: Kentucky Punk
description: Kentucky Punk is a genre of punk rock music that originated in the state of Kentucky in the late 1990s. It is characterized by a mix of punk, hardcore, and alternative rock influences, often with a Southern twang. The genre is known for its fast-paced, aggressive sound and its lyrical themes of rebellion, social issues, and personal struggles. It is often associated with bands such as Slint, Rodan, and The National.

name: Symphonic Melodic Death Metal
description: Symphonic Melodic Death Metal is a subgenre of metal music that combines elements of melodic death metal with symphonic metal. It is characterized by heavy guitar riffs, blast beats, and growled vocals, as well as the use of keyboards and orchestral instruments to create a more symphonic sound. The genre is often characterized by its use of complex song structures, intricate guitar solos, and melodic vocal lines. Symphonic Melodic Death Metal is often seen as a combination of the aggression of death metal and the melodic elements of power metal.

name: Finnish Progressive Metal
description: Finnish Progressive Metal is a subgenre of metal music that originated in Finland in the early 1990s. It is characterized by its complex song structures, intricate guitar work, and heavy use of keyboards and synthesizers. It often incorporates elements of jazz, classical, and folk music, as well as progressive rock. It is often characterized by its dark and melancholic atmosphere, and its use of extended instrumental passages. It is also known for its use of odd time signatures and polyrhythms. Notable bands in this genre include Amorphis, Wintersun, and Insomnium.

name: Synthwave Brasileiro
description: Synthwave Brasileiro is a genre of electronic music that originated in Brazil in the early 2000s. It is characterized by its use of synthesizers, drum machines, and other electronic instruments to create a retro-futuristic sound. The genre draws heavily from 1980s synthpop, new wave, and electro-funk, as well as incorporating elements of Brazilian music such as samba and bossa nova. Synthwave Brasileiro is often characterized by its upbeat, energetic sound, and its use of catchy melodies and hooks. It is often used in film and television soundtracks, as well as in video games.

name: Indonesian EDM
description: Indonesian EDM is a genre of electronic dance music that originated in Indonesia. It is characterized by its upbeat, energetic sound and its use of traditional Indonesian instruments and rhythms. It often incorporates elements of traditional Indonesian music, such as gamelan, as well as modern electronic music production techniques. It is popular in clubs and festivals throughout Indonesia and has become increasingly popular in other parts of the world.

name: Greek Drill
description: Greek Drill is a subgenre of hip hop music that originated in Greece in the early 2010s. It is characterized by its hard-hitting, aggressive beats and lyrics that often focus on themes of crime, violence, and street life. Greek Drill is heavily influenced by the UK Drill sound, but with a distinct Greek flavor. It is often characterized by its dark, menacing production and its use of Greek slang and references to Greek culture.

name: Austin Hip Hop
description: Austin Hip Hop is a subgenre of hip hop music that originated in Austin, Texas. It is characterized by its laid-back, soulful sound, often incorporating elements of jazz, blues, and funk. It is often characterized by its use of live instrumentation, such as drums, bass, and guitar, as well as samples from classic soul and funk records. Austin Hip Hop is often lyrically conscious, with many artists focusing on social and political issues. It is also known for its vibrant and diverse music scene, with many artists collaborating and creating unique sounds.

name: Beats
description: Beats is a genre of electronic music that is characterized by a heavy emphasis on rhythm and bass. It is often characterized by a repetitive, four-on-the-floor beat, and often incorporates elements of hip-hop, trap, and dubstep. Beats often feature samples from other genres, such as jazz, funk, and soul. Beats are often used as a backdrop for rap and spoken word performances.

name: Telugu Devotional
description: Telugu Devotional music is a genre of music that is dedicated to the worship of Hindu gods and goddesses. It is a form of devotional music that is sung in the Telugu language, which is spoken in the southern Indian state of Andhra Pradesh. The music is typically composed in a traditional Carnatic style and is often accompanied by traditional instruments such as the mridangam, ghatam, and tabla. The lyrics of Telugu Devotional music are usually based on Hindu scriptures and are often written in praise of the gods and goddesses. The music is often used in religious ceremonies and festivals, and is also popular among devotees of Hinduism.

name: Armenian Hip Hop
description: Armenian Hip Hop is a genre of music that combines traditional Armenian music with elements of hip hop, rap, and R&B. It is characterized by its use of traditional Armenian instruments, such as the duduk, zurna, and dhol, as well as modern hip hop production techniques. The lyrics often focus on themes of Armenian identity, culture, and history. Armenian Hip Hop has become increasingly popular in recent years, with many artists gaining international recognition.

name: African Electronic
description: African Electronic music is a genre of music that combines traditional African rhythms and melodies with modern electronic music production techniques. It is a fusion of African music and electronic music, often incorporating elements of hip-hop, house, dubstep, and other genres. African Electronic music is often characterized by its use of African percussion instruments, such as djembes, talking drums, and shakers, as well as synthesizers, drum machines, and other electronic instruments. It is a genre that is constantly evolving, as producers and musicians from around the world continue to explore the possibilities of combining African music with modern production techniques.

name: Asakaa
description: Asakaa is a genre of music that originated in Ghana in the late 1990s. It is a fusion of traditional Ghanaian highlife music and hip hop, and is characterized by its fast tempo and heavy use of synthesizers and samples. The lyrics often focus on social issues and are often sung in the local dialect of the Ga people. Asakaa is popular among the youth of Ghana and is often performed at parties and clubs.

name: Tanzanian Pop
description: Tanzanian Pop is a genre of popular music that originated in Tanzania in the late 1990s. It is a fusion of traditional African music, hip hop, R&B, and reggae. The genre is characterized by its upbeat rhythms, catchy melodies, and use of traditional African instruments. Tanzanian Pop is often seen as a reflection of the country's culture and is popular among both young and old. It is often used in films, television shows, and commercials.

name: Classic K-Pop
description: Classic K-Pop is a genre of music that originated in South Korea in the 1990s. It is characterized by its upbeat, catchy melodies, and often incorporates elements of hip-hop, R&B, and electronic music. Classic K-Pop is often associated with the "idol" culture of South Korea, where groups of young singers and dancers are groomed and marketed to become stars. Classic K-Pop is often seen as a representation of South Korean culture, and is popular both domestically and internationally.

name: Final Fantasy
description: The Final Fantasy music genre is a type of video game music composed for the popular role-playing video game series of the same name. It is characterized by its melodic, often epic, and often emotionally charged soundtracks. The music is composed by a variety of composers, including Nobuo Uematsu, Hitoshi Sakimoto, Masashi Hamauzu, and Yoko Shimomura. The music often features a mix of orchestral, electronic, and choral elements, and is often used to set the mood and atmosphere of the game.

name: Chinese R&B
description: Chinese R&B is a genre of music that combines elements of traditional Chinese music with modern R&B. It typically features a mix of traditional Chinese instruments, such as the erhu, guzheng, and pipa, with modern R&B production techniques, such as synthesizers, drum machines, and samples. Chinese R&B often incorporates elements of hip-hop, jazz, and pop music, and is often sung in both Mandarin and English. It is a relatively new genre, having emerged in the early 2000s, and is popular among young Chinese audiences.

name: Taiwan Pop
description: Taiwan Pop, also known as Mandopop, is a genre of popular music originating in Taiwan. It is a blend of traditional Chinese music and Western pop music, and is characterized by its catchy melodies, simple lyrics, and upbeat rhythms. It is often sung in Mandarin Chinese, and is popular among both young and old audiences. Taiwan Pop is often seen as a bridge between traditional Chinese music and modern Western pop music, and has become increasingly popular in recent years.

name: Taiwan Singer-Songwriter
description: Taiwan Singer-Songwriter is a genre of music that originated in Taiwan and is characterized by its lyrical content and acoustic instrumentation. It is often associated with folk music, but it also incorporates elements of pop, rock, and jazz. The lyrics are often personal and reflective, and the music is often characterized by its melodic and harmonic complexity. The genre has been popularized by artists such as Jay Chou, A-Mei, and Mayday.

name: Chinese Indie
description: Chinese Indie music is a genre of music that originated in China and is characterized by its independent, DIY approach to production and promotion. It is often characterized by its use of traditional Chinese instruments, such as the guzheng, erhu, and pipa, as well as modern electronic instruments. It is also known for its incorporation of elements from other genres, such as hip-hop, rock, and jazz. Chinese Indie music is often seen as a form of protest against the mainstream Chinese music industry, and its artists often use their music to express their views on social and political issues.

name: Taiwan Hip Hop
description: Taiwan Hip Hop is a genre of music that originated in Taiwan in the late 1990s. It is a fusion of traditional Chinese music, rap, and R&B. It is characterized by its use of Chinese language, as well as its incorporation of traditional Chinese instruments and melodies. It is often seen as a form of protest music, as it often deals with topics such as social injustice, poverty, and political issues. It has become increasingly popular in recent years, with many artists gaining international recognition.

name: Rogaland Musikk
description: Rogaland Musikk is a traditional folk music genre from the Rogaland region of Norway. It is characterized by its use of traditional instruments such as the Hardanger fiddle, the langeleik, and the willow flute, as well as its use of traditional vocal styles. It is often performed in a lively, upbeat style, and is often accompanied by dancing. It is a popular genre of music in Norway, and is often performed at festivals and other events.

name: Crack Rock Steady
description: Crack Rock Steady is a genre of music that originated in the late 1990s in New York City. It is a fusion of punk rock, ska, and hardcore hip hop. The genre is characterized by its fast-paced, aggressive sound, often featuring distorted guitars, heavy drums, and shouted vocals. The lyrics often focus on topics such as poverty, drug addiction, and violence. The genre has been heavily influenced by bands such as The Clash, Bad Brains, and Beastie Boys.

name: Chinese Minyao
description: Chinese Minyao is a traditional Chinese folk music genre that originated in the late 19th century. It is characterized by its simple, melodic tunes and lyrics that often tell stories of everyday life. The music is usually performed by a small ensemble of instruments, including the erhu (a two-stringed bowed instrument), the pipa (a four-stringed plucked instrument), and the sanxian (a three-stringed plucked instrument). The genre is often accompanied by clapping and singing, and is often used to accompany storytelling and other forms of traditional Chinese performance.

name: Zhongguo Feng
description: Zhongguo Feng (中国风) is a genre of Chinese popular music that emerged in the late 1980s and early 1990s. It is characterized by its use of traditional Chinese instruments, such as the erhu, pipa, and guzheng, as well as its incorporation of elements from traditional Chinese music, such as pentatonic scales and traditional Chinese melodies. It is often seen as a fusion of traditional Chinese music and modern pop music, and is often used in film and television soundtracks.

name: Lute
description: Lute music is a genre of music that originated in the Middle Ages and Renaissance periods. It is characterized by its use of the lute, a stringed instrument with a fretted neck and a flat back. The lute was used to accompany vocal music, as well as to play solo pieces. The music is often characterized by its intricate melodies and complex rhythms. It is often played in a slow, meditative style, and is often used in religious ceremonies.

name: Classic Mandopop
description: Classic Mandopop is a genre of popular Chinese music that originated in Taiwan in the 1950s. It is characterized by its use of traditional Chinese instruments, such as the erhu, pipa, and guzheng, as well as its incorporation of Western musical elements, such as jazz and rock. Classic Mandopop is often characterized by its romantic and sentimental lyrics, as well as its melodic and upbeat sound. It is a popular genre of music in both Taiwan and mainland China, and has been influential in the development of other genres of Chinese music.

name: Hokkaido Indie
description: Hokkaido Indie is a genre of music that originated in the Hokkaido region of Japan. It is characterized by its upbeat, melodic sound, often featuring acoustic guitars, synthesizers, and electronic drums. The genre is heavily influenced by traditional Japanese music, as well as modern pop and rock. It is often described as a mix of folk, rock, and electronic music. Hokkaido Indie is often associated with the indie music scene in Japan, and is popular among young people in the region.

name: Baroque Cello
description: Baroque Cello is a genre of classical music that originated in the 17th and 18th centuries. It is characterized by its use of the cello as the main instrument, often accompanied by other instruments such as the harpsichord, lute, and viola da gamba. The music is often characterized by its ornate and intricate melodic lines, as well as its use of counterpoint and fugue. Baroque Cello music is often seen as a precursor to the modern classical music of the 19th and 20th centuries.

name: Hakkapop
description: Hakkapop is a genre of music that originated in Japan in the late 1990s. It is a mix of traditional Japanese music, hip-hop, and electronic music. It is characterized by its upbeat, energetic sound and its use of traditional Japanese instruments such as the shamisen, koto, and taiko drums. The lyrics often focus on themes of love, friendship, and nostalgia. It is a popular genre in Japan and has been gaining popularity in other countries as well.

name: Taiwanese Indigenous
description: Taiwanese Indigenous music is a genre of traditional music from Taiwan that is rooted in the culture of the island's indigenous peoples. It is characterized by its use of traditional instruments such as the lute, flute, and drums, as well as its unique vocal style. The music often incorporates elements of folk music, as well as influences from Chinese and Japanese music. name: Gnawa
description: Gnawa is a traditional music genre from North Africa, particularly Morocco and Algeria. It is a mix of African, Berber, and Islamic influences, and is characterized by its use of the guembri, a three-stringed lute, and the qraqeb, metal castanets. The music is often accompanied by singing and dancing, and is used in rituals to invoke spiritual healing. Gnawa music is often used in celebrations and festivals, and is a popular form of entertainment in North Africa.

name: Pop Paraguayo
description: Pop Paraguayo is a genre of popular music from Paraguay that combines traditional Paraguayan folk music with elements of Latin American pop music. It is characterized by its upbeat rhythms, catchy melodies, and use of traditional Paraguayan instruments such as the harp, guitar, and accordion. The lyrics often focus on themes of love, family, and patriotism. Popular Pop Paraguayo artists include Los Kjarkas, Los Chalchaleros, and Los Cardenales.

name: Venezuelan Hip Hop

name: Jumpstyle
description: Jumpstyle is a type of electronic dance music that originated in Belgium in the early 2000s. It is characterized by its fast-paced, hard-hitting beats and heavy basslines. The genre is often associated with the hardstyle subgenre, but it is distinct in its use of a four-on-the-floor rhythm and a more melodic approach. Jumpstyle is often accompanied by a unique dance style, which involves jumping and stomping in time with the music.

name: Hardstyle
description: Hardstyle is a type of electronic dance music that originated in the Netherlands in the early 2000s. It is characterized by a heavy bassline, distorted kick drums, and a fast tempo (usually around 150-160 BPM). Hardstyle often incorporates elements of hard trance, hardcore, and gabber. It is a mix of indie rock, post-punk, and alternative rock, with a strong emphasis on melody and atmosphere. name: Deathrock
description: Deathrock is a subgenre of punk rock that emerged in the late 1970s and early 1980s. It combines elements of punk, gothic rock, and horror punk, and is characterized by dark, morbid lyrics and a gloomy, macabre atmosphere. Deathrock bands often incorporate horror movie imagery and horror-themed lyrics into their music, and often feature a heavy, distorted guitar sound. name: Polish Hardcore

The lyrics often focus on social and political issues, and the music is often seen as a form of protest. The genre has been heavily influenced by American and British punk rock, as well as thrash metal and hardcore punk. Polish Hardcore bands often incorporate elements of traditional Polish folk music, such as accordion and violin, into their sound.

name: Polish Punk
description: Polish Punk is a genre of punk rock music that originated in Poland in the late 1970s. It is characterized by its fast, aggressive sound and often political lyrics. It is often associated with the Solidarity movement of the 1980s, which sought to end the communist rule in Poland. name: American Shoegaze
description: American Shoegaze is a subgenre of alternative rock that emerged in the early 1990s. It is characterized by a dreamy, ethereal soundscape, often featuring heavily distorted guitars, reverb-drenched vocals, and a wall of sound production. The genre is heavily influenced by the British shoegaze scene of the late 1980s and early 1990s, but with a distinctly American twist. American Shoegaze bands often incorporate elements of punk, indie rock, and post-rock into their sound. Notable American Shoegaze bands include My Bloody Valentine, Slowdive, Lush, and Swirlies.

name: Nederlandse Hardstyle

The genre is often associated with the Dutch hardstyle scene, which is known for its high-energy, intense sound. Nederlandse Hardstyle is often characterized by its use of hard kicks, screeching synths, and distorted basslines. It is often used in festivals and clubs, and is popular among hardstyle fans.

name: Riddim Dubstep

name: College A Cappella

College A Cappella is often characterized by its upbeat, energetic sound and its use of vocal percussion. name: Remix Product
description: The Remix Product music genre is a type of electronic music that is created by taking existing songs and remixing them to create a new version. Remix Product music is often characterized by its heavy use of sampling, synthesizers, and drum machines. It is often used in clubs and dance music, and is often seen as a way to create a new version of a classic song.

name: Jamgrass
description: Jamgrass is a genre of music that combines elements of bluegrass, jazz, and jam band music. The genre is often associated with the Grateful Dead and Phish, two of the most influential jam bands of all time. name: Maine Indie
description: Maine Indie is a genre of music that originated in Maine and is characterized by its use of acoustic instruments, folk-inspired melodies, and often introspective lyrics. name: Historic Piano Performance
description: Historic Piano Performance is a genre of classical music that focuses on the performance of piano works from the Baroque, Classical, and Romantic eras. It is characterized by a focus on the technical and interpretive aspects of the music, as well as the historical context of the works. The genre often features performances of works by composers such as Bach, Mozart, Beethoven, Chopin, and Schumann.

name: Ragtime
description: Ragtime is a style of music that originated in the late 19th century in the United States. It is a syncopated, syncopated style of music that combines elements of African-American music, such as blues and jazz, with European classical music. Ragtime is characterized by a steady, syncopated rhythm, often with a strong emphasis on the off-beat. It is usually played on the piano, but can also be performed on other instruments. Ragtime is often associated with the early 20th century, and is often used in films and television shows to evoke a sense of nostalgia.

name: Boogie-Woogie
description: Boogie-Woogie is a style of blues piano playing that originated in the late 1920s and early 1930s. It is characterized by a steady, repetitive left-hand bass pattern, often in the form of eighth notes, and a syncopated right-hand melody. Boogie-Woogie is often played in a fast tempo and is often associated with a lively, upbeat sound. It is often used as a dance music and is often accompanied by a horn section.

name: Kentucky Indie
description: The Kentucky Indie music genre is a blend of folk, rock, and country music that originated in the state of Kentucky. The genre is often associated with the bluegrass and folk music of the region, and is often seen as a more modern take on traditional Appalachian music. name: Kentucky Roots
description: Kentucky Roots music is a genre of Americana music that draws from the traditional folk, bluegrass, and country music of the Appalachian region of Kentucky. It is characterized by its use of traditional instruments such as the banjo, fiddle, and guitar, as well as its focus on storytelling and lyrical content. name: Classical Mandolin

It is characterized by its use of traditional classical techniques, such as arpeggios, tremolos, and vibrato, as well as its use of traditional classical forms, such as sonatas, concertos, and symphonies. It is often performed as a solo instrument, but can also be performed in ensembles with other instruments, such as strings, woodwinds, and brass.

name: Concertina
description: Concertina music is a style of traditional Irish music that is played on a concertina, a small, portable, bellows-driven instrument. It is characterized by its fast-paced, lively rhythms and melodic ornamentation. The concertina is often used to accompany traditional Irish dance music, and is also used in a variety of other musical genres, including folk, jazz, and classical. Concertina music is often played in a session setting, with multiple musicians playing together in an improvisational style.

name: Irish Dance
description: Irish Dance music is a genre of traditional Irish music that is used for competitive Irish stepdancing. It is characterized by its fast tempo and driving rhythms, often featuring a combination of traditional instruments such as the fiddle, tin whistle, and bodhrán. The music is often composed in a set of reels, jigs, and hornpipes, and is often accompanied by a piano or accordion. Irish Dance music is often used in competitions and performances, and is a popular genre of music for Irish stepdancers.

name: Irish Neo-Traditional
description: Irish Neo-Traditional music is a genre of traditional Irish music that has been modernized and updated with contemporary influences. It is often characterized by a strong emphasis on melody and rhythm, as well as a focus on traditional instruments such as the fiddle, tin whistle, and bodhrán. name: Jig And Reel
description: Jig and Reel is a traditional Irish folk music genre that originated in the 18th century. It is characterized by a fast-paced, lively tempo and often features a combination of fiddle, flute, accordion, and other instruments. The jig is a dance tune, usually in 6/8 time, while the reel is a more lyrical tune, usually in 4/4 time. The two are often combined in a medley, with the jig providing the upbeat energy and the reel providing the more lyrical melody. Jig and Reel music is often played at Irish pubs and festivals, and is a popular form of traditional Irish music.

name: Lafayette Indie

The sound is characterized by a mix of acoustic and electric instruments, including accordion, fiddle, guitar, and drums. The lyrics often focus on the culture and history of the region, as well as personal stories and reflections. name: Neurostep

Neurostep often features a wide range of tempos, from slow and atmospheric to fast and aggressive. It is characterized by its use of synthesizers, drum machines, and other electronic instruments to create a unique sound. The genre is heavily influenced by the synthpop and new wave music of the time, but with a more experimental and abstract approach. description: Cubaton is a Cuban-influenced music genre that combines traditional Cuban rhythms with modern electronic music. It is characterized by its upbeat, danceable rhythms and its use of traditional Cuban instruments such as the clave, maracas, and bongos. It is often sung in Spanish and incorporates elements of reggaeton, hip-hop, and Latin pop. Cubaton is popular in Latin America and has become increasingly popular in the United States.

name: Mbira
description: Mbira music is a traditional genre of music from Zimbabwe and Mozambique. It is characterized by the use of a mbira, a type of thumb piano, as the main instrument. The mbira is usually accompanied by percussion instruments such as drums and hosho (shakers). The music is often used in ceremonies and rituals, and is often associated with spiritual and healing practices. The music is typically characterized by a repetitive, trance-like rhythm and a call-and-response structure.

name: Sungura
description: Sungura is a popular music genre in Zimbabwe and other parts of Southern Africa. It is a fusion of traditional African rhythms and instruments with modern electric guitar and drums. Sungura is characterized by its fast tempo and upbeat rhythms, and often features call-and-response vocals. The lyrics are often about love, politics, and social issues. Sungura is a popular genre for dancing and is often played at weddings and other celebrations.

It is characterized by its upbeat rhythms, catchy hooks, and socially conscious lyrics. The genre has become increasingly popular in Zimbabwe and other parts of Africa, and has been embraced by a new generation of African youth.

name: Kwaito

Kwaito is often seen as a reflection of the struggles and triumphs of South African youth, and its lyrics often address social issues such as poverty, crime, and HIV/AIDS. Kwaito has become a popular genre in South Africa and is often seen as a symbol of South African identity.

name: Naija Worship

name: Didgeridoo
description: Didgeridoo music is a genre of music that originated in Australia and is traditionally played by Indigenous Australians. It is characterized by a deep, drone-like sound created by the player using circular breathing and vocalizations. The instrument is usually made from a hollowed-out eucalyptus branch and is played with a wooden stick. The music is often accompanied by clapsticks, drums, and other percussion instruments. Didgeridoo music is often used in ceremonies and rituals, and is also used in contemporary music styles such as jazz, rock, and world music.

name: Plunderphonics
description: Plunderphonics is a genre of experimental music that involves the creative re-contextualization of existing audio recordings. It is characterized by the use of samples, loops, and other sound manipulation techniques to create new compositions. Plunderphonics often involves the appropriation of popular music, sound effects, and other audio sources to create something entirely new. The genre has been used by a variety of artists, including John Oswald, Negativland, and DJ Shadow.

name: Canadian Old School Hip Hop

It is characterized by its use of samples from classic soul, funk, and jazz records, as well as its lyrical content which often focuses on social issues and the struggles of life in Canada. It is often seen as a precursor to the more mainstream Canadian hip hop scene that emerged in the late 1990s and early 2000s. It is characterized by its upbeat, melodic sound, often featuring jangly guitars, driving rhythms, and catchy hooks. The genre is heavily influenced by the British indie rock scene of the late 1980s and early 1990s, and is often compared to the likes of The Smiths, The Stone Roses, and The Charlatans. name: Outer Hip Hop

name: Eurobeat
description: Eurobeat is a genre of electronic dance music that originated in Italy in the late 1980s. It is characterized by its fast tempo, heavy basslines, and catchy melodies. It is often associated with the Japanese anime and video game culture, and is often used in the soundtracks of these media. Eurobeat is heavily influenced by disco, Italo disco, and Hi-NRG music. It is often characterized by its use of synthesizers, vocoders, and electronic drums.

name: Kawaii EDM
description: Kawaii EDM is a genre of electronic dance music that combines elements of traditional Japanese culture with modern EDM production. It is characterized by its upbeat, cheerful sound, often featuring bright, colorful synths and catchy melodies. The genre often incorporates traditional Japanese instruments such as the shamisen, koto, and taiko drums, as well as modern EDM production techniques such as sampling and synthesizers. Kawaii EDM is often associated with the "cute culture" of Japan, and its lyrics often focus on themes of love, friendship, and positivity.

name: Korean Dream Pop
description: Korean Dream Pop is a genre of music that combines elements of dream pop, shoegaze, and indie rock with traditional Korean music. description: Throat singing is a type of traditional singing from the Arctic regions of Canada, Alaska, and Siberia. The singer uses their throat and mouth to create a low, guttural sound, while simultaneously producing a higher-pitched melody. This technique is used to create a range of sounds, from a low drone to a high-pitched whistle. Throat singing is often used in traditional music, but has also been incorporated into modern genres such as folk, rock, and hip-hop.

name: Tuvan Folk
description: Tuvan folk music is a traditional style of music from the Tuvan region of Siberia. It is characterized by its unique throat singing, or khoomei, which is a type of overtone singing. Tuvan folk music is often performed with traditional instruments such as the igil (a two-stringed bowed lute), the doshpuluur (a three-stringed lute), and the khomus (a jaw harp). The music is often accompanied by traditional Tuvan dances, which are often performed in a circle. Tuvan folk music is often used to tell stories and express emotions, and is often used in rituals and ceremonies.

name: Rock en Asturiano

Rock en Asturiano has become increasingly popular in recent years, with many bands and artists performing the genre.

name: Guadalajara Indie

name: Rock Urbano Mexicano

name: Post-Punk Argentina

name: Funk Mexicano

name: Cumbia

It is a mix of African, Indigenous, and Spanish influences, and is characterized by a strong beat and a syncopated rhythm. Cumbia is often played with a variety of instruments, including drums, bass, guitar, and accordion. It is often accompanied by singing and dancing, and is popular in many Latin American countries.

name: Full On
description: Full On is a subgenre of Psytrance music that is characterized by its fast tempo (usually around 145-150 BPM) and its intense, driving basslines. name: Appalachian Folk
description: Appalachian Folk music is a genre of traditional music that originated in the Appalachian Mountains of the United States. It is a mix of traditional English, Irish, Scottish, and African-American music, and is characterized by its use of banjos, fiddles, and acoustic guitars. It is a genre that is deeply rooted in the culture of the Appalachian region, and is often used to tell stories of the people and places of the area.

name: Traditional Folk
description: Traditional Folk music is a genre of music that is rooted in the traditional music of a particular culture or region. It is typically characterized by acoustic instruments, simple melodies, and often includes elements of storytelling. name: Deep Indie Rock

Deep Indie Rock is often characterized by its use of reverb-drenched guitars, layered vocal harmonies, and a focus on creating a moody, introspective atmosphere. name: Sludgecore
description: Sludgecore is a subgenre of metalcore and sludge metal that combines elements of both genres. It is characterized by slow, heavy riffs, downtuned guitars, and aggressive vocals. name: Norsk Lovsang
description: Norsk Lovsang is a genre of Norwegian folk music that is characterized by its use of traditional instruments, such as the Hardanger fiddle, and its focus on religious themes. It is often performed in churches and other religious settings, and is often accompanied by singing and dancing. The lyrics of Norsk Lovsang songs are typically based on biblical stories and Christian hymns, and the music is often characterized by its slow, solemn tempo and its use of traditional Norwegian folk melodies.

name: Classic Praise
description: Classic Praise is a genre of Christian music that is rooted in traditional hymns and gospel music. It is characterized by its use of traditional instruments such as organs, pianos, and choirs, as well as its focus on lyrical content that is centered around praising God. Classic Praise is often seen as a more traditional and conservative form of Christian music, and is often used in churches and other religious settings.

It is characterized by its use of traditional French instruments, such as the accordion, and its incorporation of French folk music. The music is usually composed in the style of the Renaissance or Baroque periods, and often includes works by composers such as Bach, Handel, and Mozart. The music is often used for religious services, such as Mass, and is often accompanied by liturgical readings and prayers.

name: VBS

It is characterized by its use of synthesizers, drum machines, and samples from 80s and 90s pop music, as well as its heavy reliance on reverb and other effects to create a hazy, dreamlike atmosphere. VBS often features slowed-down and pitch-shifted vocals, as well as a heavy emphasis on ambient and chillout elements.

name: Children's Story
description: The Children's Story music genre is a type of music specifically designed for children. The lyrics often tell stories about animals, nature, and everyday life, and the music is often upbeat and cheerful. name: Birdsong

It is often used to create a calming, peaceful atmosphere, and can be used to evoke a sense of nature and the outdoors. It can be used in a variety of musical styles, from classical to ambient, and can be used to create a unique soundscape.

name: Canadian Choir

name: Brass Ensemble

It typically includes trumpets, trombones, French horns, and tubas, but can also include other brass instruments such as saxophones, euphoniums, and baritones. The music is usually written in a classical style, but can also include jazz, pop, and other styles. Brass Ensemble music is often used in marching bands, orchestras, and other large ensembles.

It is usually performed by boys aged 8 to 14 and is often used in religious and classical music. The genre is characterized by its use of high-pitched voices, often accompanied by a choir or orchestra. It is often used in operas, oratorios, and other large-scale works.

name: Brass Quintet
description: The Brass Quintet is a chamber music ensemble consisting of two trumpets, one French horn, one trombone, and one tuba. This genre of music is typically used for classical music, jazz, and popular music. It is often used for concert performances, as well as for accompanying choirs and other vocal ensembles. The Brass Quintet is known for its rich, full sound and its ability to create a wide range of musical textures.

name: Austrian Choir

The genre is often performed by a choir of male and female voices, accompanied by a piano or organ. It is often performed in churches and other religious settings, as well as in concert halls and other public venues. The genre is known for its strong sense of tradition and its use of traditional Austrian instruments, such as the zither and the accordion.

name: Library Music
description: Library music is a type of production music that is typically used in television, film, and radio productions. It is often referred to as "production music" or "stock music". Library music is composed and produced specifically for use in media projects, and is typically not available for purchase or download. It is usually created by professional composers and producers, and is often of a higher quality than other types of production music. Library music is typically categorized by genre, mood, and tempo, and is often used to create a specific atmosphere or emotion in a scene.

name: Vocal Ensemble

It is often a cappella, meaning that it is unaccompanied by instruments, but can also include accompaniment from instruments such as piano, guitar, or percussion. Vocal Ensemble music can range from traditional choral music to contemporary pop and jazz. It is often used in film and television soundtracks, as well as in live performances.

name: Dansei Seiyu

name: Oshare Kei

Oshare Kei is often seen as a more accessible version of visual kei, as it is less extreme and more commercially viable. It is often characterized by its use of acoustic instruments, such as the guitar, banjo, mandolin, and fiddle, as well as its focus on storytelling and lyrical content. It is often seen as a more modern take on traditional country music, and is often associated with the city of Nashville, Tennessee.

name: British Country
description: British Country music is a genre of popular music that originated in the United Kingdom. It is a blend of traditional folk music, American country music, and rock and roll. It is characterized by its use of acoustic instruments, such as the guitar, banjo, mandolin, and fiddle, as well as its focus on traditional themes such as love, loss, and heartache. British Country music often features a strong vocal performance, with lyrics that tell stories of everyday life. It is often seen as a more traditional and authentic form of country music than its American counterpart.

name: Dangdut Koplo
description: Dangdut Koplo is a popular Indonesian music genre that combines traditional dangdut music with modern electronic music. It is characterized by its fast tempo and heavy use of synthesizers and drum machines. The genre is often associated with the Javanese culture and is popular in Indonesia, Malaysia, and Singapore. It is often performed in a live setting with a band consisting of drums, bass, keyboards, and vocals. The lyrics are often about love, heartbreak, and social issues.

name: Yodeling
description: Yodeling is a form of singing that involves rapidly changing between the chest voice and a falsetto voice. It is often associated with country, folk, and cowboy music, and is characterized by its use of melodic, high-pitched vocalizations. Yodeling is often used to express emotion, and is often used to punctuate a song or to add emphasis to a particular phrase. It is also used to imitate the sounds of nature, such as birds or animals.

name: Grebo
description: Grebo is a British music genre that emerged in the late 1980s and early 1990s. It is a fusion of punk, funk, and hip hop, and is characterized by its heavy use of samples, distorted guitars, and electronic drums. It is often associated with the "baggy" scene of the late 1980s and early 1990s, and is often seen as a precursor to the Britpop movement. Grebo bands often had a humorous, irreverent attitude, and their lyrics often dealt with social and political issues. Notable Grebo bands include Pop Will Eat Itself, Jesus Jones, and EMF.

name: Brazilian Tech House
description: Brazilian Tech House is a style of electronic music that combines elements of Brazilian music with the energy and production of tech house. It is characterized by its use of Latin rhythms, percussion, and samples, as well as its heavy basslines and melodic synths. It is often seen as a fusion of Brazilian music and tech house, and is popular in clubs and festivals around the world.

name: Dub Reggae
description: Dub Reggae is a genre of music that originated in Jamaica in the late 1960s. It is a subgenre of reggae music that is characterized by its heavy use of studio effects and dubbing techniques, such as echo, reverb, and delay. Dub Reggae is often instrumental, and features a heavy bass line, drum and percussion, and sparse melodic elements. It is often used as a backdrop for MCs and DJs to rap over.

name: Houston Indie
description: Houston Indie is a genre of music that is rooted in the city of Houston, Texas. It is a blend of indie rock, folk, blues, and country, with a focus on storytelling and lyrical content. The sound is often characterized by a mix of acoustic and electric instruments, with a strong emphasis on vocal harmonies. Houston Indie is often seen as a more laid-back, relaxed version of the traditional indie rock sound. It is often seen as a reflection of the city's diverse culture and its unique blend of musical influences.

name: Canadian Blues
description: Canadian Blues is a style of blues music that originated in Canada in the early 20th century. It is characterized by a mix of traditional blues styles, such as Delta blues, with more modern influences, such as rock and roll. Canadian Blues often features a strong emphasis on electric guitar and harmonica, as well as a focus on storytelling and lyrics. It is often characterized by a slower tempo and a more laid-back feel than other blues styles. Canadian Blues has been popularized by artists such as Jeff Healey, Colin James, and the Downchild Blues Band.

name: Acid IDM
description: Acid IDM is a genre of electronic music that combines elements of acid house and IDM (intelligent dance music). It is characterized by its use of acid-style basslines, distorted and filtered synths, and complex drum patterns. It often has a dark, experimental sound, and is often used in film soundtracks and video game soundtracks.

name: Stateside DnB
description: Stateside DnB is a subgenre of drum and bass music that originated in the United States. It is characterized by a heavy emphasis on bass and drums, often with a syncopated rhythm. It is often characterized by a more melodic approach than traditional drum and bass, with a focus on complex rhythms and intricate sound design. It often incorporates elements of hip-hop, funk, and jazz, as well as other genres. It is often characterized by a faster tempo than traditional drum and bass, and is often more experimental in nature.

name: Djembe
description: Djembe is a traditional West African drumming style that originated in Mali, Guinea, and other parts of West Africa. It is characterized by its fast, complex rhythms and its use of call-and-response patterns. Djembe music is often accompanied by singing and dancing, and is often used in ceremonies and celebrations. Djembe music is typically played on a single-headed drum, and is often accompanied by other percussion instruments such as shakers, bells, and rattles.

name: Reading
description: Reading music is a genre of music that is typically used in educational settings. It is often used to help students learn to read, as it is designed to be easy to follow and understand. It is usually instrumental, and often incorporates elements of classical music, jazz, and folk music. It is often used in classrooms, libraries, and other educational settings.

name: Deep Happy Hardcore
description: Deep Happy Hardcore is a subgenre of Happy Hardcore that is characterized by its slower tempo and deeper, more melodic sound. It typically features a 4/4 beat and a range of synthesized sounds, including trance-like pads and melodic leads. The genre is often characterized by its uplifting and positive vibes, and its use of vocal samples and catchy melodies. Deep Happy Hardcore is often seen as a more mature and sophisticated version of Happy Hardcore, and is popular among fans of the genre.

name: Southern Metal
description: Southern Metal is a subgenre of heavy metal music that originated in the Southern United States. It combines elements of traditional heavy metal with Southern rock, blues, and country music. It is characterized by its heavy, distorted guitar riffs, aggressive vocals, and often incorporates elements of Southern culture such as Confederate flags and references to Southern states. It is often associated with the Southern rock movement of the 1970s and 1980s.

name: Japanese Power Metal
description: Japanese Power Metal is a subgenre of heavy metal music that originated in Japan in the late 1980s. It is characterized by its fast-paced, melodic sound, often featuring high-pitched vocals and heavy guitar riffs. The genre is heavily influenced by traditional Japanese music, as well as European power metal bands such as Helloween and Stratovarius. Japanese Power Metal bands often incorporate elements of traditional Japanese music, such as taiko drums, shamisen, and koto, into their sound. The genre is also known for its use of fantasy and science fiction themes in its lyrics and artwork.

name: Japanese Melodic Punk
description: Japanese Melodic Punk is a style of punk rock that originated in Japan in the late 1980s. It is characterized by its fast-paced, melodic sound, often featuring distorted guitars and high-energy vocals. The genre is heavily influenced by traditional Japanese music, as well as Western punk and hardcore. It is often seen as a more accessible form of punk, with its catchy melodies and upbeat tempos.

name: Baton Rouge Indie

name: Israeli Hip Hop

name: Amharic Pop
description: Amharic Pop is a genre of popular music originating in Ethiopia. It is a fusion of traditional Ethiopian music with elements of modern pop, rock, and hip-hop. It is characterized by its upbeat rhythms, catchy melodies, and often incorporates traditional instruments such as the krar (a stringed instrument) and the masenqo (a one-stringed bowed instrument). Amharic Pop is often sung in the Amharic language, and is popular among both young and old Ethiopians.

name: Ethiopian Pop
description: Ethiopian Pop is a genre of popular music that originated in Ethiopia in the late 1960s. It is a fusion of traditional Ethiopian music with elements of jazz, funk, soul, and rock. The genre is characterized by its upbeat rhythms, catchy melodies, and often politically charged lyrics. Ethiopian Pop is often performed by large ensembles featuring multiple vocalists, electric guitars, keyboards, and traditional instruments such as the masenqo (a single-stringed bowed lute) and the krar (a five-stringed lyre). name: Rap Ivoire
description: Rap Ivoire is a style of hip-hop music that originated in the Ivory Coast in the late 1990s. It is characterized by its fast-paced, upbeat rhythms and its use of traditional African instruments such as the djembe and balafon. The lyrics often focus on social issues such as poverty, corruption, and inequality. The genre has become increasingly popular in recent years, with many artists gaining international recognition.

name: Cameroonian Hip Hop
description: Cameroonian Hip Hop is a genre of music that originated in Cameroon in the late 1980s. It is a fusion of traditional African music, reggae, and rap. It is characterized by its heavy use of samples, its fast-paced beats, and its socially conscious lyrics. The lyrics often focus on topics such as poverty, corruption, and social injustice. Cameroonian Hip Hop is often seen as a form of protest music, as it speaks out against the political and economic issues facing the country. It has become increasingly popular in recent years, with many artists gaining international recognition.

name: Cameroonian Pop

name: Cumbia Andina Mexicana
description: Cumbia Andina Mexicana is a genre of Mexican music that combines traditional Andean music with Mexican cumbia. It is characterized by its upbeat rhythms, traditional instruments, and a mix of both Mexican and Andean influences. The genre is often used to celebrate Mexican culture and heritage, and is popular in both Mexico and Latin America. It is often performed with traditional instruments such as the guitar, accordion, and drums, as well as modern instruments such as synthesizers and electric guitars. The lyrics of Cumbia Andina Mexicana often focus on themes of love, family, and celebration.

name: Cumbia Sonidera

It is a fusion of traditional cumbia music with electronic elements such as synthesizers, drum machines, and samples. It is characterized by its upbeat, danceable rhythms and its use of samples from other genres such as hip-hop, reggae, and salsa. name: Synthetic Classical
description: Synthetic Classical is a genre of music that combines elements of classical music with modern electronic production techniques. It typically features orchestral instruments such as strings, brass, and woodwinds, but also incorporates synthesizers, drum machines, and other electronic elements. The result is a hybrid of classical and electronic music that is often used in film scores, video game soundtracks, and other media.

name: 48g
description: 48g is a Japanese music genre that combines elements of hip-hop, EDM, and J-pop. It is characterized by its upbeat, catchy melodies and heavy use of synthesizers and drum machines. It is often associated with the Japanese idol group AKB48 and its sister groups. The genre has become increasingly popular in recent years, with many artists releasing songs in the style.

name: Korean Mask Singer
description: Korean Mask Singer is a popular music genre in South Korea that combines elements of traditional Korean music with modern pop and hip-hop. It is characterized by its upbeat, catchy melodies and its use of traditional Korean instruments such as the gayageum, janggu, and haegeum. The genre is often used in K-pop and K-drama soundtracks, and is popular among both Korean and international audiences. Mask Singer is known for its high-energy performances and its use of elaborate costumes and masks, which add to the theatricality of the performances.

name: Croatian Metal
description: Croatian Metal is a subgenre of heavy metal music that originated in Croatia in the late 1980s. It is characterized by a mix of traditional heavy metal, thrash metal, and death metal, with a strong emphasis on melody and technicality. The genre is often characterized by its use of complex rhythms, intricate guitar solos, and aggressive vocals. It is also known for its use of traditional Croatian folk instruments, such as the tamburica and the gusle. name: Backing Track
description: Backing Track music is instrumental music that is used as a backing track for singers, musicians, and other performers. It is typically used in live performances, recordings, and rehearsals. It is usually composed of a rhythm section, such as drums, bass, and keyboards, and may also include additional instruments such as guitar, strings, horns, and percussion. Backing Track music is often used to provide a consistent musical accompaniment for a singer or instrumentalist, and can be used to create a fuller sound.

name: Canadian Comedy
description: Canadian Comedy music is a genre of music that combines elements of comedy and music. It is often characterized by humorous lyrics, often poking fun at Canadian culture and stereotypes. The music is often upbeat and lighthearted, and often features a variety of instruments, including guitars, drums, and keyboards. Canadian Comedy music is often performed by Canadian artists, and is popular in Canada and around the world.

name: Novelty
description: Novelty music is a genre of popular music that is characterized by its humorous and often satirical lyrics. It often includes elements of parody, burlesque, and pastiche. Novelty songs are often performed in a lighthearted, comedic style, and often feature exaggerated vocal effects and sound effects. Common topics for novelty songs include pop culture, current events, and political satire.

name: Hard Glam
description: Hard Glam is a subgenre of glam rock that emerged in the late 1970s and early 1980s. It is characterized by a harder, more aggressive sound than traditional glam rock, with heavy guitar riffs and a driving rhythm section. The lyrics often focus on themes of rebellion, sex, and excess. Hard Glam bands often featured outrageous costumes and makeup, and their live shows were often highly theatrical. Notable Hard Glam bands include Mötley Crüe, Poison, and Twisted Sister.

name: Swing Revival
description: Swing Revival is a genre of music that combines elements of traditional swing music with modern pop and rock influences. It emerged in the late 1990s and early 2000s, and is characterized by a strong emphasis on swing rhythms, big band instrumentation, and a focus on vocal harmonies. Swing Revival bands often feature a mix of male and female vocalists, and often incorporate elements of jazz, blues, and rockabilly into their sound. Popular Swing Revival bands include Big Bad Voodoo Daddy, Cherry Poppin' Daddies, and Squirrel Nut Zippers.

name: Deep Melodic Hard Rock
description: Deep Melodic Hard Rock is a genre of rock music that combines elements of hard rock and melodic rock. It is characterized by heavy guitar riffs, powerful drumming, and soaring vocal melodies. The genre often features extended guitar solos and complex song structures. Deep Melodic Hard Rock is often seen as a bridge between classic hard rock and modern metal. It is often seen as a more accessible version of metal, with its emphasis on melody and songwriting. Artists such as Led Zeppelin, Deep Purple, and Van Halen are often cited as influences on the genre.

name: Paisley Underground
description: The Paisley Underground is a genre of music that emerged in the early 1980s in Los Angeles, California. It is characterized by a blend of 1960s-influenced folk-rock, psychedelic rock, and jangle pop. The genre is named after the paisley-patterned clothing worn by many of its musicians. The Paisley Underground was a loose collective of bands that included the Dream Syndicate, the Bangles, the Three O'Clock, the Rain Parade, and the Long Ryders. The genre was heavily influenced by the British Invasion bands of the 1960s, as well as the psychedelic rock of the late 1960s and early 1970s. The Paisley Underground was a short-lived movement, but its influence can still be heard in the music of many modern indie rock bands.

name: Modern Jangle Pop
description: Modern Jangle Pop is a genre of music that combines elements of indie rock, power pop, and jangle pop. It is characterized by its bright, melodic sound, often featuring jangly guitars, upbeat rhythms, and catchy hooks. The genre is often associated with bands such as The Smiths, The Cure, and The Stone Roses. It is a modern take on the classic jangle pop sound, with a more polished production and a focus on catchy melodies.

name: Dortmund Indie
description: Dortmund Indie is a genre of music that originated in the city of Dortmund, Germany. It is characterized by its use of electronic instruments, such as synthesizers and drum machines, as well as its incorporation of elements from various other genres, including post-punk, new wave, and shoegaze. The genre is often characterized by its dreamy, atmospheric soundscapes and its use of reverb-heavy guitars. name: Mod Revival
description: The Mod Revival was a music genre that emerged in the late 1970s and early 1980s in the United Kingdom. It was a revival of the 1960s mod subculture, which was based around fashion, music, and lifestyle. The Mod Revival was a blend of punk, ska, and power pop, with a focus on catchy melodies and upbeat rhythms. Bands such as The Jam, The Chords, and Secret Affair were some of the most popular acts of the genre. The Mod Revival was short-lived, but it had a lasting influence on the British music scene.

name: Stuttgart Indie
