name: Hard House
description: Hard House is a genre of electronic dance music that originated in the UK in the late 1990s. It is characterized by its hard-hitting, fast-paced beats and aggressive basslines. It is often associated with the rave and club scenes, and is often played at high volumes. Hard House typically features a 4/4 beat and is often heavily influenced by techno, trance, and hardcore. It is often characterized by its use of samples, synthesizers, and drum machines.

name: Japanese Post-Punk
description: Japanese Post-Punk is a genre of music that emerged in the late 1970s and early 1980s in Japan. It is characterized by its experimental, avant-garde sound, often incorporating elements of punk, new wave, and noise music. It is often characterized by its use of synthesizers, drum machines, and other electronic instruments, as well as its incorporation of traditional Japanese instruments and musical styles. It is often seen as a reaction to the more mainstream, commercial sounds of the time.

name: Italian Punk
description: Italian Punk is a genre of punk rock music that originated in Italy in the late 1970s. It is characterized by its fast, aggressive sound and its lyrics, which often deal with social and political issues. The genre is heavily influenced by the British punk scene, but also incorporates elements of traditional Italian music, such as folk and traditional instruments. Italian Punk bands often sing in both English and Italian, and the genre has become increasingly popular in recent years.

name: Rap Maroc
description: Rap Maroc is a style of rap music that originated in Morocco. It is characterized by its use of traditional Moroccan instruments, such as the oud, as well as its incorporation of traditional Moroccan rhythms and melodies. It is often characterized by its use of Arabic and French lyrics, as well as its incorporation of traditional Moroccan musical elements. Rap Maroc is often seen as a form of protest music, as it often speaks out against social and political issues in Morocco.

name: Bagpipe Marching Band
description: Bagpipe Marching Band music is a genre of music that combines traditional bagpipe music with marching band music. It is typically performed by a marching band that includes bagpipers, drummers, and other musicians. The music is usually upbeat and lively, and often includes traditional Scottish and Irish tunes. It is often used in parades and other public events, and is a popular choice for military ceremonies.

name: Military Band
description: Military Band music is a genre of music that is typically performed by a marching band or concert band. It is characterized by its use of brass and percussion instruments, as well as its traditional military-style marches and patriotic tunes. It is often used to accompany military parades and ceremonies, as well as to provide entertainment for military personnel. It is also used in a variety of other contexts, such as in film scores and at sporting events.

name: Neue Volksmusik
description: Neue Volksmusik (New Folk Music) is a genre of German music that combines traditional folk music with modern elements. It is a contemporary style of folk music that has been popular in Germany since the late 1980s. It is characterized by its use of traditional instruments such as the accordion, zither, and mandolin, as well as modern instruments such as electric guitars and synthesizers. It often features traditional German folk songs, as well as original compositions. The lyrics often focus on themes of love, nature, and nostalgia. Neue Volksmusik has been popularized by artists such as Heino, Andreas Gabalier, and Die Flippers.

name: Neomelodici
description: Neomelodici is a genre of popular music originating in Naples, Italy. It is characterized by its melodic, often romantic lyrics and its upbeat, danceable rhythms. The genre is heavily influenced by traditional Neapolitan music, as well as by other genres such as pop, rock, and hip-hop. Neomelodici songs often feature themes of love, friendship, and nostalgia, and are often performed in a theatrical style. The genre has become increasingly popular in recent years, with many artists achieving mainstream success.

name: Danish Experimental
description: The Danish Experimental music genre is a style of music that emerged in the late 1990s and early 2000s in Denmark. It is characterized by its experimental and avant-garde approach to music, often incorporating elements of jazz, classical, and electronic music. It is often characterized by its use of improvisation, unusual instrumentation, and unconventional song structures. Artists associated with this genre include Efterklang, MØ, and Trentemøller.

name: Rap Liegeois
description: Rap Liegeois is a style of rap music that originated in the city of Liège, Belgium. It is characterized by its use of French and Walloon dialects, as well as its heavy use of samples from traditional Belgian music. It is often characterized by its upbeat, party-like atmosphere and its focus on social issues. It is also known for its use of humor and its often lighthearted approach to rap music.

name: Mongolian Hip Hop
description: Mongolian Hip Hop is a genre of music that combines traditional Mongolian music with elements of hip hop. It is characterized by its use of traditional Mongolian instruments, such as the morin khuur (horsehead fiddle), as well as modern hip hop elements, such as rap and scratching. The lyrics often focus on topics such as Mongolian culture, history, and identity. Mongolian Hip Hop has become increasingly popular in recent years, with many artists gaining international recognition.

name: Tarantella
description: Tarantella is a traditional Italian folk dance and music genre. It is characterized by a fast, upbeat tempo and a lively, energetic feel. The music is usually played on a variety of instruments, including accordion, mandolin, guitar, and tambourine. The dance is usually performed in a circle, with the dancers taking turns leading the group. The lyrics often tell stories of love, loss, and joy.

name: Middle East Hip Hop
description: Middle East Hip Hop is a genre of music that combines traditional Middle Eastern music with elements of hip hop. It is characterized by its use of traditional Middle Eastern instruments, such as the oud, darbuka, and qanun, as well as hip hop beats and samples. The lyrics often focus on topics such as politics, social issues, and identity. Middle East Hip Hop has become increasingly popular in recent years, with artists from countries such as Egypt, Lebanon, and Palestine gaining international recognition.

name: Karadeniz Pop
description: Karadeniz Pop is a genre of Turkish folk music that originated in the Black Sea region of Turkey. It is characterized by its upbeat, danceable rhythms and its use of traditional instruments such as the baglama (a stringed instrument), the davul (a double-headed drum), and the zurna (a double-reed wind instrument). The lyrics of Karadeniz Pop songs often focus on themes of love, nature, and nostalgia. The genre has become increasingly popular in recent years, with many modern artists incorporating elements of Karadeniz Pop into their music.

name: Norwegian Folk Rock
description: Norwegian Folk Rock is a genre of music that combines traditional Norwegian folk music with elements of rock music. It typically features acoustic instruments such as the fiddle, accordion, and guitar, as well as electric instruments such as electric guitar, bass, and drums. The lyrics often focus on traditional Norwegian themes such as nature, history, and folklore. The genre has been popular in Norway since the 1970s and has seen a resurgence in recent years.

name: Swansea Indie
description: Swansea Indie is a genre of music that originated in the city of Swansea, Wales. It is a mix of indie rock, post-punk, and alternative rock, with a strong emphasis on melody and atmosphere. The genre is characterized by its use of reverb-heavy guitars, driving bass lines, and often melancholic lyrics. It is often seen as a more laid-back and introspective version of the indie rock sound. Bands associated with the Swansea Indie scene include The Joy Formidable, Los Campesinos!, and The Automatic.

name: West-Vlaamse Hip Hop
description: West-Vlaamse Hip Hop is a subgenre of hip hop music that originated in the Flemish region of Belgium. It is characterized by its use of Flemish dialects and slang, as well as its focus on social and political issues. The genre is heavily influenced by American hip hop, but also incorporates elements of traditional Flemish music. West-Vlaamse Hip Hop is often characterized by its hard-hitting beats, aggressive lyrics, and its use of samples from classic Flemish songs.

name: Russian Ska
description: Russian Ska is a genre of music that combines elements of traditional ska music with Russian folk music. It is characterized by a fast tempo, upbeat rhythms, and a mix of traditional Russian instruments such as balalaikas, accordions, and bayans. The lyrics often focus on themes of Russian culture and history, and the music often features a mix of traditional Russian melodies and ska-style horn riffs.

name: Dark Electro
description: Dark Electro is a genre of electronic music that combines elements of industrial, EBM, and synthpop. It is characterized by its dark, aggressive sound, often featuring distorted and distorted vocals, heavy basslines, and distorted synths. It often has a dystopian or post-apocalyptic feel, and is often associated with the horror and sci-fi genres.

name: Manipuri Pop
description: Manipuri Pop is a genre of music that originated in the Indian state of Manipur. It is a fusion of traditional Manipuri folk music and modern pop music. It is characterized by its upbeat tempo, catchy melodies, and use of traditional Manipuri instruments such as the pena, pung, and sarangi. Manipuri Pop is often used in Bollywood films and is popular among the youth of Manipur.

name: Belgian DnB
description: Belgian DnB is a subgenre of drum and bass music that originated in Belgium in the early 2000s. It is characterized by its hard-hitting, fast-paced beats and heavy basslines. It often incorporates elements of other genres such as dubstep, electro, and hip-hop. Belgian DnB is known for its intense energy and its ability to get crowds moving. It is often played at festivals and clubs around the world.

name: Kaneka
description: Kaneka is a genre of music that originated in the Caribbean islands of Trinidad and Tobago. It is a fusion of traditional calypso and soca music with modern electronic music. It is characterized by its upbeat, danceable rhythms and its use of synthesizers and samples. The lyrics often focus on themes of love, partying, and having a good time.

name: Indonesian Blues
description: Indonesian Blues is a genre of music that combines traditional Indonesian music with elements of blues, jazz, and rock. It is characterized by its use of traditional Indonesian instruments such as the gamelan, kendang, and suling, as well as electric guitars, bass, and drums. The genre is often characterized by its slow, melancholic melodies and its use of improvisation. It is often seen as a reflection of the struggles and hardships of the Indonesian people.

name: Indonesian Hardcore
description: Indonesian Hardcore is a style of punk rock music that originated in Indonesia in the late 1990s. It is characterized by fast tempos, aggressive vocals, and distorted guitars. The lyrics often focus on social and political issues, and the music is often associated with the DIY punk scene. The genre has been influenced by a variety of punk and metal styles, including thrash metal, crust punk, and grindcore. Indonesian Hardcore bands often tour internationally, and the genre has gained a following in other countries, particularly in Europe.

name: Indonesian Metal
description: Indonesian Metal is a subgenre of metal music that originated in Indonesia in the late 1980s. It is characterized by a mix of traditional Indonesian music, such as gamelan, with heavy metal and punk rock. The genre is known for its fast tempos, aggressive guitar riffs, and intense vocal delivery. It is often associated with themes of nationalism, social issues, and anti-establishment sentiment. Indonesian Metal bands often incorporate traditional Indonesian instruments, such as the gamelan, into their music, as well as incorporating traditional Indonesian melodies and rhythms. The genre has become increasingly popular in recent years, with bands such as Burgerkill, Deadsquad, and Koil gaining international recognition.

name: Indonesian Punk
description: Indonesian Punk is a genre of music that originated in Indonesia in the late 1990s. It is a mix of punk rock, hardcore punk, and metal, with influences from traditional Indonesian music. The lyrics often focus on social issues, such as poverty, corruption, and oppression. The sound is characterized by fast tempos, distorted guitars, and aggressive vocals. The genre has become increasingly popular in recent years, with bands such as Burgerkill, Superman Is Dead, and Seringai gaining international recognition.

name: Hungarian Techno
description: Hungarian Techno is a style of electronic music that originated in Hungary in the early 2000s. It is characterized by its hard-hitting, driving beats and its use of traditional Hungarian folk instruments and melodies. It is often characterized by its dark, brooding atmosphere and its use of heavy basslines and distorted synths. It is often seen as a fusion of traditional Hungarian folk music and modern electronic music.

name: Rominimal
description: Rominimal is a genre of electronic music that combines elements of minimal techno and Romanian folk music. It is characterized by its repetitive, hypnotic beats and its use of traditional Romanian instruments and melodies. The genre has been popularized by Romanian producers such as Rhadoo, Raresh, and Petre Inspirescu. It is often associated with the Romanian club scene and is a favorite among DJs.

name: Croatian Electronic
description: Croatian Electronic is a genre of electronic music that originated in Croatia in the late 1990s. It is characterized by its use of traditional Croatian folk music elements, such as traditional instruments, rhythms, and melodies, combined with modern electronic production techniques. It is often characterized by its upbeat, energetic sound, and its use of traditional Croatian instruments such as the tamburica, gusle, and šargija. It is often seen as a fusion of traditional and modern music, and has become increasingly popular in recent years.

name: House Argentino
description: House Argentino is a style of electronic music that originated in Argentina in the late 1990s. It is characterized by its use of Latin American rhythms, samples, and melodies, as well as its incorporation of traditional instruments such as the charango, bombo, and guitar. It is often characterized by its upbeat, energetic sound, and its use of Latin American vocalists. House Argentino is often seen as a fusion of traditional Latin American music and modern electronic music.

name: Techno Argentina
description: Techno Argentina is a style of electronic music that originated in Argentina in the late 1990s. It is characterized by its fast-paced, energetic beats and its use of Latin American rhythms and samples. It is often described as a fusion of techno and Latin American music, combining elements of both genres to create a unique sound. It is often associated with the underground club scene in Buenos Aires and other cities in Argentina.

name: Deep Progressive House
description: Deep Progressive House is a subgenre of Progressive House that is characterized by its slower tempo, deep basslines, and melodic chords. It often incorporates elements of other genres such as Trance, Techno, and Ambient. Deep Progressive House is often more atmospheric and melodic than other forms of Progressive House, and its tracks often feature long builds and breakdowns. It is often used in clubs and festivals, and is popular among DJs and producers.

name: Experimental Dubstep
description: Experimental Dubstep is a genre of electronic music that combines elements of dubstep, drum and bass, and other genres of electronic music. It is characterized by its heavy basslines, complex rhythms, and experimental sound design. It often incorporates elements of hip-hop, grime, and other genres, and often features vocal samples and sound effects. It is often characterized by its dark and intense atmosphere, and its use of complex sound design and production techniques.

name: Slovenian Indie
description: Slovenian Indie is a genre of music that originated in Slovenia in the late 1990s. It is characterized by its use of electronic instruments, experimental sounds, and a mix of traditional Slovenian folk music with modern rock and pop influences. The genre is often described as having a dreamy, ethereal quality, with a focus on creating a unique atmosphere and soundscape. It is often seen as a reaction to the more mainstream music of the time, and has been described as a "sonic exploration of the Slovenian soul".

name: Hungarian Indie
description: Hungarian Indie is a genre of music that originated in Hungary in the late 1990s. It is characterized by its use of traditional Hungarian folk instruments, such as the cimbalom, combined with modern rock and pop influences. The genre is often characterized by its use of traditional Hungarian folk melodies, as well as its incorporation of elements from other genres, such as jazz, classical, and electronic music. The lyrics of Hungarian Indie songs often focus on themes of love, loss, and nostalgia. The genre has become increasingly popular in recent years, with many Hungarian Indie bands gaining international recognition.

name: Isle Of Man Indie
description: The Isle of Man Indie music genre is a style of music that originated on the Isle of Man, a small island located in the Irish Sea between England and Ireland. It is a blend of traditional folk music, indie rock, and alternative rock. The genre is characterized by its use of traditional instruments such as the fiddle, mandolin, and accordion, as well as electric guitars, drums, and synthesizers. The lyrics often focus on the island's culture and history, as well as its people and landscapes. The genre has been popularized by bands such as The Verve, The Charlatans, and The Coral.

name: Industrial Hardcore
description: Industrial Hardcore is a subgenre of hardcore techno and industrial music that combines elements of both genres. It is characterized by its aggressive, distorted sound, often featuring distorted and heavily processed vocals, distorted and heavily processed drums, and distorted and heavily processed synths and samples. It is often associated with the gabber and speedcore subgenres, and is often used in the context of rave and club culture.

name: Terrorcore
description: Terrorcore is a subgenre of hardcore techno music that is characterized by its dark, aggressive, and often violent sound. It is characterized by distorted and heavily distorted kick drums, distorted basslines, and often distorted and heavily distorted vocals. It is often associated with horror and death themes, and is often used in horror films and video games.

name: Dutch Underground Hip Hop
description: Dutch Underground Hip Hop is a subgenre of hip hop music that originated in the Netherlands. It is characterized by its hard-hitting beats, aggressive lyrics, and often dark and gritty production. The lyrics often focus on topics such as poverty, crime, and social issues. The genre has been heavily influenced by American hip hop, but has also incorporated elements of Dutch culture and language. Dutch Underground Hip Hop is often seen as a more underground and independent form of hip hop, and is often associated with the Dutch hip hop scene.

name: Deep Hardcore
description: Deep Hardcore is a subgenre of hardcore techno that emerged in the early 2000s. It is characterized by its dark, brooding atmosphere and intense, driving rhythms. It often features distorted basslines, heavy percussion, and eerie soundscapes. Deep Hardcore is often associated with the darker side of the rave scene, and its sound has been described as “a mix of industrial, gabber, and dark ambient.”

name: Rotterdam Indie
description: Rotterdam Indie is a genre of music that originated in the Dutch city of Rotterdam. It is a mix of indie rock, post-punk, and electronic music, with a focus on creating a unique sound. The genre is characterized by its use of synthesizers, drum machines, and other electronic instruments, as well as its incorporation of elements from other genres such as hip-hop, funk, and jazz. It is often characterized by its upbeat, energetic sound, and its use of catchy melodies and hooks.

name: Chanson Quebecois
description: Chanson Québécoise is a genre of French-language folk music from Quebec, Canada. It is characterized by its use of traditional instruments such as the fiddle, accordion, and guitar, as well as its focus on stories of everyday life in Quebec. The lyrics often focus on topics such as love, family, and the beauty of the Quebec landscape. The genre has been popular since the 1950s and is still popular today.

name: Classical Horn
description: Classical Horn is a genre of classical music that features the French horn as the primary instrument. It is characterized by its lyrical melodies, intricate counterpoint, and lush harmonies. The genre is often associated with the Romantic period of classical music, but it can also be found in works from the Baroque and Classical periods. It is often performed by soloists, chamber ensembles, and symphony orchestras.

name: Classic Tunisian Pop
description: Classic Tunisian Pop is a genre of music that originated in Tunisia in the 1950s and 1960s. It is a blend of traditional Tunisian music, such as chaabi, with influences from other genres, such as jazz, rock, and funk. It is characterized by its upbeat rhythms, catchy melodies, and use of traditional instruments, such as the oud, tabla, and qanun. Classic Tunisian Pop is often seen as a symbol of national pride and is still popular today.

name: Whale Song
description: Whale Song is a genre of ambient music that is inspired by the sounds of whales and other marine mammals. It typically features long, slow-moving drones and melodic textures that evoke a sense of calm and relaxation. The music is often used in meditation and yoga practices, as well as for relaxation and sleep. It is also used in sound healing and sound therapy.

name: Psytech
description: Psytech is a genre of electronic music that combines elements of psychedelic trance, techno, and progressive house. It is characterized by its fast-paced, hypnotic beats, and its use of complex, layered melodies. It often features a wide range of sounds, from ambient and atmospheric textures to more aggressive and driving rhythms. Psytech is often associated with the psychedelic trance scene, but it is distinct in its own right, with its own unique sound and style.

name: Deep Vocal House
description: Deep Vocal House is a subgenre of House music that combines elements of soulful vocals with deep, groovy basslines and a 4/4 beat. It is characterized by its soulful, melodic sound and often incorporates elements of jazz, funk, and disco. Deep Vocal House is often slower than other House genres, and its lyrics often focus on themes of love, relationships, and heartache.

name: Reggaeton Mexicano
description: Reggaeton Mexicano is a Latin American music genre that combines elements of hip-hop, reggae, and Latin music. It originated in Mexico in the early 2000s and has since become popular throughout Latin America. It is characterized by its heavy bass lines, catchy melodies, and often explicit lyrics. Reggaeton Mexicano is often seen as a form of protest music, as it often speaks out against social and political issues. It is also known for its upbeat and danceable rhythms, making it a popular choice for parties and clubs.

name: Chaabi Marocain
description: Chaabi Marocain is a popular Moroccan music genre that combines traditional Moroccan folk music with modern influences. It is characterized by its upbeat rhythms and catchy melodies. The lyrics often focus on themes of love, family, and social issues. Instruments used in Chaabi Marocain include the oud, violin, qanun, and drums. The genre has become increasingly popular in recent years, with many artists releasing albums and performing live shows.

name: Mahraganat
description: Mahraganat is an Egyptian electronic music genre that emerged in the early 2000s. It is a mix of traditional Egyptian folk music, hip-hop, electro, and techno. It is characterized by its fast tempo, heavy bass, and repetitive rhythms. It is often accompanied by a mix of traditional and modern instruments, such as the electric oud, electric violin, and synthesizers. The lyrics are often in Egyptian dialect and often focus on social issues. Mahraganat has become increasingly popular in Egypt and the Middle East, and is now considered a mainstream genre.

name: Country Quebecois
description: Country Quebecois is a genre of music that originated in Quebec, Canada. It is a blend of traditional French-Canadian folk music and country music from the United States. It is characterized by its use of fiddle, accordion, and guitar, as well as its lyrical content which often focuses on the rural life of Quebec. It is a popular genre in Quebec and is often performed at festivals and other events.

name: Albany NY Indie
description: The Albany NY Indie music genre is a blend of alternative rock, indie rock, and punk rock. It is characterized by its raw, energetic sound and its DIY aesthetic. It often features distorted guitars, driving rhythms, and passionate vocals. The lyrics often focus on topics such as social issues, personal struggles, and the local Albany scene. Artists in this genre include The Slaughterhouse Chorus, The Parlor, and The Parlor Mob.

name: Baiao
description: Baiao is a popular Brazilian music genre that originated in the northeastern region of the country. It is a combination of traditional Portuguese folk music and African rhythms, and is characterized by its fast-paced, syncopated rhythms and its use of the accordion and triangle. Baiao is often performed in a call-and-response style, with the lead singer singing a verse and the chorus responding with a refrain. It is a popular genre of music for dancing, and is often played at parties and festivals.

name: Forro Instrumental
description: Forro Instrumental is a style of Brazilian music that originated in the Northeast region of the country. It is characterized by its upbeat rhythms and melodic lines, often featuring accordion, triangle, and zabumba (a type of bass drum). The genre is often used for dancing, and is popular at parties and festivals. It is also used in traditional folk music, and has been adapted to other styles such as jazz and rock.

name: Forro Tradicional
description: Forro Tradicional is a style of Brazilian folk music that originated in the Northeast region of Brazil. It is characterized by its upbeat rhythms and lively melodies, often featuring accordion, triangle, and zabumba (a type of bass drum). The lyrics often tell stories of love, loss, and everyday life. Forro Tradicional is often played at parties and festivals, and is a popular genre of music in Brazil.

name: Sanfona
description: Sanfona is a style of Brazilian music that originated in the Northeastern region of the country. It is a type of forró, a genre of music that is traditionally played with an accordion, triangle, and zabumba (a type of drum). Sanfona is characterized by its fast-paced, upbeat rhythms and its use of improvisation. It is often played at parties and festivals, and is popular among both young and old.

name: Sertanejo Tradicional
description: Sertanejo Tradicional is a style of Brazilian country music that originated in the rural areas of the country. It is characterized by its use of acoustic instruments such as the guitar, accordion, and mandolin, as well as its focus on traditional themes such as love, family, and nature. It is often sung in a duet style, with one singer taking the lead and the other providing harmony. The lyrics are often simple and direct, and the melodies are often catchy and upbeat. Sertanejo Tradicional is a popular genre in Brazil, and it has been gaining popularity in other countries as well.

name: Rap Feminino Nacional
description: Rap Feminino Nacional is a Brazilian rap music genre that focuses on female empowerment and social justice. It is characterized by its strong, empowering lyrics and its use of samples from traditional Brazilian music. The genre has become increasingly popular in recent years, with many female rappers gaining recognition for their work. The lyrics often focus on topics such as gender equality, racism, and social injustice. The beats are often upbeat and energetic, and the music is often accompanied by a strong visual aesthetic.

name: Rap Guarulhense
description: Rap Guarulhense is a style of rap music that originated in the city of Guarulhos, Brazil. It is characterized by its fast-paced, aggressive beats and lyrics that often focus on social issues and the struggles of life in the city. The genre has become increasingly popular in recent years, with many local artists gaining national recognition. The sound of Rap Guarulhense is heavily influenced by traditional Brazilian music, as well as hip-hop and funk.

name: Brazilian Blues
description: Brazilian Blues is a genre of music that combines elements of traditional Brazilian music with the blues. It is characterized by its use of the 12-bar blues structure, as well as its incorporation of Brazilian rhythms and instruments such as the cavaquinho, pandeiro, and berimbau. The genre is often associated with the work of artists such as Baden Powell, João Gilberto, and Caetano Veloso. Brazilian Blues is a unique blend of two distinct musical styles, creating a sound that is both familiar and exotic.

name: Glitter Trance
description: Glitter Trance is a subgenre of Trance music that is characterized by its uplifting, melodic, and euphoric sound. It typically features a driving 4/4 beat, lush pads, and bright, shimmering synths. The genre often incorporates elements of Progressive House, Trance, and Techno, and is often used in film and television soundtracks. Glitter Trance is often seen as a more accessible form of Trance music, and is popular among both club and radio audiences.

name: Haitian Dance
description: Haitian Dance is a genre of music that originated in Haiti and is characterized by its upbeat rhythms and lively melodies. It is often played at parties and celebrations and is a popular form of entertainment. The music is usually a mix of traditional Haitian rhythms and modern beats, and often incorporates elements of reggae, hip-hop, and other Caribbean styles. The lyrics are often in Haitian Creole and focus on themes of love, joy, and celebration.

name: Beach Music
description: Beach Music is a genre of music that originated in the Carolinas in the 1950s. It is a mix of rhythm and blues, jazz, and soul music, and is often referred to as "Shag Music" due to its association with the popular dance of the same name. It is characterized by its upbeat tempo and its use of horns, saxophones, and electric guitars. Beach Music is often associated with summertime and the beach, and its lyrics often focus on themes of love, romance, and nostalgia.

name: Rock Paraibano
description: Rock Paraibano is a Brazilian rock music genre that originated in the state of Paraíba in the late 1970s. It is characterized by its heavy use of electric guitars, synthesizers, and drums, as well as its incorporation of traditional Brazilian rhythms and instruments such as the zabumba, triangle, and pandeiro. The lyrics of Rock Paraibano songs often focus on themes of love, social justice, and politics. The genre has been popularized by artists such as Alceu Valença, Geraldo Azevedo, and Elba Ramalho.

name: Rock Campineiro
description: Rock Campineiro is a Brazilian rock music genre that originated in the state of Rio Grande do Sul in the late 1980s. It is characterized by a mix of traditional Brazilian folk music, rock, and punk influences. The genre is known for its energetic and upbeat sound, often featuring electric guitars, drums, and bass. Lyrics often focus on themes of love, friendship, and social issues. Rock Campineiro is popular in the southern region of Brazil and has gained some international recognition in recent years.

name: Rock Sergipano
description: Rock Sergipano is a Brazilian rock music genre that originated in the state of Sergipe in the late 1970s. It is characterized by its heavy use of electric guitars, drums, and bass, as well as its lyrics which often focus on social and political issues. The genre is heavily influenced by punk, hard rock, and heavy metal, and is often seen as a precursor to the Brazilian thrash metal scene. Rock Sergipano is still popular in the region today, and is often performed at festivals and concerts.

name: Musica Cearense
description: Musica Cearense is a traditional music genre from the Brazilian state of Ceará. It is a mix of African, European, and Indigenous influences, and is characterized by its use of traditional instruments such as the zabumba, triangle, and cavaquinho. It is often played in a fast, upbeat tempo and features call-and-response singing. Musica Cearense is often used to celebrate important events such as weddings, baptisms, and other festivities. It is also used to accompany traditional dances such as the carimbó and the coco.

name: Brazilian Surf Rock
description: Brazilian Surf Rock is a genre of music that combines elements of traditional Brazilian music with the surf rock sound of the 1960s. It typically features electric guitars, drums, and bass, as well as traditional Brazilian instruments such as the cavaquinho, pandeiro, and berimbau. The genre is characterized by its upbeat, energetic sound, often featuring reverb-drenched guitar riffs and a driving rhythm section. It is often seen as a fusion of traditional Brazilian music and the surf rock sound of the 1960s, and is popular among both Brazilian and international audiences.

name: Haitian Traditional
description: Haitian Traditional music is a genre of music that is rooted in the traditional folk music of Haiti. It is characterized by its use of traditional instruments such as the rara horn, drums, and accordion, as well as its incorporation of African and Caribbean rhythms. Haitian Traditional music often features call-and-response vocals, and is often used to celebrate important events such as weddings and religious ceremonies. It is a vibrant and lively genre of music that is deeply rooted in Haitian culture.

name: Deep Funk
description: Deep Funk is a genre of funk music that emerged in the late 1960s and early 1970s. It is characterized by a heavy, driving beat, often with a syncopated rhythm, and a strong emphasis on bass and percussion. Deep Funk is often seen as a precursor to modern funk and soul music, and is often seen as a more experimental and improvisational form of funk. It is characterized by its lyrical content, which often focuses on personal and social issues. The genre is often associated with the use of acoustic instruments such as the guitar, piano, and ukulele. It is also known for its use of traditional Singaporean instruments such as the gamelan and tabla. The genre has seen a resurgence in recent years, with many Singaporean artists gaining international recognition for their work.

name: Classic Thai Pop
description: Classic Thai Pop is a genre of popular music that originated in Thailand in the 1950s. It is characterized by its upbeat, melodic sound and its use of traditional Thai instruments such as the khim, a type of hammered dulcimer. Classic Thai Pop is often performed in a style that is similar to traditional Thai music, but with a modern twist. It is often accompanied by a variety of traditional Thai instruments, such as the saw duang, a type of two-stringed fiddle, and the pi nai, a type of flute. Classic Thai Pop is often used in films, television shows, and commercials, and is a popular genre of music in Thailand.

name: Thai Rock
description: Thai Rock is a genre of music that originated in Thailand in the late 1960s and early 1970s. It is a blend of traditional Thai music with elements of rock and roll, blues, and jazz. The genre is characterized by its use of electric guitars, bass, drums, and keyboards, as well as traditional Thai instruments such as the khaen and the saw duang. The lyrics are often in Thai, and the music is often upbeat and energetic. Thai Rock has been popular in Thailand for decades, and has recently gained international recognition.

name: Thai Idol

The lyrics are usually in Thai and focus on themes of love, friendship, and positive messages. name: Guidance
description: Guidance is a genre of electronic music that is characterized by its dreamy, ambient soundscapes and its use of synthesizers and samples. name: Taraneem

name: Xtra Raw
description: Xtra Raw is a genre of music that combines elements of hip-hop, trap, and EDM. It is characterized by hard-hitting beats, aggressive lyrics, and heavy bass. name: Deep Rai
description: Deep Rai is a genre of music that originated in Algeria in the late 1980s. It is a fusion of traditional Algerian music with modern electronic music. The lyrics often tell stories of love, loss, and tragedy, and the music is usually accompanied by a guitar and accordion. name: Spanish Progressive Rock

name: Rap Catala

name: Deep Sunset Lounge

name: German Punk Rock

name: German Ska

German Ska is often seen as a more aggressive and political form of ska, with lyrics that often address social and political issues. name: Dutch Musical

name: Detskie Rasskazy

It is a type of children's music that is often performed by a narrator and accompanied by a variety of instruments, such as accordion, balalaika, and guitar. The music is usually upbeat and cheerful, and the lyrics often tell stories of brave heroes, magical creatures, and other fantastical elements. The genre is popular among both children and adults, and is often used in television shows, films, and other media.

name: Ostrock
description: Ostrock is a genre of rock music that originated in East Germany during the 1960s and 1970s. It is characterized by its use of traditional German folk music elements, such as polka and waltz, combined with rock music. Ostrock is often seen as a form of protest music, as it was used to express the frustrations of East German citizens during the Cold War. It is also known for its use of synthesizers and electronic instruments, as well as its incorporation of jazz and classical music elements.

name: Austrian Classical Piano

It is often characterized by its lyrical melodies, intricate counterpoint, and harmonic complexity. name: Belarusian Punk

name: Russian Punk Rock

name: Dundee Indie

It is characterized by its upbeat, guitar-driven sound, often featuring jangly guitars, driving rhythms, and catchy melodies. name: Dubsteppe

name: Mathgrind

It is characterized by complex and often dissonant riffs, abrupt tempo changes, and chaotic song structures. Mathgrind is often characterized by its use of odd time signatures, polyrhythms, and atonal melodies. The vocals are usually screamed or shouted, and the lyrics often focus on social and political issues.

It is characterized by its use of brass instruments such as trumpets, trombones, tubas, and other wind instruments. The music is usually upbeat and lively, and often features marches, polkas, and waltzes. Blaskapelle is often performed at festivals, weddings, and other celebrations.

name: Perreo
description: Perreo is a genre of reggaeton music that originated in Puerto Rico in the early 2000s. The genre is often associated with the dance style of the same name, which involves two people dancing closely together in a sexually suggestive manner.

name: Czech Punk

name: Heavy Gothic Rock

It is characterized by distorted guitars, heavy drumming, and often dark, melancholic lyrics. It is often associated with the Goth subculture and is often seen as a darker, heavier version of Gothic Rock.

name: Kansas Indie

name: Minimal Synth
description: Minimal Synth is a genre of electronic music that emerged in the late 1970s and early 1980s. It is characterized by its sparse, minimalistic sound, often featuring simple melodies and drum machine beats. It is often associated with the DIY aesthetic of the punk and post-punk era, and is often seen as a precursor to the synth-pop and new wave genres. Minimal Synth often features heavily distorted and processed synthesizers, as well as unconventional sound sources such as field recordings and found sounds. It is often seen as a precursor to the industrial and dark ambient genres.

name: Deep New Wave
description: Deep New Wave is a subgenre of New Wave music that emerged in the late 1970s and early 1980s. It is characterized by a darker, more melancholic sound than traditional New Wave, often incorporating elements of post-punk, synthpop, and gothic rock. Deep New Wave songs often feature brooding lyrics and minor-key melodies, and are often slower and more atmospheric than traditional New Wave. Artists associated with the genre include The Cure, Joy Division, Bauhaus, and Siouxsie and the Banshees.

name: Italian New Wave
description: The Italian New Wave is a genre of music that emerged in the late 1970s and early 1980s in Italy. It is characterized by a mix of electronic and acoustic sounds, often with a strong emphasis on synthesizers and drum machines. The genre is heavily influenced by the post-punk and new wave movements of the time, as well as the disco and funk sounds of the 1970s. It is often characterized by a dark, moody atmosphere, and often features lyrics that are socially conscious and politically charged. name: Beat Poetry
description: Beat Poetry is a genre of music that combines spoken word poetry with musical accompaniment. It is often characterized by its use of improvisation, free-form lyrics, and a wide range of musical styles. Beat Poetry often has a strong political and social message, and is often associated with the Beat Generation of the 1950s and 1960s. It is often seen as a precursor to rap and hip-hop music.

name: Chilena

It is characterized by its upbeat rhythms and cheerful melodies, often featuring the use of traditional instruments such as the charango, guitar, and quena. The lyrics of Chilena songs often tell stories of love, nature, and the Chilean countryside. Chilena is a popular genre in Chile and is often performed at festivals and celebrations.

name: Musica Madeirense
description: Musica Madeirense is a traditional folk music genre from the Portuguese archipelago of Madeira. It is characterized by its upbeat rhythms and cheerful melodies, often featuring the braguinha (a small four-stringed guitar) and the cavaquinho (a small four-stringed ukulele). The genre is often accompanied by traditional Portuguese dances such as the dança dos pés descalços (barefoot dance) and the dança dos cadeirões (chair dance). Musica Madeirense is a popular genre in Portugal and is often performed at festivals and celebrations.

name: Honky-Tonk Piano
description: Honky-Tonk Piano is a style of piano-based music that originated in the early 20th century. It is characterized by a fast-paced, syncopated rhythm, often featuring a heavy emphasis on the off-beat. The style is often associated with country music, but it has also been used in jazz, blues, and rock and roll. Honky-Tonk Piano is often played on a piano with a honky-tonk sound, which is created by using a heavy attack and a bright, percussive tone. The style is often associated with a lively, upbeat sound, and is often used to create a sense of energy and excitement.

name: Jug Band
description: Jug Band music is a style of music that originated in the early 20th century in the United States. It is a type of folk music that is characterized by the use of a jug, washboard, spoons, and other homemade instruments. The music is often upbeat and lively, and often includes elements of blues, ragtime, and early jazz. Jug Band music was popular in the 1920s and 1930s, and has seen a resurgence in recent years.

name: Derry Indie

It is a mix of indie rock, post-punk, and alternative rock, with a strong emphasis on melody and atmosphere. The genre is characterized by its use of reverb-heavy guitars, driving bass lines, and often melancholic lyrics. It is often seen as a more introspective and atmospheric take on the indie rock genre, and is often compared to the likes of The Smiths, The Cure, and Joy Division.

name: Italian Baritone
description: Italian Baritone is a style of operatic singing that originated in Italy in the late 19th century. It is characterized by a deep, rich, and powerful sound, with a wide range of dynamics and a strong emphasis on legato phrasing. The style is often associated with the great Italian opera singers of the early 20th century, such as Enrico Caruso and Beniamino Gigli. It is also closely related to the bel canto style of singing, which emphasizes the beauty of the voice and the use of ornamentation.

name: Czech Indie
description: Czech Indie is a genre of music that originated in the Czech Republic in the late 1990s. It is a mix of alternative rock, indie rock, post-punk, and electronic music. The genre is characterized by its use of unconventional instrumentation, such as synthesizers, samplers, and drum machines, as well as its incorporation of elements from other genres, such as jazz, classical, and folk. Czech Indie is often characterized by its dark, melancholic sound, and its lyrics often focus on themes of alienation, loneliness, and despair. name: Vaudeville

name: Serialism
description: Serialism is a 20th century musical style that is based on the use of a series of musical elements, such as pitch, rhythm, and dynamics, that are arranged in a predetermined order. It is a form of atonal music, meaning that it does not adhere to any particular key or tonal center. Serialism is often associated with the works of composers such as Arnold Schoenberg, Anton Webern, and Alban Berg. Serialism is characterized by its use of twelve-tone technique, which involves the use of all twelve notes of the chromatic scale in a predetermined order. This technique is used to create a sense of unity and structure in the music. Serialism also often features complex rhythms and textures, as well as the use of extended techniques, such as microtones and aleatoric elements.

name: Baltic Choir

It is typically performed in a classical style, with a focus on melodic and harmonic development. The music often features intricate counterpoint and complex rhythms. It is often performed in a chamber setting, with other instruments such as strings, piano, and woodwinds. Classical Bassoon music is often used in film scores, television shows, and other media.

name: Tecnobrega
description: Tecnobrega is a Brazilian electronic music genre that originated in the city of Belém, in the state of Pará. It is a mix of traditional Brazilian rhythms, such as carimbó and lambada, with electronic music elements, such as techno, house, and drum and bass. The genre is characterized by its fast-paced beats and its use of synthesizers and samples. It is often accompanied by a live band, which includes drums, bass, and keyboards. Tecnobrega is popular in the northern region of Brazil, and is often played at parties and festivals.

name: Firenze Indie
description: Firenze Indie is a genre of music that originated in Florence, Italy. It is a mix of indie rock, post-punk, and alternative rock, with a strong emphasis on melody and atmosphere. The genre is characterized by its use of dreamy, ethereal soundscapes, often featuring reverb-drenched guitars, driving bass lines, and lush synth textures. Firenze Indie bands often draw influence from shoegaze, post-rock, and ambient music, creating a unique sound that is both melancholic and uplifting.

name: Truck-Driving Country
description: Truck-Driving Country is a subgenre of country music that emerged in the late 1960s and early 1970s. It is characterized by its lyrical content, which often focuses on the lives of truck drivers and the hardships they face on the road. The music is typically upbeat and often features a driving beat, with prominent electric guitar and steel guitar solos. The lyrics often tell stories of truckers' struggles, such as long hours, loneliness, and the dangers of the road. The genre has been popularized by artists such as Dave Dudley, Red Sovine, and C.W. McCall.

name: Russian Folk Rock
description: Russian Folk Rock is a genre of music that combines traditional Russian folk music with elements of rock music. It typically features acoustic instruments such as the balalaika, accordion, and domra, as well as electric guitars, bass, and drums. The lyrics often focus on themes of Russian culture, history, and folklore. The genre has been popular in Russia since the 1970s and has seen a resurgence in recent years.

name: Traditional Funk
description: Traditional Funk is a genre of music that originated in the late 1960s and early 1970s. It is a combination of soul, jazz, and rhythm and blues, and is characterized by a strong backbeat, syncopated rhythms, and a heavy emphasis on the bass line. It is often associated with the funk bands of the 1970s, such as James Brown, Sly and the Family Stone, and Parliament-Funkadelic. Traditional Funk is often seen as a precursor to modern funk, and is still popular today.

name: Kenyan Alternative
description: The Kenyan Alternative music genre is a style of music that originated in Kenya in the late 1990s. It is a fusion of traditional African music, hip hop, reggae, and other genres. It is characterized by its upbeat rhythms, catchy hooks, and socially conscious lyrics. The genre has become increasingly popular in recent years, with many artists gaining international recognition. name: Finnish Soul

It is characterized by its use of traditional Finnish instruments such as the kantele, jouhikko, and harmonium, as well as its incorporation of traditional Finnish vocal styles. The genre is often seen as a reflection of the Finnish national identity, and its lyrics often focus on themes of nature, love, and nostalgia. name: Koto
description: Koto is a traditional Japanese music genre that dates back to the 8th century. It is typically performed on a 13-stringed instrument called the koto, which is plucked with picks attached to the player's fingers. The music is characterized by its gentle, melodic sound and its use of pentatonic scales. Koto music is often used in traditional Japanese ceremonies and festivals, as well as in modern popular music.

name: Burkinabe Pop
description: Burkinabe Pop is a genre of music that originated in Burkina Faso, a landlocked country in West Africa. It is a fusion of traditional African music with modern pop and hip-hop influences. The genre is characterized by its upbeat rhythms, catchy melodies, and positive lyrics. It is often used to celebrate the culture and heritage of Burkina Faso, as well as to promote social and political messages. name: Pipa
description: Pipa is a traditional Chinese plucked string instrument that has been played for over two thousand years. It is a four-stringed lute with a pear-shaped body and a fretted neck. The music genre of Pipa is characterized by its melodic and lyrical nature, often featuring intricate finger techniques and complex rhythms. It is often used to accompany traditional Chinese opera and storytelling, as well as in modern Chinese pop music.

name: Native American Flute

name: Darbuka

name: Capoeira

The music of Capoeira is an integral part of the art form, and is typically played on traditional instruments such as the berimbau, pandeiro, and atabaque. The music is characterized by a call-and-response style of singing, with the lead singer improvising lyrics and the chorus responding. The music is often accompanied by clapping and hand-clapping, as well as other percussion instruments. The music of Capoeira is often used to set the tempo and energy of the game, and is an important part of the overall experience.

name: Finnish Techno

It is characterized by its dark, minimalistic sound, often featuring heavy basslines and distorted synths. It is heavily influenced by Detroit techno, but also incorporates elements of industrial, trance, and ambient music. name: Music Box

It is often used in choral music, operas, and oratorios. It is also used in a variety of other genres, such as folk music, jazz, and pop. The contralto range is typically between the F below middle C to the second F above middle C.

name: English Renaissance

It is also known for its use of madrigals, which are secular vocal compositions with multiple parts. The English Renaissance music genre is often seen as a precursor to the Baroque period.

name: Spanish Renaissance

It is characterized by its polyphonic texture, its use of imitation, and its use of the cantus firmus technique. It is also known for its use of the isorhythmic motet, a type of composition that uses a repeating rhythmic pattern. The music of this period was heavily influenced by the music of the Middle Ages, as well as by the music of the Italian Renaissance. It is often characterized by its use of the lute, the vihuela, and the harp. Spanish Renaissance music is often considered to be the foundation of the Spanish Baroque style.
