name: Deep Freestyle
description: Deep Freestyle is a genre of electronic dance music that originated in the late 1980s and early 1990s. It is characterized by its heavy use of synthesizers, drum machines, and samples, as well as its fast-paced, repetitive beats. Deep Freestyle is often associated with the Latin freestyle scene, and its sound is heavily influenced by Latin music, such as salsa and merengue. It is also known for its use of vocal samples, often from classic soul and funk records. Deep Freestyle is often seen as a precursor to the more modern EDM genres, such as house and techno.

name: Old-Time Fiddle
description: Old-Time Fiddle is a genre of traditional American folk music that originated in the Appalachian Mountains in the late 19th century. It is characterized by its use of the fiddle as the lead instrument, as well as its use of traditional folk instruments such as the banjo, guitar, mandolin, and harmonica. Old-Time Fiddle music is often played in a fast-paced, upbeat style, and is often accompanied by singing and clogging. It is a popular genre of music at festivals and dances, and is often used to accompany square dancing.

name: Psicodelia Mexicana
description: Psicodelia Mexicana is a genre of psychedelic rock music that originated in Mexico in the late 1960s and early 1970s. It is characterized by its use of distorted guitars, heavy reverb, and a mix of traditional Mexican folk music and rock and roll. The genre is heavily influenced by the psychedelic rock of the United States and the United Kingdom, but also incorporates elements of traditional Mexican music such as mariachi, bolero, and ranchera. It is often associated with the counterculture movement of the 1960s and 1970s, and is seen as a reflection of the social and political unrest of the time.

name: Israeli Punk
description: Israeli Punk is a genre of music that combines elements of punk rock with traditional Middle Eastern music. It is characterized by its fast-paced, aggressive sound, often featuring distorted guitars, pounding drums, and shouted vocals. The lyrics often focus on social and political issues, such as the Israeli-Palestinian conflict, and the struggles of the Israeli people. Israeli Punk bands often incorporate traditional Middle Eastern instruments, such as the oud, into their sound, creating a unique blend of punk and Middle Eastern music.

name: Tallava
description: Tallava is a popular music genre originating from the Balkans, particularly Kosovo and Albania. It is a mix of traditional folk music and modern pop music, and is characterized by its fast tempo and energetic rhythms. It is often accompanied by traditional instruments such as the accordion, clarinet, and violin. Tallava is often used in weddings and other celebrations, and is a popular genre of music in the Balkans.

name: Norwegian Folk
description: Norwegian Folk music is a traditional style of music that has been passed down through generations of Norwegian people. It is characterized by its use of traditional instruments such as the Hardanger fiddle, the langeleik, and the willow flute. It is often played in a lively, upbeat style and often includes singing and dancing. Norwegian Folk music is often used to celebrate special occasions such as weddings, baptisms, and other holidays. It is also used to tell stories and express emotions.

name: Moorish Traditional
description: Moorish Traditional music is a genre of music that originated in North Africa and the Middle East. It is characterized by its use of traditional instruments such as the oud, qanun, and nay, as well as its use of complex rhythms and melodic improvisation. It is often performed in a call-and-response style, with the lead singer or instrumentalist improvising a melody and the other musicians responding with a countermelody. The genre is heavily influenced by Arabic, Berber, and Andalusian musical traditions.

name: Candombe
description: Candombe is a traditional Uruguayan music and dance genre that originated in the late 18th century. It is characterized by its African-influenced rhythms and percussion instruments, such as the tambor, chico, and repique drums. The music is usually accompanied by singing and dancing, and is often performed in a procession. Candombe is an important part of Uruguayan culture and is celebrated during Carnival and other festivals.

name: Bury St Edmunds Indie
description: Bury St Edmunds Indie is a genre of music that originated in the town of Bury St Edmunds in Suffolk, England. It is a mix of indie rock, post-punk, and alternative rock, with a strong emphasis on melody and atmosphere. The genre is characterized by its use of reverb-heavy guitars, driving bass lines, and often melancholic lyrics. It is often compared to the shoegaze and dream pop genres, but with a more upbeat and energetic sound. Bands associated with the genre include The Horrors, The Maccabees, and The Vaccines.

name: Indie Cantabria
description: Indie Cantabria is a genre of music that originated in the autonomous community of Cantabria in northern Spain. It is a mix of traditional folk music, rock, and electronic music. The genre is characterized by its use of traditional instruments such as the guitar, accordion, and drums, as well as its incorporation of modern electronic elements. Indie Cantabria is often described as a mix of traditional and modern sounds, and its lyrics often focus on themes of love, nature, and nostalgia.

name: Spanish Stoner Rock
description: Spanish Stoner Rock is a genre of rock music that combines elements of traditional Spanish music with the heavy, distorted sound of stoner rock. It typically features a slow, heavy groove, often with a bluesy feel, and incorporates elements of traditional Spanish music such as flamenco and rumba. The lyrics are often sung in Spanish and the instrumentation typically includes electric guitars, bass, drums, and sometimes keyboards.

name: Puerto Rican Metal
description: Puerto Rican Metal is a subgenre of heavy metal music that originated in Puerto Rico in the late 1980s. It is characterized by its aggressive sound, fast tempos, and heavy guitar riffs. It is often influenced by traditional Latin American music, such as salsa and merengue, as well as other genres such as punk and hardcore. The lyrics are often in Spanish and focus on topics such as politics, social issues, and Puerto Rican culture. Popular bands in this genre include Puya, Nonpoint, and Ill Niño.

name: Koligeet
description: Koligeet is a traditional folk music genre from the Indian state of Maharashtra. It is usually performed during weddings and other festive occasions. The music is characterized by its upbeat tempo and cheerful lyrics. It is often accompanied by traditional instruments such as the dholak, tabla, and harmonium. The lyrics are usually in Marathi, the local language of Maharashtra. Koligeet is a popular form of entertainment in the region and is enjoyed by people of all ages.

name: Thai Folk
description: Thai Folk music is a traditional style of music from Thailand that is typically performed by rural communities. It is characterized by its use of traditional instruments such as the khaen (bamboo mouth organ), the ranat (xylophone), and the pi (bamboo flute). The music is often accompanied by singing and dancing, and is often used to celebrate special occasions such as weddings and festivals. It is also used to tell stories and express emotions. Thai Folk music is an important part of Thai culture and is still widely performed today.

name: Balalaika
description: The Balalaika is a traditional Russian stringed instrument that is used to play a style of folk music known as Balalaika music. This genre of music is characterized by its upbeat, lively rhythms and melodies, often featuring a combination of strummed chords and melodic solos. The instrument is usually accompanied by a variety of other instruments, such as the domra, garmoshka, and bayan. Balalaika music is often used in traditional Russian folk dances and celebrations.

name: American Romanticism
description: American Romanticism is a style of music that emerged in the United States in the early 19th century. It is characterized by its expressive melodies, lush harmonies, and often-dramatic use of dynamics. It is often associated with the works of composers such as George Gershwin, Aaron Copland, and Leonard Bernstein. American Romanticism is often seen as a bridge between the classical and popular music of the time, combining elements of both. It is often seen as a precursor to the American musical theater tradition.

name: Sonora Indie
description: Sonora Indie is a genre of music that originated in the Sonora region of Mexico. It is a blend of traditional Mexican folk music and modern indie rock, characterized by its upbeat rhythms and catchy melodies. It often features a mix of acoustic and electric instruments, including guitars, drums, and synthesizers. The lyrics often focus on themes of love, nature, and social issues. Sonora Indie is a popular genre in Mexico and has been gaining popularity in the United States in recent years.

name: Bisaya Rap
description: Bisaya Rap is a genre of music that originated in the Philippines. It is a fusion of traditional Filipino music and hip-hop, and is characterized by its fast-paced beats and catchy melodies. The lyrics are usually in the Bisaya language, which is spoken in the Visayas region of the Philippines. Bisaya Rap is popular among the youth of the Visayas region, and is often used to express their culture and identity.

name: Re:Techno
description: Re:Techno is a genre of electronic music that combines elements of techno, house, and other electronic music styles. It is characterized by its use of repetitive beats, heavy basslines, and melodic synth lines. Re:Techno often features a wide range of tempos, from slow and mellow to fast and energetic. It is often characterized by its use of samples and loops, as well as its incorporation of elements from other genres such as hip-hop, funk, and jazz. Re:Techno is often seen as a more accessible form of techno, as it is often more melodic and less abstract than traditional techno.

name: Indie Boliviano
description: Indie Boliviano is a genre of music that originated in Bolivia and is characterized by its use of traditional instruments and rhythms. It is a mix of traditional Bolivian music, rock, and folk music. It is often characterized by its use of acoustic guitars, charangos, and quenas, as well as its incorporation of traditional Bolivian rhythms such as the huayño and the chacarera. Indie Boliviano is often seen as a way to express the culture and identity of Bolivia, and it has become increasingly popular in recent years.

name: Szanty
description: Szanty is a type of Polish folk music that originated in the 19th century. It is characterized by its use of traditional instruments such as accordions, fiddles, and drums, as well as its lyrics, which often tell stories of the sea and sailors. The music is often upbeat and lively, and is often accompanied by dancing. Szanty is popular in Poland and other parts of Europe, and has been gaining popularity in the United States in recent years.

name: Cape Breton Indie
description: Cape Breton Indie is a genre of music that originated in Cape Breton, Nova Scotia, Canada. It is a blend of traditional Celtic music, folk, and rock, with a modern twist. The genre is characterized by its use of traditional instruments such as the fiddle, guitar, and bodhran, as well as modern instruments such as synthesizers and drum machines. The lyrics often focus on the culture and history of Cape Breton, and the music is often upbeat and energetic. Cape Breton Indie is a popular genre in the region, and has been gaining popularity in other parts of Canada and the world.

name: Belgian Experimental
description: The Belgian Experimental music genre is a style of electronic music that emerged in the late 1990s and early 2000s. It is characterized by its experimental nature, often incorporating elements of ambient, noise, drone, and industrial music. It is often characterized by its use of unconventional sound sources, such as field recordings, found sounds, and manipulated samples. It is often characterized by its use of abstract and surreal soundscapes, often with a dark and brooding atmosphere. It is often associated with the Belgian electronic music scene, which has produced a number of influential artists such as Autechre, Aphex Twin, and Venetian Snares.

name: Irish Ballad
description: Irish Ballad music is a traditional style of folk music from Ireland. It is characterized by its slow, melancholic melodies and lyrics that often tell stories of love, loss, and longing. The instrumentation typically includes acoustic guitar, fiddle, and tin whistle, although other instruments such as the bodhrán, bouzouki, and accordion are also used. Irish Ballad music has been popularized by many Irish artists, such as The Dubliners, The Clancy Brothers, and The Pogues.

name: Italian Ska
description: Italian Ska is a genre of music that combines elements of traditional ska music with Italian folk music. It is characterized by a fast tempo, upbeat rhythms, and a strong emphasis on horns and brass instruments. The genre often features a mix of traditional ska and reggae beats, as well as elements of jazz, funk, and Latin music. The lyrics are often in Italian, and the music often has a strong political message. Italian Ska is popular in Italy and has been gaining popularity in other parts of Europe and the United States.

name: German Renaissance
description: German Renaissance music is a style of music that emerged in the late 15th and early 16th centuries in Germany. It is characterized by its polyphonic texture, its use of imitation, and its use of cantus firmus techniques. It is also known for its use of the motet form, which was a popular form of vocal music during the Renaissance. The music of the German Renaissance is often seen as a bridge between the Medieval and Baroque eras, as it combines elements of both. It is also known for its use of the lute, which was a popular instrument during this period.

name: Minnesang
description: Minnesang is a genre of medieval German lyric poetry and song that flourished in the 12th and 13th centuries. It is characterized by its courtly love themes and its use of rhyme and meter. The lyrics often revolve around themes of courtly love, chivalry, and religion. The music is typically performed by a solo singer accompanied by a lute or harp. Minnesang is considered to be the earliest form of German literature and is an important part of the German cultural heritage.

name: Musica Goiana
description: Musica Goiana is a style of Brazilian music that originated in the state of Goiás in the mid-20th century. It is a mix of traditional Brazilian rhythms, such as samba and choro, with influences from African and European music. Musica Goiana is characterized by its upbeat, lively rhythms and its use of traditional instruments, such as the cavaquinho, pandeiro, and viola. It is often performed in a trio format, with two guitars and a percussion instrument. Musica Goiana is popular in Brazil and is often performed at festivals and other events.

name: Blues Band
description: The Blues Band is a genre of music that originated in the American South in the early 20th century. It is characterized by its use of the blues scale, a 12-bar chord progression, and a call-and-response vocal style. The genre is heavily influenced by African-American spirituals, work songs, and the folk music of the rural South. It is often associated with the Mississippi Delta blues, but it has also been adapted to other styles, such as jazz, rock, and country. The Blues Band typically features a lead vocalist, a rhythm section, and a lead guitar. The lead vocalist often sings in a soulful, bluesy style, while the rhythm section provides a steady groove. The lead guitar often plays a solo or fills in the gaps between the vocal lines.

name: Muzica Bisericeasca
description: Muzica Bisericeasca (Church Music) is a genre of music that is used in religious services in the Eastern Orthodox Church. It is typically sung a cappella and is characterized by its use of traditional Byzantine scales and modes. It is often performed in a call-and-response style, with a soloist singing a phrase and the choir responding. The music is often accompanied by traditional instruments such as the tambura, cymbalom, and accordion. Muzica Bisericeasca is an important part of the Eastern Orthodox liturgy and is used to create a spiritual atmosphere in the church.

name: Panamanian Indie
description: Panamanian Indie is a genre of music that combines traditional Panamanian rhythms and instruments with modern indie rock and pop influences. It is characterized by its upbeat, danceable rhythms, often featuring a mix of traditional Panamanian instruments such as marimbas, drums, and guitars, as well as modern electronic elements. The lyrics often focus on themes of love, identity, and social issues. Artists in this genre include Los Rakas, Los Macuanos, and Los Amigos Invisibles.

name: Panamanian Rock
description: Panamanian Rock is a genre of music that originated in Panama in the late 1960s and early 1970s. It is a fusion of traditional Latin American music, rock and roll, and other influences. It is characterized by its heavy use of electric guitars, bass, drums, and keyboards, as well as its incorporation of Latin American rhythms and melodies. It is often seen as a precursor to the Latin rock genre. Popular Panamanian Rock bands include Los Rabanes, Los Amigos Invisibles, and Los Bunkers.

name: Caracas Indie
description: Caracas Indie is a genre of music that originated in Caracas, Venezuela. It is a mix of traditional Venezuelan folk music, rock, and electronic music. It is characterized by its upbeat rhythms, catchy melodies, and a mix of traditional and modern instruments. The lyrics often focus on social and political issues, and the music is often used as a form of protest. Caracas Indie is a vibrant and diverse genre that has been gaining popularity in recent years.

name: Chaabi Algerien
description: Chaabi Algerien is a popular Algerian music genre that combines traditional North African music with modern influences. It is characterized by its upbeat rhythms and melodic lines, often featuring traditional instruments such as the oud, violin, and qanun. The lyrics of Chaabi Algerien songs often focus on themes of love, family, and patriotism. The genre has become increasingly popular in recent years, with many Algerian artists releasing albums and singles in the style.

name: Turkish Experimental
description: Turkish Experimental music is a genre of music that combines traditional Turkish music with elements of experimental music. It is characterized by its use of traditional Turkish instruments such as the saz, ney, and kanun, as well as electronic instruments and sound manipulation techniques. It often incorporates elements of jazz, classical, and folk music, as well as traditional Turkish rhythms and melodies. The genre has been popularized by artists such as Mercan Dede, Baba Zula, and Omar Faruk Tekbilek.

name: T-Pop Girl Group
description: T-Pop Girl Group is a genre of music that originated in South Korea and is characterized by its upbeat, catchy melodies and lyrics. It is often performed by female K-Pop groups and is heavily influenced by hip-hop, R&B, and EDM. The genre is known for its bright, colorful music videos and choreography, as well as its use of autotune and synthesizers. T-Pop Girl Group songs often feature themes of friendship, love, and empowerment.

name: Spanish Psychedelic Rock
description: Spanish Psychedelic Rock is a genre of rock music that originated in Spain in the late 1960s and early 1970s. It is characterized by its use of psychedelic elements such as distorted guitars, heavy reverb, and experimental production techniques. It is often associated with the counterculture of the time, and is heavily influenced by the music of the British and American psychedelic rock scenes. Spanish Psychedelic Rock is often characterized by its use of traditional Spanish instruments such as flamenco guitars, castanets, and tambourines, as well as its incorporation of Latin American rhythms and melodies. It is also known for its use of surreal and poetic lyrics, often dealing with themes of love, nature, and the search for inner peace.

name: Andean Flute
description: The Andean Flute is a genre of traditional music from the Andes Mountains of South America. It is characterized by its use of the traditional pan flute, a wind instrument made from bamboo or reeds. The music is often played in a slow, meditative style, with a focus on improvisation and melodic ornamentation. The genre is often associated with the traditional music of the Inca, Quechua, and Aymara peoples, and is often used in traditional ceremonies and festivals.

name: Malian Traditional
description: Malian Traditional music is a genre of music that is rooted in the traditional music of Mali, a West African country. It is characterized by its use of traditional instruments such as the kora, ngoni, and balafon, as well as its incorporation of traditional rhythms and melodies. It is often performed in a call-and-response style, with the lead singer singing a line and the chorus responding. It is often accompanied by dancing and is used to celebrate important events such as weddings and funerals.

name: Ethnomusicology
description: Ethnomusicology is a field of study that focuses on the music of different cultures around the world. It is an interdisciplinary field that combines musicology, anthropology, sociology, and other disciplines to study the music of different cultures. Ethnomusicologists study the music of a particular culture, its history, its social and cultural context, and its relationship to other cultures. They also study the music's role in the lives of the people who create and perform it. Ethnomusicology is a field of study that is both academic and practical, and it is an important part of understanding the diversity of music around the world.

name: Tanzanian Traditional
description: Tanzanian Traditional music is a genre of music that is rooted in the traditional music of the various ethnic groups of Tanzania. It is characterized by its use of traditional instruments such as drums, xylophones, and flutes, as well as its incorporation of traditional vocal styles. It is often performed in a call-and-response style, with the lead singer singing a line and the chorus responding. Tanzanian Traditional music is often used in ceremonies and celebrations, and is an important part of Tanzanian culture.

name: Cumbia Santafesina
description: Cumbia Santafesina is a traditional style of music from the province of Santa Fe in Argentina. It is a mix of traditional cumbia rhythms with a more modern, electronic sound. It is characterized by its upbeat, danceable rhythms and its use of traditional instruments such as the accordion, guitar, and drums. It is often accompanied by a chorus of singers and dancers. The lyrics of Cumbia Santafesina often focus on themes of love, family, and friendship.

name: Orkney And Shetland Folk
description: Orkney and Shetland Folk music is a traditional style of folk music from the Orkney and Shetland Islands in Scotland. It is characterized by its use of traditional instruments such as the fiddle, accordion, and guitar, as well as its unique vocal style. The music is often upbeat and lively, and often includes traditional songs and dances. It is often performed in a group setting, with the musicians playing off of each other and creating a lively atmosphere.

name: Scottish Fiddle
description: Scottish Fiddle is a genre of traditional Scottish music that is played on the fiddle. It is characterized by its lively, upbeat rhythms and melodies, often featuring intricate ornamentation and improvisation. It is often played in a session setting, with multiple fiddlers playing together in a group. It is often accompanied by other instruments such as the accordion, guitar, and drums. It is a popular genre of music in Scotland and is often played at ceilidhs (traditional Scottish dances).

name: Barrelhouse Piano
description: Barrelhouse piano is a style of blues piano playing that originated in the early 20th century. It is characterized by a fast, driving rhythm, often with a heavy emphasis on the left hand. The right hand often plays a syncopated melody, while the left hand provides a steady, driving beat. The style is often associated with the honky-tonk and juke joint scenes of the American South. It is also closely related to ragtime and boogie-woogie.

name: Batak
description: Batak is a traditional music genre from the Batak people of North Sumatra, Indonesia. It is characterized by its use of traditional instruments such as the gondang (a two-headed drum), the saron (a bamboo xylophone), and the gong. The music is usually performed in an ensemble, with the gondang providing the main rhythm and the saron and gong providing the melody. The lyrics of Batak songs often tell stories of love, loss, and life in the Batak community. The music is often accompanied by traditional dances, which are performed in a circle and involve intricate hand and foot movements.

name: Trio Batak
description: Trio Batak is a traditional music genre from the Batak people of North Sumatra, Indonesia. It is characterized by its use of three instruments: a flute, a drum, and a gong. The flute is usually played by a lead musician, while the drum and gong provide accompaniment. The music is often upbeat and lively, and is often used for ceremonial occasions such as weddings and funerals. The lyrics of Trio Batak songs often tell stories of love, loss, and life in the Batak community.

name: Icelandic Jazz
description: Icelandic Jazz is a unique blend of traditional Icelandic folk music and modern jazz. It is characterized by its use of traditional Icelandic instruments such as the langspil, a bowed string instrument, and the kantele, a plucked string instrument. The music often features improvisation and complex rhythms, as well as a mix of traditional and modern jazz styles. Icelandic Jazz is often seen as a bridge between the traditional and modern music of Iceland, and has become increasingly popular in recent years.

name: Portuguese Contemporary Classical
description: Portuguese Contemporary Classical music is a genre of classical music that has been influenced by the traditional music of Portugal. It is characterized by its use of traditional Portuguese instruments, such as the guitar, mandolin, and accordion, as well as modern instruments like the piano and synthesizer. It often incorporates elements of jazz, folk, and world music, and is often performed by ensembles of both classical and traditional musicians. It is a vibrant and diverse genre that has been gaining popularity in recent years.

name: Belgian Blues
description: Belgian Blues is a genre of music that originated in Belgium in the late 1960s. It is a mix of blues, rock, and jazz, and is characterized by its heavy use of improvisation and extended solos. The genre is heavily influenced by American blues, but also incorporates elements of European jazz and folk music. Belgian Blues is often characterized by its use of electric guitars, bass, drums, and keyboards, as well as its use of vocal harmonies. It is often seen as a bridge between traditional blues and modern rock music.

name: UtaPri
description: UtaPri, short for Uta no Prince-sama, is a Japanese music genre that is based on the popular anime and video game series of the same name. It is a mix of J-Pop, rock, and dance music, and is often characterized by upbeat, catchy melodies and lyrics about love and friendship. The genre has become increasingly popular in recent years, and has spawned a number of spin-off series and albums.

name: Shojo
description: Shojo is a Japanese music genre that is typically associated with female singers and songwriters. It is characterized by its upbeat, pop-influenced sound and often features lyrics about love, friendship, and other topics of interest to young women. Shojo music is often accompanied by bright, colorful visuals, such as anime-style artwork or music videos. It is a popular genre in Japan and has been gaining popularity in other countries as well.

name: A3
description: A3 is a genre of electronic music that combines elements of ambient, chillout, and downtempo. It is characterized by its dreamy, atmospheric soundscapes, often featuring lush pads, ethereal synths, and gentle beats. A3 is often used as background music for relaxation, meditation, and yoga.

name: Chill-Out Trance
description: Chill-Out Trance is a subgenre of Trance music that is characterized by its relaxed, laid-back atmosphere and melodic, dreamy sound. It typically features a slower tempo than other Trance genres, and its instrumentation often includes lush pads, dreamy synths, and ethereal vocals. It is often used as background music in chill-out rooms at clubs and festivals, and is also popular for its calming and meditative qualities.

name: Deep Discofox
description: Deep Discofox is a modern electronic dance music genre that combines elements of classic disco and modern house music. It is characterized by a steady 4/4 beat, a driving bassline, and a melodic synth lead. The genre often features a variety of vocal samples, as well as a range of percussion instruments. Deep Discofox is often seen as a more laid-back and relaxed version of traditional disco music, with a focus on creating a more chilled-out atmosphere.

name: Deep Full On
description: Deep Full On is a subgenre of Psytrance music that is characterized by its slower tempo and deeper, more melodic sound. It is often characterized by its use of atmospheric pads, lush soundscapes, and hypnotic rhythms. Deep Full On is often seen as a more accessible form of Psytrance, as it is less intense and more melodic than other subgenres.

name: Finnish Rockabilly
description: Finnish Rockabilly is a style of rock and roll music that originated in Finland in the 1950s. It is a combination of traditional Finnish folk music and American rockabilly, and is characterized by its upbeat tempo and catchy melodies. The genre is often associated with the 1950s rockabilly revival, and is known for its use of electric guitars, double bass, drums, and vocals. Finnish Rockabilly is often seen as a precursor to the punk and alternative rock genres, and has been influential in the development of modern Finnish music.

name: Trouvere
description: Trouvere is a genre of medieval French music that originated in the 12th century. It is characterized by its use of poetic lyrics and its use of the vielle, a bowed string instrument. Trouvere music is often associated with courtly love and chivalry, and its lyrics often tell stories of courtly love and heroic deeds. Trouvere music is often performed in a call-and-response style, with a soloist singing the verses and a chorus responding with a refrain.

name: Indie Rock Colombiano
description: Indie Rock Colombiano is a genre of music that combines traditional Colombian folk music with modern rock and indie influences. It is characterized by its use of traditional instruments such as the tiple, cuatro, and maracas, as well as electric guitars, bass, and drums. The lyrics often focus on social and political issues, and the music is often upbeat and energetic. Indie Rock Colombiano is a popular genre in Colombia, and has been gaining popularity in other countries as well.

name: Trival
description: Trival music is a genre of electronic music that is characterized by its repetitive, upbeat, and often humorous sound. It is often associated with video game soundtracks and is often used in television and film soundtracks. It typically features a simple, catchy melody and a repetitive beat. It is often characterized by its use of synthesizers, drum machines, and samples.

name: Tamburica
description: Tamburica is a traditional folk music genre from Croatia and other parts of the Balkans. It is characterized by its use of the tamburica, a stringed instrument similar to a mandolin. The music is typically played in a fast tempo and features intricate melodies and improvisation. It is often accompanied by singing and dancing. The genre has been popular since the 19th century and is still widely performed today.

name: Irish Accordion
description: Irish Accordion music is a genre of traditional Irish music that is played on the accordion. It is characterized by its lively, upbeat rhythms and melodies, often featuring a driving beat and a strong melodic line. The accordion is often accompanied by other instruments such as fiddles, banjos, and bodhrans. The music is often played in a session setting, with musicians taking turns playing the melody and improvising around it. Irish Accordion music is a popular genre in both Ireland and the United States, and is often heard at Irish pubs and festivals.

name: Rockabilly en Espanol
description: Rockabilly en Espanol is a style of music that combines elements of traditional rockabilly music with Spanish-language lyrics. It is a fusion of rockabilly and Latin American music, and is often characterized by a fast-paced, upbeat sound. The genre typically features electric guitars, drums, and bass, as well as Latin American instruments such as the maracas, bongos, and congas. The lyrics are usually in Spanish, and often feature themes of love, heartbreak, and nostalgia. Rockabilly en Espanol is popular in Latin America, and has been gaining popularity in the United States in recent years.

name: Polish Noise Rock
description: Polish Noise Rock is a genre of music that combines elements of noise rock, punk, and post-punk with traditional Polish folk music. It is characterized by distorted guitars, heavy drums, and often incorporates traditional Polish instruments such as the accordion and fiddle. The lyrics are often sung in Polish and the music is often chaotic and dissonant. It is a genre that is still developing and is gaining popularity in Poland and abroad.

name: Cancion Infantil Mexicana
description: Cancion Infantil Mexicana is a genre of Mexican children's music that is characterized by its upbeat, cheerful melodies and lyrics. It often features traditional Mexican instruments such as the guitar, maracas, and accordion, as well as more modern instruments like keyboards and synthesizers. The lyrics of these songs often focus on themes of childhood, such as friendship, family, and nature. This genre of music is popular among both children and adults in Mexico, and is often used in television shows, movies, and commercials.

name: Rosario Indie
description: Rosario Indie is a genre of music that originated in the city of Rosario, Argentina. It is a mix of indie rock, folk, and Latin American music, with a focus on creating a unique sound that is both modern and traditional. The genre is characterized by its use of acoustic instruments, such as guitars, drums, and percussion, as well as electronic elements, such as synthesizers and samplers. The lyrics often focus on social and political issues, as well as personal experiences. Rosario Indie is a vibrant and diverse genre that continues to evolve and grow.

name: Mountain Dulcimer
description: Mountain Dulcimer is a folk music genre that originated in the Appalachian Mountains of the United States. It is typically played on a stringed instrument called a dulcimer, which is a fretted zither with three or four strings. The instrument is usually plucked or strummed with a pick or the fingers. The music is characterized by its simple melodies and harmonies, often featuring drones and modal scales. It is often accompanied by other instruments such as the guitar, banjo, fiddle, and mandolin. Mountain Dulcimer music is often used to accompany traditional folk songs and dances, and is a popular choice for jam sessions and festivals.

name: Min'Yo
description: Min'Yo is a traditional Japanese folk music genre that dates back to the Edo period (1603-1868). It is characterized by its upbeat tempo and cheerful melodies, often featuring the shamisen (a three-stringed instrument) and the koto (a 13-stringed instrument). The lyrics of Min'Yo songs often tell stories of everyday life, love, and nature. The genre has been popularized in recent years by artists such as Kiyoshi Hikawa and Masaharu Fukuyama.

name: Carimbo
description: Carimbo is a traditional music genre from the Brazilian state of Paraíba. It is a lively and upbeat style of music that is usually played with a variety of instruments, including the accordion, drums, and triangle. The lyrics of Carimbo songs often tell stories of love, loss, and everyday life in the region. The genre is characterized by its fast tempo and syncopated rhythms, as well as its use of call-and-response vocals. Carimbo is a popular genre in Brazil and is often performed at festivals and other celebrations.

name: Funk Melody
description: Funk Melody is a genre of music that combines elements of funk, soul, and R&B. It is characterized by its heavy use of syncopated rhythms, funky bass lines, and soulful vocal melodies. It often features a call-and-response style of singing, as well as a variety of instruments such as electric guitars, keyboards, and horns. Funk Melody is often seen as a precursor to modern hip-hop and R&B, and has been influential in the development of many other genres.

name: Musica Gaucha
description: Musica Gaucha is a genre of folk music from the Brazilian state of Rio Grande do Sul. It is characterized by its use of traditional instruments such as the viola, guitar, and accordion, as well as its lyrical content which often focuses on the culture and history of the region. Musica Gaucha is often seen as a symbol of regional pride and identity, and is a popular form of music among the people of Rio Grande do Sul.

name: Bahamian Folk
description: Bahamian Folk music is a genre of music that originated in the Bahamas and is characterized by its use of traditional instruments such as the guitar, banjo, and accordion. It is often accompanied by a call-and-response style of singing, and is heavily influenced by African and Caribbean rhythms. The lyrics of Bahamian Folk music often tell stories of the island's history, culture, and people. It is a vibrant and lively genre of music that is enjoyed by many throughout the Caribbean.

name: Dancehall Colombiano
description: Dancehall Colombiano is a genre of music that originated in Colombia in the late 1990s. It is a fusion of traditional Colombian music, such as cumbia, vallenato, and salsa, with Jamaican dancehall and reggae. The genre is characterized by its fast-paced rhythms, heavy bass lines, and catchy melodies. It is often accompanied by lyrics that focus on social issues, such as poverty, violence, and drug trafficking. Dancehall Colombiano is popular in Colombia and other Latin American countries, and has become increasingly popular in the United States and Europe.

name: Czsk Black Metal
description: Czech Black Metal is a subgenre of extreme metal music that originated in the Czech Republic in the early 1990s. It is characterized by its raw, aggressive sound, often featuring distorted guitars, blast beats, and harsh vocals. The lyrics often focus on themes of darkness, death, and anti-Christianity. The genre has been heavily influenced by Scandinavian black metal, but has also incorporated elements of traditional Czech folk music and classical music. Czech black metal bands have gained a cult following in the underground metal scene, and the genre has become increasingly popular in recent years.

name: Metal Tico
description: Metal Tico is a heavy metal music genre that originated in Costa Rica in the late 1980s. It is characterized by its aggressive sound, fast tempos, and distorted guitars. The lyrics often focus on themes of violence, death, and social issues. The genre has been influenced by thrash metal, death metal, and black metal, as well as traditional Costa Rican folk music. Metal Tico bands often incorporate traditional instruments such as marimbas and drums into their sound. The genre has become increasingly popular in recent years, with bands such as Sepulcro, Sarcófago, and Desalmado gaining international recognition.

name: Brazilian Doom Metal
description: Brazilian Doom Metal is a subgenre of heavy metal music that originated in Brazil in the early 1990s. It is characterized by slow, heavy riffs, often with a melancholic atmosphere. The genre is heavily influenced by traditional doom metal, but also incorporates elements of death metal, black metal, and progressive metal. The lyrics often focus on themes of death, despair, and the occult. The sound is often described as "doomy" and "atmospheric," with a strong emphasis on melody and atmosphere.

name: Indonesian Electronic
description: Indonesian Electronic music is a genre of electronic music that originated in Indonesia. It is characterized by its use of traditional Indonesian instruments and rhythms, as well as modern electronic production techniques. It often incorporates elements of traditional Indonesian music such as gamelan, as well as influences from other genres such as hip-hop, house, and techno. The genre has become increasingly popular in recent years, with many Indonesian artists gaining international recognition.

name: Proto-Rap
description: Proto-Rap is a genre of music that emerged in the late 1970s and early 1980s. It is considered to be the precursor to modern rap and hip-hop music. Proto-Rap is characterized by its use of spoken word, often in the form of rhyming lyrics, and its focus on social and political issues. It also often incorporates elements of funk, soul, and jazz. Proto-Rap is credited with laying the groundwork for the development of modern rap and hip-hop music.

name: Mento
description: Mento is a style of Jamaican folk music that dates back to the early 20th century. It is a fusion of African and European musical elements, and is characterized by its upbeat rhythms and lighthearted lyrics. Mento is often seen as the precursor to ska and reggae music, and is still popular in Jamaica today. It is typically performed with acoustic instruments such as banjos, guitars, and hand drums.

name: Austrian Stoner Rock
description: Austrian Stoner Rock is a genre of music that combines elements of stoner rock, psychedelic rock, and heavy metal. It is characterized by its heavy, distorted guitar riffs, groovy bass lines, and pounding drums. The genre is often associated with a laid-back, relaxed attitude and a sense of freedom. It is often seen as a more melodic and accessible version of stoner rock, with a focus on catchy hooks and memorable melodies.

name: Spanish Rockabilly
description: Spanish Rockabilly is a style of rock and roll music that originated in Spain in the 1950s. It is a fusion of traditional Spanish music, such as flamenco, with the rockabilly sound of the United States. It is characterized by its upbeat tempo, twangy guitars, and a strong emphasis on rhythm. It is often played with a heavy dose of reverb and echo, giving it a unique sound. Spanish Rockabilly is still popular in Spain today, and is often heard in clubs and bars.

name: Rap Ecuatoriano
description: Rap Ecuatoriano is a style of rap music that originated in Ecuador. It is characterized by its fast-paced beats and lyrics that often focus on social issues, such as poverty, inequality, and politics. The genre has been growing in popularity in recent years, with many artists gaining international recognition. It is often seen as a way to express the struggles of the Ecuadorian people and to bring attention to the country's issues.

name: Samoan Pop
description: Samoan Pop is a genre of music that originated in Samoa and is a blend of traditional Samoan music with modern pop music. It is characterized by its upbeat, danceable rhythms and catchy melodies. It often features traditional Samoan instruments such as the ukulele, guitar, and drums, as well as modern instruments like keyboards and synthesizers. Samoan Pop is popular in both Samoa and the United States, and is often performed at festivals and other events.

name: Gospel Drill
description: Gospel Drill is a subgenre of Christian hip hop that combines elements of trap music and gospel music. It is characterized by its heavy 808s, hard-hitting drums, and melodic gospel-style vocals. The lyrics often focus on themes of faith, hope, and redemption, and the music is often used to spread a message of positivity and encouragement. Gospel Drill is a relatively new genre, but it has quickly gained popularity in the Christian hip hop community.

name: Namibian Pop
description: Namibian Pop is a genre of music that originated in Namibia, a country in southern Africa. It is a fusion of traditional African music with modern pop and hip-hop influences. The genre is characterized by its upbeat rhythms, catchy melodies, and a mix of traditional and modern instruments. It often features a mix of English and Afrikaans lyrics, and is often used to express the struggles and joys of everyday life in Namibia.

name: Belgian Punk
description: Belgian Punk is a genre of punk rock music that originated in Belgium in the late 1970s and early 1980s. It is characterized by its fast, aggressive sound and its use of English lyrics. The genre is heavily influenced by British punk, but also incorporates elements of ska, reggae, and hardcore punk. Belgian Punk bands often have a political message, and many of them are associated with the anti-establishment movement. The genre has been influential in the development of other punk subgenres, such as hardcore punk and crust punk.

name: Belgian Classical Piano
description: Belgian Classical Piano is a genre of classical music that originated in Belgium in the 19th century. It is characterized by its lyrical melodies, intricate counterpoint, and a strong emphasis on the piano as the primary instrument. The genre is often associated with the works of composers such as César Franck, Eugène Ysaÿe, and Joseph Jongen. Belgian Classical Piano is often seen as a bridge between the Romantic and Impressionist styles of music.

name: Australian Rockabilly
description: Australian Rockabilly is a style of rock and roll music that originated in Australia in the 1950s. It is a combination of rock and roll, country, and rhythm and blues, and is characterized by a strong backbeat, twangy guitars, and a driving rhythm. It is often associated with the "pub rock" scene of the 1970s and 1980s, and is still popular today. It is often seen as a precursor to the punk and alternative rock scenes of the late 1970s and 1980s.

name: Deep Psychobilly
description: Deep Psychobilly is a genre of music that combines elements of punk rock, rockabilly, and psychobilly. It is characterized by fast tempos, distorted guitars, and a heavy emphasis on drums and bass. The lyrics often focus on themes of horror, death, and the supernatural. The genre is often associated with horror punk and gothic rock.

name: Traditional Bluegrass
description: Traditional Bluegrass is a genre of American roots music that developed in the 1940s in the Appalachian region of the United States. It is a form of country music that is characterized by its use of acoustic instruments, fast tempos, and vocal harmonies. Traditional Bluegrass is typically played on acoustic stringed instruments such as the banjo, guitar, mandolin, fiddle, and upright bass. It is often accompanied by a vocal harmony featuring three-part harmonies. The lyrics of traditional Bluegrass songs often focus on themes of love, heartache, and loss.

name: Balfolk
description: Balfolk is a type of folk music and dance from France, Belgium, and the Netherlands. It is a combination of traditional folk music and modern dance music, and is often played at folk festivals and dances. The music is usually played by a band of two to four musicians, and the dances are usually done in couples. The music is usually upbeat and lively, and the dances are often energetic and fun. Balfolk is a great way to get people up and dancing, and it is a great way to experience traditional folk music in a modern setting.

name: Tatar Folk
description: Tatar Folk music is a traditional genre of music from the Tatar people of Russia. It is characterized by its use of traditional instruments such as the domra, balalaika, and accordion, as well as its use of traditional vocal styles. The music is often upbeat and lively, and often includes elements of Russian folk music. It is often performed at weddings and other celebrations, and is a popular genre of music in the Tatar community.

name: Cocuk Sarkilari
description: Cocuk Sarkilari (Children's Songs) is a genre of Turkish music that is specifically designed for children. It is typically upbeat and cheerful, and often includes lyrics about animals, nature, and other topics that are of interest to children. The music is often accompanied by simple, repetitive melodies and rhythms that are easy for children to follow. It is a popular genre in Turkey, and is often used in children's television shows, movies, and other media.

name: Jaw Harp
description: The Jaw Harp is a traditional folk music genre that originated in Central and Eastern Europe. It is played by plucking a metal or wooden instrument with the teeth and tongue. The instrument produces a unique sound that is often used to accompany traditional folk songs and dances. The Jaw Harp is also known as a Jew's Harp, Trump, or Mouth Harp. It is a popular instrument in many countries, including Russia, Ukraine, Poland, Hungary, and Romania.

name: Cambodian Pop
description: Cambodian Pop is a genre of popular music that originated in Cambodia in the late 1960s and early 1970s. It is a mix of traditional Khmer music, rock, and pop influences from the West. Cambodian Pop is characterized by its upbeat, catchy melodies and often incorporates traditional instruments such as the khim (a type of hammered dulcimer) and the roneat (a type of xylophone). The lyrics of Cambodian Pop songs often focus on themes of love, romance, and nostalgia. Cambodian Pop has become increasingly popular in recent years, with many Cambodian artists gaining international recognition.

name: Musica Indigena Mexicana
description: Musica Indigena Mexicana is a genre of traditional Mexican music that is rooted in the country's indigenous cultures. It is characterized by its use of traditional instruments such as the guitar, violin, and flute, as well as its incorporation of pre-Hispanic rhythms and melodies. The genre is often used to celebrate important events and holidays, and is often performed in traditional dress. Musica Indigena Mexicana is a vibrant and diverse genre that is deeply rooted in Mexican culture and history.

name: Musica Prehispanica
description: Musica Prehispanica is a genre of music that is rooted in the traditional music of the pre-Columbian cultures of Latin America. It is characterized by its use of traditional instruments such as drums, flutes, and rattles, as well as its incorporation of indigenous rhythms and melodies. It is often performed in a ceremonial context, and is used to celebrate and honor the cultural heritage of Latin America.

name: Musica Folk Asturiana
description: Musica Folk Asturiana is a traditional folk music genre from the Asturias region of northern Spain. It is characterized by its use of traditional instruments such as the gaita (bagpipe), the pandereta (tambourine), and the tamboril (drum). The music is often accompanied by singing and dancing, and is often played at festivals and celebrations. It is a lively and upbeat style of music that is often used to celebrate the culture and history of the Asturias region.

name: Italian Choir
description: Italian Choir is a genre of music that is characterized by its use of traditional Italian choral singing. It typically features a large choir of voices singing in harmony, often accompanied by a piano or organ. The music is often religious in nature, and often includes a cappella singing. It is often used in religious ceremonies, such as weddings and funerals, as well as in concerts and other performances.

name: Chant Religieux
description: Chant Religieux is a genre of religious music originating in France. It is typically performed in a choral setting and is characterized by its solemn, reverential tone. The music is often based on traditional hymns and liturgical texts, and is often accompanied by organ or other instruments. Chant Religieux is often used in religious services and ceremonies, and is a popular choice for weddings and funerals.

name: Modern Downshift
description: Modern Downshift is a genre of music that combines elements of downtempo, chillout, and ambient music. It is characterized by its relaxed, laid-back atmosphere and its use of synthesizers, samples, and other electronic elements. It often features a slow tempo and a dreamy, ethereal soundscape. The genre is often used to create a calming, meditative atmosphere, and its sound is often described as “floating” or “drifting.”

name: Slovenian Hip Hop
description: Slovenian Hip Hop is a genre of music that originated in Slovenia in the early 2000s. It is characterized by its use of rap and hip hop beats, as well as its incorporation of traditional Slovenian folk music elements. The lyrics often focus on topics such as social issues, politics, and everyday life. Slovenian Hip Hop has become increasingly popular in recent years, with many artists gaining international recognition.

name: Fisarmonica
description: Fisarmonica is an Italian folk music genre that originated in the 19th century. It is characterized by its use of the diatonic button accordion, or fisarmonica, as its main instrument. The music is typically upbeat and lively, and often features improvisation. It is often played in a duo or trio format, with the accordion accompanied by a guitar or mandolin. Fisarmonica is popular in Italy, particularly in the south, and is often performed at weddings and other celebrations.

name: Deep Brazilian Pop
description: Deep Brazilian Pop is a genre of music that combines elements of traditional Brazilian music with modern pop music. It typically features a mix of acoustic and electronic instruments, as well as a variety of vocal styles. The genre often incorporates elements of samba, bossa nova, and other traditional Brazilian styles, as well as influences from jazz, funk, and other genres. Deep Brazilian Pop is often characterized by its upbeat, danceable rhythms and its melodic, soulful vocals.

name: Pop Catracho
description: Pop Catracho is a popular music genre from Honduras that combines traditional Honduran music with modern pop music. It is characterized by its upbeat rhythms, catchy melodies, and a mix of traditional instruments such as marimbas, accordions, and guitars. The lyrics often focus on themes of love, family, and patriotism. Pop Catracho is popular among both young and old, and is often heard at parties, festivals, and other celebrations.

name: Bisaya Indie
description: Bisaya Indie is a genre of music that originated in the Visayas region of the Philippines. It is a mix of traditional Visayan folk music and modern indie rock. The genre is characterized by its upbeat, catchy melodies and its use of traditional instruments such as the kulintang, gong, and kudyapi. It is often sung in the Visayan language and is popular among the youth of the Visayas region.

name: Horror Punk Brasileiro
description: Horror Punk Brasileiro is a Brazilian music genre that combines elements of punk rock and horror movie soundtracks. It is characterized by its dark, aggressive sound and lyrics that often focus on horror-related themes such as death, violence, and the supernatural. The genre is heavily influenced by classic horror films, and often incorporates samples from them. It is often associated with the gothic subculture, and is popular among fans of horror films and punk rock.

name: Pilates
description: Pilates music is a genre of music specifically designed to accompany Pilates exercise routines. It is typically instrumental and has a slow, calming tempo. The music is often composed of gentle, soothing melodies and rhythms that are designed to help the listener relax and focus on their breathing and movements. The music is often accompanied by nature sounds, such as birds chirping or the sound of a waterfall. Pilates music is often used in yoga classes, meditation sessions, and other relaxation activities.

name: Lagu Timur
description: Lagu Timur is a genre of traditional music from East Indonesia, particularly from the Maluku Islands. It is characterized by its use of traditional instruments such as the sasando, a stringed instrument made from palm leaves, and the kolintang, a set of small gongs. The music is typically upbeat and often features call-and-response singing. Lagu Timur is often performed at traditional ceremonies and festivals, and is an important part of the cultural heritage of the Maluku Islands.

name: Lai Hla
description: Lai Hla is a traditional Burmese music genre that is typically performed by a small ensemble of musicians. It is characterized by its use of traditional Burmese instruments such as the saung-gauk (harp), the hne (flute), and the pat waing (drum circle). The music is often accompanied by singing and dancing, and is often used to celebrate special occasions such as weddings and festivals. The lyrics of Lai Hla songs often tell stories of love, loss, and joy.

name: Belfast Metal
description: Belfast Metal is a subgenre of heavy metal music that originated in Belfast, Northern Ireland. It is characterized by its aggressive sound, fast tempos, and heavy guitar riffs. It often incorporates elements of traditional Irish music, such as the use of tin whistles and Uilleann pipes. It is also known for its lyrical themes, which often focus on Irish history and culture. Popular bands in the genre include Gama Bomb, Gama Bomb, and The Answer.

name: Guitar Case
description: Guitar Case is a genre of music that is characterized by its use of acoustic guitar as the primary instrument. It is often a blend of folk, blues, and country music, and is often played in a fingerpicking style. The genre is often associated with singer-songwriters, and is often used to tell stories and express emotions. It is often seen as a more intimate and personal style of music, and is often used to create a more intimate atmosphere.

name: H8000
description: H8000 is a subgenre of hardcore punk that originated in the late 1980s in the Belgian city of Kortrijk. It is characterized by its fast tempos, heavy guitar riffs, and aggressive vocals. The lyrics often focus on social and political issues, and the music is often associated with the DIY punk ethic. The genre has been influential in the development of other genres such as metalcore and post-hardcore.

name: Korean Hardcore
description: Korean Hardcore is a subgenre of punk rock that originated in South Korea in the late 1990s. It is characterized by fast tempos, aggressive vocals, and distorted guitars. The lyrics often focus on social and political issues, and the music is often seen as a form of protest. The genre has been heavily influenced by American and British punk rock, as well as Japanese hardcore punk. Korean Hardcore bands often perform in small venues and have a strong DIY ethic.

name: Malagasy Folk
description: Malagasy Folk music is a traditional style of music from Madagascar, an island nation off the east coast of Africa. It is characterized by its use of traditional instruments such as the valiha (a bamboo tube zither), the marovany (a box zither), and the kabosy (a four-stringed lute). The music is often accompanied by singing and dancing, and is often used to tell stories or express emotions. Malagasy Folk music is often upbeat and lively, and is often used to celebrate special occasions.

name: Malagasy Pop
description: Malagasy Pop is a genre of music that originated in Madagascar and is a mix of traditional Malagasy music and modern pop music. It is characterized by its upbeat rhythms, catchy melodies, and use of traditional instruments such as the valiha (a bamboo tube zither) and the marovany (a box zither). The lyrics often focus on themes of love, family, and nature. Malagasy Pop is popular throughout Madagascar and is often heard in clubs, bars, and on the radio.

name: Belfast Indie
description: Belfast Indie is a genre of music that originated in Belfast, Northern Ireland. It is a mix of indie rock, post-punk, and alternative rock, with a strong emphasis on melody and atmosphere. The genre is characterized by its use of reverb-heavy guitars, driving rhythms, and often melancholic lyrics. It is often associated with bands such as Snow Patrol, Ash, and The Answer.

name: Juju
description: Juju music is a traditional Nigerian style of music that originated in the Yoruba culture. It is a combination of traditional Yoruba percussion and vocal styles with Western instruments such as the guitar, bass, and keyboards. The lyrics of Juju music often focus on social issues, love, and religion. It is a popular genre in Nigeria and is often performed at weddings and other celebrations.

name: Guzheng
description: Guzheng is a traditional Chinese musical instrument that has been around for thousands of years. It is a plucked zither with a trapezoidal soundboard and movable bridges. The strings are made of silk or metal and are plucked with the fingers or a plectrum. Guzheng music is characterized by its melodic and harmonic complexity, as well as its use of ornamentation and improvisation. It is often used in traditional Chinese music, as well as in modern Chinese pop music. It is also used in film scores and other forms of contemporary music.

name: Chinese Wind
description: Chinese Wind is a genre of Chinese music that combines traditional Chinese instruments with modern musical elements. It is characterized by its use of traditional Chinese instruments such as the erhu, pipa, and guzheng, as well as modern instruments such as the electric guitar, synthesizer, and drum machine. The genre is often used in film and television soundtracks, and is known for its melodic, emotional, and often melancholic sound.

name: Dizi
description: Dizi is a traditional Chinese wind instrument that is used in many genres of Chinese music. It is a double-reed instrument that is made of bamboo and has a distinct sound. Dizi music is often used in traditional Chinese operas and folk music, and is characterized by its bright, clear, and melodic sound. It is often used to accompany singing and dancing, and is often used to create a festive atmosphere. Dizi music is also used in modern Chinese pop music, and is often combined with other instruments to create a unique sound.

name: Gaita Zuliana
description: Gaita Zuliana is a traditional Venezuelan music genre that originated in the Zulia region of the country. It is a type of folk music that is typically played on a gaita, a type of Venezuelan flute. The music is characterized by its upbeat rhythms and lively melodies, often featuring call-and-response singing between the lead singer and the chorus. It is often accompanied by drums, maracas, and other percussion instruments. Gaita Zuliana is a popular genre of music in Venezuela and is often performed at festivals and other celebrations.

name: Indie Tucumano
description: Indie Tucumano is a genre of music that originated in the Argentine province of Tucuman. It is a blend of traditional folk music, rock, and electronic music, and is characterized by its upbeat rhythms and catchy melodies. The lyrics often focus on themes of love, nature, and the local culture of Tucuman. The genre has become increasingly popular in recent years, with many artists from the region gaining national and international recognition.

name: Viet Instrumental
description: Viet Instrumental is a genre of traditional Vietnamese music that is characterized by its use of traditional instruments such as the đàn tranh (zither), đàn bầu (monochord), đàn nguyệt (two-stringed fiddle), and đàn tam thập lục (16-stringed zither). This genre of music is often used in traditional Vietnamese ceremonies and festivals, and is characterized by its slow, melodic, and often melancholic sound. It is often accompanied by singing, but the focus is on the instrumental performance.

name: Metal Balear
description: Metal Balear is a subgenre of metal music that originated in the Balearic Islands of Spain. It is characterized by a mix of traditional heavy metal and traditional folk music from the region, often featuring acoustic guitars, flamenco-style rhythms, and traditional instruments such as the tambourine. The lyrics often focus on themes of regional identity, culture, and history. Metal Balear is a relatively new genre, having only emerged in the early 2000s.

name: Nyahbinghi
description: Nyahbinghi is a type of traditional Rastafarian music that originated in Jamaica in the 1930s. It is characterized by a heavy drumbeat, chanting, and call-and-response vocals. The lyrics often focus on themes of peace, love, and justice. The music is often used in religious ceremonies and is seen as a way to connect with the divine. It is also used as a form of protest against oppression and injustice.

name: Necrogrind
description: Necrogrind is a subgenre of extreme metal that combines elements of death metal, grindcore, and black metal. It is characterized by fast tempos, blast beats, and heavily distorted guitars. The vocals are usually guttural and growled, and the lyrics often focus on death, violence, and the occult. The overall sound is often chaotic and dissonant, and the production is usually raw and unpolished.

name: Irish Fiddle
description: Irish Fiddle music is a traditional style of folk music from Ireland. It is characterized by its fast-paced, lively melodies and rhythms, often featuring intricate ornamentation and improvisation. It is usually played on a fiddle, but can also be played on other instruments such as the flute, tin whistle, or guitar. Irish Fiddle music is often accompanied by other instruments such as the bodhrán, banjo, or accordion. It is often played in a session setting, with multiple musicians playing together in an informal, improvisational style.

name: Pygmy Music
description: Pygmy music is a genre of traditional music from Central Africa, particularly the Congo Basin. It is characterized by its use of polyrhythmic percussion, vocal harmonies, and call-and-response singing. Pygmy music is often performed by small groups of musicians, and is often accompanied by dancing. The music is used for a variety of purposes, including entertainment, storytelling, and religious ceremonies.

name: Vintage Reggae
description: Vintage Reggae is a genre of music that originated in Jamaica in the late 1960s and early 1970s. It is a style of reggae that is characterized by its slower tempo, heavy bass lines, and soulful vocal harmonies. It is often associated with the roots reggae movement, which was a conscious effort to return to the original sound of reggae music. Vintage Reggae is often seen as a more laid-back and mellow style of reggae, and is often used to create a relaxed atmosphere. It is also known for its use of traditional instruments such as the steel drum, melodica, and organ.

name: Bengali Folk
description: Bengali Folk music is a genre of traditional music from the Bengal region of South Asia. It is characterized by its use of simple melodies and rhythms, often accompanied by traditional instruments such as the dotara, dhol, flute, and tabla. The lyrics of Bengali folk songs often tell stories of everyday life, love, and nature. The genre is popular in both Bangladesh and West Bengal, and is often performed at festivals and other celebrations.

name: Folclore Castilla y Leon
description: Folclore Castilla y Leon is a traditional music genre from the Castilla y Leon region of Spain. It is characterized by its use of traditional instruments such as the guitar, mandolin, and accordion, as well as its use of traditional Spanish rhythms and melodies. The genre is often accompanied by traditional Spanish dances such as the jota, pasodoble, and fandango. It is a lively and upbeat style of music that is often used to celebrate special occasions such as weddings and festivals.

name: Neo Soul-Jazz
description: Neo Soul-Jazz is a genre of music that combines elements of soul, jazz, and R&B. It is characterized by its smooth, soulful sound, often featuring a combination of acoustic and electronic instruments. It typically features a laid-back groove, with a focus on improvisation and experimentation. Common instruments used in Neo Soul-Jazz include electric piano, synthesizers, and drum machines. Artists in this genre often draw inspiration from classic soul and jazz, while incorporating modern production techniques.

name: Bahai
description: Bahai music is a genre of music that is based on the teachings of the Bahai faith. It is characterized by its uplifting and spiritual lyrics, often focusing on themes of peace, unity, and justice. The music is often accompanied by traditional instruments such as the sitar, tabla, and harmonium. It is often performed in a call-and-response style, with the lead singer singing a line and the chorus responding. name: Lithuanian Folk

name: Gamelan
